description:
This is a fun casual place to grab pub food.  I've been here several times.    They often have live music and there are time when they are really crowded-like when there is a St. Patrick's Day parade.  I often have fish and chips which I enjoy-the fish is cooked nicely and tastes good.  Fries are crisp and it comes with mushy peas.  I also like the cottage pie.  

 In my most recent visit, we were celebrating a birthday-hadn't tried the desserts before-will do so again.  The birthday dessert was a brownie with ice cream and whipped cream-very tasty.  We also got a banana cheesecake dessert to go which was another good choice.
author: Betsy B.

description:
First and fore lost HAPPY BIRTHDAY SHELLY! We had such a good time. That time, for me, was soured by staff and management at Johnny Mc Foleys in San Francisco. I was in a group of 10-15 people. However, from the moment I and my black friend sat down we were badgered about a "two drink per person per table minimum." For an hour and a half we were asked OVER AND OVER AND OVER about our ability to pay for our drinks. Where as our friends who hadn't bought a drink until about an hour in, were never asked about buying drinks, even though they occupied tables just like we did. We were badgered so much that I and my friend got up from the table and stood, because for us, it was clear that the waitress wanted the table for more lucrative customers. 

From them at moment the waitress called the manager to attempt to quell any issues or misunderstandings. For
Me, it was clear that the difference in Treatment was because of race. I and my friend were two of about 5 black people in a room of non-black individuals. 

The manager attempted to argue with me about the minimum. I asked her why she was bothering me and my friend about the table minimum when we were no longer sitting at a table. She kept telling me that none of the waitresses decisions were based on race and that the drink minimum wa the drink minimum for everyone. But several of our friends told us that NOONE in all of the TWO HOURS  that we had been there asked them about drink minimums. It was not until the waitress and manager confirmed that I and my friend were with a majority non-black party that she left us alone. 

People think that treatment changed bacause you get a degree--it doesn't. I have a JD and my friend has one too! She also is an attorney BAR'd in the state of California...but to the waitress, we were just two black people unable to pay a tab.

It hurt my feelings that this waitress would do such an insensitive thing and that the manager would try to invalidate my feelings after I expressed them to her. Ya'll know me. I don't yell and I don't  fight.  So for this woman to see me as aggressive was very much so rooted in her preconceived notions and biases.

I am truly disgusted by the actions of the staff, the management, and the lack of understanding In either party.

I said all this too say, that, if you are black and people have biases, your proximity to whiteness won't Change that, your light skin won't Chang that, your money won't change that, your riches won't change that.

#imtoothrough
author: Cristal H.

description:
Julio Tavares 
Best man at work! He's kind but can be strict when he needs to be.. Daven superb awesome! And all 3 wonderful bar guys at piano bar! 

We are from folsom and we never miss going Johnny Foleys whenever we are in San Francisco. The BEST fish & chip in town. 

Food & overall 5star!! Excellent service! Thank you for another great weekend!!
author: Tini M.

description: We are in San Francisco while I am working and this place has decent reviews so we gave it a try. VERY impressed. I wasn't very hungry, so I got a Guinness and an order of crab cakes. Excellent. Just enough breading to hold it together, and plenty of crab. My wife got the corned beef and that was equally good. The cabbage wasn't soggy and the brisket wasn't dry. A very good sized portion. There is a very well stocked bar and it's HUGE. It can be loud, as it is a sports bar as well. The decor is awesome, dark wood with original hexagon flooring and tin ceilings. Wait staff is friendly. We came at 7 pm on a Saturday and only had to wait a few minutes for a table. Would definitely come again.
author: Brian B.

description:
Cute spot in Union Square!! Super happy they had the authentic black currant Guinness... So delicious! We already had dinner, but I couldn't help but try the lamb chops. Paired with an almond-mint pesto on top of an eggplant puree, it was no disappointment!! Although pricey, I would return for these chops. 

The area is very touristy and on a Tuesday evening had a twenty minute wait. Street parking is limited, but there's a garage a block away. Very accessible by public transport. 

Very lively, classy, pub vibe! Beautiful cherry oak finish to the whole place. The seating is very private besides the bar and could accommodate larger groups!! Their menu caters to a variety of tastes and restrictions.
author: Navila H.

description: I come to San Francisco for 8 days, come to Foleys 3 times, and was blown away every single time. 10/10 coming back here every time I'm in town. Food is phenomenal.
author: Tylor G.

description:
Really friendly staff! 
We had the crab cakes as an appetizer and it was so good! 
One of the best I had for awhile , definitely will order it again . 
Also had the Banger and Mash .. love that dish .. so delicious, came back because I had that before . 
Plus the prime rib , which was a little over cooked but was very flavorful , I asked for more au jus sauce to make it more juicy.
author: Cynthia K.

description:
Great decor, including the old time tile floors.  Lots of room at the bar.

Cheeseburger was great but $9 for a draft beer seems like a lot, even for San Francisco.
author: Gary A.

description:
Had a work dinner here and it was awesome.  We had a private room and the staff working there were amazing.  I never needed to request a drink and the food flowed flawlessly.   My steak was really flavorful.  Not the most tender cut of meat but well prepared.

The chocolate soufflé was absolutely delicious as well.

Sometimes work dinners are a drag but the food, staff and atmosphere here made this a fun time.   It is a cool space as well.
author: Bill T.

description: We quickly stopped in to have a pint and an appetizer. Really glad we did. Not only was the pint really good but so was the service. Real cool Irish pub atmosphere. The best thing was the fish and chips!!! I'm not a connoisseur of fish and chips but these were amazing!! Light, crispy and flaky!! Would love to stop in again for a pint and fish and chips!!
author: Tyler D.

description: Enjoyed a couple of beers at JOHNNY FOLEY'S in San Francisco. I did not eat there, but the service, historical feel of the building, and beer menu was cool. I had two Chimay's and was on my way. Definitely a cool, spacious, and historical place to grab a drink.
author: Joel V.

description: The food here was pretty decent, but my *god* the acoustics are impossible. I couldn't hear a thing from anyone at my table, let alone the waitress. We were surrounded by people standing in the vague vicinity of the bar, screaming into each other's ears in horrible cacophony. The chicken pot pie was tasty, but I'd never go back.
author: Patrick H.

description:
If you are looking for an awesome Irish Bar in Downtown San Francisco you just found it. Johnny Foley's is located a few blocks from Union Square. Right in the heart of Downtown.

Always a good crowd with plenty of seating. Bartenders are friendly and always give good service. 

The pints are always cold. You can't go wrong with a Guinness Stout or Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale. They also have an array of beers, wines, and liquor. 

I highly recommend the Irish Cheddar Potato Skins
(with Sour Cream, Bacon and Scallions) and Grilled Lamb Sliders (with Eggplant Caponata, Goat Cheese and Mint Aioli). My two go to appetizers.

For dinner, stick with the Irish traditions, you can't go wrong.

For dessert, the Chocolate Hangover made with
Warm Chocolate Brownie, Chocolate and Vanilla Ice Cream, Whipped Cream, Chocolate Sauce, Toasted Almonds... need I say more?

Don't forget to finish the night with an Irish coffee. Nice on those cold nights or as a morning pick me up.
author: Brandon L.

description: This was our first time going to this particular restaurant and we were not disappointed. The atmosphere was fun, food was amazing and everyone was very friendly. Just a couple blocks away from the Hilton in downtown San Francisco so it was very convenient if you're staying there. We had the chicken pot pie, corned beef and cabbage with crabcakes to start. Excellent!!
author: Bryan D.

description: This place appeared to be close but it turns out it was only the upper level dining room that was closed for remodeling or something. Downstairs, was a nice restaurant and bar. There are two smaller TVs right behind the bar and a large big screen on the opposite side to enjoy watching sporting events which is what we were there to do. We ended up having dinner which included the beef and barley soup and the cottage pie.   Both were absolutely delicious and I would definitely go back and try other menu items.
author: Ondrea B.

description: Amazing food and great portions. Great vibes and lots of good energy. I thought the menu was well put together, options for everyone. ILoved the lamb chops which came out quickly. Service was slow. Our waitress kept forgetting about us which was frustrating and it took 20 min to get a drink menu.. our appetizer came out first.
author: Sarah A.

description: Food was bomb, especially the vegetable stew. The wife said, "it was the best mashed potatoes she's ever had!" The only reason we are not giving it 5 stars is because the drinks are a little pricey! The food alone is worth it though!
author: Julius D.

description:
A friend of mine was craving fish and chips. We decided to go to Johnny Foley's since it's close to my work. We had a party of three, but two of us showed up on Wednesday, September 20th around 5:45pm. We had no problem grabbing a four top, even though our friend showed up about 30+ minutes later.

*Mussels in Irish Whiskey Cream Sauce with Bacon, Garlic & Parsley ($16)
*Foley's Seafood Chowder with Chives ($9)
*Foley's Fish & Chips, Fresh Cod in Lager Batter: mushy peas, lemons, house-made tartare sauce ($19)
*Bangers & Mash, Two Plump Pork Sausages: mashed potatoes, stewed onions, seasonal vegetables, gravy ($19)
*Guinness Stout ($8.75) x3
*Guinness Blonde Lager ($8.75) x2
*Prosecco, Caposaldo, Italy, n/v ($12 glass)
*Jameson 18 ($22.75)
*Irish Coffee ($11.50) x4

I honestly was more about the drinking than the eating. I ended up having a glass of bubbly, two beers, two irish coffees, and a Jameson neat. I'd never had a guinness blonde lager, so it was fun trying that as I like lighter beers. The Irish coffees were good and not too sweet. (I asked our server to make mine less sweet.) I love soup, so I enjoyed the seafood chowder. It was creamy, had a good amount of seafood, and not too rich as I tend to like a lighter broth. I tasted the rest of the dishes and thought they were pretty good. The boys seemed to enjoy them.

I used to come to Johnny Foley's a lot about a decade or more ago as I had a coworker who adored this place. It was fun coming back and revisiting a place I hadn't been to in a long while. I know they have dueling pianos, but unfortunately they weren't here that night. Maybe I'll come back to check that out. I do have fond memories of a dueling piano bars.
author: Elena N.

description:
Love this place! Great spot to both get some real food as well as some bar munchies and beers on tap. Super nice waiter and delicious food. It's in a great location and I liked it a lot. I'm definitely going back!!

Another Yelper made the comment that it's super loud in here and they were right--it's deafening in there!!! Not their fault, but just be warned that it's loud as all hell inside.....really, really LOUD!!!!!!!!!

Tip: one of the sides you can order is (I'm guessing it's an Irish food) called "champ." It's mashed potatoes with green onions. YUM!!!! Sooooo good. Get it.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I was on my way to another place to eat when I stopped to look at the menu.  I was happy I did!  It didn't start out well though.  Sat at the bar and was ignored by the first bartender ( he waited on everyone around me).  Just as I was ready to leave another bartender came over and helped me.  I was trying to decide between vegetable Irish stew and pot pie.  He recommended the stew and it was awesome!  The small amount of potatoes in the middle were just the right amount.  The veggies were still crunchy but cooked through.  All of this is swimming in a broth that had lots of flavor.

Will come back but maybe sit at a table to get better service (would have given 5 stars if I hadn't been ignored).
author: Buzzy B.

description: Great steak and fries. Great drink options. It is a good place to meet for drinks and dinner after work.
author: Juan V.

description: 36 dollars for a meal you need a telescope to see the portions, I had the corned beef and cabbage and a sparkling water. Came with 3 thin slices of corned beef, a mountain of mashed potatoes, a fork full of carrots and a fork full of cabbage. Had to ask for mustard, more butter, and vinegar for my cabbage. Table service was clueless. The whole Irish theme is what draws the drinkers in but the food is something else.
author: Sandra H.

description: We were excited to try some traditional Irish food in San Francisco. Upon our arrival, we were promptly greeted and seated. Our waitress was attentive and she was actually from Ireland! We ordered the corned beef and cabbage, and the chicken pot pie. The corned beef was incredibly tender and lean. The mashed potatoes were fluffy and delicious. The chicken pot pie was bland, but, after stirring in some salt and pepper, it was pretty good. If it weren't for the bland pot pie, I'd be giving Johnny Foley's five stars.
author: Amanda B.

description: Nice place for Irish food in San Francisco.  Very nice bar and environment was clean and not noisy.  They did have a band come in later after our meal and that was nice.  Service was good and accommodating and made good on an issue with our meal even though no complaint was made.  Great pub but a little pricey.
author: Victor D.

description: Love the food and the atmosphere here! We go back every time we're in down.  It's a little dicey in the area to walk alone but the drinking Mona Lisa is worth it!
author: Joy K.

description:
We came here on a Saturday night for a group dinner, but were the first ones here. Luckily, we were able to head over to the bar to grab some drinks and hang around the bars before the rest of the party arrived. This place is huge with two bars and a live band. The six of us were seated in a table within a mini room, which provided some nice privacy. The server was also great about checking up on us through the dinner despite us being hidden away.

Each couple in the group shared, so we decided on three appetizers for two (which thankfully we did, because the portions aren't much): Grilled Baby Back Ribs with Habanero-Roasted Vegetable Salsa ($17), Grilled Bacon-Wrapped Prawns with Sweet Chili Chutney ($16), and Pan-Fried Dungeness Crabcakes ($20). Each plate came with their own version of salad, which was pretty interesting. I enjoyed the salad paired with the baby back ribs the most as it was more of a coleslaw. As for the appetizers itself, the crabcakes lacked flavor even with the sauce and you only get two pieces; the bacon-wrapped prawns were glazed for this sweet, spicy taste that was delicious yet you only get two skewers with three pieces each; the ribs came in six bones, but dry and flavorless as well. The ribs really should've been paired with some good ol' barbeque sauce instead of the salsa.

Overall, the food is not only pricey, but it sucks and come in small portions. There is nothing I would order again, unfortunately. Although service was consistent on checking up on us, they did mess up our order when we added one of our cards that was on tab. At least we got a free brownie for the birthday boy in the end.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
SO FUN!!!! I came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night and we had such a great time. We got to the door a little after 8pm and got in and got a table. Cover was $10 a person, cash only.

It got really crowded, so I'm happy we got there when we did to secure a good spot.

I didn't try any of the food so can't comment on that. I had 3 martinis and he had two greyhounds and three beers. Total was $96.

The dual piano bar was so so fun. Great songs, great energy, great atmosphere. I can't wait to bring my friends here.
author: Jenna G.

description: Amazing place.  The prime rib was perfect.  My wife said the fish and chips were fantastic.   Lots of people here on a Saturday evening making the place alive.  Obviously very popular with the locals
author: Jared H.

description: Nice pub environment with very pleasant staff. The cottage pie had lots of diced meat in a "gravy" covered by a layer of mashed potatoes. Both the pie and the salad were very good.
author: Jim T.

description:
I loved coming here with my in-laws for lunch during the Thanksgiving weekend. They were staying nearby in Union Square and had passed by this restaurant a couple of times and just decided to try it on a whim.

Super cute on the inside with a traditional European pub sort of feel (but much larger). Our server was excellent, although of course with my memory I can't recall her name. All the food ordered looked delicious, although I can only vouch for my yellow chicken curry which was amazing, and came with a huge heaping of delicious rice *and* fries. I couldn't eat it all but if my husband would've been there he would've finished it for me.

Great place! And the bar is also quaint and full at all hours. Would definitely return if ever again in this touristy neighborhood I try to avoid at all costs.
author: Joanna R.

description: The food was alright. The pastry on the chicken pot pie was a little stale and the Bloody Mary could have used some spice and was pretty thin. We came for our anniversary and they gave us a huge brownie for dessert. Nice people and I've always been a fan of this place. We will return for sure because I want to give them the benefit of the doubt.
author: Angelea R.

description:
For fucks sake. Just go here 

I ate and drank here 9 nights in a row. Each night was a heaven better than the other. I imbibed Murphys Stout. I downed Jack and Diets. Corned beef cabbage. Yum  Cottage pie. Yum. Fish and chips. Yum. Guinness beef stew. Yum. 

Oh god, bless this fine place. May St Patrick lay his eternal blessing on its incredible goodness. 

Great food. Great drink. Stellar staff. Go here. Now.
author: M M.

description: Stopped here while at a business trip. Very fast service and nice place. Delicious Cesar salad and fish and chips. One of the better pubs I've had here and actually has good food and not just bar food. Would recommend
author: Veronica G.

description: Delicious  food! We got a wonderful restaurant on our trip ,very good service and friendly here
author: Maddy J. R.

description:
I love the Irish look and feel. Winding paths of tables to sit at and decent Irish food, beer and alcohol. Large screen TVs to watch the game and friendly staff. They got my order right which is always a plus...
I ordered the corned beef and cabbage. It seemed good to me!
author: Roxy L.

description:
Outstanding, fresh food! Chicken sandwich was juicy and tender, fries thick but crisp. And my arugula salad was just sooo delicious! The plates were cleaned to the last crumb.
Great beer selection, and great food selection as well. Definitely want to go back ASAP.
author: Nataly R.

description: I've mentioned that I absolutely love me some Irish Pubs..  This one, no different and I loved it!!  My wife and I took in cocktails and dinner here during our vacation to San Francisco and we were treated to great customer service, strong drinks, and very yummy - and plentiful, food.  We started out with a couple martini's - my girl an Irish Martini, which is your run of the mill Vodka martini, but they splash a shot of Jameson around the glass, and I my go-to...  Manhattan.  Both were priced right and tasted sooooo good.  Not long after, we ordered dinners to share...  Foley's Fish & Chips:  Fresh Cod in Lager Batter, served with Mushy Peas, Lemons, House-Made Tartare Sauce and their Buttermilk Fried Chicken, served with Coleslaw, Mashed Potatoes, Gravy.  Both meals were hearty and very, very good!  It goes without saying, we both left very happy with a great buzz.  This bar was packed even on a weekday night, which tells you something!!  Even with a packed house, the customer service didn't lack and they definitely treat you very kind here!  If I'm ever in the area again, I will most certainly hit up this Irish Pub again!  Highly Recommended!!!!!!
author: Scott V.

description: Great corned beef sandwich and the Guinness Stout is available on Draft. Friendly service and nice decor. An upscale pub for sure!
author: David B.

description:
High volume Irish pub/eatery located conveniently near Union Square.  I have been here scads of times over the years either to listen to the Irish guys, or just hang out with them.  Yesterday on St. Paddy's Day, I found out that there is a whole other room downstairs.  Went to see locals Vince Keehan, Rory McNamara, and Kyle Alden play-all three very talented.  Atmosphere was fun, but not sloppy as much of the city was yesterday with both rain and revelers seemingly falling from the sky onto many of the sidewalks.  Much of the room was filled by fireman from central valley towns of Fresno, Stockton and Manteca. The fireman fit in perfectly with the crowd and a check of their genealogy by 23 and Me would probably show that most of them have a Paddy in their tree.  
Food? I had a corn beef sandwich on a ciabatta roll which did the trick and downed with what else, Guinness.  Good times rolled at Johnny Foleys.
author: Derald C.

description:
We came here for some grub and drinks while touristing around San Fran. It's a nice bar clean usual "Irish" bar layout. The waitress was very friendly and attentive.
There were 3 of us we shared wings and a prawn dish to start very tasty.
For mains I had fish and chips the fish was cooked beautifully in a beer batter and they had malt vinegar. My partner had mussels in a cream sauce served with chips mixed in wow the mussels were so tasty and the chips soaked up the delish cream sauce.
Overall very enjoyable
author: Siobhan W.

description: Cute pub in SF, I was in the mood for an irish coffee and was determined to try it in a legit place. We had mussels, burgers and chicken entree. The food was just okay, the mussels were too fishy, not fresh at all. The service was upbeat and efficient and the ambience was relaxing. I just was not impressed with the food.
author: Milka C.

description: Johnny Foley's is an Irish Pub located near Union Square. Our large party was accommodated very quickly and without a reservation. They have great options on the menu for everyone, which was a welcome relief to everyone. They have a mushroom ravioli which I ordered with added shrimp. It was a little on the bland side, and the portion was small, but it was okay. They also had another vegetarian option that another member of my party ordered. Everytime seemed to enjoy their meals. They had a live band playing music and the bar was fairly packed. Overall, nice choice if you're looking for Irish fare.
author: Kari C.

description: Super tasty! Great service. Traditional Irish pub fare. Excellent selection of beer on tap. Only reservation is garlic on the garlic truffle fries needs to be cooked-raw garlic was too much. Way. Too. Much. I couldn't kiss my husband for at least 14 hours!
author: Carey D.

description: Came here for dinner with my guy. We shared the chicken and a few sides. Chicken was a little dry but the gravy was delicious. Veggies and mashed potatoes were good as well. Side of roasted Brussels sprouts were very tasty. My favorite was probably the Irish cheddar Mac and cheese. Highly recommend.
author: Kim A.

description:
I've probably been here 20-30 times at least. I started coming here when there no such thing as Yelp. With my job, I stayed at a hotel nearby, so it was a convenient place to eat. 
Great bar menu and the food is actually making my mouth water just thinking about it. Many people come here for drinks only, but get the food. Everything I've had is excellent from the fish & chips to the Shepherd's Pie. 
I love this place & every time I come back to San Francisco, I head to Johnny Foley's.
author: Coleen F.

description:
Talk about a hidden gem. If you like pubs, this is a great spot, even for food. Great beer selection, ate a burger, it was amazing and reasonably priced. Always a great time on St Patrick's Day. Good stuff!

Special, big thank you to our server Anastasiya. The service was excellent. Even though she had a number of customers, she was constantly checking in with us and my glass of Coke never went dry. Can't commend her enough. Thank you!!!
author: Zoey C.

description:
Reached at 9:50pm on a Friday, only to learn that the kitchen closes at 10pm. But somehow we got a seating, thanks to the host. 

Nice music and lovely ambiance.... to compliment awesome food and service. And the  place downstairs is a must check out.
author: Bobby S.

description: friendly and efficient service. They allowed us to split a meal which was nice because the entrees are a bit expensive. I wish their menu had a wider variety but overall we had an enjoyable experience. I would recommend the veggie panini!
author: Madison M.

description:
This place is amazing!! 
I would recommend anyone who is in the San Francisco area to try it out. 
Their drinks are great and you must try some of their Irish whiskey. 
I would recommend the pork chop or the kale salad, it was honestly one of the best salads I have had in a long time. The salad has a lemon vinaigrette which was just perfect!  
The service is exceptional and really feels like you are in a pub from Ireland. 
I would recommend getting there before the crowds because around dinner time it is packed! 
Thank you for the amazing service and the great atmosphere.
author: Jessica D.

description: Nice pub. Great friendly service.  Cottage pie was excellent.  Guinness served a tad cold but was still tasty.  Enjoyed the bread as well.  BF had the prime rib with creamed spinach,  said it was the best he's had. Definately a place to give a go.
author: Tammy F.

description:
Came by for happy hour on a Friday and had a good experience. 

Pros: Gorgeous restaurant, HUGE, nice decor. Staff was friendly and helpful. While I was waiting for the rest of my group, they escorted me to a little bar area and took my drink order. When everyone arrived, they seamlessly brought us over to a table. Delicious, delicious food and drink!  Good portions too. The wings, the fries and the potato skins were particularly good. Service was speedy, attentive, but not overbearing. 

Cons: As some others have mentioned, because of the huge space, the acoustics can be a little challenging. Didn't bother my group too much and for the most part we were able to hear each other. This restaurant is in Union Square, so expect tourist prices.

Bottom line:  It's a little too pricey to make it my regular happy hour spot, but would definitely go back for the tasty food and drink.
author: Mandissa L.

description: They wouldn't let us in because they thought we'd been drinking. We'd actually just woken up from a nap and were starving and super excited to try the food. Won't ever go back. Don't be excited or they won't let you in.
author: Emily B.

description: Chicken wings as small as my pinky. Tourist prices. Good atmosphere, but food was lacking. In all fairness did not order a full meal and food came to table fast but won't go back for anything other than another $9.25 beer
author: Meg O.

description: It was ok over priced. Could barely eat my food it came out so hot. I got to take two bites before I was tired of being at the place
author: Trenton C.

description: Great Irish pub feel. The food is what one would expect: Fish and chips, corned beef and cabbage, etc... Good selection of draft beers. When in SF, a good place to go when thirsty.
author: Greg F.

description: Great drinks, service, and environment.  I particularly enjoy the fish and chips with a pint of Guinness on a nice cold San Francisco evening.
author: Jared J.

description:
This review is for the downstairs piano bar only:

This place is a great time! Arrive early if you want to grab a seat because the room gets crowded on weekends after 9pm. The pianists are talented entertainers, and better singers than I expected. And by the time I left there was a crowd of people on the dance floor.

The age range here is pretty broad and there were some very entertaining older people cutting a rug with the rest of them. Songs also ranged from Brittney Spears to Elvis. A little something for everyone. 

One warning- if you want to request a song when it's busy and you only give them $5, your song may never be played. The crowd we were in was forking over $20 per song request, and even up to $40 for one. This may vary by night, and is the way dueling piano bars go, but was disappointing for me since they never got to my song.
author: Elena K.

description: Talk about rude! No open sitting at the bar, and God forbid the waiters and staff crack a smile...Shame
author: PJ V.

description: Excellent food and beers. Bartender was very good. Great atmosphere but difficult to get over the bar smell. Been here many times and will be back again
author: Pat L.

description: Bartender here was great the several times we came by! They did do a solid on just bacon for snacks. But my partner in crime said his mom's corn beef was better. **Sad but bows down to mom throwing it down in the kitchen** also, THE FRIES ARE THE BEST THING ON EARTH.
author: Jennifer M.

description: When the restaurant our concierge had recommended didn't meet our expectations, we stumbled upon this delightful spot. Although the service was slow and we were seated by the front door, the food is delicious. It sounds weird at an Irish pub, but get the baby kale salad!
author: Adrienne A.

description: Fantastic ambiance, love the dark wood interior. Great menu selections! I had the smoked salmon on boxty. Imagine a smoked salmon pizza with dill sauce as marinana and the crispy boxty is the crust. If you are a salmon fan - it's a must try! Delicious! Also had efficient and courteous staff. Great stop if you are near Union Square.
author: Michael E.

description: Great Irish bar, amazingly large space for the neighborhood. Great selection of beer and awesome bartenders who are very pleasant, knowledgeable and great and making San Francisco tourist recommendations. We didn't eat here, my only negative was the strong fried fish smell.
author: John D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and was extremely happy to get a table almost right after getting there. 

The dueling pianos show is incredibly fun to watch. If you request a song, make sure you put more than $10 if you want to hear it. We put $5 and didn't hear our song in the 3 hours we stayed there. It makes sense considering some people were paying $40 to hear their songs though. 

The drinks are rather expensive. They're good if you order a specialty drink because those are big. But if you order a basic "vodka soda" or something of that sort, it's really not worth it. 

Great experience. But keep in mind there's a $10 cover. Definitely pregame and then come here. Not worth it to try to get drunk at Johnny Foley's. 

Oh and to the pianists...excellent work! You guys rock.
author: Nick D.

description: Such a delicious salmon salad with Gorgonzola and apples. Highly recommend it alongside a Magner's cider or two. Just fantastic!
author: Meredith C.

description: This is not okay. I show up for my gf Birthday and I get deny because I'm too "drunk". Really? I have had a stroke I walk a bit weird . Horrible service Trevor this is pathetic! Disabled people should be treated the same as anyone.
author: Jose B.

description:
We decided to try this it out because we were all starving after flying and it was a short walk from our hotel. It has a great pub atmosphere with possibly a lot of original decor from decades past, including one of the coolest bars I've ever seen!

My beef Guinness soup was delicious. It's a pretty sizeable portion that you could almost make a meal out of by itself. I also had the fish and chips, which were good, but nothing special. It looked like they have a decent tap selection, but I'm expecting and unfortunately couldn't try any of it. Our service was great. A downside is that it's pretty pricey for what you get, especially considering that we went for lunch, which is usually cheaper. I spent about $40 including tip, which wouldn't have been too bad if a drink or two was on the tab as well. Welcome to San Francisco!
author: Laura B.

description: PACKED! Went in for a pint.  I go to an Irish pub in every city I visit.  Johnny Foley's was legit.  Nice cold Guinness poured perfectly.
author: Adam B. J.

description: Referred to this great Irish pub by my spouse who had previously eaten here on a business trip. My friend and I were seated immediately. In typical Irish  pub fashion, our server was warm, friendly and very attentive. The atmosphere was lively that evening with live music so we opted to stay a little longer after our dinner was finished to enjoy a few more adult beverages. Food was delicious... shared an order of fish and chips, after a starter of potato skins, which was more than enough for two. Our server, Angelica, was a doll! Will definitely be back when in SF again.
author: Missy T.

description: We stopped by at Foley's while visiting San Francisco to watch the Dodger game, ordered Jameson and Ginger Beer, awesome drinks. We didn't order appetizers since we were going out for dinner a bit after, but we really enjoyed this bar. The staff was chill and the atmosphere was nice. The customers were super cool with us considering we were the only Dodger fans in the place. All in all this was a cool bar to have drinks, we'd return when visiting.
author: Diana R.

description:
Beautiful woodwork. Excellent beer selection. Very clean taps.  5 stars for the choices of beer on tap and freshness. 

The place is a little too polished.  Way too many TVs. Bartender is relying on TVs to entertain the guests. Music is goofy dance beat stuff and too loud. 

Bring your own entertainment. Enjoy a couple decent beers. Then go elsewhere.

My Anchor Steam was $8.75.
author: J H.

description: A great time, simply said.   Angelica was a phenomenal server.  The owner came tableside and talked stories of Ireland and we had a great meal.  Prime Rib, Bangers and Mash, Fish and Chips.  All were fantastic.   If you're looking for a good night in a good pub, this is the place.
author: Michael B.

description:
Shittiest service of my life.
Literally got dragged by my arm for asking where my friend was taken.
Will never come back to this shitty place
author: Renata H.

description: We eat here every time we come to San Francisco. Great beer selection. I love the Smithwicks! My wife loves the Powers whiskey. The calamari is the most tender and flavorful I've ever had and the Mac and cheese (with bacon of course) is also the best ever. Yes it's super noisy, but has a great, happy vibe. If you want a quiet, intimate place seek somewhere else. Service is attentive and friendly. Doesn't get better than this place!
author: T L.

description:
* T r i b u t e__B u r g e r *

Johnny Foley's is your quintessential Irish pub.. It's named for a long time SF resident known to sing and drink quite a bit and there's quite a storied life out of those two things. You can read ab out it on their website. 

Down to business - I came here to get the Foley burger.

I sat down at the serious looking bar and ordered a Swiss Burger from a serious looking bar keep. Nice guy actually, great service. After a short wait it arrived.

Foley burger / Side - Cup of Tomato Basil Soup
- Fries were an option, but I got the soup instead (hey, I'm watching my figure)
- Solid presentation, looked delicious
- Paddy is cradled on a delicious looking bun
- Heft - the burger stood tall and wide, large patty with steam emanating from within
- Melted Swiss lay across like a small yellow blanket
- Fresh red onion draped over the lettuce and tomato
- Soup was good, but let's face it, the burger stole the show

I  went to take a bite but my eyes caught a replay of Dee Gordon hitting a lead-off home run in a game dedicated to Jose Fernandez, the all star pitcher who died just days before. "Ride On" by Chisty Moore played overhead, and it was just such the perfect song to send Jose off. I had tears, ESPN did a nice job, and the taste of the burger at that moment...I was so confused my mind capsized by the emotion of it all...Christy was the hammer. Tissue please, grown man weeping here!

And so, my Foley's burger became the Tribute Burger and I don't think I'll ever forget it and it was outstanding,.

"Ride on", Jose, "Ride on"


SUMMARY:

Great burger, worth a cross town walk
Great song, Casey Kasem would be proud
Great Tribute to a fallen player
author: Jason J.

description:
In the heart of downtown S.F. it can be overwhelming to find a place to eat. There are many good choices, but which one? We were in such a dilemma on a recent Saturday. Then we saw a sign for an Irish pub, Johnny Foley's.

A beer and menu choices that go beyond basic pub grub sounded perfect. The prices were pretty reasonable for this touristy location. The place is bigger than it first appears, which means we got a table without a wait!

Be forewarned, its a bit loud and there are many TV's to watch the Warriors play. Aside from that the atmosphere has cozziness to it. We were tempted by several choices on the menu: the cottage pie, fried chicken, the soups, corned beef and cabbage, and so on. We settled on some seafood chowder to share, the fried chicken, and bangers and mash. The chowder was rich and tasty without being too salty. The entrees were very generous. Each had a deliciously smooth mound of mashed potatoes with a rich and plentiful gravy. I hate it when there isn't enough gravy. No worries of that at Johnny Foley's. There's plenty of flavorful gravy. The fried chicken was a full boneless breast and a thigh piece with a light crisp skin and crisp coleslaw. The bangers had a smooth grind and snappy casing that was really tasty. 

Everything was delicious and we really appreciate the talent of the kitchen that didn't just relied on salt to flavor the food. The food was good all by itself with salt to accent. The beers were great too. We just wished our stomachs were bigger, because we were so very very full. 

So if you're in the neighborhood looking for a place with good value and good food stop looking at menus and just stop here.
author: Teresa F.

description: Don't go here, so I can find a bar seat. Soda bread, corned beef, no mushy peas. Don't drink any Guinness, leave it for me. If it's not Irish it's crap, but not from here. Portions lessened lately but really bring out more flavors and wow, across the menu. Only good moods or sorrowful grief allowed. Whiskey selection display could be grander, as me only recommendation.
author: Paul M.

description: Nice place to come in and hear a good band, have drinks, and good foods.  I like the kickback and casual atmosphere here.  Had fun here on New Years Eve/Day.
author: Ann R.

description:
I visited this place with friends to try out the Irish coffee. They had very few vegetarian options on the menu. We ordered chilly fries along with the drinks. The fries were okayish and we felt that maybe we should have ordered garlic fries. The Irish coffee was strong and good.
I loved the overall ambience of the place. They had a big screen showing live Oscar Awards that night. Overall, it was a really nice place to chill with friends.
author: Aanchal G.

description:
Kicking it at this cool bar in San Francisco tonight having a few drinks 
The atmosphere is nice and relaxing
author: Chris G.

description: Great food and great service. The atmosphere was very relaxing and felt like some of the pubs in Ireland. The bathrooms were very clean as well. Great location in Union Square right next door to the Holiday Inn Express. Several different types of food on the menu. We are there a couple times so I tried the curry chicken and the wild mushroom ravioli. Both times I also tried the soup of the day and both times it was great.
author: Megan H.

description: Took a friend here for her 25th BD. 10 minutes into the dueling pianos she was puked on by a drunk chick at the bar that couldn't handle her 10th shot of jack. I asked them for a shirt I could BUY so my girl could change, they had NONE. I asked for a LOST AND FOUND item she could wear, NONE. So we left, leaving our drinks at the table. The bouncers felt bad and gave me a card... I emailed them and called with NO response. Bummer we spent $40 to get in and another $30 on drinks we couldn't even enjoy.
author: C F.

description:
Kudos to excellent Customer Service to Devon! 
Thank u for being welcoming and rendering great service, u are an awesome bartender!
author: Betanzos R.

description:
- Great atmosphere for drinks but I'd go elsewhere for food. 

I had the corned beef and cabbage which you would think should be amazing... and it was... amazingly bad. The meat was tough and dry, it was barely edible. 

My fiancé had the cottage pie and she said that was so-so at best.
author: Robert W.

description: Deliciousness!!   We really enjoyed the bangers and mash.  Reminded me of my trip to England.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Open until 1:30, but 10 pm, bar 70% full, live band but kitchen closed.  Go somewhere else if you are hungry.  $9 draft beer, $20 card minimum.  Even the gas station sells me a $2 bag of chips without credit card minimum.
author: Jj M.

description: Went here for dinner and the steak and sweet potato fries were amazing and I had fried calamari which was definitely fresh lastly the desert the Johnny Foley's chocolate hangover was out of this world.Also had a great server.
author: Christopher P.

description: As tourists, we were looking for a restaurant close to our hotel for a nice dinner. We were seated immediately, but the service was slow from the beginning. I had prime rib which was great. My son had the chicken pot pie, which was awful. He ate one bite and then wanted mine. :) Even though it was obvious he didn't touch his good, our waitress never asked if everything was good. She was obviously very busy - maybe with too many tables?
author: Jennifer T.

description:
The only real complaint here is the noise. This is a loud pub and if you actually want to talk to the people across from you, prepare to yell and ask them to repeat themselves many times. We came on the Sunday night prior to a conference starting at Moscone so I imagine this was abnormally busy for a Sunday night. 

The food is quite solid for pub food. We got the cod croquettes and tandoori chicken skewers for starters. The croquettes were fantastic. The chicken skewers were solid, not exceptional

I got the lamb stew and it was tender and plentiful. You will not leave hungry.

The waitstaff was sufficiently attentive, not incredible, but no real complaints here.

Aside from the noise and the rather unremarkable choices due to the pub menu, this would deserve 4 stars. You won't be unhappy if you come here .. you just won't recommend that anyone go out of their way to come here.
author: D E.

description: If you enjoy a good dueling piano show, this is the place to go in San Francisco, but you have to get there early to avoid standing all night.  Service is excellent and it literally feels like you are at your own house party dancing and singing with everyone in the room. We enjoyed it so much we were there two nights in a row .
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Came for my bachelorette party.  The guys were great and the atmosphere was fun and friendly.  Service was nice as well.  Definitely a great place to check out.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I've been working in SF downtown for a few years now but never gone to Foley's until today.  Big mistake!  Super lovely, cozy place -- and I never thought I'd say this about a pub blasting soccer on multiple screens.  Yet, it feels very homey and the staff is super friendly.  I had cottage pie which was exactly the way I was craving it.  The waiter (Ryan) was attentive and caring.  Wonderful experience over all!
author: Inna G.

description: Corned beef and cabbage and chicken pot pie, that's what we ordered in this centrally located Irish pub. Great atmosphere and people drinking and eating with reckless abandon. I almost ordered the lamb stew but had to try the pot pie. The pot pie was hot to the bottom and it comes with an arugula salad which is a nice complement to the steaming pie. The biscuit crust was super crisp and flavorful.  The CB and cabbage was a perfect combination with sliced carrots and creamy mashed potatoes. Put them all together on your fork and experience what comfort good is. Oishii! I skipped the beer for a McMurray Chardonnay as I enjoy the refined flavor of a good wine. Beer lovers must think I need a lesson which I probably do but wine is my taste. Bread pudding is my standard of comparison when it comes for dessert. Foley's was ok. Not bad. Just ok. Their home made apple pie Ala mode was my second choice. I would definitely dine here again. It gives me comfort.
author: Dan M.

description:
This is a pretty good Irish bar near Union Square.  Service and alcohol are good.  Bar food (such as fries are good).  I order the Irish stew and it was the worst stew I have ever experienced.  Basically a large blob of mash potatoes, surrounded by boiled potatoes and a few under cooked carrots and celery. The lamb was do tough I couldn't eat it.  They then cover it with a gravy which I think was chicken or turkey.  

Maybe the fish & chips or bangers are better.  DO NOT ORDER THE STEW.
author: B M.

description: This pub was packed. Its has lots of space for dine in or eat at the bar. We went just for drinks. The bartenders were all Irish and kinda intense but efficient. Lots of different kinds of beer on tap and quick service. We ordered some snacks to calm down the alcohol intake and had a great time meeting people from all over the USA. Lots of older adults but I did see some kids eating with their parents. Place was clean for it being so crazy busy. Will definately go again.
author: Theresa G.

description: This place is great !!! I had the corned beef which was mouth watering so yummy .A five star Irish pub with wonderful food great staff and atmosphere wow baby . Come and eat here.  I will again for sure
author: Peter C.

description: Great Irish bar , can't beat getting a pint of Guinness , our server was great but expect this place to be packed on most nights , Murphy's is a cold pint also , authentic Irish
author: Erik T.

description: I've been here twice once on a Sunday night when they had live music & another on Monday. Both visits have been great. Haven't ordered food but it's a cool spot to hangout with friends.
author: Matt K.

description: Take out Thai chicken curry. I'm at the hotel. Probably the best I've ever had. Rice was cooked perfectly, the salad was fresh. Polite and efficient on the phone. It's the way you run a business Awesome meal on the road. Thank You!
author: J D.

description: This review is solely on the dueling pianos. Best dueling piano bar I've ever been to! I'm a Los Angeles native, but my sister lived up in Dublin for a year. Every time I'd visit this place was on the itinerary. Definitely miss it now that I'm not up there as much.
author: Danielle G.

description:
In one word - 'meh
First impression was that it was cute. But I was turned off by the sight of stacks of "Bud Light" glasses. I know that the beer people provide free glasses, but.... this is an irish pub, right? Put them on the other side of the bar or under the bar. 
It was late, I was hungry. I stayed. I must have been so hungry that I missed fish and chips on the menu (I see it online, though) so I got a Tuna Melt and a Guinness Blonde Lager. Was pleased to see that the beer didn't come in a Bud Light glass. Again I was hungry, but I don't think that the beer was served quite cold enough. Was happy they had the Blonde Lager, though!
The tuna melt was GINORMOUS. Seriously a huge sandwich. Came with a mixed green salad on the side (you could change it for something else, I was happy with the non-iceberg salad). There wasn't a lot of cheese on it, but it was tasty. It was so big that I had to opt out of most of the bread so that I could eat the entire tuna portion. Was pleased that they had mixed greens on it, rather than boring iceberg.
I'd like to think I would have been happier with fish and chips. My bad for missing that on the menu.
author: Sharron G.

description:
I came here on a Sunday night for a late dinner. The place was pretty crowded with young professionals. A live band was playing and people were enjoying their drinks and dancing. 

I sat in one of the booths. It was a good spot to people watch and enjoy my food. Once the band started it was a little loud and I had trouble hearing the conversation. Luckily, the music the band was playing was great so I did not mind too much!

For dinner I ordered two things off of the appetizer menu. I had the grilled tandoori style chicken skewers and curry fries. Both were delicious. They were not quite what I would expect to find at an Irish pub and restaurant but good nonetheless. 

The chicken was well cooked and very flavorful. It came with a cucumber dipping sauce which was tasty! 

The curry fries were good as well. They were thick cut and a little less crispy than I would normally like, but the curry made up for it. The fries were covered in a mildly spicy yellow curry sauce. I had never had curry fries before and I was very pleased.

Overall, a great place to grab a bite to eat or a drink. The bar itself seemed like a good place to enjoy music and have some fun dancing with friends!
author: Kerry O.

description: Still one of my favorite places in S.F.  Food, service, and attmosphere are all on spot.  When my parents visit from New England they always insist we go here at least once.
author: Sean M.

description: After getting into town late on a Friday night, we walked down the street from hotel to this cool Irish Pub. Had a short wait to get a table and the place was hopping. Very authentic Irish Pub. Good fish and chips and bangers and mash. Good comfort food and drinks.
author: Tim M.

description: The dueling piano bar is the best. I've been here a few times and they have never disappointed. Here for St. Patrick's day and I know it's been a long day but the piano guys and bartenders are still amazing. Definitely recommend to all of my friends and look forward to coming back
author: Emily R.

description: Love this place. Atmosphere is fun, friendly, and upbeat. Bartenders are on their game! Food is excellent. Didn't ask, but wondering if the boys are Irish. I love the accents! Busy, bustling. We will return!
author: Sheri S.

description: Good fish & chips. Great service. Dined alone for dinner. I was seated fast, although the place was busy. Server was ultra-friendly, food came out fast, and my diet coke glass was always full. Fish was crispy and tasty. Had to add a little salt to perk up the flavor. Not greasy. Not mushy. Fries were cooked to order, extra crispy, per request.
author: scott h.

description: Foley's food is good and consistent. Love to come here. Today, our server was Anastasia. She was the best, most attentive server I have ever had at Foley's. It was a fantastic birthday celebration thanks to Anastasia. And thank you Foley's.
author: Timothy L.

description: Had a small city hall wedding on a Thursday  and wanted to go to dueling pianos after the dinner and drinks so we could request a few songs and get a "first dance" experience. They had already played the song we wanted but they still made our night with our other requests. So much fun!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Let me say how disgusted I am with this place, I wait for my friend to get off of work at Fogo's around 12-12:30 and just learned about the place yesterday. The first time I went the bartender who was trying to help me by the name of David I believe that he is the main manager was completely rude his attitude was awful. I was trying to order a drink and in the midst he walked away, completely rude. Moving forward I ordered a drink did not tip because his service was awful tried to make the most of it that night and decided to leave. The next day I went back, David again there when I sat down he was trying to rush me to order a drink wasn't sure what I wanted and told him to give me a second. When he comes back around and I try to order, which someone had walked up behind me ordering a bunch of drinks offered me one and I told him no worries but he insisted, David comes up and says "You know what I am not serving you have a nice night." So I'm sitting there confused, he comes back telling me I need to leave literally haven't even been there for more than 5mins, I ask why and he says he doesn't need a reason and he doesn't need to explain himself. As much as I wanted to curse him out I leave and talk to security. The security informs me that David had came out and said not to allow me in no more with no reasoning. The security was also confused because he had said he's only seen me once. If it wasn't for the security I would picket out and boycott this place but he was really nice and let me know David does that alot. If this was a corporate establishment I would be making a thousand complaints, but it is not so you deal with a lot of unprofessionalism. I am disgusted with how David treated me and behaved, he will be the downfall of there establishment. David get off your high horse I have spent my money here just to get disrespected the way I did, you will not be hearing the last from me! Please if you go avoid David his attitude is shitty and he is extremely disrespectful if he tries to help you go to someone else it is not worth dealing with him. Really I am more offended because I was the only one in the bar from afro\latin decent it was nothing but white people and they were trying to kick me out. It's really saddens me that you get judged off of your looks. I have worked in management before and that is not how you handle business!
author: Shaudai H.

description: The lamb chops are amazing!  This is the best appetizer.  I ordered the prime rib for my main course and it was to die for.  Service was also amazing.  Overall this was the best dining experience I had on my trip to San Francisco!
author: Jay C.

description: My Dad was in town for the holiday and based on the menu we decided to check this place out.  I live nearby and it's always busy so we figured it would be pretty good.  We were wrong.  Neither of us were particularly impressed with our food (I had fish and chips, he had corned beef and cabbage).  The real downfall though is the noise level.  We were sitting at a table and could hardly hear each other talk.  It's a big space and there's nothing to absorb any of the sound.  The Christmas music playing over the speakers certainly didn't help the situation.  I won't be going back.
author: Shelly R.

description:
This is now my favorite Irish bar in San Francisco. It's always lively, the style of the pub is very typically Irish, and the food is good. 
There are usually bands that play here nightly, with a variety of different music styles. 
The menu is traditional Irish style. It's got the usual shepherds pie, bangers and mash. Also has good appetizers. Have to say though that the prices really surprise me at times. Drinks are expensive, even by SF standards. Also the food is pricey. 
The highlight is the Guinness though- the best in the city.
author: Derek M.

description:
"Time For a Pint!" reads the sign above clock at the corner of O'Farrell St. & Cyril Magnin St. This San Francisco icon almost says it all. I write "almost" because you get so much more than a pint at Foley's. 

You see, at Foley's you get a San Francisco institution, tradition, an experience uniquely Johnny Foleys.

The moment you walk through the door, you feel the warmth of the Irish. And this place is cavernous so making a body feel warm is no easy feat. But that's what you get at my favorite bar and restaurant in SF.

First, the staff is stellar. The bartenders know how to pour a proper Guinness as well as shake a perfect Martini. This is my favorite bar in the city and it's due to the bartenders. They are professional in their white shirts and dark ties but they can also be playful and fun, especially with the locals. From behind the gloriously ornate wooden bar, you'll hear charming brogues, witness the spectacle of a mad flurry of activity, and be served a beverage that is sure to refresh and revive. These guys are the best, bar none! And they're dishy. Speaking of dishy, let's talk food.

The food is seriously superb. Recently, O, my spouse and I were staying at Bartlett's Bunkhouse just across the street. Over the course of our stay, we had three suppers at Foley's and all servings were beautifully plated and more importantly lip-licking delicious. It's near impossible for me to order anything other than Foley's cottage pie so I'm not surprised I had it two out of three meals. For my taste and from my exposure to cottage pie in SF, Foley's pie simply can't be beaten. 

On our final night, O and I both had one of the night's specials: grilled pork chops and mashed potatoes. The chops were thick and juicy with grill marks so perfect and pristine in their geometry, they looked painted on. I'm a gravy guy, my Texas roots, I guess, so I was disappointed to see a towering serving of potatoes sans gravy. But after one bite, I was missing gravy no more!

Another night, O had clam chowder. Wow! Until then, our go-to place for clam chowder was a great little place in the Castro but now, we're not so sure which is best. They should call it Foley's Chunky Clam Chowder. 

The Foley's atmosphere is festive and friendly. It's the kind of place you can engage with the stranger next to you who might be a local or a visitor from another country. The place is welcoming and downright familial, so much so it provides the perfect environment to either chat with your neighbor or to enjoy a solitary moment with your journal.

Visually, it's a wonderland if, like me, you're seduced by old-warm charm. Be sure to take it all in from the floor to the ceiling and everything in between. 

Mona Lisa with a Guinness mustache? You betchya!

Many thanks to our warm friends at Foley's who took such great care of us during our stay. We hope to see you all again very soon. Cheers! 

And GO BULLDOGS!
author: Julian J.

description: Live music on a Thursday night- they were awesome! Upbeat, clean, and bartenders were friendly!
author: Jessica B.

description:
This is only for St. Patrick's day, and only for the downstairs area with the dueling pianos. 
I had never been do a dueling piano night so I had see what the fuss was about.  My friend goes every year for St. Patrick's day and says its his favorite holiday because of Johnny Foley's and their dueling piano. 
Piano's start around 8pm, we aimed for 9 and ended up showing up at 10pm where we had to wait in a line for about 40 minutes. Once we were in there was a $10 cover which I'm usually pretty meh about covers but I figured I waited in line this long I gotta go in. 
The atmosphere was pretty cheery, good crowd all there for friendly fun, singing, dancing, and drinking. I wouldn't say there is any dueling or rivalry with these 2 pianos in the room.  It's basically write your song request on a piece of paper, put it on the piano with a big tip, and then the pianos take turns doing requests based on if they know it, and if the tip is big enough. Throw down $100 and they'll sing anything. The pianists are playing the piano and singing so they are kinda amazing- super talented folks. Even tho my Prince song was not played, it was great just to watch these people sing and play. Crowded but not overly obnoxious crowded. There was seating if you really wanted to sit. Curious to see what the dueling pianos night looks like when it's not St. Patrick's day.
author: Veronica L.

description: Great piano bar downstairs .  A little crowded  it a lot of fun. You can request songs
author: Alex A.

description: My husband and I ordered the corned beef and cabbage. They split it for us, which was really nice. The mashed potatoes were delicious and very creamy. But the corned beef was dry and tough and we felt like the dish needed more sauce. The beer was great.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Solid place to watch football (American) on a Sunday (what I did).  4 games on multiple tvs. Murphys stout by the pint over and over.  Typical Irish fare with some west coast twists.   
The curry fries were unique and I enjoyed them.  Bartenders knew how to pour a proper pint.
author: Doug S.

description: Stopped in here for a quick beer upon arriving in the city for my mini vacation. Right in the heart of Union Square, this is one of those old school Irish bars where you can get a cold (and I mean cold!) one amidst tourists and regulars alike. Bartender was attentive. Prices are probably better at happy hour, but I was early and paid $6 for a Coors Light. Not bad considering you are in one of the most expensive cities in the world. Perfect stop to wet my whistle and move on down the road!
author: Lisa R.

description: Tried their calamari and cottage pie, both were amazing! Calamari batter is light and tasted fresh. And the Cottage pie was nicely baked!
author: Christian G.

description: The server and service was on point. We were greeted, offered menus and drinks, dishes were explained in detail and suggestions made by our server. The food was pretty good and portions generous. I had the fish and chips which served big chunks of fried cod, French fries and tarter sauce and malt vinegar. Delicious choice!
author: Liv M.

description: Good times and great pub food. Try an Irish car bomb
author: Charlene M.

description:
I went here in a group and they put us in a nice separate room.  It is a really nice old pub, feels inviting.

After drinks, we started with soda bread.  It is pricy and was really disappointing, very stale and kind of flavorless.

For appetizers, we ordered the bacon prawns and calamari.  The prawns were good ( hard to go wrong with bacon) but the calamari was a little rubbery.

For the main course, I had the lamb stew.  The lamb was fine, but it was very potato heavy with mashed and boiled potatoes ( and could have used more veggies)  Others had the prime rib and had mixed feedback.

I would definitely go back here for drinks, but for the pride the food should be better.
author: Edward S.

description: This is a super fun place to visit! We came in from out of town and it was just down the street from our hotel. The manager I think, was super friendly, got us in right away! The food was super fast and so so good! Great first experience for my boyfriend who has never been to San Francisco!
author: April E.

description: Great genuine-Irish pub atmosphere with friendly staff. Perfect pint pours and delicious higher-end pub grub. In a tourist area, but not a tourist trap!!!
author: T S.

description: We went to the dueling piano show in the basement . The crowd was high energy, the piano players were fun and sang well and the bartenders were prompt and quick to serve in this busy bar. We were lucky and got a table near the stage. It was really fun!!
author: Kim W.

description: Excellent veggie stew and fantastic service. The vegetables were perfectly cooked with a nicely flavoured but not overpowered broth. Our waitress Jenny was prompt and very courteous. My only complaint is the limited selection of vegan/vegetarian options on the menu.
author: Melanie S.

description:
We came for the dueling pianos, and had a fun evening.   But, I've got to caveat that it's dueling keyboards, not pianos.  They've literally just set a keyboard into the hull of a piano.  There were three keyboard players, who rotated throughout the night.  They take requests (choosing those with the highest tip, generally $20 or $30, first) and allow people to "shut down" requests if they pay more than the original tip. (i.e. If you paid $20 for "Let It Go", someone can pay $25 and shut the song down)

They've got tables that are first-come, first-grab.  And a dance floor in the middle, perfect for bachelorette parties, birthdays, and just general singing into the air. It's a small space, so you will likely wait in line.  $10 cash cover.
author: Kelly E.

description: Cool atmosphere and good food. They have live bands some nights. We stopped in for dinner before a concert because it was near our hotel. The staff was so friendly they convinced us to come back after the concert for the band. We did and it was a blast! 80's cover band was fantastic, bartender made us drinks we gave him recipe for. The kitchen closes at 10:00 though so if you want late night food this is not the spot!
author: Leah P.

description: Really good sandwich. This is a barbecue pulled pork on ciabatta. Service is good and the the food came out fast!
author: Franco M.

description: Giving 2 stars just for that fact that the place is kinda cool with the  loud/busy scene ....nice bar but with a surprising lack of quality whiskey....the waiter was a complete waste of time..it was almost as if we were bothering him ...and I'm not one to complain about service when places are busy..i get that.. but this guy was plain rude...so we had our drinks and an appetizer and left to eat elswhere
author: Dennis M.

description:
I pass by this place on a daily basis but never go in. There is usually a crowd outside and it looks pretty touristy. I also see that they have the Dueling Pianos her, which is a reason for their popularity.

I came here with coworkers to celebrate her last day on the job. It seemed like a good venue that was large enough to accommodate a large group, and there is no cover.

Likes:
-Plenty of seating and standing area
-Food options if you come early enough
-Pretty decent draft selection
-Live music! The band playing when I went was lively, fun, and got the crowd dancing.
-Dueling Pianos on certain nights
-Central location. Right next to 38 stop and close to Bart/Muni

Dislikes:
-EXPENSIVE. $8-9 for draft beer not including Tax! $14 for a signature cocktail. Absolutely ridic prices.
-Gets packed quickly.
-Crowd can be hit or miss. It was super touristy and several men kept trying to impress me when I clearly was not impressed by them.

It's maybe a fun stop if you're having a night out, but with the prices, I could not imagine going for more than 1 drink here before wanting to move onto the next bar where I can get a drink for half the price.
author: Lanie L.

description: Another great spot in San Fran. Will go back for sure. Watched games, drank a few beers and food is good as well. Lots of fun with other customers. Great atmosphere. Little pricey but what isn't while in S/F?
author: Gary M.

description:
The food is relatively expensive and some of the portions for the entrees are not worth the price (i.e. Wild mushroom ravioli). Nonetheless, I visit this place every time I'm in downtown SF. 

Fish and chips are very good and large portion. The wild mushroom ravioli is very garlic-Y and I was still hungry after I finished the plate. The cottage pie is delicious and more filling. Overall, I would recommend this place to catch up with friends over some beers. Service is quite slow when it's crowded.
author: Jessica W.

description: Food was good! We had the fish and chips and they were great! The service was good. We felt it was a bit overpriced but for San Francisco I guess it wasn't too bad! We would recommend it for a pub!
author: Anita P.

description: I wanted to go for Dueling Pianos but it turned out we were there on the wrong night. Nevertheless, the bar was a hopping place, and notwithstanding that I came already well charged with beer, we had a great time.
author: Nick B.

description:
Outstanding service and delicious food. I came here just to get a salad. 
My friend and I decided to split the Irish Lamb Stew. It was the best ever. 
So tender and flavorful. I highly recommend. Odd thing was our salad was served at the same time as the main meal. 
Other than that amazing.
author: Wendy M.

description: Great atmosphere, numerous beers on tap.  We ordered the burger and fish and chips. Burger was ordered medium but served well well done.  It was dry.  Fish and chips were pretty good though.  The host was Irish so we liked that.  Friendly staff.  Neat restaurant.  Probably won't come back or recommend.  We ordered the potato skins which were good.  This might be a good place to come to for just beers and appetizers.
author: Michelle S.

description: This pub is conveniently located close to Union Square. We went there on a Saturday and still got good seating for a large group. There was no air conditioning or fan or anything and it was super hot inside. When we asked the waitress if there is some AC unit, she just got rude and told us that she herself is wearing a tie. We had one drink there and left since the heat was unbearable. There was a live rock band there which was playing nice music and people were dancing in that little area. I feel like this place can do a lot better with their service since they already have a great location.
author: Roma M.

description:
The Veggie Stew and Fried Chicken were phenomenal! Last year when I came here with my family I ordered the wings and garlic fries and my brother had the Veggie Stew. I remembered how yummy it was so I had to come back. I wish I lived here so I could have the Veggie Stew at least twice a month! 

I asked for more water several times but never got a refill... It would've been five stars if the waitress had been a little more attentive.
author: Rebecca F.

description: The ratings didn't lie! Great tartar sauce for the fish and chips, and the Gorgonzola sauce for the steak was amazing. The atmosphere was busy but friendly. We are so glad we came.
author: Melissa S.

description: Fish and chips were good, a little 'fishy' tasting but at least you know it's fresh!  Food can quick and the beer is cold with plenty of taps to choose from.  They had the Oakland game was on as well, for those wanting a little sports.
author: Josh B.

description: This place knows how to pour a pint of the black stuff.  Appetizers are also delicious. Stopped in here after a day of shopping.  Bar staff was great and friendly.
author: Ron J.

description: The grilled lamb sliders were delicious!!  The creek brûlée was also very delicious.  I would dine here again.
author: Roxy P.

description:
Classic Irish Pub!
We had the mussels, calamari, and oysters and they were all DELICIOUS! The best calamari I've ever had. The mussels were uniquely and brilliantly flavored.
Kind and attentive wait staff.
Very, very glad we came!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
This place is old school cool.  When you walk in you know your at an Irish Pub.  It is very nice and the bar tenders are nice and knowledgeable.  Every thing about service was perfect.  We enjoyed our time here!

I highly recommend this establishment.  We did not eat this trip but I have eaten here before and enjoyed the food.
author: Doug P.

description:
An Irish Bar in San Francisco! Is that Backstreet Boys playing? Yes, yes it is. When I spent a week in Ireland they played a lot of "american" music, songs that we forget about, generally dislike but will definitely sing along to. The music here was like my Shazam download history from 1990. 

Lots of beer on tap here, I love at least one warm beer like a Kilkenny and then I'm off to the cold races. Our Kilkenny pints were very full, and served in real pint glasses. 

The food was really expensive and not that great. I had just walked over from Masterchef tryouts and after staring and tasting some really good dishes and this place fell flat on it's culinary kilt. My fish and chips was three pieces of battered fish served a top a pile of chips, or frozen fries. Barely crisp and mush in the middle I mentioned this to my waitress when she said they made the best fish and chips. The fish was okay, tasted fresh at least. She was very friendly but never offered to bring a fresh batch that was actually cooked.

I'd give it 3 stars, 4 for the beer, 3 for the service and 2 for the food. Hopefully it was just an off day.
author: Katie G.

description: Great atmosphere, but if you're going to be an Irish pub in a city with such great food, you better make sure your corned beef is excellent.  This was average at best.  The shephards pie was also pretty middle of the road.   Service was very attentive though
author: Scott C.

description: Was looking for a bar sobI just walked in dammmmm I had fun good drinks and very good Live band Im coming back for sure
author: John C.

description:
Fish and chips were amazing
Corned beef was divine, mash potatoes out of this world!! The cabbage, no words! So good
author: Jessica L.

description: Go for the dueling pianos night because it's a ridiculously fun time. They play crap music until you tip them. The performers offer a lot of crowd engagement.
author: Em L.

description: Friday evening with the dueling piano bar. Drinks, buffalo wings and shrimp were all great. Go here for a fun night listening to dueling pianists and a sing along atmosphere.
author: Raquelle Z.

description:
Expect a wait! When I heard it would be up to an hour I was ready to walk out but then I heard an accent. Irish accents are so sexy. I had to do a u turn and go tot he bar. Packed pretty tightly by the bartenders gave girls prior attention, so we ordered for the guys next to us and they covered the tab! :-) 

Great Irish pub and lovely piano bar. One of those places where you feel strange as hell to order wine unless you're a 21 year old girl. And by the time you down the wine there's someone offering you an IPA - I mean you're an adult at a pub do it right. 

Food was just a skip past okay (salmon and wild ravoli) but the service, music, decor and ambiance was top notch. Extremely spacious bar but still has that neighbor small vibe. I had re-watched Far and Away before visiting. So raise your pint and enjoy yourself. Kilkenny, Guinness, Karp and Murphy's (in that order). Expect to hear some profanity from a few smiling faces.
author: Marie F.

description: It was football Saturday and most bars were filled with sports fans. What this restaurant did was reserve seats for the people that wanted to dine in. We were able to come in eat, drink and leave at a prompt time but not rushed time. Will definitely come again.
author: Melbin A.

description: Best Irish bar and food in the city. I go here every opportunity I get. Try the pot pie.
author: Brendan C.

description: Good ambience, like in Ireland.  The steak was great and the shrimp was delicious! You can really taste the grill.  There was a great band playing at the end of the night. It made the dining experience a whole lot better. Good food and free live music!
author: Cath C.

description: OK, new here. Had a small incident, and can't believe how professional the staff and management handled it. The food is great, drinks top notch. Can't say how much this place reminds us of Ireland.  You can't go wrong with a stopover here!
author: Ed T.

description: Very good food!  I had the filet mignon with a side of mashed potatoes. I recommend getting no the peppered sauce with the filet. Cool atmosphere and bar.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
A place for a pint and a Jameson. A stop I always try to make. 
The maze like set up in a bit charming, but breaks up the bar in an odd way. 
The food is filler at best, but it's the atmosphere and the genuine Irish qualities that bring me back each time.
author: David B.

description: Stopped for lunch.  Great atmosphere and helpful staff.  Menu has lots of options, so hard to choose.  Had the Wild Mushroom Ravioli with Chicken.  Very good meal that was just what I needed on this chilly afternoon.  Prices are moderate but in line with the area.
author: Chris H.

description:
I LOVE JOHNNY FOLEY'S! This is one of my favorite places to bring family and friends from out of town. What could be better than listening to some of your favorite tunes sung by some hot pianist talent. 

I have frequently attended PianoFight, but the last time I went I witnessed what they sing to birthday goers. It's hilarious and a little embarrassing but definitely worth it. 

On highly active nights you will find more people getting the courage to go up and dance which is a lot of fun and better than just sitting and watching. 

PianoFight for tha win.
author: Alexa H.

description:
This place is absolutely fantastic. I had never heard of it, but a friend who was visiting from Chicago found it online, so we decided to check it out. We went to the Dueling Pianos in the downstairs cellar, and it was equal parts fun and hilarious. They have a one-out-one-in policy at the door, but we only had to wait for about five minutes. 

The music downstairs was absolutely terrific--it's all requests driven, and the pianists can play just about everything! I was surprised to find that there was a pretty packed dance floor. It took a bit to get a table, but it was never overcrowded. The drinks were delicious, and the prices weren't much more than you'd expect from your average SF bar. The decor is awesome--especially the dark red wallpaper-- and the bathrooms were clean and well-decorated as well. 

We came to Johnny Foley's expecting to get some drinks but end our night elsewhere, but we had such a fun time, we ended up sticking around for last call. It was a fun, welcoming space, and I can't recommend it enough!
author: Olivia H.

description:
Upstairs: Irish Pub/Sports Bar
Downstairs in the cellar: Limited bar menu and dueling pianos at night.

I can't review the whole upstairs menu, but I can review what we had while we were downstairs for the dueling piano show, which was one of the highlights of this trip and is not to be missed.

I don't think I have ever encountered a server that was as nice as the server we had. She seemed genuinely concerned that we were enjoying ourselves, even apologizing when I said did not care for the garlic fries. Potato skins were standard. Wings were nothing that stood out, but sit back have some beers or drinks and watch the pianists go at it. 

They play for tips and the biggest tippers get their requests played. Everything from Wilson Phillips to Miley Cyrus to Taylor Swift to the anthemic "Don't Stop Believing"... these guys are entertaining.
