The crowd gets into it, sings, dances and is even allowed to participate... if the tip is right.

Of course, it gets crowded, but that's half the fun. Watching the crowd and singing along yourself, you can let your hair down a little bit and just have fun... and who doesn't love fun?
author: Mark S.

description:
My friends and I came here one Friday night to check out the dueling pianos. Since this was my first time seeing this, I didn't know what to expect. At the end of the night, I was very surprised at how much fun I had!

The venue itself is split in two: sports bar on the right and dueling pianos on the left. On this occasion, we only checked out the piano bar (I'll write an updated review when I check out the sports bar in the future). There was a $10 cover up front which I expected for the show. When I arrived at the actual piano bar, it was packed with people! There were no tables for my friends and I so we stood the whole time. The bar itself was fine. On this night, there were two or three bartenders working which made for timely service. They also serve some food which I didn't try but might do so on a future occasion. 

The show featured two pianist (one male and one female) who made the show lively and fun. They made the audience participate and do fun dances on stage making everyone laugh and have a good time. Also, you can make specific song requests if you tip them. When I was there, they mostly sang country songs and contemporary rap music. I liked the show a lot and would come here again with my friends.

This is a great place to spend a night if you're a fan of all types of music. The vibe is lighthearted with plenty of fun people around you. My only complaint would be the space (especially on Friday) so get there early if you want a table. I would come here again so I'll see you there!
author: Chris M.

description:
Came here in May 2015. NOTE: I only tried the drinks here. 

I give this place 1 star for the service at the bar. The first bartender did not know how and/or refused to make any drinks that were not on the menu. A second bartender came over to fulfill our "custom" drink orders. He was a little too confident about about his drink-making skills. However, the drinks he made us did not live up to his claim. They both tasted like sours, which was not what we wanted. The service along with the drinks definitely left a bad taste in my mouth, and I do not plan on coming back here.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: This place is a perfect traditional Irish Pub. Music, ambient, and service are very good and pleasant !
author: Jean-Baptiste S.

description: Second time here. We came in after watching musical, restaurant still has a lot of people about 9:30pm on sat night. Food came fast and we really enjoyed the xmas atmosphere around the bar. Live music came on at 10pm which was awesome way to end the night.
author: Grace L.

description: Love love love!! The food is AMAZING, extremely fresh and delicious flavors! Kristy, our server, was simply phenomenal. She was precise, quick and a joy! Thank you for the amazing service, high quality food and the awesome decor and ambiance. Highly recommended and would love to return!!
author: Nicole J.

description: I had a great time at this place. I'm not sure if it was because it was my first time being in city and got myself hyped up, but I surely had a great time here. Fish and Chips were soooooo good after couple pints of Guinness.
author: Yao M.

description: We love the place and we did enjoy our stay. We had so much fun listening to the music. The food tastes so good. Thier staffs are very approachable.
author: Mega Team R.

description:
Sorry, can't do 5 stars which would be maybe deserved because of their (ahem) "policy"

I'm solo at a table for 3. A lovely older couple is at the bar, one seated at the only seat and one standing. I try to swap ... And management tries to kick them out because they don't have a "reservation"

Needless to say I reclaimed my table so they were not kicked out... (Might have helped that I hadn't paid my tab yet)


KC waitress is first rate best ever! Many good brews on tap. 

They have some lessons to be learned on customer service ... And I'm glad I had the trump card of an open tab
author: Jim M.

description: Came for my husbands birthday and we loved it, great atmosphere. Bartenders are very friendly great customer service!
author: Leticia M.

description: Had a great time. Great service. Piano bar was hilarious. Was a touch pricey, 2 drink minimum.
author: Bob H.

description:
Walked down from the Hilton for an early dinner because the Urban Tavern, connected to the Hilton, doesn't start seating for dinner until 5:30pm, but my stomach was set for the central time zone.

I ordered the 6 oz. Petit filet and a side of steamed asparagus... With the Gorgonzola butter sauce on the side.  It was excellent... Portion wasn't too big nor was it too small.  

I ordered a glass of Reisling as well.

Total bill was about $40... Not too bad for the area.
author: Ann J.

description:
Faith and begorrah, I thought that wee ole Johnny had opened his pub more than a few fortnights ago, but it's only been around since 1998. I kept thinking to myself that surely I was drunk in here years before that, but I find myself mixing this place up with Lefty O'Doul's on Geary (my review: http://bit.ly/16xkXTE). They both have active bars, mostly Norm Petersen-types looking into their emptying mugs, I'm guessing. This place is cavernous with the oddest configuration. Dividers everywhere making it feel claustrophobic despite the constant cacophony of drunken revelers (photo: http://bit.ly/1adnzcy). Jamie W. and I came here one Friday evening seeking some pub grub without the pints.

We were seated smack in the middle right near the portrait of dear ole Johnny Foley who apparently exhibited quite a tenor voice in his day (photo: http://bit.ly/18i1rMO). Jamie wasn't feeling as peckish as me and ordered the $11 Buffalo Chicken Wings with Gorgonzola Dip and Celery Sticks (photo: http://bit.ly/18i1p7L). He got eight of them, somewhat chewy in that overcooked way and lacquered with a cayenne-pepper hot sauce. It was pub grub, what do you expect? I was more ambitious and had the $29 Slow Roasted Prime Rib of Beef, which believe me, would never be mistaken for a Henry the Eighth cut at the House of Prime Rib. The beef was a 12-ounce slab heavy on the au jus but a bit chewy around the gristle.

It was surrounded by garlic mashed potatoes that were extra creamy and a mixed vegetable medley. There was a ramekin of horseradish on the side but no sign of the parsley-mint pesto advertised in the menu (photo: http://bit.ly/18JSBeM). It was what I was in the mood for, what can I say? That wasn't a deadly piece of meat, laddie. No, it wasn't brilliant but it was good craic. There, did I sound a wee bit Irish? I didn't? Well, neither did the waiter. I heard tell of the Dueling Pianos show in the cellar, but a previous experience at Jellyroll's on the Disney Boardwalk in Orlando thwarted my appetite for any future keyboard gymnastics. And I doubt I'd come back for the prime rib, but I could be convinced to have a pint on you. That would be good craic.

FOOD - 3 stars...regulation pub grub should meet your expectations
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...t'is a pub...a very big pub by Dublin standards, methinks
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...pretty regulation as well
TOTAL - 3 stars...a place to hoist a few, laddie
author: Ed U.

description: This place had old world charm.  We stopped in for a Bloody Mary and tried the clam chowder.  It was very delicious!  We checked the dinner menu and decided to come back for dinner.  We had the Kale salad and the Irish Stew.  They were both awesome!
author: Sharon M.

description: Very nice food and friendly atmosphere  highly recommended, specifically the great server who is fluent in English & Russian  great place !!!
author: Zoya M.

description: Imagine you are in one of the best food cities in the world with your teenage son. This is where he wants to go for his birthday dinner. So we went. The portions are way too big, which I suppose justifies the price but only if you want a huge amount of food or you split one thing. The food is fine. The onion straws a the best item we had. It was too loud, which made the server not hear what my son ordered a brought the wrong thing. Not at all worth the trip if you are looking for go food while visiting the city.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Great Irish bar, lots of space too. I went for drinks but ended up getting a prime rib! It was tremendous! I felt the staff could have been more personable, but hey it was busy. Right in union square, you can walk to your hotel after if your in town for business.
author: Thomas R.

description: I was in San Francisco over the weekend to tour around town and this bar was very chill and relaxing, good music, live band.
author: Liliana R.

description:
This place.  I can't even.

Part I: The pub.  In general I don't like pub food since the best pub in existence was my mainstay during college (RIP Sean Kelly's).  As of yet, I've been no where that can top it and whenever my husband and I try one of these places out... I tend to be disappointed.  But my SanFran guide and nephew, TJ, wanted to stop in here and grab dinner before the Dueling Piano show downstairs (at 9pm).  So, we went.

Food was not memorable but not bad my any means.  The quality of your food, naturally, depends on what you order.  My husband got the fish and chips and I was a little jealous.  But I'd ordered a green Thai chicken curry (it was the special?) and it was sufficiently ok.  Lots of vegetables and creamy coconut, but served with that ubiquitous rice pilaf stuff you get in bars. Service was easy peasy, even though it was pretty packed.  Pints were abundant, plentiful, and I think $8 a piece?  Even for imports.  Could definitely be worse.

Part II:  I couldn't possibly overstate how much I enjoyed the piano show downstairs.  Having never been to one, I will confess, I was prepared to hate it.  We'd just come from Bourbon and Branch, which I loved, and has a completely different vibe.  Settling into my front row chair (Thanks, TJ), the waitress said there was a two drink minimum and then left for like 20 minutes.

Don't make me assume my true form.

(I actually drank water the whole show without reprisal.  I was already completely snickered, so, good job on that one.  You blinked first, lady.)

Todd and... $hit.  Todd and his compadre were lovely and talented.  Although they didn't know 2 Chainz's "Birthday Song" I did get them to play Beyoncé's "Single Ladies," and laughed hysterically the whole time.

Being the saucy wench that I am, I bantered back and forth with the performers all night.  That is, until things backfired, went south, the whole nine.  Todd pulled me up on stage (despite a lot of drunk-a$$ resistance) and sat me on top of the stage.  Todd's friend (I am so sorry) went on break, and he sang... "F*** Her Gently" to me, in front of about 75 strangers.  My husband (darling that he is) got it all on video (it's ok honey, I'm playing the long game).  I tried to be a good sport.  But I was about as red as the Kremlin. The whole song.

Bravo, you guys.  You'll see "that loud-a$$ girl from Miami" soon enough.
author: Lacey C.

description: Pricey drinks but the duo of musicians is awesome!! Went there for a friend's birthday and we had a blast!
author: Rim K.

description: Great spot near the Westin Hotel, food was delicious. Service was excellent! Will be back again!
author: Erin P.

description: Fantastic steak! Get the gargonzola butter! Incredible additive to a steak that didn't even need it. Good price for a the quality of steak you receive. Wanna go back as soon as I can!
author: Lindsey E.

description: Drinks were good, service was friendly.   Nice lively place to hang out.  Would return for sure.
author: Kim M.

description: Service is good not great.  Music is hit or miss.  Didn't try the food.  Would definitely come back though
author: Josh M.

description: Love this pub! I also love that they stay a bar during Dreamforce. I can count on them to be a place to have a pint & chill. Best mushy peas too!
author: Melinda S.

description:
Recommended by the hotel....not a fan. Overpriced beer selection....service was subpar and non attentive. For being right in the heart of Union Square would think this place would try to pack them in with helpful service and attentive staff....nope. 

Food was also overpriced and small portion, we got the potato skins and came with 4 of the smallest potato skins I have ever seen. After being on a plane and airport food we had higher hopes and were very disappointed.

Even though this is one of the closer bars to our hotel, we did not return and would not recommend.
author: Christy B.

description:
Great service but food def doesn't live up to the price tag. 

I ordered the prime rib $32 item. Some how I got my prime rib before my beer. I am wondering if it was sitting for a while. It seemed to be a little past med cooked. Lacks seasoning .

I will return for the piano bar but not to eat . Better place would be garden club in south San Francisco .
author: Justin I.

description: The food here is always delicious! Great beer selection. Professional staff with very timely service! Plenty of food options & not enough stomach room!!! Still one of my favorite SF picks.
author: Richard H.

description: Great service,food was high qaulity, and an amazing atmosphere.Ill be back!! I recommend checking it out.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Food was hearty and plentiful. I loved the fact the menu included Indian food since a pub "back home" would include those as well. A good mix of Irish fare and American. Americanized pub grub to appeal to just about anyone. If you want more "authentic" Irish foods, um, go to Ireland.
Expect to wait (20-30 mins) since the place is popular and good location. Service isn't 4-star but staff is friendly and the crowds keep them hustling.
We brought visiting family and they were happy. Good experience overall.
author: lynda m.

description:
I came out to Foley's with some friends while we were staying in town for the 2015 Chocolate run. One of our group members lead us here for some late night carb loading and even more important, late night beers. 

While the bouncer at the door made me question my own birthday when he scrutinized my Ohio ID, our server, Patrick, was awesome! Patrick made sure our drinks were filled and amused us with friendly banter as we people watched and enjoyed our food and beverages. 

While I didn't eat any food here I did enjoy a few perfectly poured Guinness and  I know my friends loved their food and drink. 

I would definitely visit again!
author: Rachel K.

description:
Good bar.   Admittedly the place is kinda touristy, but if you want a good bar with a fun friendly atmosphere, this is a great place.  

Make sure to take a look around at all of the paintings on the walls.  There are some fun portraits of mostly famous Irish people.  Worth a look.  

We saw a band called "Luv Bomb" the other night there.  They were fantastic.  Worth the time if you like 60's and 70's soul music.
author: Nelson W.

description:
This place is great. I went here alone due some business travel and there was a little bit of a wait to get in, but I was repeatedly checked on and asked if I wanted a drink while I waited.

Once I got seated, the waitress came by quickly and was very friendly. She seemed knowledgeable about the beer offered, too. I ended up ordering the traditional corned beef and cabbage and it was fantastic, and also arrived very quickky. I really enjoyed the parsley gravy it came with. The waitress checked on me multiple times, and even offered to do something about the guy sitting next to me who wouldn't stop talking to me. It's nice to know she was attentive enough to see this.

Beer is priced a little high, but I do think the prices for downtown SF are fair. My entree was $23, and I'd continue to pay that much for the quality and size of the meal I received.

Thank you for the delicious meal and great experience!
author: Becky T.

description: Absolutely awesome!!  Had the smoked cod and lamb stew. Perfect meals with a appetizer bacon wrapped shrimp
author: Sophia W.

description: While on vacation, we stopped in to Johnny Foley's and we're very glad we did. Food was excellent as well as the drinks. Our server Jessica was extremely competent and chatted with us for a short time. Loved this place so much, we returned another night and had the same wonderful experience. The manager, Nancy, was so great! We highly recommend this place!
author: Joan C.

description: We have came here before but only for drinks! We came in yesterday to try the food out and it was delicious! We had the potato skins, chicken sandwich and the lamb stew! Everything tasted great! The service was good too! We will be back!
author: Dulce G.

description: Excellent food and service.  Yummy Bacon wrapped scallops, chicken, and Irish lamb stew!
author: Suzan I.

description: Always 5 stars! The beer is cold the fish is fresh and the service is top notch! We had brats n beers chicken wings muscles hot bread n better fish n chips to die for! Anytime I am in San Francisco this is my go to! Why? The piano bar is so damn fun! When the night is over I am begging for more and believe me when I say I am not alone!!!! I can't wait to come back!
author: Lisa B.

description: Had a rather pleasant experience here. Enjoyed the mussels for appetizers and Irish car bombs throughout the evening which were bomb. Their steak however was okay, I've certainly had much better as this one didn't have a lot of zest to it but it was decent. Their mashed posts were tasty though with a nice kick of garlic to them and the gravy was fabulous!!!! Ended dinner with their strawberry cheesecake for dessert and it was pretty bad! I'm talking a frozen piece of cheesecake from Costco would have tasted better than this places'. Great service but overall their menu is really hit n miss
author: Sarah S.

description: The bar itself has a very cool atmosphere and scene.  The bar was super slammed and only had 1 bartender (at 3:30pm on a Sunday), so make sure to grab someone when they come by.  The food was decent, but I won't go rushing back.
author: John C.

description: We have been coming here for years, and the food and service is consistently good quality. I've had many items on the menu, the Cottage Pie, corned beef and cabbage, steak sandwich and even the tuna melt, and the quality of the food does not disappoint. They pour the best Guinness in California! Appetizers are also fantastic, wings, potato skins. I highly recommend trying Johnny Foleys when in Union Square.
author: Robin F.

description: We received great service, and all the food came promptly and was delicious. These place does their potato skins better than any other place I have ever been to.
author: Mario G.

description: Great Irish Pub.  Large selection of beer and a really good food menu.  Only complaint is there is a bad smell - kinda like the place needed a good cleaning.  That could be because I was in 2 days after St. Patrick's day.  Definitely will be back.
author: Mark Y.

description: A bit pricey, but portions were large and food was delicious. Server was not friendly at all, and she seemed aggravated our entire meal. But this is a great place to grab some drinks and great food!
author: Hoku L.

description:
Ok so this is not quite as nice as an Irish pub in Ireland where, I lived for 15 months but, it's pretty close :-))

Great selection of beers on tap and a wide variety of other drinks. Most of my colleagues from England, US and Ireland hung out here and I visited this place a few times and enjoyed some great pints of Kilkenny. 

Happily come back here and hang out and even stay for dinner. Cannot comment on the food as we did not eat here but the food looked good.
author: Sam S.

description:
We had frequented this business once while celebrating our anniversary back in September.

They had a pretty good band that night that made the night go by fast.  There was a decent crowd there that night.  Some were there for a computer convention and would have not normally be in that bar crowd otherwise.

My HB and I actually got up and danced to the band Fusion.  They played to the tunes of today's music plus some rock and pop.  We actually were able to sit close to the dance floor which was small but it worked out for the night.  There was good energy for partying for some odd reason; maybe bc it was a Saturday night. 

We didn't stay too late as we are old-timers.  Thank goodness that the hotel we stayed at was just across the street within good walking distance! Nice and convenient!

I believe this restaurant does have some good entertainment like the dueling pianos.
This restaurant was pretty packed full of people that Saturday night!  Not sure if ever we would be back though.
author: Karen K.

description:
At 3pm on a Saturday, we had a few hours until our next scheduled activity.  We'd been talking about getting an Irish Coffee at the Buena Vista, one of our tourist traditions, but decided that we didn't want to make the effort to get all the way over there from our hotel in Union Square. Luckily Johnny Foley's was just around the corner.  We walked in and immediately seated ourselves at the center of the bar.  There place was pretty busy, but not yet crowded, so there were still several seats at the bar.

The drinks took a couple of minutes, since the bartender warmed up the mugs with hot water prior to making the actual drink.  It was a great IC when it arrive - hot coffee, cool cream, pinch of nutmeg, and just enough whisky to take the edge of a cold summer's day in SF. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ywTPpJFALm3WZKlaJbUUjg&userid=ya3mbvTaymecfrTc08SxhQ

We paid and were on our way in about 30 minutes, revived and ready to do some more sightseeing.
author: Angela M.

description: Decent place for a after work or dinner hour stop over while down near Powell Station and Near Union Square. I had two pints and they didn't disappoint. Decent selection of all your Irish favorites.  I only tried the pints, but the menu selection has a great variety and a few of the local seafood favorites if you wish. See Kalista. She was the best and will take care of you. I will definitely be back.
author: Brian S.

description: Two small complaints: the free wifi is godawful, and HolyFuck is it loud in here. That said, THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC! The shepherds pie was outta sight, and the steak with the wine peppercorn sauce, and champ, was delectable. Great service, and the place was SICK PACKED that night, so kudos to them. Cool ambience, with a bevy of celebrated Irish heroes from Yeats to U2 in beautifully framed painted portraits covering the dark wooden walls.
author: Tony F.

description: It's ok
author: Kevin L.

description: Foley's is consistently good and is always a fun place to visit.  Today we stopped for lunch since we were in SF for a day of shopping.  A cool Guinness, football and a sunny Autumn day; what could be better.  Although we've been here numerous times, we tend to stay with our favorites, which are the cottage pie, fish and chips, beef and Guinness soup, and a few others.  The service is ALWAYS great and the atmosphere is very relaxed, so a visit to Foley's is well worth your time.
author: James G.

description:
There are great drink options here- a little expensive but this is the city so can't complain too much. 

I got the potato skins which are delicious but again expensive.
I'll only go here once every month, my poor little wallet can't handle the cost. 
I'd rather treat myself somewhere a little more clean and posh.

It's pretty dark and loud here as well- not the best place to go when you want to chill.
author: Jenny B.

description: Great place to come to watch sports ball. I spend a good part of the World Cup here with friends, and had a wonderful time. The wait staff is very friendly, the food is good solid pub food. Nothing to write home about, but decent all together. Yes, tourists come here as well, but you can't avoid that given the location.
author: Danielle L.

description: Waited 10 minutes at the bar just now and no service. He seemed to not care. Won't recommend this place.
author: Bryan C.

description: Wandered here on the recommendation from our uber driver. Best Bloody Mary I've ever had and I'm basically an alcoholic after last weekend.
author: Gina J.

description: I've been here a dozen times with friends and family! The downstairs piano bar is the place to go! For a couple dollars you can request any song you like! The players are extremely talented. The bar tenders are really sweet as well. My only complaint is how greedy they were on New Year's Eve! If you paid cover for one side of the bar and you wanted to go to the other they actually charged you a second cover... Umm why?!after the count down we wanted to go to the other side which would have let other patrons enjoy the music, but well we didn't really want to pay a second cover for the same place. Seems silly. Folley's I love you but don't be greedy.
author: Sarah E.

description: Really great atmosphere and menu.  Excellent service right downtown.  Highly recommend.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Came here with my family for dinner. Staff were very accommodating especially for a large party. Since it's a pub/restaurant, it is quite noisy so nothing out of the ordinary here. Good selection of beers and other drinks. Food was delightful. I had the fried chicken. Was gonna try the corned beef hash, but was gonna have corned beef the following day so I thought I'd try something else. Would come back if around the area.
author: Erik C.

description: Best fish and chips I've had in a long time. Great atmosphere, staff. Coming back later tonight for the nightly music.
author: L M.

description: The food was worth 5 stars and MOST of the staff was very kind and helpful an happy. BUT our server was NOT good. I work in a restaurant and am a server myself so I understand the stress of serving. Our server didn't introduce herself, didn't smile, didnt appreciate us as guests and my friends and I felt unwanted. When the bills came she LOOKED in the books to see for cash or card. And make it seem she wasn't giving us change. Then, when we did get change she gave incorrect change. Only a small amount she missed but it's the moral behind it not the amount we were missing.
author: Jaye V.
Stars S.

description:
Awesome bar near Union Square. Old-timey-looking taps set the mood at the bar and the bar itself is spacious. Sadly, they stopped serving food at 10 so I could not sample it. They have an awesome Irish whiskey and beer selection though and the bartender was great company.

There was live music on Tuesday night and the atmosphere was lively.

Will update this review with feedback on the food.
author: Irina P.

description: Good beer and good times.  The downstairs piano bar brings in some good talent and the place is always packed with people who want to have fun.  The upstairs Irish pub has many really good beers on tap to choose from.  I will be back.
author: James W.

description:
Can't speak much on food as I go there for drinks - have gotten the calimari and it was how calimari should be.
Drinks? Decent pricing. Service? Great. The environment is friendly and often packed so grabbing attention may take a few minutes longer.
-1 star to the socially awkward tall and lanky security guy with glasses. Was being semi rude to us and other customers when he was carding them (the ones he did card).
A couple walked in front and he opens the door for them right away, when it got to us he asked us for card. Sometimes they ask sometimes they don't depending the event and who's out there. 
He rambled about the under 40 look CA carding... Yeah that couple in front of us were definitely not in their 40's. 
We get it. We don't have blond hair and blue eyes.
author: Jenny T.

description: Nice nice place! Food is great ! I really enjoyed my night here with my coworkers. We all ordered steak. Prices are ok, I would say fair. I would definitely want to come back and try something else.
author: Francesco F.

description: We stopped in for a quick lunch while waiting for our hotel room check in. Great location close to Union Square and traditional Irish Pub setting. The food is very good and the staff super friendly!
author: Georgia C.

description: Looking for a piano bar? Come to this one! It has a very lively and fun crew that keeps you laughing (and tipping) with their songs. The upstairs food area isn't bad either but it's more of a tourist spot since it's close to the Powell BART stop. Just come for the dueling experience!
author: Brittini S.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! The staff is super friendly and we never had to wait for a drink. If anyone asks me where to go out in the city, I will always say Johnny foleys. We had the best night laughing and signing with the 2 guys playing on the piano.  We will definitely be back soon.
author: Kelly L.

description: This place is hands down a great place to go on a night out with friends! Great live music and atmosphere!! If you like Irish pubs this is the place to be!!! I want to come back here! Loved all the laughter and drinks my friends and I shared!  I will for sure be back!!!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I love Foley's.  It's always on my list of places to eat when I'm in SF for any length of time.

I was on my own, in town for business, so I sat at the bar.  I will always sit here if there is room.  It's great to chit-chat with the friendly bar staff.

I didn't even look at a menu - I already knew what I wanted, and bangers and mash was the order of the day.  The wait for food wasn't super long, but not super-speedy either, however, it was SO worth the wait.  It was nuclear hot when it was served.  So hot that I had to wait, with a rumble in my tummy and a tear in my eye, for it to cool down a bit.  I nibbled impatiently at the yummy mashed potatoes while the sausages cooled down.  Don't be put off by the fact that the menu says '2 sausages' - they are HUGE and cut in half, so you get 4 pieces of sausage.

Will always be back...
author: Vikkie N.

description:
Just. For. The. Cocktails. 5 stars 

Bar bites - average. Have had better curry fries
author: Milana R.

description: Had the burger and fries. Great hand-made burger and fresh fries. I liked the pickled onion in the burger. Great service!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Fun times Jason and Travis do an awesome job engaging  the crowd.  Fun time with friends and co workers laughing  and singing.
author: Anne K.

description: A couple of us at here on a Saturday night and the service, food, and atmosphere was great.  I would not consider it a pub, however, it is a good Irish restaurant and bar!  I had the Dungeness Crab Cakes and my friend had the Irish Stew and Garlic Fries.  Both meals were great and with the tip and drinks, we payed about $30 a piece.  The Irish Coffee was good as well, a slight sprinkle of cinnamon would make it better!  Would recommend if you are looking for a nice Irish restaurant and bar.
author: Robert H.

description: Would have been five stars for the best Cottage (Shepard's) Pie that I've ever eaten in my life, except for an incident at the end.  It was excellent with Guinness on tap.  Great atmosphere.  Good mix of tourists and locals.  Very authentic, if you are looking for that pub experience and feel.  Within walking distance to many of the local hotels.  I was staying at the Post Hotel around the corner and decided to pop in for dinner.  As Foley's sign says, "It was time for a pint!" The Guinness was great on tap.  Was greeted by the very friendly and cute blonde hostess and told it would be about a 15min wait.  I ordered a pint ($8.75 plus tip so $10 per pint) in the waiting area and brought it with me to my table.  $20 for Shepard's pie and $8 for bread was a little pricey, but I had heard good things and it is San Francisco after all.  The place was full with lots of interesting people.  Some Asian Businessmen next to me were trying the dark Guinness Stout for the first time and really enjoying it. The Shepard's pie came and was perfectly prepared.  I downed two additional pints during the course of the meal.  I was feeling no pain.  They must have thought I was a tourist, because they tried to pull a fast one.  When the bill came they had billed me for four pints at $10/pint.  Believe me when you are paying that much for a beer, you keep track.  I argued with the waiter that if I had drank half a gallon of beer(Four pints = 2 quarts) in an hour I probably wouldn't be able to stand, let alone walk back to my hotel.  I'm sure they pad the bill this way with a lot of tourists, who don't notice. In the end, it wasn't worth ruining the experience over $10 bucks, but I will think twice about going back.
author: Sean F.

description: Even though Johnny Foley's has all the usual trappings of the typical American-style Irish pub, it's still a pretty fun place for a few pints and some music.  Whether you want slightly schmaltzy (but still entertaining) dueling pianos in the cellar bar or rock bands in the main bar, you're sure to get a healthy dose of live music  Have never had the food, but what I've seen looks pretty good.  I'll have to give dinner a shot next time I'm there.
author: Bryce B.

description:
Love the fish n chips. First time here. My friends & I came here during lunch hour. This place is big. The interior is beautiful all around. Old historian feel throughout the restaurant. Very irish. Even the men staff looks Irish with the Hobbit (long curly wavy) hairstyle going on and wardrobes. And their accent too. It would be so cool & awesome if they play Irish music instead of the sound of sports TV. And an Irish drink/dance show. Hmm, maybe they do and I just don't know about it. 

Anyhoo, we shared a soda bread for appetizer. That was different and unique. I can taste the soda in the bread. For the entrees, my friends ordered the Vegetarian Irish stew and Cottage Pie. They loved it and enjoyed the food. I love my order of fish & chips. It was delicious. The steak fries could be better but still good. The mushy peas was good. Everything was flavorful and tasty. Mmmm. I am definitely coming back again whenever in the area.
author: Amy H.

description:
**This review is only for the dueling piano show**

There's a $10 cover charge, but it's worth it!  It's not the type of piano bar where they only play Billy Joel -- you'll also hear some current tunes (Katy Perry and Taylor Swift were in the mix when I went) as well.  It gets crowded and there's barely any seats available, but it's a lot of fun!  To request a song, you can write it down on the pieces of paper on top of the piano.  The bigger tip you add (it's not mandatory), the more likely your song will get played soon!

This was a fun, different experience that I definitely enjoyed!
author: Annie P.

description: Love this place!  Dinner and drinks were awesome! We had plans to go somewhere else but the music and atmosphere was so much fun we didn't leave. Will be returning for sure!
author: Brandy O.

description:
We dropped in here New Years Eve. Which perhaps was a mistake,

Parking to get to the space was horrific thus when we met our friend at the front the boy and I were not in a good mood. The mood turned even more sour when the bouncers for the (pub?) refused to let us in without a twenty dollar cover charge.

Excuse me? 

We had a table in the back. Which our friend had waited over 2 hours for and they wouldn't let us in... what? We assured them we had a table. They ignored us. Another of our party came out and motioned us in, the bouncers barred the way. He told them the hostess had let him come out to get us because we were the rest of their party. They told him she didn't know what she was talking about.

The hostess finally came out, flexed her muscle and we got into the restaurant... after about a ten minute delay.

The food wasn't worth the fuss. Same fare as the Irish pub down the way but more expensive. The service was good, but not spectacular beyond the waitress's ability to remember everyone's order without writing it down.

The most positive and unusual aspect of the dinner was they had free party hats and other New Years paraphernalia at the tables. But I really rather doubt I'll ever be back.

I can find cheap party hats without the attitude at the door. Thanks.
author: Meg T.

description: This place has the best corned beef I have ever had, my husband also loved the bangers and mash with a chimay. Service from Madina was super during the dueling piano show later that evening!!! Another great meal and great service from Madina, wish this place was closer to us, I might be 200lbs though.
author: Tracy W.

description:
This is an true Irish Pub, the beer list is impressive and, Irish beer on tap is always a welcome gift. The staff is friendly and, helpful... even when we decided to change tables. The food was a traditional pub menu. The fish & chips where classically battered. The Shepherds  pie is the best comfort food around, even in the summer. 

Great bar to watch the Giants game or, Classic Football. The bar tenders are knowledgeable about the beers and, can easily recommend something for you. It is a bar that you will soon feel like a regular.
author: Heather H.

description: Great food!! Great music!! Kristy is best server in SF. Come when Emphatic is here. Awesome!!!!
author: Steve R.

description:
The bangers & mash are great! The curry fries and crab cake appetizer is also good. 

Good beer selection to go with whatever you order. Service was quick and friendly. 

Worth stopping by to hang out and relax on a Friday night.
author: Erin E.

description: My son and I went here after a BART ride to San Francisco and walking around trying to find a decent place to eat. It was wonderful and the service was nice. We both had fish & chips. The whole surrounding area was questionable. What happened to San Francisco? It isn't the same wonderful place it used to be when I lived there. Newsom, get out of politics! You ruined my city.
author: Boo R.

description: This place is a rip off. We were waiting to see the live piano duel and after eating dinner as they instructed us to do to see the piano duel, we find out they are not affiliated at all. We wasted so much money and time and we ended up not seeing the dueling pianos at all but ended up trying to have fun.
author: Krystal N.

description: This is such an underrated restaurant and bar.  The wait staff goes out of their way to make you happy.  The food is amazing and the Irish Pub ambiance is perfect.  We had Steak, Shepherds Pie and Pork Chops plus Garlic Fries.  Everything was great!!!  We went for a birthday and got a beautiful complimentary dessert and even free shots of Irish Whiskey.  Only negative we can find is that we wanted a shirt and they didn't carry 2X.  . Fabulous restaurant!
author: Caren F.

description: I've gone there 3 times this week! Wonderful service, great beers on draft, amazing food and at least 8 tvs for all your sports needs. I tried the prime rib, filet mignon, and fish and chips. I would recommend all of them. I stuck with Guinness and ciders for drinks but they also have a nice little wine list. They make some beautiful cocktails and wonderful desserts from what I could see. Great if you're traveling alone or for groups.
author: Maelinda R.

description: My husband and I are visiting San Francisco, we considered taking the trolley to the wharf, but reconsidered after seeing the long lines. Instead, we found this lovely place that pours a very nice Guinness. I had the chowder and he had the beef barely soup. Delicious!
author: Susan M.

description: Lots of beers on tap and a huge bar to sit at. The bartenders were really friendly and gave us good tips on where to go during our trip to SF. We just stopped in for a beer and didn't order any food though (the sign outside told us it was time for a pint!)
author: Ashley S.

description: Always treated well at Foley's! Great food and very accommodating. We started with a party of 8, and by the end 13 people ended up showing up. The staff were quick to add seats, and they split the check 10 ways to help us out. Bangers and mash were delicious too!
author: Ryan W.

description:
Great place - fantastic service, fabulous Irish pub food.
Casual vibe.
Love the chicken tikka and lamb slider appetizers. Fish and chips - not as good as the other items.
Great place for casual date nights (hubby and I go to Irish pubs now, instead of reservations/waiting around @restaurants).
author: Shilpi D.

description: Anything but an Irish pub! Just because they sale Irish themed good and alcohol, doesn't make it an Irish pub. No Irish music; pretty much pop. No rude slogans or employees. But service isn't great. Nobody checked to see if my food was good.  Didn't get asked if I wanted a refill. The bar is huge, but broken up by tons of pillars. Restrooms are slight Italian up-scaled themed. The prime rib was decent, but way overpriced. The sides that went aren't great. Not enough Irish foods. I have been to pubs all over the world; By far the most disappointing and not really an Irish pub I have ever been to. I gave one extra star because the prime rib was decent, and a mediocre beer list
author: Wang C.

description: We went for a company dinner while we were in town but weren't super hungry. My husband and I both got the seafood chowder and it was really great! Almost everyone else got the fish and chips and said they all really loved it. The building is cool and I saw several larger groups in there. We also got our food pretty quickly. We took our one year old with us and they were accommodating for that as well!
author: Jayme A.

description: This is probably my most favorite Irish Pub I've ever been to! The service was outstanding! The crowd was amazing! And let's not forget the cool dual piano bar downstairs!! The entertainment was out of this world! I highly endorse Jonny Foley's and encourage anyone looking for some good ol fashion fun to check it out!!!
author: Cara S.

description:
Whenever I go to San Francisco I must make a stop at Johnny Foley's Irish House.  In fact, I usually pick my hotel location based on the vicinity to this amazing restaurant.  

The drinks are fantastic! The traditional irish fare is fantastic! I love the corn beef, shepherds pie and prime rib.  The garlic fries are fantastic as well.  The space is huge so there is always room to have dinner or lunch. The bar does get packed, but the bartenders to quite well to give you attention when you need it.  The Irish Coffees and Bloody Mary's are quite good. 

I highly recommend this bar for a great meal or fun times with old friends meeting new friends. 

The Piano Bar downstairs is a blast! Its a great way to spend a Friday Night with your favorite people.
author: Sarah M.

description:
4.5 stars rounded up to 5. 

Had a fantastic time at this bar with a group of friends. Love the myriad of rooms and seating areas. Depending on where you sit you can choose to have a more intimate night or hang out in the main room with the crowd. 

Ordered two bottles of wine, several beers, and about 3 appetizers and our total came out to $130. Not terrible for the city. 

I recommend the smoked salmon appetizer. This was suggested to us by our bartender, and being a bit buzzed, we happily obliged without looking at the price - hence I have no idea how much it was. 

The live music on Saturday night was a big plus!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
We arrived here about 9:00 pm on a Saturday night. The place was BUSY but we were seated right away in the restaurant (We wanted to see the dueling pianos but we're told it was standing room only.) 

Our service was good. The food was delicious. I had the  cottage pie. I enjoyed it but it could have used more vegetables in my opinion. My H had the fish and chips and substituted mashed potatoes for the peas. He said the fish was really good. 

We both ordered a drink, old fashion and Crown and 7. We should have saved our money and ordered soft drinks. If I were in a blind taste test I would have sworn there was no alcohol in either of the drinks. Ask anyone who knows me, I am a light weight when it comes to drinking. If I say the drinks are weak it is really saying something.

When the check came we both had to do a double take. $80! Probably won't return on our next SF visit.
author: Tracy B.

description: The bartender David from County Cork Ireland is a great man and the service was fantastic and he traditional Irish music in the background was a treat. I highly recommend the place!!
author: David P.

description:
All you expect from an Irish pub--great beers on tap; a nice selection of whiskey; and a food menu that includes mashed peas, fish & chips, and shepherd's pie. 

The barkeep was attentive and cordial and the Seahawks won.
author: Jesse S.

description:
After having drinks across the street for our friends birthday, the bar across the street decided that they didn't want our money- even though we were a good group of respectable professionals. So we came across the street to Foley's and was immediately taken care of, assigned Linda as our server and was happy to spend our hard earned money ($900 tab) with them instead of the bar across the street.
They were very friendly, quick w/ the drink and food orders and were very gracious.
The food is typical irish bar, but those potato skins were fantastic- not greasy, actually left yummy potato in there. delicious. 

I will continue to take my business here rather than any other bar in the neighborhood. 
Thanks for making our evening end on a positive note for our friends birthday!!!
author: Lisa B.

description: We ate here on vacation because it was close to our hotel and it turned out to be my favorite place in San Fran!  The service was great and my steak was cooked perfectly!  I loved the authentic pub atmosphere!
author: Lynn T.

description:
We visit SF once a year, and always stop on for a pint! What a great atmosphere with super service. The food is above average, but this is an Irish pub so that's perfect! Believe it or not, lots of Irishmen in here - drinking and working - so it gives it even more authenticity.

Had their Thanksgiving dinner - yum! A real bargain for $30 - tons of turkey, mashed potatoes, and stuffing - very good.

Looking forward to returning in a year!
author: Ryan S.

description: Had the bangers and mash, hubby had the fish and chips (with mushy peas lol).  A wonderful Irish Pub experience right in Downtown San Francisco.  Pricing is par with San Francisco - $20-25 for an entree.
author: Heather J.

description: I feel torn with this review.  With a party of six, we had a great time.  Two drink minimum in the downstairs piano bar with a limited pub menu.   No option for full menu items.  Between the six of us, we ordered 24 drinks throughout the night (4 hours). Total tab at the end of the night with food (6 items) was just over $450.  That's not a typo.  $450.  Plus tip and bribes to the piano players so they'd play our songs. So, great time but don't think I'll ever go again as I can drink at any other number of bars for a fraction of the cost.
author: Matt C.

description: This is the best Irish pub that I have been to!  The fish and chips were off the chain!  The live band was great!  Desert was fantastic! And of course the beer was cold!
author: JC T.

description: Barkeep was spot on and the staff overall very friendly. Let me tell ya about the 12 oz prime rib plate, mountain of potatoes and a big serving of greens! Absolutely tender and delicious! Now to see if I have enough room for all my Guinness and Jamie shots!
author: Sirdrewbrew ..

description: Enjoyable place to get an Irish Coffee downtown. It almost feels like stepping back in time. There is beautiful old wood detail everywhere. The staff is extremely courteous and brought my friend a birthday dessert on the house. Cheers to Johnny Foley's, a classic and comfortable Irish Pub SF style.
author: Dawn D.

description: Nancy! Nancy! Nancy! We love Nancy! We had to check out the dueling pianos at this joint but didn't know the scoop. Arrived at the restaurant side of this place and were seated immediately. Ordered the bacon wrapped prawns for our appetizer. My friend went to the restroom and learned that if we wanted a table at the dueling piano show we should get in line immediately! It was about 7:40 pm. Doors at 8:00. Nancy came over to our table (she wasn't even our server) and got right on it. Quickly got us our check and our appetizer to go so we could eat it in line! Didn't know there was a 10$ cover. The boys in charge of allowing humans in let us keep our spot in line and directed me 3 doors down to the ATM. We got a great table and enjoyed the show so much! Nathan was hilarious! Thank you to all of the employees at this place but especially to Nancy!
author: Eva G.

description:
Apparently all bars in San Francisco are either closed for Labor Day or close on Mondays in general.  Except Johnny Foley's!  They won our business for their slightly overpriced Irish beers (two pints for $15) by default of the fact that they were literally the only non-hotel bar open.  

Despite being near tourist central, they actually had a pretty good crowd of locals and tourists alike.  The space is big, so it would be a great spot to bring a group.  The live music was pretty good as well.  Though I didn't expect Johnny Cash covers in an Irish bar in San Francisco, it worked.

While I had hoped our one night out in San Fran would have included a more bespoke cocktail at Local Edition, Johnny Foley's came through in a pinch (with cider on draft!), and, for that, I am a  fan.
author: Kristin B.

description:
I entered Mr. Foley's Irish House knowing the fish and chips were something I had to try. Unfortunately, my hunger didn't fully manifest as this was the first stop on my afternoon pub crawl. I am, however, pleased to report that I was able to revive an old classic - the greyhound! Granted, there is a 99.3% success rate, credit is always due when a cocktail is successfully concocted.

This spacious joint brings in some exciting prospects if you're into talking to strangers. I left Johnny Foley's with an acquaintance and strong desire to return for their fish and chips.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Thank you again to yelp advice- getting there before the crowd was definitely the right move.  They opened the door at 8 and we were there at 8 with a few people behind us in the crowd.  The guys working the door were nice and got us in quickly.  

The space is relatively small- a clear reason to get there early if you want a seat/table. The bartenders and servers were nice, giving solid recommendations for drinks.  I didn't try any of the food but it looked appetizing. 

The show itself was really fun- the pianists were super fun and played and awesome show. I would definitely go back again. People say that the drinks are expensive but they didn't seem to cost much more than other bars..
author: Stephanie D.

description: Dear Johnny Foley's, Thank you on behalf of our alumni association for providing Johnny Foley's as a venue at which we were able to gather and celebrate common ground on Friday, April 28, 2017. Everyone raved about the food, the ambiance, and most importantly how welcome they felt at Foley's. Thank you, in particular to Mary C., for providing such first-class hospitality.
author: Jeanne A.

description:
My wife had the Vegetable Panini with the potato bacon soup and I had the Corned Beef Panini with the onion barley soup.

The potato bacon soup was spot on!  Deep, rich, and very tasty! 

The onion barley soup tasted like it came from a can and left me wishing I had ordered the potato bacon soup. =(

The vegetable Panini was beautiful and my wife really enjoyed it.  

The corned beef Panini was not good.  I was expecting fresh corned beef and sauerkraut, but I am pretty sure it was flavorless slices of corned beef from the deli and the sauerkraut was dry and flavorless as well. I was going to ask the server about the corned beef, but she never came back after she served the food and by the time we finally got her attention, 20 minutes after we finished eating, all we wanted was the check. 

Service: Service was terrible. Our server had several tables and consequently never refilled waters, checked on the table after the food was served, and my wife had to stand up to flag her down just to get the check so we could leave. I ordered a beer when we sat down and am usually good for several in any irish pub when I am on vacation, but today one was apparently my limit. 

Overall: Dissapointing experience.  We have been here in the past and had good experiences, but today was terrible.
author: Pat T.

description:
Really? How long have you been doing this to me and the public off over the years?!

First off I've been coming here since 1999. I've even rented the back room for my birthday. (Yes I have pictures)

I really liked this place until tonight!

I had a look at my bill pretty straight forward but it just did not add up correctly.  I would not have noticed it if I had not just popped in for a quick bite and I had only one line item. (For once)

So it goes like this:

Fish and Chips 18.00. A bit spendy for the new smaller portions...
Tax 1.64
Gov. Mandate tax .74

Total 20.36

Let's look at what it should have been and what they are doing... Stay with me here.

18.00. Food
1.64. Tax 
0.74 Gov tax
20.36 total

First off the tax should have been 1.58. 18.00 x 8.75% = 1.58
But what they are doing is adding in the Gov Mandated tax
18.00 +0.74 x 8.75% which does equal 20.36 

THIS IS ILLEGAL AS HELL!
You can't charge tax on a tax. 

But you say hey it's only 0.06 cents... 
Really why say anything. Cause I figure I drop on average 100.00 every time I'm there times 15 years. Is a whole lot of money. Add in everyone that goes there has the same thing  happen.  

Pocketing some free coin huh?

So I like a good person and a business owner brought it to the Managers attention. All she could say was "the owners are really honest... Did you like the food?" 
You've got to be kidding me. 
She did not fix the bill or anything but walk away quickly. 
Wow trying to help so someone does not turn them into the Franchise Tax Board or California ABC. 

Never again will I go there...
I'd add a copy for the bill if I could... :-/
author: Bryan E.

description: I thought this place was going to be good and was looking forward to dropping some cash while I was at a 3 day conference a block over.  Sadly, on my first visit, the two working bartenders ignored me for 15 minutes and helped two others who showed up at the bar far later than I did.  Then the blonde bartender pretended that he did not see my disappointed face but I doubt that looking me in the eyes made him feel good when he did. Coward. If I dropped a penny on their sticky floors I would still pick it up just so that they would not get any of my money.
author: Lio C.

description: very busy, very loud, but awesome corned beef and cabbage.  Hearty portion of all, both mashed potatoes (piping hot) and boiled potato's along with corned beef.  Would have gotten a 5 start except their cabbage is small portion and shredded, so it cooks down to nothing.  Need more cabbage to have the Irish mix.
author: Jerry N.

description: Love Foley's! They have the BEST pub food in all of SF. In fact, their food is so great that I've been there three times in the past 2 weeks. Highly recommend the soda bread, Gorgonzola and apple salad, cottage pie, and corned beef and cabbage. Service is always good and consistent and the manager, Nancy, is delightful. Looking forward to going back soon!
author: Jaclyn N.

description: Slightly touristy location. But always have a great time when I head downtown. They really get the place going on the weekends. The piano bar downstairs is super fun.
author: Kyle M.

description: The Best Pub Experience.  Was introduced to Johnny Foley's during last year's Cub winning  World Series and was on work travel in SF.  Everything on the menu was fantastic.  Great Irish Pub ambience and great staff.
author: John N.

description:
Great bar with the dueling pianos.

1 star for the racist bouncer who wouldn't let my friend in for being "too drunk".  Both of us were somber enough to operate an airplane.
author: Minjian W.

description:
I came for the Deuling Pianos on a Friday night!

Cons: 
-This place is LOUD. I had to wear earplugs to not get ringing in my ears.
-I ordered a dessert but it never came. ;_;
-The beers/drinks are kind of pricey too.

Pros:
-The deuling pianists are HILARIOUS. They welcome people to sing with them on the stage, as well as dancing.
-The music is really awesome and they UNDERSTAND the horror of Don't Stop Believing. You had to pay hella to get this played (thank GOD).
-The atmosphere is pretty light hearted and really friendly.
-You could also pay money to NOT listen to a song if you didn't want them to play it (which happened a few times that night). The battles are REAL.

Tips:
-Get there early if you want seats at a table.
-Bring earplugs!
-Bring dollar bills and other amounts of cash. 

10/10 I would come here and I would also bring people with me. This place is a blast!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Always have a great experience when we come here! Having grown up in San Francisco, Foley's is one of the places we come to often. The food is great and prices are expected. If you are looking for $3 beers in the city good luck! Last time we ate here I had the prime rib. Cooked perfectly with great mashed potatoes! Arrive early or expect a wait at the bar.
author: Alexander W.

description: Great service knowledge about vegan food. Vegans get the Vegetable Stew without mashed potatoes for a yummy comforting meal!
author: Amy L.

description: Fish and chips is commendable but the rest of the dishes disappointed especially seafood, which was not fresh. Wouldn't come here for food again but the bar has a great beer selection!
author: Shulin T.

description:
My friends were looking for someone who supposedly in this bar so we stopped in here for a quick minute, grabbed a some moscow mules, enjoyed it, and left. It was like a 20 minute experience here.

There was no cover (but there was for the downstairs piano bar).
It was crowded, there was a band playing and it was fun from what I can remember.
I had just came from an AYCED (all you can eat and drink) so my mind was in a different place.

So, cool spot to grab a drink and listen to music in downtown SF. The age range was like 30's-50's.
author: Marlon T.

description:
After walking around SF all day and not eating for a while, I had hit a wall and was whiney and hungry and my husband dragged me in here to eat (which, of course, I complained about because I didn't want to eat somewhere tourist-y and boring). I would've dragged me in here, too, to make me shut up.

Turns out, I loved it. I don't know if it was just what I ordered or if all the food is as good. I had the vegetarian Irish stew, and was completely impressed. Carrots, Brussels sprouts, parsnips, asparagus, and every single vegetable was perfectly cooked and intensely flavorful.
author: Dara M.

description: Cute Irish pub. Fantastic Irish coffee, probably the best we have had. Too bad we had eaten, because their food looked good as well. Friendly staff.
author: Harley D.

description:
Foley's is a fav. of mine. Its loud...low lit and well, I think this place is just damn awesome! They have my fav. scotch, make a burger w/ salad *not on menu* just right...their mac n cheese is killer and they have great beers. Prices are a tad high, but you get what you pay for. And I get FULL off Foley's in a very good way...

I have never had a bad meal here.
author: Bella B.

description: Food was very good and filling.  Service was good.  We went early dinner and got right in, later they got busy.  Drinking brings in lots of loud groups and people seam to have fun.  It was close to our hotel and well worth the stop.  We had lots of choice in area and we were glad we made this stop.
author: Sam A.

description:
The Boston transplant in me has a soft spot for Irish pubs.  This place reminds me of Doyle's, a historical local pub in my old neighborhood.  They are located in the Union Square area not far from Powell BART.  They have great beer and a large menu.  I've only stopped here for happy hour drinks, but I will definitely come back to try the food.

Staff was also remarkably patient and quick given how touristy I'm sure it gets.
author: Seth E.

description: Great place recommended by hotel staff in the local area did not disappoint...a must visit for anyone coming to the area
author: Rob S.

description: If you need to unwind with a great hearty meal or a night of great live music and dancing, this is the place to be!  These Irish really know how to make great food, great value-prices, great friendly service from hostess to bartenders and wait-staff and really, really excellent live music, every night of the week - even on Monday nights when you are entertained by a very talented singer, Damir Stosic, who sings everything from Neil Diamond to Prince!  This is sure to impress visiting friends and relatives to the SF Bay area of any generation and be a great afternoon meal or evening dinner with music.
author: Pauli P.

description:
NIce place to eat while walking in San Francisco downtown. It is near Union Square but it was quiet and with a lot of space to enjoy our food. 
The food was ok. And the beer selection was good.
author: Charo S.

description: Awesome service, great food, and IRISH MUSIC......very seldom happens where an Irish Pub is playing Irish music! Watched the NCAA Championship Game and then jammed to the live music.The service by Kasie was outstanding. We are from Houston and there on a long weekend getaway. After being in several establishments during our stay in Union Square I highly recommend this spot. Ask for Kasie she is very attentive and service oriented with a great personality.
author: Brian C.

description: Just spent $120 here, $140 with tip(I only tip under 20% if the service was horrible) for 1 prime rib plate, 1 rib eye steak, 1 order of hot wings, and 3 beers. The price wouldn't be so bad if the food was great, but it was only ok. My bf said his steak was good, cooked perfectly and juicy, but my prime rib was not $30 worthy. Maybe my expectation was too high, but there was no wow factor to my meal. To top it off, the service was not great. Our waitress spent 10 minutes talking to the table behind us while we waited to order, then rushed through our ordering.
author: Abigail K.

description: Stopped by a few days ago for lunch and had such a wonderful time. I work in Union Square and wanted something out of the norm from fast food, so I began walking. I walked and walked and somehow ended up here. I walked inside and was greeted very nicely by the host who brought me to the bar, but it was cozy and away from everyone. The bartender immediately helped me order a drink as well as my food, he was so nice! A few more people sat down and we started chatting like we had known each other for forever, it was a great atmosphere. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich which is not how you expect it to "normally" be. It was fantastic. It had slaw on it which was perfect and made the sandwich absolutely delicious. Will be taking many more walks down here for lunch time :)
author: Jennifer G.

description: I enjoyed this place partly because I am comparing it to the horrendous piano bar downstairs (see other review).  Johnny Foley's upstairs on a Saturday night had no cover, affordable drinks, and a great cover band playing super-fun 80s and 90s music and older classics.  After abandoning the sinking ship that was the piano bar, we felt salvaged by the great music and fun atmosphere here.  Dont' waste your money downstairs.  That great music you hear when you're waiting in line for the piano bar is NOT the same as you'll get downstairs, the music you're hearing is the upstairs cover band.  Go there instead.
author: Meredith A.

description:
I like Johnny Foley's bar, mostly of the times I've been there, the piano players were very good, and they interact a lot with the crawl.

The prices are normal for SF, the drinks are good, the service is what you would expect of a packed place with waiters.

I do recommend if you want to have a piano bar experience in SF, or if you want to have a couple place to go, or a small party with your friends.
author: Gabriel G.

description: The bar staff was amazing!  The food was amazing!  Who would've thought that a curry dish at an Irish joint would be so good???  Our waitress wasn't the most pleasant but she appeared to be slammed.  We will definitely come back here if we're ever in San Fran again.
author: Amy C.

description: Great service. Loved the food. Simple menu and loved the atmosphere. Pretty loud in there. My side salad before my meal was small but they charged an extra $10.00 for it, so consumer beware.
author: Shea M.

description: Worst service and rudest staff in the history of restaurants. Lifetime ban. Came with large group, manager said she would reserve a table for us when we called ahead a couple of hours ahead, didn't and then proceeded to say we should go elsewhere. There were multiple open tables and no explanation of availability!
author: Logan A.

description:
Sometimes I just want a Shepard's pie and there's not a lot of place that make them.

It's a better bar/pub than restaurant.
author: Jen L.

description:
Visited this place after walking round Union Square seeing a non-mainstream eatery. Was drawn in by the decor and menu. Ordered the Fried Chicken - leg and boneless breast- . Service was okay, kinda standard non-personal food server. Decor was interesting/entertaining and gave the feeling of a cool Irish bar. 

Food, well was adequate. Chicken was dry and plain. Sides - Cole slaw and mashed potatoes and gravy - were nothing to remember. 

Food along with the service didn't live up to the charm that the place gave off from appearances.
author: Matthew B.

description:
I'm giving Foley's 3 stars because the food and service was great and I like the fact that it's open till 2AM, which is rare for SF. For someone who's coming from a 24 hour town a bar open till past midnight is a huge deal for me.

I had the pear gorgonzola salad and lamb sliders which was tasty but I didn't like the fact that the lamb was uncooked for my taste and could not bring myself to enjoy it so I just passed it down to my hubby. My hubby had clam chowder soup and a beer and he said it was good.

Our waitress was very friendly and attentive to our table and was fast to service our table as soon as we were seated. I thought everything was good and would probably come back again to try some other items and next time I'll be bettered prepared to tell them to make those burgers better. 

Our total bill with tip came to $46 which is a little spendy but cheaper than other places I've been to in SF, which is not that bad.
author: V W.

description: Cool old English pub on a bust SF corner. Packed with people. Seated 6 of us right away. Food came quickly. Thai chicken curry was delicious. Everyone else raved about the Rosemary lemon chicken. Good service for a super busy pub.
author: Brigid L.

description:
The service was excellent! We shared the bangers and mash between two of us, since we had a half marathon to run the next morning. They split the meal and served it on two plates, with extra mash and veggies for a mere $2 extra. Nice!
I've tried this dish many times, in many cities, and have never been satisfied... until now. This was bangers and mash the way it should be. Delicious!
We also had the calamari appetizer and it was also among the best I've had.
I'd give them 5 stars if they had more TV's. The Stanley Cup playoffs were on, but I couldn't see it from where I was sitting.
author: Charles S.

description: Went here on a whim after striking out at several other places. Sat at the bar and the bartenders were very nIce and attentive. Ordered the lamb sliders and seafood chowder and both were excellent. Cider on draft is always a plus. Very good place, highly recommend.
author: Larry B.

description:
We went here with some co workers my husband loved the shepherds pie!
I got the salmon and it was ok. They have a huge selection of beers on tap.
author: Anne M.

description: I have been to the dueling piano bars downstairs for a birthday a year ago and that was amazing, but until last night, I had never been to the upstairs restaurant. Three of us went at 6:30 on Saturday night for some dinner and to watch the USA soccer game.  All of the staff was very kind and prompt.  We ordered 3 entrees, The Roasted Chicken, Fillet, and Corned Beef and Cabbage.  I had the Corned Beef as it is one of my favorite dishes.  It came with a parsley cream sauce which I was unsure about so I got it on the side and also ordered a side of the horseradish cream sauce.  I am very glad I did as I didn't care for the other one.  The portions were huge and delicious.  Very good Corned Beef with hardly any fat.  Cabbage was seasoned really well and the potatoes were absolutely great.  Best Corned Beef entree I have had in SF!  I highly recommend both the bar and restaurant upstairs and the dueling piano bar downstairs.  If you go to the piano bar, make sure you get there early because it fills up quick and people tend not to leave because they are having so much fun!
author: Michelle W.

description: Last night we walked over from Union Sq after ice skating. There was 11 of us and we were sat within 10 min. Our server was also a bartender and was really good. No complaints! We had Irish Coffee which was delicious! I had the boneless fried chicken and my husband had the cottage pie. Both were very good! Creme Brûlée for dessert was also good. My friends had oyster shooters, seafood chowder, and many of their salads. All with no complaints! I would definitely go there again!
author: Dina D.

description: We came here as part of our San Francisco pub crawl. The atmosphere is nice. Its bright and clean for an Irish pub which was good, but the fact that an order of french fries topped with cheese was $12 was a bit much. I just thought the food was a bit overpriced for what it was.
author: Ray G.

description: Let me begin by saying that there are plenty of "Irish Pubs" in California that put up a noble effort, but Johnny Foley's is real and authentic. The menu includes many well-known traditional Irish entrees such as Bangers and mash, corned beef and cabbage, fish and chips, and various types of stews. I love starting up a conversation with the staff because there's a good chance that they moved to the city from Ireland and its always interesting to hear their stories. As a caveat, be prepared to spend a considerable amount because the food is pricey despite how delicious the food may be. If you're arriving at the right time, you can usually have the exclusive opportunity to enjoy live entertainment, which adds extra luxury to the experience.
author: Sean B.

description:
This review is for the basement piano bar only.

I went on a Friday night and it was quite crowded. The $10 cover was a little steep but whatever. 

There were two piano players, but rather than playing together, they alternated songs. Occasionally the non-playing pianist would play drum machine for the other, which (in my opinion) ruins piano covers.

The overall vibe was more like a cheap wedding reception than a piano bar. The dance floor was too bright, the average age was 55 and libations were flowing. But I'm not complaining, this all made for great people watching.

It's not perfect, but for wandering tourists and bored locals, this is a decent spot to catch a cheesy live act.
author: Nick K.

description:
Not impressed at all with this experience. I had just had dinner with friends and they decided to come here for some drinks. When I arrived the bouncer saw my doggy bag and said he couldn't let me in with it. I told him that I just ate and that it was my leftovers. He told me that it didn't matter, they don't allow outside food.

Seriously? I get that the place is probably trying to sell their own food, but you're in an area filled with many other food establishments. It's not unheard of to eat some place and drink some place else with leftovers in tow. Homeless people should hang out in front of this place. They're more likely to get some food from patrons discarding their food before entering.

The policy is really stupid. If you catch me eating my outside food in your establishment or just making a mess with it, then fine, ask me to leave. But don't ask me to throw it out before entering for fear that I might eat that instead of ordering something out your menu.

Fortunately, I didn't have to throw out my food because one of my friends grabbed my food and stuffed it in her big-ass purse.

As for service inside, my entire group wasn't thrilled with it. A couple of times out waitress would come by and ask if we needed anything, we would check among ourselves if we wanted to get anything else, but less than 5 seconds later she would be gone.

On the plus side, they have Irish beers besides Guinness, not that there is anything wrong with Guinness (I love Guinness), but it's nice to see more; Murphy's Irish Stout and Kilkenny Cream Ale are a couple.
author: Dennis Z.

description: Nice enough pub.  Great historical portraits. . $8.50 is the most I've ever paid for a pint but our waitress, Rosaleen, was a doll. Very helpful, knowledgeable and attentive.
author: Aaron B.

description: This place was within walking distance of our hotel. The service wasn't great and the band that was there on Saturday was terrible. I recognized one song... and, couldn't wait to leave. The Foley's seafood chowder with chives was delicious! I would definitely recommend it. The fish and chips were just OK, nothing special. I thought they lacked flavor. The mushy peas were good and it's really difficult to mess up french fries. Overall, I thought it was overpriced and not that great on the quality of food. If I'm raving about soup... that should tell you something.
author: Fuzzy O.

description:
OK this place is awesome. I even took a tourist I met who was from Ireland to Johnny Foley's. He liked it. The Dueling Pianos downstairs is super rad and upstairs in the dining area there is a framed portrait painting of Liam Neeson. I repeat: THERE IS A FRAMED PAINTING OF LIAM NEESON.

Good selection of beers that they serve up in 9ers pint glasses and really really good food. 

One time I even left my Christian Dior sunglasses at the bar and they held it for me until the next day! 

I am subtracting one star for one employee (pretty sure her name is Emma because that's the name on my receipt). My girlfriend and I tried to split our lunch by paying cash for half the bill and the rest on a credit card. When the waitress took our check, she ran back to us and literally said "What the F*CK is this?" Like she had never in her career of waiting tables seen a half cash half card payment. It was so nuts, I couldn't believe she was talking to us that way.

I think this is a fantastic place to visit and I'm not going to stop coming here. But mark my words, if I see that waitress again, I will ask to be seated in another section.
author: Christina S.

description: This place is very close to and definitely within an easy walk of Powell Station Bart. The staff seem young, pretty and friendly. The food tasted as if there was at least one stick of butter in everything, but it wasn't too sweet or salty. The crab cakes had a very generous serving of crabs, but one was a bit burned while the other seemed a bit pale and undercooked. The mushroom ravioli was very moist and cooked just right. The bangers and mash fell short of expectation with very creamy mashed potatoes and nicely steamed broccoli but just average sausages. The room is decorated from top to bottom with framed pictures of people and other things. The center of the room is bare, and, especially with tile floors, it can give off a somewhat cold impression when the place is not as crowded. Overall, not a bad place for a night of no-frills beer and simple food for those who want to avoid the hipster, crowded and unduly fancy places. There were, however, kids running around. So might not be ideal for those who need a night away from the kids.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Amazing food, great atmosphere always busy which is a good sign. The service is second to none and the music too! I got the shrimp and bacon starters and the cod for dinner- fish was so so good! Will be returning!!
author: Sinead M.

description: We were seated right away which was nice. But the food was so bad, I mean my friends and I can really eat and we each ordered the burger. All of us took a couple bites and left the rest on our plate. I will say the calamari was great and the beer as well. But eat somewhere else and come here for drinks!
author: rosanna b.

description:
I've been here a few times for Dueling Pianos, which kicks off at 9:30pm.  The show was honestly HILARIOUS.  I came here with my girlfriend after a few drinks at Local Edition.  We sat front and center on a Wednesday and the piano players kept on joking around with us.  When I went to the bathroom, the piano player made jokes saying, "YES, he's gone!  Now it's time to hit on his girlfriend."  I'm a great sport, and found this really, really funny.

We felt so good that we got up and danced to the music as well.  The piano players are fantastic at playing requested music.  I'm not even sure how they know so many songs!  If they don't know it, then they have an iPad right in front of them so they can look up the song and play it on spot.  Come check it out!  You won't regret it - it's always a great time.
author: Andrew H.

description: What service - some of the best customer service I've had in a long time. Great beer, good food - just priced a bit higher than appropriate for what they serve. Ask for Jennifer, she is so sweet and always makes sure you're taken care of.
author: Peter B.

description: I dig this place a lot. It's right across the street from my job but I don't come here that often although when I do, it's a blast. My most recent visit was pretty fun. There was a live band playing that Friday night and they sang some old school hits. It gets pretty crowded and it's funny when you see people stumbling or falling whilst dancing. All in good fun! I'll be back again.
author: Candice J.

description:
Johnny Foleys is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The atmosphere is electric and the food is phenomenal. I was truly sad to leave at the end of the night. The range in selection 
Wonderful they have everything from traditional greasy yummy bar food to delicious healthy salads. The alcohol selection is superb, no one will be left wanting for anything at this family run delightful place. I will return every time I visit sf.
author: Chace B.

description:
