Walked in and they were busy.  I expected a delay.  I was told that it was open seating for dinner and to have a seat.  I selected my seat along one of the sides to not take up a table (since I was a single diner).  

I waited.   5 minutes.   Waited. 7 minutes.  Finally I got up at 10 minutes and walked to the host stand to let them know I was leaving.  I waited.  2 minutes later a waiter walks up and asks if I am dining in.    The waiter from the section I was siting in!   

When I told him why I was leaving he responded with a flippant "then go".   

Won't recommend this place to people I know.
author: John G.

description: This is just a great place to go and have a beer with a lively crowd and some live music. A great place to go if you just don't have the energy to try to hard to have fun.
author: Richard S.

description:
This is one of our favorite places to eat in SF! The lamb sliders are ridiculously good. Also had the kale salad and steak and onions. Everything was so perfect! The steak and onions is served with sautéed spinach and fries. The fries are super crispy and it's the perfect combination when they soak in the steak and onion juice. Little tip, dip your bread in the juice. 

The only reason this place isn't getting five stars is because the service wasn't the best. We got our food quickly but no one came back for refills and we were sitting there a while with our menus closed waiting to order. 

All that said, the food is amazing and the atmosphere is great!!!
author: Reggie D.

description: A shout out to our waitress just so nice & very attentive It was 16 hours ago (really), I tossed the receipt but hopefully they know who she is. I enjoyed the most Spectacular Fish & Chips with a Cold Pint ( A Pint!) of  perfect temperature  Guinness. Heaven, I was in Heaven (song running through my happy mind).  If you want to real Irish Pub in SF this is the place I recommend.  Make sure UR hungry the portions are generous.  I just reheated my take home and still could not finish the 2 hearty pieces of Cod in a light Beer Batter. There was also a band (our table was 2 close it seems) BUT the Band was ROCKING, seriously rocking.  I plan on working this into my entertainment budget because it is $$ but that what I would expect from the Perfect Irish Pub.
author: Karolyn H.

description:
Stopped by this place for a round of drinks a few times now and finally getting around to reviewing it. Never had a bite of food here so I can't comment on that but their drinks are decent. 

Got an Irish Coffee which was good but I think we all know where to go for the best Irish Coffee in the city. The tap selection is solid but don't expect to find anything here that you can't find somewhere else. 

This place has been packed every time I've been and even walked by. It's nothing to write home about but it's a pub where you can grab a pint, sit on some comfy bar stools and hanging out. Good luck finding that open bar stool though.
author: Eric S.

description: Great service - incredibly friendly staff. Food was terrific. Recommend appetizers but heck that was all we had. I suspect anything on menu is great. Bar has three or more distinct seating areas. Great for dining or hanging with pals. Two of a party of four recommend the ribs other two says potato skins. Go figure!...I'd like to try the entire menu. See you again Foleys.
author: Wolf E.

description: Great food, music and super nice waitress!  We ate their fish and chips!!! I recommend that! Would totally go back!
author: Jamie A.

description: Absolutely DIVINE.  The service was EXCELLENT.  Very friendly and very fast.  The food was delicious.  We enjoyed the smoked salmon on boxty - best EVER!  I enjoyed the wild mushroom ravioli - very very good!  My husband enjoyed the prime rib immensely.  We bought the Chef's cookbook - can't wait to try a few things in it!  We highly recommend this place!  A lovely treasure in the Union Square area!
author: Joy J.

description:
Very pleased! The food was flavorful, wonderfully prepared and artfully presented.
We ordered the Oysters and crab cake appetizers and both were outstanding!
author: Michelle S.

description: I had never been here before, but I went in and it's this giant traditional Irish pub similar to one in which I ate in Dublin. The decor, the selection of beer, and the great ethnic food were all stupendous. I had the Finnan Haddie. I had never heard of, nor had it before, even after having been in Ireland a couple of times and Scotland sixteen, but it sounded great, and I was definitely not disappointed. It was heaven for the palate! Wow! that's one dish I will never forget. I definitely recommend a visit to this pub if you like Irish pubs! And if you don't, I think a visit to this one will convert you!
author: Gary M.

description: Nice atmosphere! Very touristy spot. Hard to find an empty barstool. Yet, I love coming here. You will find traditional Irish pub fare and on tap selections.
author: Kathy M.

description: Who ever loves music will love this place. I am here right now and IT IS LIVE! Live music is also great thing in my book! The performers are amazing and get the crowd involved! Expect to lose your voice!
author: Alicia J.

description:
A great new discovery!  

We were on a staycation, with the ground rules being we would go to places where we had never been before.  So passing by all the places we KNEW would be good, we took a deep breath and stepped into Johnny Foley's.  

We were not disappoint!  

It was a Saturday afternoon, and traffic was low.  A peek in the door showed the tile and wood decor of an old Irish pub, a long bar along the west wall with a harp standing overhead and islands of beer pumps about every 6 feet.  

I drank 2 pints of harp that afternoon, and my date downed a couple of J Lohr chardon-yays.  A comment about soda bread brought out a basket, and this was the real deal, not the sweet stuff we had seen in the supermarket.  She had a lamb stew, with big chunks of lamb in it, and I ordered bangers and mash.  Now the menu was not without its California touches--the lamb stew had just enough garlic to enhance the flavor without hijacking it, and the bangers and mash were topped with steamed vegetables.  

Yet it all seemed to work.  I was reminded of the Bard and Banker in Victoria, it was that good.  The tab came to 84.83 + tip.  

The hostess and waitress thought a staycation was a marvelous idea, and we let them know that we loved their late lunch experience.
author: David D.

description: I love this place every time I come to SF!  It's just a good ol irish pub.  Smithwicks on tap is always a plus.  Just the whole ambiance is fun for a quick beer.
author: Sandie F.

description: Loved the food, beer, and service! They were prompt to getting us our food and very helpful with each other and the tables. The waiter had an accent so that made this Irish pub experience even better! Highly recommended the Organic Veggie Burger!
author: Chantal H.

description:
A nice, casual meal. I watched the Giants loose too the Dodgers. I enjoyed myself and the bartender was friendly. They had generic soft drinks, which was pretty cool because I've never eaten at a restaurant with generic cola's.

I had buffalo wings and they were very good. Overall I would go there again to watch a game or to have a burger.
author: Isaac M.

description:
Go in for a beer, a look of the great paintings of famous men, and beautiful woodwork and molding. Take a picture of the clock outside that says "Time for a Pint!" Don't go for the service. 

The host brought us to the back of the restaurant, away from most other guests- not sure why. We didn't have a view of the tv's or the bar. The waitress took our drink order and food order, but didn't come back to see if we liked the food or needed anything. We waited a while for the check, even though the restaurant was busy. For a $16 main course, I expected quality service. Did I mention we were on our honeymoon? 

The up side: The Vegetable Stew was tasty with still-crisp vegetables and a flavorful broth with a hint of mint. I liked the mashed potato on top. Magner's cider on draft was cold and filled to the brim.
author: Katherine C.

description:
We stated off our day at the bar upstairs with some Irish Coffee's. The bar tender was nice and very attentive. They make homemade whip cream, yum! 

We returned later that night and went downstairs for the dueling pianos. We got there about 8 and were able to get a table. The music did not get started until around 9. It was a fun experience. Our waitress was very slow. We had to flag her down every time we wanted to order another round.
author: Tammy S.

description: Food wasn't worth the price, it was ok but this is more of an overpriced pretend dive bar, not your typical Irish pub at all.  Atmosphere is great if you're into sports bars.  Servers are super nice though and the bartender makes a mean whiskey cocktail.
author: Kate B.

description:
Toss up between Foleys and the Irish Bank for my favourites pub in SF. Depends which one I'm in at the time I guess. 
Great pint though and top bar staff.
author: vambo r.

description: Good food, fun atmosphere. Gave it 4 stars because the staff wasn't the friendliest in the world and it was incredibly loud. It's a pub though so that isn't a deal breaker for many. Just wanted to let others know in case that is a deciding factor for them.
author: Kylah S.

description:
Solid Irish pub. Have dropped in on a couple occasions. Good music, great atmosphere, beer and pub food selections what I'd want from an Irish bar. I have found the Fish and Chips a bit lacking, but have enjoyed other food orders.

Do note, the homeless have been getting pretty brazen around here lately. There was a guy literally blocking the exit with a sign asking for handouts on my last visit.
author: David G.

description: Went with a friend on Valentine's Day to grab a glass of wine... Service was not the best and the wine tasted stale. The waitress kept hounding us for a card, as if we'd run out on two glasses of wine and not pay. We got so fed up with the nastiness of the wine, we just left our glasses full and left.
author: KT S.

description: Went here with a large group of people. This restaurant is a pretty spacious place. Seems very casual where people goto to kick back. Food wise is average. I got fish and chips. Price is NOT cheap here - type of food here is relatively heavy. Most dishes starts from $17-$22+ and it's just either fried batter, meat and potatoes. Maybe it's not my type of food and it's kind of pricey for what it is.
author: Kevin L.

description:
NOTE: This review is for the Dueling Piano Bar

This place is freakin awesome.  I was a little hesitant because it could either be really good or really bad. We got there around 8:30pm on a drizzling Friday night and it was the perfect time. A crowd had just started to form, but there were still a handful of tables to choose from. We took a couple bar stools and ordered our first round of drinks. There is a two drink minimum for the tables, but it's well worth it and it's not too overpriced for being in Union Square. At around 9pm, they start the show and let you know how it goes -- song requests with $$$ get played and if there's a special occasion (ie birthday, anniversary, new job, etc), let them know and they'll celebrate by serenading you with a song... Though it's always raunchy and hilarious at the same time. 

It got the most crowded probably around 10pm, and the crowd was steady even when we left after 11pm. We probably could have spent the whole night there, but I felt they were running out of good songs. I gotta give them props for keeping me entertained that long, though, because I was legitimately having a good time.

This is a great place for a date or even a group outing! Yeah, I'm pretty sure I'll be back :)
author: Leana L.

description: Not so good experience. I ordered a steak medium, the steak they brought out was very rare. I told the waitress and she took it back, the next one was over well done and worse than the first. Maybe this place has good irish good but the chef obviously doesnt know how to cook a steak. The fries were mediocre...
author: Katye W.

description: YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY!!! GREAT FOOD!!! GREAT DECORE!! GREAT SERVICE!!! what more could I ask for? In a way I liked the separations put up to give it the old Irish feeling.  The food itself tasted authentic and home cooked.  Will definitely be coming back
author: Sammy Z.

description: Every time we are in San Francisco we stop here. It is for one thing only BLOODY MARY OYSTER SHOOTERS! They are amazing. Cons the portion size is small and they are a bit pricey. With that being said I still get them every time .
author: Zaheem B.

description: I had the Veggie Stew, which was fresh and healthy. The waitress was attentive and friendly. The atmosphere, causal. Johnny Foley's was a great place to relax and eat and drink and watch the NCAA tournament.
author: Roland J.

description:
Popped into this place by happenstance when in town for a convention. Apparently so did everyone else. They were in the weeds but worked hard as a team and made it happen.  
I went with fish and chips and was not disappointed. Best part is some staff member followed us out of the restaurant with my colleagues wallet full of cash as he had left it behind.  Can't teach that it's just awesome. Solid pub.
author: MJ M.

description:
This place has a piano bar downstairs. The drinks are pretty expensive which makes sense because if they were cheaper this place would be even more packed than it already is. There's always some cute girls hanging around this spot. Fun to sing a long with the dueling piano players. They're funny and talented.

Never paid a cover but have waited in line before. I've never eaten here but upstairs they had a band once playing which was pretty fun.
author: Marty J.

description: Really enjoyed the vibes, the layout, the crowd and obviously the drinks here. Located in a happening district. Worth a visit and more.
author: Shantanu D.

description: I spent about 200 dollars here this past weekend. With that being said, this place must have been great!
author: Nubia R.

description:
Loved it.

Ordered:
Fish and Chips - Great texture, great flavors!
Fried Chicken - BOMB!  They serve it on a bed of mashed potatoes and this gravy that's full of flavor!  Loved every bite, perfectly breaded and fried!  This is a must get if you come here.
Pork ribs - Great taste, fall off the bone perfection!

Must stop if you're in SF for business or pleasure.  Great atmosphere as well!  Fun place.
author: Matthew M.

description: It's very loud and happppnin- a fun vibe but service sucks. Everyone is in a rush and the food isn't anything that stands out. It's decent. Good vibe and great music to come out and get a few appetizers and a brew. Cheers!
author: Lani F.

description:
I went with my English husband and he enjoyed the Cottage Pie and Fish & Chips.  Not many places serve mushy peas with the fish so that was a plus.

Service was quick and friendly, ambiance was great.

Wish there were more and bigger screens in the bar area. We went to another bar to watch the Euro Finals.
author: Sherri G.

description:
This is now one of my newest favorite spots in the heart of the city! So far one of the best pubs I've been in with a seemingly authentic Irish atmosphere - decor, menu and bar (lots of beers to choose from)! Ok so the layout is a little strange but it works for this place I think.  
My top favorites from the menu so far:
1. Turkey burger.  The onion was ginger and wasabi infused and tasted really good. It almost has electric quality because if you bite into it the minute it hits your tongue you feel a little zap!  
2. The cottage pie.  It is pretty amazing! It is just like a pot pie but without the crust (which I love) and the mashed potato on top was nice and smooth!  Not too heavy either and not drowning in the gravy - perfect balance.
3. Corned beef and cabbage. Always makes me think of the little green leprechaun and St. Patty's day! Excellent texture and the parsley cream sauce is a nice touch.  The corned beef was a tinge salty but I can't remember having corned beef that wasn't salty at all so I still enjoyed it a lot.

It gets really loud in here so probably not the right place for a family reunion unless you're all there to drink and be merry!
author: Mercy D.

description: Nice place,  friendly staff even though they were swamped due to some no show employees.  Veggie  burger is not bad.  Somewhat  bland. Beer selection is good.
author: Jim H.

description: We had our 2nd firm party there this past Friday.  Again, marvelous service.  This time the waitress, Rachel, escorted one of my people out (she imbibed a bit too much) and ensured she got into a Lyft.  She was so wonderful about it, she offered to do it so I wouldn't have to leave the party.  My person said that Rachel treated her so nicely and was very appreciative of her.  The food was again wonderful, the room lovely and the bartender a real pro.  Mary and her staff are consummate professionals. I will be having a non business event in August 2017 and I have every confidence it will be as good as this. Foley's really is the best.
author: Hanya G.

description: We ordered two drinks that we $14 each. The drinks were okay and our server was very sweet. Unfortunately I had the audacity to try to eat a cupcake I bought nearby with my beverage. The hostess came over and rudely told me that I couldn't eat "outside " food in the bar. We were going to order dinner but decided to go somewhere more accommodating and friendly.
author: Aimee B.

description: Came here earliest today for drinks with friends for sana con. Lots of people dressed as Santa's, elves, snowmen, and snowflakes. It was packed. Everyone was crowded at the bars trying to order drinks but the bartender should have been able to manage it without being snappish. It was a fun vibe. I really liked the layout. Little rooms with bar tables, leading into a larger room in the back with seated tables. I heard there's a basement with dueling pianists in the evenings. I would come back again if it's convenient.
author: Ana O.

description: Found this awesome pub a block away from my hotel. I think I'm going back every day to work my way through their menu!  Excellent service, great prices.  And the mushroom ravioli with grilled shrimp was incredible.
author: Susan W.

description:
I absolutely loove this place! its super fun and friendly, great music and great times! 
If i could i would go there every day!
author: Anai S.

description:
right next to the hotel Nikko so we stumbled there for a night cap before heading up to the room. They have live music and theres plenty of seating area. Its an irish bar so the whiskey selection is huuuuge. Bartenders are nice. Feels very irish inside! there are enough TVs for watching sports or highlights.

not a huge beer selection though so stick with the hard stuff!
author: Obed C.

description:
I was reminded last night why I never go to Johnny Foley's. Overpriced. Overpriced. Overpriced. 

However, if you want to meet traveling businessmen and talk them into buying drinks and food for you - this isn't a bad place to go :)
author: Kim C.

description: We chose this restaurant because it was close to our hotel. Stopped in for lunch and sat at the bar. The bartender was very attentive, and mixed up a delicious spicy bloody mary! We chose a salad and the steak sandwich, both of which were very tasty. I don't think you can go wrong with a casual lunch or dinner here.
author: Heather G.

description: Still a fan, 3 years later! The bangers and mash were still delicious, the potato and artichoke soup was good, and the calamari were tender. The sauce accompanying them was weird, and an aioli sauce would have went along with it better, but over all, the food is still good. A bit too loud (band was), but I will return in the future!
author: Monica M.

description:
3.5 stars?! I beg to differ! Let me tell you why.

If you are lucky enough to venture into this fine establishment come the beginning weeks in December, you'll be in for a treat. You won't know it right away, but you, my friend, have stumbled into the drinking mecca of nerdom. 

For one week in December this bar is crawling with a strange group of mammals known as GEOSCIENTISTS. This phenomenon occurs during one of the largest scientific conferences in the world: AGU. This annual nerdfest single-handedly increases the the population of brainiacs in Union Square manyfold. After hours, this is where it all happens. Probably some of the best scientific connections have been made and incredible scientific ideas have emerged here. 

The breed of human known as geoscientists may appear odd at first, in their pleated pants, tweed jackets, glasses, and blue name tags, but you should know that they are, in fact, MUCH more odd than you can even begin to imagine. I would know, I am one of them (without the tweed jacket of course). With that being said, this bar does an excellent job at facilitating the bashful intoxication of hundreds of the worlds finest scientists, and for that I salute you John Foley. 

This bar is a MUST stop after a long afternoon of standing around drinking beer and listening to people talk about things way over your head.. wait.. I meant learning about the latest and greatest science (yes, you just read that correctly, they serve beer at our conferences, be jealous). 

95% of the time I'm here, I get the Smithwick's because I can't pass that up when it's on tap. Really, no one should. Then we'll end up doing some inappropriately named shots while screaming to our colleagues over the loud live music. 

Ah, Foleys, I have nothing but fond memories (at least the ones I remember) of you and I guarantee I'll be seeing you more than my fair share come this December.
author: Alicia K.

description: I was in sf for 5 nights. We just tried different bars. This Irish bar was packed when we got in. They had a band and people danced by the band. It was beautiful. I wish i could go there when its not packed.
author: Mark T.

description:
The burger was not on their dinner menu, but was offered. It was also the most affordable meal they had - and it was cooked pretty well. No complaints, no compliments. The server was nice to me, but a bit rude to my friends, especially when she realized we were all price-conscious. Kind of a bummer actually.

Other than that, the place looks great for a drink. At night, there is a line outside for the bar.
author: Jason S.

description: I stopped at Johnny Foley's while I was traveling through California.  I had just eaten across the street and figured I would stop in for a beer (or three).  I loved the old-school charm and décor of the restaurant.  The bartenders were fantastic and were all from Ireland.  They made great suggestions on which beers to try.  There was live music, which is always fantastic.  I did not eat there, so I can't speak on the food, but I would definitely stop in again.
author: Jenna E.

description:
Pros:  Everything we ordered here tasted pretty good; The mussels had a delicious white sauce that were almost slurp worthy, my lamb sliders were really good and moist, and the onion strings were interesting and came in a large portion (addictive and unlike anything I've ever had).  There were many drink options on the menu as well.

Cons:  My lamb sliders were too small for the price, drinks were expensive, service was below average, and too touristy.

Overall even though Johnny Foley's has some good food, it doesn't really have that 'spark' that makes me want to comeback ever again.
author: David P.

description: This place is awesome! Great draught beers, friendly, fast service, and the food is delicious. If you find yourself in San Francisco check out this gem.
author: Harry L.

description: Delicious food (kale salad, fish n chips, cottage pie and kids mac n cheese). Nice environment and great service.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Do not walk here from Japantown. I think I got a contact high on the way, and a great look at a woman in some fishnets and boots that was making a fashion statement men were paying money to spend time with...

So Johnny Foley's.... crowded part of San Fran when the corporate people get out of work and their hotel conferences.

Guinness poured perfectly, our server was the perfect attentive gentleman, my fish and chips rocked it london style including the mushy peas. More pricey than we were planning for, with a heck less bar space and tv's than my football watching friend wanted. But the food was good, the beer was better and i like mahogany.

Overall, not a bad spot, but I wouldn't go back just because San Fran is such a unique city, with so many cool places. Why would you go back to some place you know when there are so many new places to discover?
author: Jessica S.

description:
This place hits the spot. It's a bit noisy and pricey but the food is pretty darn good and the portions are pretty large. I will be eating here again when I return to SF. 
It's definitely not the place if you're eating on a budget, though!
author: Kay G.

description:
Review is for the pub section

Pros:
My friends and I were lucky to be here on a night with no cover charge. The bouncing and bar staff were very friendly. We also enjoyed very much the live music that night, a piano playing duo which did its part to involve the crowd on singing the chorus lines of familiar pop hits including "Bohemian Rhapsody." 

Cons:
The bar selection on tap could be more comprehensive. The import and domestic beers were pricey for my group. While we enjoyed our stellas, we only ordered one round at $7.50 a piece. 

Bottom Line:
This bar has a wonderful atmosphere with friendly staff, and good taste in musical performers. However, this bar is in the more touristy part of the city, with a closer proximity to Union Square, catering to a high paying demographic group of patrons. I may return and try the restaurant next time.
author: A. V.

description: Expensive, what isn't in SF.  However, good atmosphere and great steak sandwich.  Bartenders a bit put off but wait staff very good.
author: B C.

description:
Stopped in here to refuel during a busy day of holiday shopping.  The location is excellent, right near Union Square and very visible.  Loved the ambiance, too.  This place has lots of character!

FOOD:  Meh.  The corned beef panini left much to be desired- very dry and not much sauerkraut/cheese.  The veggie panini however (which we ordered on a recommendation from our server) was delicious!  

SERVICE:  Our server was fantastic.  She was clearly very busy and had several tables at once, but she was prompt and most importantly, was hospitable.  The bartender (we sat at the bar for a few drinks before being sat) was efficient, so that was nice.  

However, they need some improvement with their host stand.  We stood for several minutes before being greeted, and then probably another 5 before making contact with the hostess.  When she finally appeared, she was rude and short and acted like she was doing us a favor by seating us.  She seemed pretty stressed- I'm not sure if she was waiting tables in addition to hosting, or what.  And to top it off, she told us it would be 20-25 minutes, so naturally we went and got drinks at the bar.  No sooner had he poured the beers but we found out our table was ready!  No problem, I'm happy to be seated, but bummer that we couldn't have just ordered those drinks from our server.  

My  advice to this establishment would be to hire a helpful, friendly host staff.  They are the customer's first impression!  Were it not for the fact that we were starving, we probably would have left and gone elsewhere.  

IN SUMMARY- Decent place for some Irish food and drinks in the heart of San Francisco :)
author: Mallory N.

description:
Came here when there was " no room at the inn" @ the Daily Grill. Wanted drinks and apps. This place we had walked by a few times while staying at the Hilton. Decided to try it.
Had a great experience! ..GREAT service by Rebecca!!! Apps were delish and different. The tandori chicken with cucumber sauce was scrumptious. .finger lickin good.. as well as the prawns wrapped in bacon with a sweet chile glaze. Had a martini that did not dissappoint.  Not watered down like most  bars. By the the time we left the place, it  was packed. Good sign.. this was only a week night.  Happy to stumble upon this place. :-)
author: Kat M.

description: Probably the worst place you can go to in the city. A vodka tonic is sprite with vodka and a Manhattan is a coke with a concoction of crap booze. Save your money and time.
author: Rico L.

description: No frills Irish pub in Financial District. Prices were not sports bar cheap, but they have a lot of tv's and an attentive bartender, so you take the good with the bad I guess. A lot of people seem to come here after checking into their hotels nearby. They have some pretty cool golf memorabilia inside too. Only had Lagunitas on tap, but the wings were surprisingly very good, and some of the best I've had in the Bay since moving here. The calamari also was fresh. Not my first option going out there, but certainly on my callback list. The long bar inside can hold a ton of people, which helps with crowd control too.
author: Dan M.

description:
I had a great time at Foley's this past Saturday night! The dueling piano players went above and beyond just playing music requests, they got the entire bar singing and dancing. The entire bar is bursting with personality and it was the perfect combination of relaxing and upbeat! The drinks were a bit pricey, but for the location it's understandable. The staff was also very attentive and friendly which is a major plus for me.

We will definitely be making this one of our regular spots! If you enjoy live music and friendly people who like to have a good time, Foley's is the spot!
author: Shannon P.

description: Came here for dinner tonight around 4. The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere and is sectioned off. We were seated at a bar table somewhere in the middle. We shared one of the best onion string apps I've ever had! They used red onions and served it with a dill/ranch sauce. So good. I had the sour cherry salad, which is a must if you love vinegar! The Mac and cheese was awesome--very cheesy and made with some bolder cheeses. My husband really enjoyed the beef and Guinness soup, although it wasn't my favorite.
author: Kae H.

description: The dueling show was a great time and was a fabulous place to come for a night out with my friends. My friends and I came out and stayed for hours singing at the top of our lungs. One of the piano players named Chris was particularly awesome. He brought energy the entire night and totally worked the crowd. He also played everything we requested and had fun with us the entire night. He also has a voice that can sing everything from billy Joel to Elvis to Taylor swift to Michael Jackson all of which he sang effortlessly the entire night. He totally rocked and made our night out spectacular.
author: Lauren A.

description: In town visiting on business and Yelp came to the rescue after a hard day. Followed my nose to Johnny Foley's for some Bangers and Mash that were amazing! Loved the vibe and was like a 2 minute walk from my hotel. Great place to catch the game or come with friends for dinner!
author: Jesse S.

description:
It felt more like a club, than a pub.  We were led through a maze to get to our table.  I needed a GPS to get back out.  

We ordered the Irish soda bread.  I now know why Ireland is not a culinary hot-spot.  It tasted like crap.  We forced ourselves to eat it because we paid for it.  I'm not sure if all soda bread tastes that way, or just Johnny Foley's.  I'm going to order it in Ireland and find out.  I also had the fish 'n chips (cod).  It was good, but not great.  Two people could have shared this.  

I could only see coming again for a drink because it's just too crowded to enjoy dinner here.
author: Heather C.

description:
Such a fan of this place for so many reasons!  But I'll touch on my faves:

Ambiance: I like that it's sectioned off a few times.  An area in the front, another area in the middle, an area in the back (where the band plays), and a few side rooms, even one nook for a little privacy.  For some reason, not sure if it was the place itself, the bartender uniforms, bartenders themselves, or what, but it kinda felt like a throwback being in there, in a good way.  Respectable crowd, no ruckus, and a table opened up within minutes of being there.  The live band added a nice touch; they didn't dominate the place, but just complemented the already-good-time-vibe.

Service/Hospitality: The bartenders here are awesome.  Skilled, efficient, VERY professional, I love!  They learned my drink orders quickly (Captain Diet with a lime + shots of Jameson, with a glass of water), which I'm such a sucker for.  I can't remember the latter part of our time there (for obvious reasons), but I'm almost positive they threw me a buyback or two.

FYI: The shots are the big gulp kind, worth $9 (Jameson), unlike other bars who give you shots in a glass that's more like an illusion (aka really thick glass for no reason so that it just looks like you have a big shot when you really don't).

I'm a fan!
author: Carla C.

description: Fun pub atmosphere. We sat at the bar and talked to the people hanging out. They have a good beer list and ok wine list. The food was good nothing that wowed me. We had the lamb sliders and sweet potato fries - would I order them again? Probably not. According to the reviews the cottage pie is the way to go and it was good worth eating but a little bland in flavor. The dish is very hot when it arrives so be careful not to burn your tongue. I liked the bar and it was fun to be in an Irish Pub.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Love visiting this San Francisco gem. It is much bigger inside than it looks.
On our most recent visit the bf and I ordered Guinness. I asked if they serve half pints and to my delight - they do! Our beers came with decorations in the head, a sign of a good pour.
We had paninis for lunch this visit. Roast beef & cheddar and the herbed chicken. Past visits we have enjoyed traditional fish & chips,beef stew, the shrimp panini, and I can't remember what else. It is all good.
Service is prompt and friendly. Atmosphere is great.
author: Kinner J.

description: My first time here and i love it! Rebecca my server is so nice. Very good and fast service. The food is awesome i will definitely come again
author: Enrique Jr L.

description: Came here after a few cocktails for dinner. Watched the end of the Thursday night football game. Was able to sit in the dining area and still watch the game. Ordered the NY strip and came out as ordered. I hate when the waitress asks how I would like my steak, and then it comes out either under or over, then you have to argue about it. Little pricey, but good food and atmosphere. They definitely squeeze the tables in together, so a part of two may be better suited for the bar area.
author: AJ L.

description: We are in town for a play and stumbled across this place. OMG!! Fantastic food and a great staff!! Get the Lamb Stew!!! Melt in your mouth!!!!
author: Lea W.

description: Love, love, love Foley's. If you're looking for a great night out with friends, this is the spot! The piano bar downstairs as well as the food are top notch! The staff could not be nicer and the overall atmosphere will take you back in time. This is a must see establishment in San Francisco.
author: Krista L.

description:
I love this place's ambiance. The vaulted ceilings with their literally 3 ft worth of crown molding screams of a by gone era. No doubt people have enjoyed drinks here for 100 years!

Food and service are very good. Peppercorn sauce on the steak is killer as is their fish and chips! If you are just looking for a drink sit at the bar and ask for Julio, he is a damn good dude!
author: Adam L.

description: We were going to come here for dinner and to watch the piano show but it didn't start to 9:30 and we didn't think we would make it that long. So we ordered dinner and thought maybe we might make it if our food took a while. Well it turns out it didn't I ordered the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies. The food was cooked very well. Chicken was juicy and the veggies crisp. The mashed potatoes tasted real and not from a box. The dinner came with gravy which I was glad for because the food was rather bland. Maybe it's how Irish food is supposed to taste like. All in all it was just fine. Service was good and our waitress was super nice. I might stop in again to catch the show but probably not to eat. No reason other than the food was just ok.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Foley's is a great place to go and have a complete evening of drinks, dinner and Las Vegas like live entertainment.  My friends and I started by playing a round at the Olympic club; what a treasure.  We, all eight of us, headed over to Foley's for a cold pint.  We had the Lagunitas beer and it was a hole in one.  It just hit the spot perfectly; ice cold and fresh.

We decided to stay for dinner since we were having so much fun. We started with the salmon appetizer which was served on top of a potato pancake.  This was truly one of the best appetizers I have ever had so I ordered another. There were several other great appetizers that we ordered.  The steak was perfectly cooked and the different sauces added a great touch.

We headed downstairs to see the dueling piano players.  This was great fun and top entertainment.  I laughed so hard.

If you want a great night out Foley's is one of the best in the San Francisco.
author: Miguel D.

description:
Frankly overrated.
Rank stairs.
Absolutely not worth the trouble.
Underwhelming ambiance once the lights go up.
Do yourself a favor and avoid.

http://www.sfgate.com/news/article/SF-businesses-listed-in-health-care-audit-4227172.php

I'm John S., and I approved this review.
author: John S.

description:
After reading alot of great reviews of this Irish Restaurant... I have decided to check out this place myself and I did, I came here on a wednesday for lunch which was two days ago...

I have to say when the first time, I walked inside to this Irish place it was pretty big inside and a bit crowded with alot of people who were drinking  the guiness beer and I like it very much not only that you can also sit back and watch sports on the big television screen that they have at Johnny Foley's Irish House...

On the item that, I have ordered on the menu, which I ate for lunch at this awesome Irish Restaurant which I have not eaten before... I have been to several Irish Pubs before but at Johnny Foley's I ate the Bangers & Mash for the first time... What I really really like most about the Bangers & Mash is the sausages and the mash potatoes and of  course I gotta have the guiness beer with my Bangers & Mash with it without it its like you didnt eat at a Irish Restaurant & Pub...

I really really like the sausages and the mash potatoes alot it tasted really really good when I took my first bite of the Bangers & Mash!!!!!
author: William B.

description: Delicious food, Good drinks, wish I had more time to explore.
author: Jesse S.

description: Great food which feels more upscale than your typical Irish pub fare. Comfort food dishes that aren't huge but not small either. Prices are fair and the atmosphere is inviting. Many beers on tap both macro and craft. They even had a kids menu for my little guy, and the waiter brought him some free ice cream when we were finished.
author: Michael W.

description:
I walk past this place everyday and I always thought it was just a little hole in the wall. This place is HUGE! Perfect set up for sports fan, full bar, decent beer list. 
Their staff is busy but attentive and fun. 
Little pricey for food, but their lamb sliders and potato skins are prime. And I'm not sure who made my Manhattan, but one of the best I've had in the city easily. 
Definitely coming back because it's always time for a pint here! ;) 

*would be five stars if it was a few bucks cheaper. SF living tho..
author: Lexy H.

description: Great drinks and great service! We ordered the potato skins, wings and onion rings. The onion rings are homemade!!! BEST onion rings ever. Don't miss them. The wings were also delicious with the perfect amount of spice! We will be back!
author: Paula C.

description: The service was quick and the food was out in lightening speed. My husband and I ordered the calamari and it was disgusting. Breading was soggy and the calamari was rubbery. I got the cottage pie? I think that's what it's called... It had a good taste and my husband enjoyed his bangers and mash.  I ordered a Jameson & ginger. It was terrible and I'm not convinced it was Jameson. I couldn't drink it and had to send it back.
author: Angela J.

description:
I am not really a fan (4 stars) but I did have a good time. The place is really spacious and clean. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and would check up on us occasionally while my friend and I was just chit chatting while slowly drinking our beers.

Reason I am not a fan is because I decided I don't like beer. That's it. Otherwise is a great place if you are looking to drink some beer and watch sports on all the flat screens.
author: Sarah C.

description: $8.75 for a pint makes it by far the most expensive bar in the city. I was shocked at what they charged.
author: Dave O.

description:
Foley's was definitely an unexpected and gratifying surprise. 

I was expecting tasteless over-fried bar food, with limited, if any vegetarian options at Foley's. Our meals were anything but.  Each of our meals was well proportioned, full of flavor, and bursting with fresh vegetables.

If you're looking for hearty healthy food - try the vegetarian stew here. It's massive with thick cut portobello mushrooms, asparagus, carrots, tomatoes, spinach, mashed potatoes, and baked potatoes. The medley of produce swimming in light broth is astounding. 

My dining partners' meals ranging from the chicken pot pie, the mushroom ravioli, and the shepherd's pie were each devoured hungrily, and with heartwarming ooos and ahhs. Sitting in a cozy alcove of Foley's vast interior, we caught up, while our waitress checked in on throughout the duration of our exceptional lunch, with genuine care.

Our apple dessert graced with a thick ball of vanilla ice-cream, and four spoons for each of us, ended our rainy day feast superbly.

After the last bite of ice-cream drenched pastry was finished, we headed back into the thick of the drizzly San Francisco weather. Halfway down the block, we heard someone yelling behind us. We turned around to see a dampened Foley's staff member running to catch up with us, with my mom's gloves in his hand. We all couldn't get over how thoughtful the man was, to run into the rain to return my mom's forgotten gloves.

I only see my mom once a year. I thank you Foley's for making our afternoon together, before she boarded a plane not long after, such a memorable one.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Prior to last night, I would have only maybe given 4 stars.  I have yet to go to the basement or eat the food, but based on just having a good time, this is a good spot to be.  There's always live music when I show up and because of their crowd control deal it's always easy to get a drink...before midnight anyways. 

Last night was especially good, thanks to a great band and some guy who said his name is Quinn Riley.  Thank you for sharing your moves like jagger with me and  everyone on the dance floor--I don't think I'll be able to move for a while.  If you're reading this Quinn, please contact me so we have have another crazy dance party sometime haha!

And that, with all the green beer and Irish festivities in between and all over, concludes my Saint Patrick's Day weekend.
author: Britt B.

description: Very spacious, there's both an upstairs and a downstairs.  Surprisingly decent bar food, tried the buffalo wings (yum), ribs (tasty!), and calamari (so so).  Drinks were a little on the expensive side.  The downstairs is a nice big room with a couple of TVs.  Good place to hang out with a bunch of friends, grab some drinks and a couple bites for a good time.
author: Kay C.

description:
Dueling pianos in the basement on the weekends is a great time.  Crowded, but fun.
Bar has a good selection of draft beers and some big TVs for catching a game. 

Food selection is ok, but nothing great.
author: Dave C.

description:
Been here 2 weekends in a row for a friend's birthday, and dueling piano is a great way to celebrate birthdays! The pianists are uber talented and hilarious! I was blown away when they rapped "Empire State of Mind" and "Thriftshop"!!! 

If you are here celebrating a friend's birthday, make their night by requesting a birthday song! (The more money you put in for the request, the better it will be!) They will customize a personal birthday song to you AND THEY ARE HILARIOUS!! 

Coming back a second time, some of the birthday songs were repeated and reused so my 2nd experience was more predictable...but nevertheless I still had a blast.

The piano dueling show starts at 9pm and it can get pretty packed so go early to avoid the lines and to grab a table!

PS: if you're wondering why its called dueling piano, it is because if you don't like a song that was requested, you can up the amount of tip that was put in for the unwanted song and change the song. Whoever requested the first song can then up that person's amount to go back to the previous song and it can keep going and going, like a duel! 

(sorry if that doesn't quite make sense...) 

But I recommend checking this place at least once!
author: Eileen Z.

description: First time here and I love this place. Incredible customer service the hospitality is great and good food.
author: RAWDAWG L.

description:
After spending  mucho $$$$ celebrating New Years in SF, I was looking for a decent place to eat the following day that wouldn't break my bank.  I was glad to find this restaurant.  The portions were huge.  The GF ordered the buffalo/chicken wings and a dozen came with the order.  I ordered the bangers and mash and the plate was huge (as you can probably see in the pictures).  The prices were very affordable and the taste was just as good.

The waitress was very nice, she seemed a little slow but made up for it with her pleasing attitude.  My only complaint would be where we sat.  We were seated in the bar area where there is a booth along the wall and chairs on the opposite side of the table.  There is absolutely no cushioning so if I leaned against the booth wall it was solid wood and there were these wooden posts along the booth that jabbed at my shoulder when I leaned back.  But shouldn't be a huge problem if you haven't been partying all night and are not too exhausted and don't need to lean back in your seat.
author: Kristen K.

description:
Been here a couple of times, I'm sure I'll visit again in the future...hopefully no grandpa-looking finnish businessman tries to pick me up by informing me he has a room in a really nice hotel nearby and does tantric yoga...smh

They have live music a lot of the time in the evenings, and I've never seen it too packed. The only price I can remember is that a Stella was $8. Location is sweet - downtown and near a bunch of other places (*ahem infusion lounge ahem*)

This is more a chill drinking night kind of place.
author: Navjeet K.

description: Great service and ambiance. Beer was cold and there's a great selection. Both of our entrees were piping hot, fresh and flavorful. We always love Johnny Foley's. They do Irish Pub right!
author: Chad H.

description:
Came here twice on my last visit to SF, once for lunch and once for after-dinner drinks. Got the steak sandwich for lunch which I thought was pretty good and the server was friendly. When we came back for drinks we had fun but there was live music and it was just crazy loud. I guess that's to be expected.

I give it only three stars, because nothing about the place really stood out to me.
author: Meagan E.

description: I had dinner here with my friend and it was great. Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. The food was excellent, came out quick and affordable. Everyone should go here if you like good food, nice people and being happy. If you don't like that, go to Guitar Center on Van Ness.
author: Zack S.

description:
Friendly bartenders and decently priced drinks in downtown?? 

I'd love to come back for the food!
author: Jess C.

description: I love downstairs part of the bar, that place is amazing! You definitely will have fun over there! Pianists really funny guys and well players/singers as well!  Drinks price is average. Worth give a try and check it out!
author: Alex B.

description:
My first dueling pianos experience and it was a blast. I liked how they called out people to get on stage if it was their birthday or anniversary and then put them on the spot in very entertaining ways.

The two pianists were really good at taking song requests and getting the crowd going too. The bar is polished and I liked how they had english pale ale on tap, which I found was pretty enjoyable although not as much as IPAs.

Although it is a small venue and was packed at to capacity on Friday night, It wasn't annoying as I believed it offered a setting of intimacy.
author: Thanh T.

description: My husband and I checked out the reviews before going to eat here and were a little hesitant. I must say we were quite impressed! My husband had the slow cooked prime rib and it was delicious! The mashed potatoes and veggies were amazing too! I had a ceaser salad and that was tasty. It is loud but it's a cool place. We want to go check out lunch sometime soon.
author: Jessica F.

description: Cool spot! Strolled in with my girlfriend to grab a few drinks. Very nice bar, great place to catch the game, friendly staff and good food. Try the fish n chips! Our bartender was Gavin, he was very funny and personable, we had some greats laughs. I definitely recommend stoping by for a pint of Guinness or five. Thanks Gavin!
author: Grant G.

description:
Went with a great group of people and we definitely had a wonderful time.

As far as piano bars go though, this is a knock-off.  $10 cover and the guys playing clearly do not humor the crowd with their requested songs but have already decided what songs they'll play for the night.  Unfortunately their choices consisted of all the generic stuff that you would expect to hear at a piano bar.  But wait, it even gets less authentic - they used a sound machine overtop of the piano for some songs.

Chicagoans, this place will make you angry.  I should have expected this much given the location in a touristy area.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Been to a lot of bars in San Fran. Went on a sleepy Monday night, I ordered a double (well) gin and soda came to $18.50. When I asked about it I was smugly told "welcome to SF". I've been here a week, never paid that for a drink. I don't think this bar is worth it.
author: Chris M.

description: We went to see the dueling pianos tonight and it was fantastic!  We went because Nathan Temby was there and he was great as usual.  Nancy and Larry went above and beyond to make this a wonderful evening. Looking forward to coming back again
author: Karol A.

description: Great selection of beers. The food is delicious and reasonable ( for SF standards) and the staff is not too hard on the eyes. You should go here if you are looking for a fun atmosphere and some laughs.
author: Aki W.

description: No more place to sit in cocktail... Bar manager was super rude. Name was Tammy I think. Horrible customer service. Do not go here!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Excuse me but can I have some cheese with that wine?  Because that is what I'm about to do.  This place is super busy and full of cheesy performers.  I must elaborate because this was way too funny.  It was a full on band with 2 ladies hoochy'fied performers.  One was the main singer.  The other in her hot pants, boostier, was dancing around like she was in the pussycats show.  It was too much, but some of the tourist were loving it and taking their pics with their camera phones.  I had to laugh.

 I went here a Saturday night.  OMG super packed with European Travelers drinking their pints.  You can't sit down until dinner is over.  Make sure your dogs are not worn out.  I'm sure during the week this place isn't that packed and it is a lot more calmer, but man-o-man, the weekends are crazy!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I came here for lunch and had the best fish and chips since I was in London. I washed it down with a pint of Guinness and I was on my way. Until I came back the same day for dinner to have their beef and Guinness soup with barley & onions. The only problem I had with my meal, it was gone too soon. The food was very good.  

The service was excellent and also authentic. Our waitress was from Cork. The restaurant is dark wood and well used tables. Just what I hoped to find and quickly forget I was in the heart of San Francisco. 

I can't remember the last time I went to a restaurant for lunch and dinner on the SAME day. I'm glad I did.
author: Keith D.

description: I rarely write reviews for yelp, but I felt obligated to do so for this restaurant. The pork ribs were the best I've ever had. Likewise, the onion rings make a good appetizer. Good service and awesome portions! I had a good New Years Eve dinner with my girlfriend :) Shout out to our waitress, Jessica; she was very welcoming.
author: Richard Y.

description: I've worked for this awesome place 5-some years, great people, great food and entertainment upstairs and down!! :)
author: Jason M.

description: Had the Fried calamari appetizer and the Gorgonzola cheese & apple salad, both amazing. Have been here a couple time before, usually just do a bunch of appetizers for the table (haven't had a bad appetizer yet) but all of their good looks great.
author: Brittany P.

description: We were there on a Thursday night and heard a buzz, so we headed straight  downstairs to the piano bar that was rocking!  I know the image of a piano sounds like a *yawn* but it wasn't like that at all.  There are two grand pianos facing each other with a guy and girl pianist who keep the party going.  How many piano bars do you know that play "Baby Got Back" complete with "volunteered" audience participation?!  This is a great spot to let loose and to sing like nobody's listening!
author: Jason C.

description:
Let's start with the fun stuff...
The free sing-a-long piano bar downstairs is a BLAST! We made requests, we sang along, we ate, we drank...we had a good time. They'll take your written request in top tip order, meaning, the higher the tip that comes with the request, the sooner they'll play your song. They prefer a $5 minimum. It's worth it! As far as the upstairs bar area, eh, it's alright. They claim to have the best bloody marys, but I'm not sure if I agree. They're tasty, but they feel like virgins. You gotta have a both taste and tingle to get my vote. FIVE stars for the downstairs...THREE stars for the upstairs.
author: Helen L.

description: I always have a great time when I come to Johnny's with friends.  This last time was the most memorable in regards to the service because I left my jacket on a Friday night at the bar.  I called on Monday (three days later) and to my surprise they tracked my jacket down.  When I arrived to pick it up later, even with a packed bar they handed it to me right away!
author: Angeline G.

description:
If you go here, head straight for the downstairs part where there are sing-alongs to dueling pianos. 

TIP:  If you want a place to sit, get there early, otherwise you will be squished in a corner with no space to move.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Horrible service by rude waitstaff that kicked us unceremoniously off a table we were sitting at within the first 5 mins of arriving! I never have been treated so bad by any Staff member in any establishment throughout the entire world!
author: Dan S.

description:
In town for a conference, wanted to watch the hockey game and get some beer with dinner, this place was close to my hotel.

I was a little underwhelmed by the beers that were on tap as my last trip to CA was filled with fantastic beer (San Diego), so I guess San Fran is still into the whole wine thing...

The overall menu was limited, but I had a hard time choosing what I wanted as everything sounded really good. I ended up with a $19 order of fish and chips. I guess it's just my naivety coming from the midwest, but why the hell is everything in this town so expensive, especially fish and chips? In this case, work is footing the bill, but it just seems odd that such a simple dish would cost so much... Beers were $7 a piece too. Crazyness...

All in all, my meal was good, but not outstanding (I really like the mushy peas though), the beer was passable and the service was actually very good, given that this place was PACKED on a Tuesday evening.

I wasn't blown away by anyone thing in particular, and if I was in town again, I probably wouldn't make it a point to stop by this particular establishment, but I suppose it's worth a try.
author: Adam S.

description:
If I had actually stuck with piano when I was younger, I would aspire to be one of the pianists at Johnny Foley's! "Why?" you may ask. Because it looks like they have a ton of fun, they get to embarrass people, and the tips ain't bad either!

My first time here was a ton of fun! We arrived a little after 9 pm and the place was already hopping! Everyone is just having a good time singing along and dancing, but sometimes drunk people will go in front and dance around, blocking your view and occasionally stepping on your feet. 

The pianists are entertaining and it blows my mind how talented they are! Tom Petty, Johnny Cash, and Journey on one end of the spectrum, while Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber, and Bruno Mars on the other. It's easy to write down requests, just be sure to include some money with it! ;) Be warned though! If someone doesn't like the song you've requested, they can give more money to stop your song.

The place is small, it gets warm quickly, and there are a limited amount of seats and tables, but otherwise, a good way to spend a Wednesday-Saturday night!

DESSERTS ARE DELICIOUS!! :D
author: Kei H.

description: My Wife and I and friends went here for a birthday event and it was absolutely amazing! Such a fun and lively place and the Dueling piano guys were a blast and very theatrical the whole time. Can't wait to go back!
author: Daniel S.

description:
I came here with some friends to check out the dueling pianos this past weekend.  In general, dueling pianos is a pretty cool concept... the crowd was pretty into it, and they played a lot of popular songs.  I was pretty impressed by both pianists' improv skills. 

What detracted from an otherwise great experience was the fact that it was wayyy too crowded and feels like an oven. The bar is in a basement, and there were literally heat waves emanating from the mass of people. I gave up trying to see much (too many people fighting their way the front), and getting a drink at the bar is a challenge indeed. We were pretty much squished like sardines the entire time we were there and eventually couldn't take it anymore and went elsewhere. 

I'd recommend checking it out once though if you happen to be in the area, and I would be more inclined to go for dueling pianos again on a night when it isn't so packed.
author: Sarah T.

description:
One of my favorite places in SF. Good location. Very fun atmosphere.  

Live bands in the restaurant in the late hours and a piano bar downstairs. $10  cover for the Piano Bar downstairs on Friday nights when I've been, but it was free on a couple of Wednesdays I attended.  

Food is a little too pricey for me but very tasty.  Sides are also too pricey for as much as they give you.    

I think the servers have too much going on, and aren't the most friendly but not terrible either.  The Bartenders are much nicer and chatty but that's to be expected.  I think the servers could vastly improve their wine knowledge and etiquette.   But again, I'm not really that upset about it.

lastly I think for the price of the food, the wine list could be improved...A lot.  And I think if you are spending a bunch of money on dinner, you shouldn't have to pay the cover for the piano bar.  

Overall one of my favorite spots to enjoy in the city.
author: Michael B V.

description:
Recently I went on a trip to San Francisco and went to this place to meet someone for lunch. Who knew there were so many Irish pubs in San Francisco I saw them everywhere. But no reason to complain I love Irish pub food. I actually went to two different places while in San Fran and this Irish Pub was better by far. I got a Corned Beef sandwich and it was really good.  The bread they make and press the sandwich on is really good the meat seemed good quality and I got the side salad with my sandwich and the salad was really good. The ingredients tasted really good quality. 

Everyone else at the table enjoyed their food as well. I went at lunch so I cant speak for what its like at night but I can say the food is good and if I was in the area again I probably would go back.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
You cant go wrong here.  Ever ytime my best friends and I come to this city, we stop here.  

Ive had almost everything on the menu and you cant go wrong.  Even the burgers are great!   

My only complaint is that when i sports game is on, the tv is LOUD!  Too loud to hear anyone that you may want to talk to.
author: Heidi S.

description: Probably one of the worse foods and service I have encountered in San Francisco.  The waiter only cared about serving us more drinks. I asked for bread three times and finally had to ask another waiter. I ordered mushroom ravioli with grilled salmon. The salmon was raw in the middle. Sent it back to be cooked and came back burnt.  The ravioli tasted like it came out of frozen bag.  The sauce was canned tomatoes with olive oil and garlic.  Really awful.  The waiter never asked how we are doing? How is the food?  I gave them two stars because of the martini. The only good thing in this place.  What a waste of money.  Please avoid this place unless you just want drinks.
author: Maryam D.

description:
I still find Johnny Foley's very cheesy, and would not voluntarily come here for drinks.

However, they do serve a pretty decent and hearty lunch.  My friend swears by their vegetarian burger.  I had the fish & chips - served with real malt vinegar though they offset that with tartar sauce.  Very big portions.  It's not cheap but the value is good for the size.

It's also a popular place to watch soccer games during the day.
author: Jean K.

description: The hostess was very rude. After buying a beer and finding a table near the extremely packed bar, the hostess immediately said "this is for dining customers only" and immediately walked off. She could have offered us menus to order or asked us to be put on a waiting list however, she did not. This is very unprofessional and reflects poorly on an establishment that was spoken highly of. Very disappointed.
author: Jay S.

description:
What you get is what you'd expect from a pub by the tourist-central union square.  The space is huge, the food is standard, and the bar serves up drinks with tvs showing sports.  

I came for lunch with some old coworkers on a weekend afternoon (they chose the location, otherwise I probably never would have bothered) and we were seated promptly and treated well by the staff, letting us move to a bigger table after we'd settled at our first.  We shared a round of apps: potato skins and calamari, which were both good, but nothing standout compared to any other pub that serves them.  I went with the California Chicken Panini for my entree because I was needing some bacon and avocado in my life, and this again did the trick, but was nothing remarkable.  The ingredients seemed fresh, everyone seemed happy with their food, and the portions were reasonable.  

Maybe I'm just disillusioned by run-of-the-mill pub grub, so for what it is, I guess this place would get high ratings because everything came out just fine.  I guess I like to look for something a little unique in my restaurants and I didn't find it in my food selections here.  Would I come back? Probably not given its location and lack of uniqueness, but if you're in the mood for some typical Irish fare, standard steak fries and chicken wings, or a pitcher of beer with your burger, you'd be happy enough at Johnny Foley's.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Do you drink to remember or drink to forget? 

In this case it was definitely to remember a magical evening in San Francisco many years ago. It involved drunken piggy back rides through Union Square, voyeuristically watching a couple practically ripping each others clothes off at the bar oblivious to being in the center of a drunken mob, beer and live music.

On my latest visit, I decided to find the bar and see if the atmosphere was as fun as I remembered or was it all just a dream? The search began for an Irish bar close to Union Square. Turns out there are at least three. 

My first stop was Lefty O'Douls and I immediately knew it wasn't right. Next stop was The Irish Bank, which looked amazing. I'll return there to make new memories.

Turns out my epic evening was at Johnny Foley's. When I walked in the main bar, it all came flooding back and was almost exactly as I remembered it. Just a lot quieter since I wasn't with 50 drunken friends. But what made this visit equally special was wandering downstairs to see the dueling pianos.

I spent time with friends earlier in the evening, but at this point I was alone in the city. The piano bar was perfect for a solo traveler. It was filled with laughter, dancing and singing. It was the anniversary of Michael Jackson's death, so perhaps a few of us who grew up with his music before his personal life eclipsed his genius, were feeling a little emotional that day. There were many requests for his music that night.

When I wander a city alone, this is the kind of place I hope to find. A place that envelops you with a warm embrace. Equally enjoyable with friends or as a fly on the wall with moist eyes.
author: Jen K.

description: I am kicking myself for not trying this spot before the other night! An authentic Irish pub right in the heart of the city, what more can you ask? Do yourself a favor, order a Guinness w/ the bangers and mash. I was instantly brought back to my time abroad in Dublin. Not to mention great service from Kellie! Highly recommended.
author: Michael M.

description:
The best night I have had in awhile.

The pianists were amazing and the waitress was very attentive to our large group keeping us with drinks the whole time. 

Will be back again! Super enjoyable and fun place to be on a Saturday night :)
author: Lissa Z.

description: Under cooked chicken gave roommate food poisoning ... Couldn't explain the horror ... avoid
author: Wdfa W.

description:
Every meal I have here seems like the best meal I've ever had. I've tried the Salmon, Prime Rib, and a hamburger. Everything was great. They also have a quality selection of beers on tap, bonus!

Eating here is a little on the pricey side, but it's definitely worth it. The price you pay shows in the quality of food and service, I would highly recommend this for a special occasion.

If you're looking for a quick, cheap meal try Lefty O'douls around the corner or even Blondie's Pizza.
author: John M.

description: Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale was so good! The food was awesome and the actual bar was an experience in it's self. My Cleary heritage would be proud to know I stopped in to get a taste of home.  A+ on selection, price, taste and environment. Try the garlic string fries and thank me later ;)
author: Jess C.

description:
DOWNTOWN PUB'N
(3 stars)

I hate to write mediocre reviews because they're boring. this is a boring review for a mediocre place. Came here after a long day at work to grab eats with some coworkers. I think we were searching for a "pub with good food" and saw pictures of the calamari and said we'd give it a whirl. 

My first impression while visiting their website "why aren't there no prices next to the description of the food?" if your a foody, you already know that's a sign for expensive. 

- food, meh had better
- service, meh okay
- ambiance, restaurant setting - better than the usual irish pub 

We've ordered many appetizers and shared. Calamari, hot fries, ribs, chicken wings, garlic fries. Here's my two cents,

Calamari - it was soggy
Hot Fries - not bad
Garlic Fries - average
Chicken wings - sauce on the side, the fried chicken wings were perfect but there was NO wings all drumlettes
Ribs - looked good but i didnt take a bite because i was already full but my coworkers said they were good

The service could have been better. Our waitress was always coming by to see if we were ready to order. when we did order, we barely saw her. Its like we had to flag her down. I hate to wave but i had to wave. And after we got our bill, i was in a rush to go home and it took forever to have her pick up the bill. 

Will i be back? maybe.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
I actually liked this place. The location scared me as it is tourist central but I was pleasantly surprised.

Bar has a good beer selection and full bar (around $6 for beer, $8 for hard liquor). Apps were mainly fried but sure sounded good.

Sat down in the restaurant and tried the filet mignon (which was a little fatty) and lamb (which was good, the mashed potatoes were awesome) and a side of veggies that were way too buttery for me (why do places do that?! There is obviously a reason why I didn't get the fries).

I didn't get dessert but heard the bread pudding is amazing. Service was a little lacking but the cute host made up for it.
author: Karen S.

description: The location is nice. The food was ok but overpriced. I couldn't finish my drink and all time we were asked to order a new drink. It was very stressfull. I don't recommend if you would like to stay in a stressless place.
author: Angie A.

description: Great food with big portions. Then went down stairs to the dueling piano bar to celebrate my birthday and had a fun time. Both guys on piano were amazing and even cute the girl killed all the song not a favorite.  Fun was had by all!!!
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Giving Johnny the fab five stars!  Why? Maybe because I'm still in a happy cloud after hanging out with friends on a cold December night listening to AWESOME piano duels. This was just what I needed after a grueling week of preparing for finals - wholesome songs and 2,3 ok 4 drinks. Ok, maybe not wholesome. Food was just ok, but the bread pudding really hit the spot. I am so glad we went here. Music was great, server was servicing, patrons were all having a great time. What a fun holiday outing. 

Remember, there's a difference between a request and a $uggestion. Don't be stingy, they are worth it!
author: Maria S.

description:
Omgosh.  This place was AMAZING! I don't know why it's only 3.5 stars.  I didn't even plan on coming here.. me and some friends wanted to go to Infusion Lounge which was just around the corner, but we were early so we thought we'd get started and came to this pub.  It was so packed we had to stand in the corner! 

The atmosphere was so fun!! You have dueling pianos, basically two guys singing and playing the piano together in harmony but the songs they pick are songs that everyone knows, so the whole crowd is just singing along while drinking or eating.  I came on a sat night and there were 2 girls that had a birthday.  He put them on the middle of the dance floor and he made up songs about them which were just hilarious.  I wish I remembered them!! But I just remembered laughing a lot and having a good time, even while standing in the corner.  

Drinks were about $8-10 bucks.  I had an "Alicia Keys" drink but it wasn't that strong.. but it was good? haha 

Overall, I loved the atmosphere here, the pianists were great, and I think this is definitely a hot spot to take someone to experience the San Francisco nightlight :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
There's actually two separate entrances with two different venues.  The basement is where the piano bar is, and the upstairs is the main dining room with bar.

I've never eaten here; only for drinks and live music at night.  There's a bouncer at the door, and no cover charge.

The place is packed with locals and tourists alike.  Grab a table, and wait to be served or go up to the bar yourself.

Dark wood paneling and various rooms separated by walls.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Looks like an Irish Pub but ...  Cold ... Staff, food not so hot, freezing inside (so maybe that Irish feel)

Multiple TVs for sports but not showing the NFL game on Thursday which was the only live event.   

Fish and Chips should have been much better - soggy batter, cold and hard fries.  Just not good.  

2 stars for the look of a great Irish Pub but...That's all.
author: Drew O.

description: Really nice bar, great live band on a Thursday and lovely bar staff. What more could you ask for?!
author: Heather M.

description:
Last stop on my California beer crawl.

Stopped in here after Zeitgeist and a few other bars. 

The draw for me was the live classic rock band performing inside and no cover to enter.

The beer list is nowhere near as good as some other places in town, but I enjoyed the music for a little while. 

Also, if live bands aren't your thing, there is a dueling pianos bar downstairs.
author: Brian K.

description:
This review is only for the dueling pianos downstairs.  I've been here a handful of times and it's always fun.

They play everything from Sinatra to BEP to 2pac to NIN.  You can request songs (for $ of course).  They won't usually know the latest hits you hear on the radio.  I guess it takes them a couple of months to memorize the newest songs.  

Note: If they ever invite the craziest person in the bar to jump onto the pianos and that person is you, don't literally jump onto the pianos.  They don't like that.  They want you to just sit on top of the pianos.  

I've heard from others that it's only fun for the first three or four visits because they start playing the same songs over and over...

Great if you want to just have fun with live music and cheap drinks in a bar with great energy.  There's not much room to dance, but who goes to a bar like this to dance anyway?  Like I said earlier, don't try to dance on the pianos because they don't like it.  

Note:  You'll never get any reception down there, and you'll be lucky to find an open table on a weekend.
author: Richard T.

description: Pedro the doorman at John Foleys asked for my phone number while I tried to get in and because I politely declined, he told the other security entourage to not let me in.
author: Pam C.

description:
We decided to have dinner before going into the Basement for the Dueling Pianos. The restaurant was packed but the food was good. The Piano show was awesome. These guys are seriously talented. They found away to make everything work, even Rap. California Love will have all new meaning from this day forward. 

Thanks for a great time.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I don't even get the layout of this place. Let's start by pointing that out.

So is it supposed to be a room, then another room? What's the use of having so many walls? It's still noisy as hell. 

I've had the misfortune of coming here at different times for different reasons. It's one of those spots tourists visit, and they love, and then they always wanna come here not realizing it's another tourist trap. Totally belongs at Pier 39, but oh well. 

Go to the more smelly and cool bars in the TL if you want to experience the real SF. Or maybe I just like dive bars and fancy cocktails.

They're always busy as well...with nothing but tourists. I heard something about a drag show one day of the week...just got to the Castro or Esta Noche for a drag show. 

Nothing to be impressed about.
author: Alexia R.

description: Meh. I've experienced better. Came in on Friday night and it was very loud, we could barely talk to each other. FYI - very expensive for a pub.
author: Shaleem J.

description: We had our rehearsal dinner at Johnny Foley's in June 2015 and it was AMAZING. The private party (The Parlour) room is beautiful and ornate, but not TOO fancy. It also has its own dedicated bar and restrooms which was great for our party. The food was delicious. The staff were incredibly nice and accommodating. We had a group of about 30 with many little kids and it was nice to be able to be closed off from the rest of the restaurant.
author: J F.

description: Someone said they felt like drinking Irish Coffee. So we rode, or sorry, walked. Coz that's what you do at night in SF. I loved the different beers I drank, and a shot of Jameson followed by very well cooked bangers and mash.
author: Devavrat O.

description: Good place to relax and have a drink when you are in the Bay Area! The food was also good and not expensive!
author: Jessica R.

description: GREAT service.  Very good menu selections. We had about a dozen appetizers and many, many beers entertaining a client.  A great time, highly recommend.
author: P H.

description:
You know... a dueling piano bar may sound super gimmicky, but this place really knows how to do it right! I have a small place in my heart for this kind of stuff. I'm a huge fan of piano music/improv (having played piano since I was 2 years old... I know... so Asian...) and these guys actually do it pretty well. There's the upper floor which is just the bar/restaurant, if you want to do that, and there's the lower floor with the actual pianos and bar.

I've actually been to both. We held a birthday party in the upstairs part with food and everything, and I have to say the food is okay. It's not the best food I've ever had, but it seems like basic Irish fare. I had the chicken, which was a lot larger than I expected... and all the other stuff looked pretty decent. The bar part... is crazy nasty... super sticky... everywhere... the tables, the chairs, the floor... omg... don't touch anything because it's probably covered in alcohol... XD

I like the downstairs better, but be prepared to not have any sort of meaningful conversation... and to go when it's slightly earlier to get a table if you want one. It gets super crowded too, so if you're xenophobic... highly not recommended you try getting into this. The drinks are decent, and when you have some overzealous friends break lots of glasses, the staff are pretty quick about cleaning that stuff up... so people don't hurt themselves... so that's a plus.

Drinks are generally the average SF price, and I don't remember there every being a cover when I went (but I think there is after a certain time... so you'll have to check the other Yelp reviews for that). It's a great place to start off a night! The only place I can think of that comes close to beating it is the dueling piano bar in Seattle bar "Chopstix".
