author: Denise C.

description:
I have run the Nike Women's Marathon every year for the past four years. After our first run, I was invited to this pub by a group of fellow running friends. I fell in love with it! Fun yet relaxed atmosphere, amazing food, fantastic service. My favorite is the Cottage Pie with a pint of hard cider. The first time we went, the owner also sent us over a round of pear cosmos. I'm not much of a drinker, but add a pint, a cosmo, and 26.2 miles of running and I was under the table. Fortunately it was a short walk from our hotel. 

Great time and can't wait to go again this year!
author: Tory K.

description:
Possibly biggest bar ive been in. Its touristy. And there was a band. With that many drunken tourists its bound to be entertaining so people watching was pretty awesome. Allow me to illustrate. 

A tourist named Margaret, from Wichita KS, after several drunken attempts at hitting on the bassist and getting repeatedly ignored, ended up in something that cant really be described as a fight, though there was a fair amount flailing going on, right outside of the ladies rest room.  She proceeded to disappear in the said restroom for about 4 minutes and then emerged with apparently friends in tow, exclaiming that she should have puked earlier.  What can i say, classy joint. **

** the above story is totally fictional, and does not express the views of neither the author nor yelp, nor any affiliated entities, any similarities to actual events or people are purely coincidental.
author: Oleg H.

description:
4.5 stars
In town for the Allen Stone concert and decided to stop by for a drink. We walked in a found 2 seats at the bar and was quickly greeted by Devon. He made a very tasty yet strong Irish coffee and always made sure that we were doing okay. He was nice enough to refill my glass with more coffee to water it down a bit and keep it warm. He was also nice enough to charge my iPhone as the battery was on the verge of dying.
 Fun atmosphere, lots of locals and tourists. We watched the Raider game, followed by the Giants game.

Downside, I wish the TV's were a little lower, my neck started to hurt after about 45 min of watching the games. Ordered the chocolate brownie ice cream dessert. The brownie was cold and dry, too much whipped cream. Not my favorite.

Overall, small but great location and atmosphere --and our Bartender Devon was excellent! I'll definitely be back.
author: Tasha M.

description:
Little packed in here, always. Being from San Francisco, it's just fun to watch out-of-towners get wasted and sing songs. Guys on the piano are great cheesy entertainment, and I say that in the nicest of ways :) 

Cool place to get quick drinks, but don't stay too long or go here too many times if you live in the area. I've heard the same songs over and over :(
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Ok so we went in to grab bite to eat.  The hostess was obviously just working her shift not the warm friendly you would expect. The waitress was an older lady super friendly and really great.  
We ordered Cottage pies. Awesome. Just the right flavor. Drinks were stiff and good. 

Went down stairs to the piano bar which was a packed house of mostly twenty somethings. No place to sit lots of laughter and silliness. The three guys that rotated through the pianos were working the crowd well and were very entertaining. One jerk in the bar who was but hurt that the ladies did not get his vibe. So literally one in 200 in a very small space. not bad not bad at all. Good  fun go if you can.
author: Rob R.

description:
This review is for the live piano nights downstairs. Great carefree vibe of this place makes me so happy.  Best nights are Fri/Sat.  Its just unbeatable fun every time!!

Shows start at around 9. Grab a drink and forward requests for your favorite songs.  Sing-along loud with the crowd and dance to the numbers, its guaranteed fun time! This is just what i need from time to time for a change from regular clubbing and bar time.

This is the best place to celebrate friend's birthdays or anniversary and GET EVEN  with your friends!!!  Let the pianist know of the occassion and then be prepared to be called on the stage and get embarassed. The pianists sings funny raunchy numbers dedicated to the special person!!  This is quite hilarious to watch and definitely a night to remember. 

NOTE: 

1. Conveniently close to Union Square 
2. No cover charge. May have to wait in line on Fri/Sat but line is never too long, moves fast. 
3. Best is to reach a little late,around 10ish for the party to catch its fever and sing-along and dance until music stops at 1.30.  
4.  Never over-crowded to stamp on neighbor's feet which is a big relief.

5. Great place to celebrate special occasions.

6. Great fun vibe, especially in big groups!

One unique heck of a place in SF!!
author: Payal B.

description: Came here late night for a final drink.  Bar was crowded and busy but wait staff were very accommodating.  Active atmosphere and spendy drinks but worth a visit for sure.
author: Danny O.

description: This bar was awesome. We came here in the afternoon, went to some other bars and came back. Good beer great Service. Ask for Owen. Great guy made our visit fun. Great customer service. We will be coming back!
author: Georgina R.

description: We went here for a friend's birthday. We got there 10 min before it opened and waited in line and got in right away and reserved seats for our 30 other people coming. The place gets soooo packed!  Drinks are moderately priced, and the pianists are AMAZING, but the real winner was our server and the bar staff. There were so many people packed in this place and not once did I ever have to wait for a drink or wave down our server. She was quick with orders and never missed a beat. We had a blast!
author: Mandi L.

description:
Great pub!  The musician who played last night (Sunday Nov. 4th) was EXCELLENT!  We will definitely go again.  We asked for swing music and he played the top songs!  We would love to know when he plays again so we can come back =) 

Thanks!

Nate & Lindsay
author: Lindsay H.

description: Foley's dueling pianos make for an epic place to hang out at night. The guys on that night made it fun and easy to sing, dance and have a great time! My friend and I had a blast and definitely recommend it if you are looking for a fun night out in Union Square!
author: Brooke K.

description:
Was here last night with my partner.  Ordered a Cosmo.  Expected David,  the bartender, to ask what kind of Vodka but he didn't.  I wanted Ketel or Grey but he made it without asking.  It was well Vodka.  I didn't complain,  and tipped 20%, but it was not tasty.  I only had two sips and left. 

Tonight we went back.  After ordering, he came to the table and asked if I didn't like my Cosmo from last night.  I told him my thoughts and he said he noticed I didn't drink it.  He then said the next drink was on him and he bought our round of shots.  

Amazing that he remembered me/us and was so thoughtful to check in with us.  AMAZING!
author: Clinton C.

description:
It's 5 O'clock somewhere, right?!?! Well, it always is at Foley's! 

Great traditional Irish pub with standard Irish brews, some nice Irish dishes and standard pub fare. I love the dueling pianos concept and the irish architecture and woodwork throughout. 

Great place to catch a game near Union Square. 

What's with the "Health Tax"?!?! Is this just a SF thing? 

Overall, nice little SF Irish pub. It's a casual place to unwind and you will find good service, good pub food and a good time!
author: Gary R.

description:
Just recently visited this bar two nights in a row and it was amazing! Not to mention the awesome piano bar downstairs. 

The food is amazing I had the Chicken Curry as well as some Filet Mignon, asparagus and mashed potatoes. SO YUM!!!

Service was wonderful, we had a couple of bottles of wine that were delicious as well.

I would definately recommend going to this irish bar.
author: Sara G.

description: came here for a friends B-day..nice place to hnagout.  Pianist were good...Had the crowd totally involved.  Crowd was very upbeat and fun...would visit again...Be prepared to sing your heart away....
author: Nic C.

description: That's exactly what I needed! Walked about a 100 miles today and the Smithwicks hit the spot! Super friendly place.
author: Lorinda B.

description: Roasted Alaskan halibut filet, Irish cheddar potato skins with sour cream bacon scallions, chili crusted crispy calamari with tartare sauce, smoked salmon on boxty pancake with dill-shallot cream and chives.  Waiter, soup potato and bacon. Delicious
author: Debbie M.

description: Just ok experience as I'm not a big fan of Irish bar.... It was close to the hotel we stayed so quick stop at this bar
author: Live Love Laugh D.

description: I enjoyed my visit here and would frequent again.  I'm in love with the atmosphere but not necessarily in love with the food & drink prices.  The service was decent, nothing out of this world.  Their appetizers are tasty; I enjoyed the lamb sliders especially.  As noted in other reviews, this place does attract a good amount of tourists because of its location.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Yes, Johnny, I would love to grab a drink with you.

The first time I came here for drinks, it was a casual weekday some years ago and all I remember was the good convo and the couple in the corner sucking face and ready to make babies. 

This is usually the first stop or.. THE stop my good friend and I like to grab drinks and have deep, meaningful conversations at.  (or get smashed...)

The place is huge.  Don't worry about which bar area u sit at, someone WILL serve you.  It's $6~ for a pint, which isn't cheap but... I really like the casual, laid-back atmosphere of the bar.  Stella's for days.  

Cheers.
author: Kat C.

description: I went into this place only because I was with a group of friends that wanted to go. Turned out to be a really good bar. They had a live Irish musician that played plenty of great classics. Kind of made up for the drinks being so pricy. I would deff go back.
author: Joseph G.

description:
We ended up here to meet up with some local friends during our visit New Year's weekend, figured it would be a good place to get some drinks and appetizers before our very late dinner reservation. I really enjoyed my salad and I normally don't order salads but figured apples, Gorgonzola and spiced walnut sounded good. I loved the dressing on the salad creamy but light! We ordered Calamari which could have been crispier but still very hearty pieces of calamari which we prefer. We just got some beer which were good, nice selection since we love darker beers. Also bartenders were very nice and even came to our rescue when a drunk guy we did not know decided to start kissing us on the cheek. All in all good place to get together and meet people or hangout with friends and if you are staying in Union Square the location is great.

UPDATE: A few years later we always end up here every visit for that salad and a cold beer! They have a great bar with tasty drinks, the Irish coffee is our new favorite! Always our go to for meet ups with family and friends when we are in town visiting. Also a great recommendation for people who ask us where we like to go when visiting the city!
author: Cecilia M.

description: This place is so much fun! Good crowd, musicians are great - talented and hilarious. Fun dancing too.
author: Michelle L.

description: Great place to grab a pint or explore their wide selection of Irish, American and Scotch whiskies. Very laid back atmosphere and plenty of TV's. Had a couple appetizers which were good. Also, the bartenders were funny and kept things entertaining always cracking jokes. If you are staying in the city and need a fun place for a few drinks and bites to eat, then this is a good place to start. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the drinks and food were a little pricey for a pub but very on par for being in the city.
author: Matt A.

description: Food was very good.  The beer over priced at $8.50 a pint but service was good. Nice sports bar atmosphere.
author: Jim C.

description: Well, wait at 7 pm on a fri night was short.  Bread was cold, butter was hard.  Waitress was excellent.  Garlic fries were bland.  So was the soup of the day.  It was worse than popping a tin of soup.  Would not return or recommend this place for dinner.  However, if you just need drinks and a cool atmosphere, this is a cool spot.
author: Food L.

description:
I came here for a daytime 49ers Game (btw we crushed the Saints) and yelp steered me to Johnny Foleys. My bf and I both started off with Bloody Mary's then moved on to beers. Great big place with big, clean bathrooms, good beer selection and a grip of TVs. 
I didn't get any food but everything looked and smelled awesome!
author: Jenn K.

description: After visiting the UK, I wanted to find a good fish n chip place here. I love this place! Fish n chips are authentic Brit/Irish style! Great atmosphere
author: Lynn V.

description:
It's been a long while since my last visit here, but I was here w/ a small group of co-workers this past week for a farewell lunch for a colleague, who's moving down to L.A. for a new job...

The food was ok. I ordered their Madras chicken curry with cucumber raita, which serves with rice pilaf or fries, and grilled naan bread. The portion was huge! I couldn't finish everything...However, it was tasty, but the chicken was kinda dry...still yummy, due to the sauce! Everything on their menu looks really tempting and great! Service was quick...

I'd definitely come back to try their other delicious items!
author: Annette L.

description:
As a peruvian descendant,there are a couple of things that I cant resist to : Good weather,good beer and good food .Magically Foley's have them all. Its like a Nirvana in the middle of the city. The drunken gods heard my prayers!!

A must stop for me every time I go to San Francisco. They carry a beer called Kilkenny and I firmly believe that it was made by God himself. Combine that with outstanding food with room to customize it (awesome clam chowder btw) and great service. They even let you change the TV channels for any game in particular you are looking for!

The place seems to be packed all the time, but never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a spot , nor there was ever a long wait for the food.

The decoration makes it feel like you have been teleported to a bar right in Dublin.

On top of that..check for the paintings inside..They have Chuck Norris nemesis :Liam Neeson picture right there as well.

Now thanks to this review I must book another trip to the bay. !!!
author: Raul T.

description:
This is a definitely good place for large group gathering. From outside, it appears as a small pub on the corner, but surprisingly it is huge inside. The architecture and decorative details made it look a very authentic traditional Irish bar. There is a huge backroom for private party. Large varieties of drinks are offered here. Our group had a happy hour there. We had warm receptions from the owner and bartenders, had a great time there, and also a sizable damage on the credit card. :) 
.
author: Emmy P.

description: Dueling piano bar was amazing. Servers were very accomodating. Best thing: bread pudding!
author: Neil C.

description:
We went on Saturday night for dinner in the bar and the dueling pianos downstairs.  What a great experience!!  We were a little nervous about eating here.  Afraid the food would not be too good, because of the Union Square location.  We were wrong.  The food was excellent.  Not the cheapest, or the most expensive, but quality was high.  I had an Apple and Walnut Salad with Shrimp and my husband had the Fish and Chips.
We enjoyed the food imensely and the bartenders were absolutely professionals.   Just cool and attentive.  

We then headed downstairs for the pianos.  That was a blast.  The guys are so tallented and great personalities.  The only down side to the piano show was a little too much emphasis on money.  I have been to a similar show in Ft. Lauderdale many years ago and they didn't talk about money almost at all.  These guys encourageed you to pay more to hear your song.  Even saying to give me one more $ and I will play yours and not this one in my hand.  Just was a little cheap and greedy.  

Over all a good time and we will go back.
author: Jeanine K.

description:
Decent selection, good location.

I had the burger. It was good. For the price I paid for a burger + cheese and bacon w/ fries, though (18$ pretax), I expect something out of this world.

From what  understand, this place has turned into more of a tourist venue, and I guess that explains the somewhat outlandish prices. We have a yearly event at Parc 55, so this place came recommended.

I guess I'd go back, but like, 28$ for a cheeseburger and a beer is just too much to be anything short of the best burger I've ever had.

I liked the environment though...
author: Conrad B.

description:
So my hubby threw a surprise 50th for me here a few weeks back.  If I could give this place 10 stars, I most certainly would.  This place rocks!
Let me start off by saying that, for obvious reasons, I was not involved in the planning process.  My husband worked with the manager, Mary, and he had nothing but great things to say about her.  She worked with him every step of the way.  After all the festivities were over, she phoned us a few days later to get our feedback and to see if everything was to our liking.  It couldn't have gone better.  
But let me start at the beginning.  We arrived late in the afternoon a few Saturdays ago and were escorted to a private back room where friends and family were waiting to surprise me.  There were flowers and candles on all the tables and a glass of chilled champagne was handed to me!  My husband had made a custom CD of my fave tunes and they played it on their sound system.  Sweet!
It was a catered affair.  Chicken satay appetizers, baby potatoes, kale salad and chicken curry.  I wish I had bought my tupperware . . . the food was that good!  They made up a special kids menu for all the younguns.  And the Shirley temples were flowing!  The kids could also order their own dessert!  And speaking of the bar, fabulous!  The drinks were stiff and quality.  No two buck chuck.  My husband only drinks Guinness when he goes home to Ireland, but he said they really know how to pour a pint here.  The bar business back in Ireland is a serious business.  It's not something you do to work your way through college.  It is a real profession and, as such, they take it very seriously.  Johnny Foley's is the same.  They are top notch professionals, but with all the warmth and humor that only the Irish have.  They could not have been more welcoming with our large party which ranged in age from 3 to almost 80.  There were almost 50 of us and they took such good care of us.  
Mary was the manager that my husband worked with.  Kate was the day manager on duty when we arrived at 4:30 in the afternoon.  Ollie and Christy were part of the staff that worked the event and I'm sorry if I am forgetting anybody else by name.  But kudos to Johnny Foley's for being a great run business.  Great food, good drinks, warm and welcoming atmosphere.  It will now be our go to destination for big events or parties.  We can't recommend it highly enough!
author: Kendall H.

description: I've been here a few times while in town for work and really enjoy the atmosphere and quickness in service. My only complaint is that they don't have more TVs.
author: Matt D.

description: Our visit was spontaneous without reservations because of the rain. I had a lamb stew, my sister ordered Caesar salad and beef soup. This is my first time in USS when main course for $24 was too small and just obvious, nothing special. Sister was disappointed about size and taste of her food too. This restaurant deserves $$$ and not more two stars. Never come back in any case.
author: Boris G.

description: As far as pub food and drink goes, the menu has it spot on. There are two touches on the menu that i think are a sign of a good pub: soda bread and bread pudding. The fish and chips were very good, and the tartar sauce is some of the best i've had. The mushy peas were a nice touch. Someone at the bar got the stew, that looked great as well. The barman knew his whiskey and was a pleasure to talk to.
author: Nick S.

description: A great place for singing along and awesome piano covers of music. And the best thing everyone else is there for the same thing. Beer selection is passable (don't expect a craft beer panorama). They take suggestions but money talks so bring cash. Also don't pick lame songs. Pick awesome songs and they will play your music ahead of everyone else.
author: Will D.

description: Yummy food.  I had the chicken curry bowl with chutney and it was really good, although I added an extra thing of chutney... as I like more sweet than curry.  My husband had the pot pie and it was delicious.  The food is fresh and everything is always good.  Service is ok.  We were a big group so I am not sure I would rate this always... but probably would give it a 3 of 5 for service this time.  Probably better with smaller groups.  Good beer and wine list.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: The fish and chips are awesome. I had great service and my drink was never empty. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Rommel M.

description:
Big huge space with big huge partitions so you don't feel like you're in a big huge space. Muy excellente!

+ + +

Downstairs dueling pianos... AMAZING!
author: Annie T.

description:
This is a very lively pub! A bit too lively as it's packed with out of towners at any given time.
I'd never really come here unless it's a relative or friend who's visiting and needs a good beer which by the way this place pulls the best Guinness in the city! Come here for that, a good beer.
Clean restrooms, good snacks, great beer.
author: Bobby M.

description: I went there to celebrate my friend's birthday party on Sunday night . ..first we had a good time with the band, good entertainment, we ordered a bottle of wine and shots...the server came with a bad mood without smiling.. seem like she really mad with someone, I spent time there about hour and half...she never showed up after she gave us a drink, I went to the bar trying  to close my bill, the bartender ignored me, he making drinks in front of me but not even said hi..or asking anything. He acted like he didn't see me at all, I saw another server walked by, so I told her to give me a bill because we had to leave soon, but she ignored me again...they DON'T care, at the end while I waiting for our ride, the singer came to us and asked what happened, I told her all the story, she said that server been working there about 20 years but..is she happy with her job? Is she has a service mind?? ..good entertaining band,we gave them a good tip but service was really horrible, I won't go there anymore...
author: Damisa J.

description:
WE went here on a Saturday night and the place was packed!  Waited in line for about 5 mins, but line could get longer a bit later.  The piano players are amazing, how the heck do they know so many songs?  To get your song played, you gotta go up and put some $$ in the jar, but the twist is if someone doens't like your song they can tip the other player to interrupt w/ their own choice of tunes.  The battle can rage pretty hard if you get some tourists requesting country songs and yuppies throwing down their cash to get Journey going.  I saw at least one $100 bill in the mix, but on average you probably need at least $20 to make a credible bid.

The bar gets packed and it's hard to move around, but it's a good place for groups to drop in for a couple of drinks.
author: Chi N.

description:
GREAT FOOD.  We went to grab a bite to eat while waiting for some friends to finish up a meeting nearby.  I had the corned beef and cabbage, and it was everything I remembered from growing up in an Irish household.  Corned beef was tender and juicy, they brought mustard, cabbage was buttery and flavorful, etc.  Homemade mashed potatoes.  It was really a treat.  

My buddy got the irish pie with mashed potato topping, and he said it was amazing.  

It's a little spendy, but it's good food.  I want to go back asap.
author: Jace P.

description: Excellent food, but our waitress was not the greatest. Didn't refill our drinks promptly and sort of avoided our table, in my opinion. I'm giving a 4th star though because the manager seemed to notice that I wasn't eating my entree (it was delicious, but I just didn't have an appetite! I was full from the calamari appetizer). She came right over and made sure we were okay. My husband had the NY and so did the other couple we were with, everyone liked the food. It's also a fun atmosphere to be at. The piano bar was a ten dollar cover charge and there's parking just across the street for 15 bucks. :)
author: Aimee C.

description: I like pretty much everything about this place except the noise level.  The acoustics in here make it so unbearable, that one time a group from work had to leave because we couldn't hear each other.  Other than that, they have a pretty decent beer selection, a full bar, the place is cut up into sections for some privacy and the food is above average pub fare.  Prices are average for the area.
author: Daniel W.

description:
This is our favorite Irish bar in the City.  They make you feel at home. It has a lot of TV's, music and just that friendly feeling.

Today we ate dinner here with the granddaughter. We had fish and chips, cottage pie and cheese Panini. For dessert some bread pudding.

Cottage pie was good.  Not the best but still very good. A few more spices but hey it's Irish food and sometimes boring.  But still ranks right up there with the stuff we had in Ireland and other places.

The fish and chips was great. Very light and flavorful. A good amount of fish.  It tasted fresh and was not over cooked or oily.

I even tried the cheese Panini. It was good and my 6 year old GD loved it. 

My wife said the bread pudding was excellent.
author: Ralph T.

description:
I went to Johnny's for Dinner in January , I went up north and the restaurant was walking distance from the Hotel.
The food was ok , we ordered the steaks.  My steak was cooked pretty well but the mashed potatoes were better than the steak, that is saying a lot! My cousins steak was too chewy and more on the raw side. So overall the food not worth the price at all. The drinks and the dessert were amazing however! 
We were at the restaurant portion but as the night progressed we could hear the bar next door with the dueling pianos. Sounded like a good time , wished we could have just gone to the bar instead. Will not try again when I am in SF.
author: Cindy N.

description: Definitely wouldn't come here again! Service was ok food was horrible and everything is way overpriced.
author: Destiny M.

description:
I liked my bloody mary.  It was flavorful.  The place is huge and there's a ton of seating for dining.  

The hostess on the day of the Giants parade 2012 was pretty rude.  I didn't feel too welcome after her unfriendly greeting.  I understand that it's packed and you don't want to seat anyone who isn't eating and just having drinks, but you don't have to have an attitude.  Plus she told the woman in front of us "Everyone looks the same to me so just keep coming back to check on your table."
author: Elise G.

description: This place is hilarious. Came here for a friend's birthday, and we all had a blast. I didn't even know this kind of dueling pianos group karaoke thing existed! Great service, fun crowd, awesome atmosphere. Get here early to avoid waiting in line (and standing!)
author: Eliza D.

description:
If you are feeling down and wanna cheer up, check this place out. Great live music, funny show, amazing vibe especially with the entire crowd singing, good friendly bar tenders and bouncers, and good food. One of my goto places in the city.

Tips: come a little before 9 if you don't want to stand In a line (no covers though)
author: Pinjalim B.

description:
Had the prime rib dinner here recently.  Meh...dry and over-cooked, but decent portion with mediocre accompaniments.  Maybe I came on a bad night, but I was sorely disappointed.  Service at the bar was okay.  One guy was great, the other two were in outer space.

Sorry, but I've relegated this place and the bar upstairs as a drinking destination.  As for the dueling piano bar downstairs, ugh...please...never again!
author: Roy N.

description:
I checked out Johnny Foley's during Drupalcon last month.  Johnny Foley's is a decent Irish Pub.  The beer selection seemed to be decent, but you better like Irish beers because I didn't see a lot on tap other then that.  Beer prices were not amazing, but it's San Francisco - everything costs 2x as much as it does in Texas, so who am I to talk, ha.

There seemed to be plenty of seating and I liked the way it was setup so that the tables seemed to have a bit of privacy.  

The painting of Bono could seemingly see into my soul.  Frightening.  

Not a bad option!
author: Erik W.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan! :)

Chill bar to relax in with friends and the fish and chips was really good too.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Bf wanted his beer fix, so we stopped by this good ol' Irish pub. Inside is very pub like, but very calming. 

Loved the interior and setting, and it had a good quietness to it. 

I saw that their bloody Mary's were popular throughout the pub as at least one person per group was drinking one. 

I actually stuck with boring water this time. 

It made me strangely happy that their hostess was actually an Irish lady with her accent. *Thumbs up*
author: Ayumi S.

description:
A really weird experience with dueling pianos -- kind of a group karaoke event with piano men. Definitely not what I expected.

Eat before you go! No dinner menu in the piano lounge area. They only have 6-7 bar bites to choose from. Drinks are a bit pricey, but expected for this touristy area. 

Overall, okay to visit once, but I wouldn't necessarily go back, unless you enjoy singing cheesy songs with a bunch of strangers.
author: Mansi A.

description: I always make an effort to visit this place when in town.  Sometimes they have a live band playing so it can be a little loud and crowded but it is very enjoyable. Good place to grab a drink and some food while enjoying the atmosphere. Also a good place to watch a Giant or 49er game with others. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
author: Wayne C.

description: Old place in the City. First time their. Great place to watch the game, enjoy some Guinness and a burger! Touristy but you'll catch some locals in there. It's on the lunch menu for the work week.
author: Jeff S.

description: ************************************************************************************************************: Today a situation was completely handled by a phone call from the owners of Johhny Foleys, who were horrified and disgusted by the behavior of their security door person. I was assured that this situation would be dealt with expeditiously. The Foley family do not tolerate disrespect in any form, and Mary was extremely professional, apologetic, and sympathetic to what happened to me. I can tell you this the Integrity of this establishment was truly shown today. They take their business seriously, their customers, are of most importance, to them. This is truly a family oriented establishment and the owners took this very personally. Its a very rare find when The Owner of a business takes the time to call you to rectify a problem. I look forward to going back, with my family and having dinner, and a very good time. Thank you Mary for you kind words, your dedication to resolving this, and truly Foleys dedication to making their customers have a wonderful experience.  Foley's is at a 5 star status with me. See you soon.  Sandra
author: Sandra F.

description: Great to find a gluten free menu at Johnny Foley's.  My daughter enjoyed  the Thai Curry Chicken.  I ordered the potato skins with a caesar salad.  The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and the gluten free choices.  I will dine here again next time I am in San Francisco!
author: Rhonda N.

description: Cool Irish pub with all the favorites on tap along with boddingtons
author: Stephen T.

description:
The food here was surprisingly delicious. The cottage pie was great, and a big portion. I saved half of it for lunch the next day and it heated up well too.

Kind of a weird setup with tables and half-walls everywhere, but the food and drinks were great.
author: Lauren P.

description: I love this bar--I've come regularly for the last 4 years and brought multiple parties of friends here. Even had the occasion to meet the owners one of those times. Really disappointed tonight, however. Came for the dueling pianos show, and when several friends got here we went up to stand with them in line (even though we'd already gotten in). Per policy, they let people into the bar in our place. But when we got in line with our friends they rudely informed us that we'd have to go to the back of the line--regardless of the fact that we were already stamped. Telling us would've been one thing, but yelling was a complete other. Really disappointed that they've lost the personal touch they had for all these years.
author: Jess O.

description: Amazing services!!! Bartenders have great personalities.  Had the bloody mary oyster shooters and Oysters on the half shell....YUMMIE!!!
author: Michelle R.

description:
This place is pretty awesome. They have dueling pianos! (but should get better singers, sorry) It's a great place to be drunk and have a drunken singalong with all your drunken neighbors. 
Many different kinds of people were there:: old folk, young folk, and it was a good blend of people. 
The beer on tap was the typical and I expected at least one IPA to be on tap but the prices were reasonable.
The beer wrench seemed to have an 'tude with everyone. I mean come on::: we didn't ask you to work here.
I would try it out again and bring a large group along
author: Lauren Z.

description: Had the Cottage Pie and it was delicious. The staff was friendly. The blonde curly-haired young lady who seated us was smiling, engaging, friendly, and helpful. Our server--who later shared that she was from Dublin--was quietly efficient and attentive to our needs. I recommend this place for anyone who is looking for some Irish soul food.
author: Brent T.

description: Best fish and chips I have EVER had!  Amazing service and atmosphere.  We came here twice during our stay in SF and it was fantastic!  The Manager runs a good ship!  I know a cohesive team when I see one.  They all work very hard to please the customer and ensure a positive experience!  They are all on the same page and work efficiently to serve you.  I would HIGHLY recommend this place!  Thank you for the excellent service and delicious food!
author: Angie V.

description:
Johnny Foley's is a great Irish themed bar for drinks and late night live music.  

I would give the food 3 out of 5.  The ambiance is great and it's a great place to catch a game or meetup with people.  This place does get crowded and is pretty loud.  But they know how to pour a Guiness and reminds you of an irish bar in the Temple Bar area in Dublin.
author: Sunny C.

description: I had come here after work for an Alumni Happy Hour. The sections were well spaced out with ample standing room. They had a bunch of big screens showing the NFL game as well. They had an adequate drink selection and the prices were also quite competitive. Wouldn't mind returning.
author: Tejas P.

description:
3 1/2 stars.

Star 1: because I want to go back
Star 2: fish and chips were yum
Star 3: atmosphere

Now, I can't tell you what an Irish House or pub is supposed to look like, but I assume it looks like this place.  It just seemed like the type of spot you can enjoy some good food, drink some good beer, chill and listen to some music.  They had a live band when I was there.  Service was fast, always a good thing!

I ordered the fish and chips and of course Guinness.  I love my Guinness, the problem for me is, when I order it at a bar/pub it's usually super cold, which is not how I like my Guinness.  I like it slightly cooler than room temp, and that's how it was served.  The fish and chips were good, not great, but good enough, and mushy peas, I didn't think I'd like it, since I've never had it before, and they tasted just like mushy peas, and I like peas, so it was good.

Would definitely love to come back and check out the dueling piano.
author: Manjit Z.

description:
Couldn't get in for New Year's Eve, so we went here New Year's Day.

Imagine my surprise to see an Irish pub staffed by REAL Irish people, and the people who work here are all pretty cool people.

and the food is great to boot. had the Shepard's (Cottage) Pie which was done just right, and three pints (Murphy's, Guinness, Harp--had to go for the Irish beers in an Irish pub). Crowd seemed lively, and the atmosphere, warm.

I'll definitely turn this into my regular hang out for a beer after school or work.
author: Stevie D.

description:
This place is great and has some excellent food and drink choices. Lots of choices on tap! 

The food is delicious and servered hot and fresh. I went for an afternoon lunch and was treated well. One person of our party was having a birthday, the staff bought a round of drinks for the whole party as well as a birthday dessert on the house. Great value for the dollar spent.
author: Will M.

description:
My first time @ Foley's, and I will be back. 
Great atmosphere, excellent selection of beer.
Not cheap: I  find  $7 a tad on the hefty side for a tap beer. 

Went there with some friends; we had a wonderful attentive waiter who served us fast and with a smile.  He didn't even ask if we want split checks but sensed we wanted to pay separately.  What an outstanding service.  

The food was -despite it being "pub food," very good. There was a variety of dishes, such as spinach salad, rosemary chicken in an Irish whiskey gravy, potato skins, fish&chips and lamb sliders. 

From 10pm on a band was performing. 
Cover charge  $10
author: Ellen G.

description: Nice American menu. Nice drink list. Fun place to hang out near Union Square!
author: Denise C.

description: Great crowd, cheap drinks, fast service. If you are around the area, probably one of the good places to stop by and grab a drink.
author: Claudine V.

description: This place blows.  It was 900pm and I was the only person in line for 30 minutes?  WTF?  Fat people can't go downstairs?  When I finally got down there an entire corner was empty.  Awesome.
author: Fatty A.

description: I was not impressed. The Calamari was tough and chewy. The chicken wings were tiny and not very flavorful. The mussels were pretty plain. The lamb sliders were good. The atmosphere was pretty commercialized Irish. I suppose it is a good place to go drink beer with the white guys, because that appears to be what was going on.
author: David H.

description: I was there a couple of days ago and had a few drinks with one of my great friends. Today I check my account and was charge $50.00 extra dallors on top of what I paid for my drink and food. I am so fed up of places taking advantage of there costumes. I will never go to this bar again and let all my friends know about it. I did not sign my bill with additional charges on my card. This is against the law!
author: Cece H.

description: After walking around and shopping at H&M my friend Tracy and I decided to go to a place that served beer and so we stumbled upon this pub. I ordered a Guinness and  their Fish n chips. My friend ordered the spinach salad with dried cherries. My Guinness went very well with my fish n chips. The fish was very flaky and the outside was very light and crispy. The batter coated the fish just enough so that while the batter is frying the fish is steaming underneath the batter. That is the secret to deep frying fantastic fish. The spinach salad was great too very light and for some reason it went very well with the dry cherries. I liked it! And I normally do not like dried fruits in my salad. So come, eat, drink and be happy!
author: Charlie C.

description: Good food well prepared. Service good and attentive. Good variety of drinks and beers. Really like the atmosphere of the "snugs".
author: Robbie T.

description:
We visited this bar a few times as we were staying right down the street at Hotel Nikko. I thoroughly enjoyed this bar. The bartenders were friendly and fast and the music was decent. What's not to love about an Irish Bar? I didn't drink pints but I did order a hot tea and the bartender brought me a box of about 6 different types of tea to choose from (nice touch)!

Also looking around the food (traditional Irish fair) looked delicious. When it came time for last call the lights went on and the bouncers came in a hollerin "Last Call, Finish Up and Get Out". No one was really in a hurry to move and the bouncers weren't pushy. We had a great time and I would probably be a regular if I lived/worked in the Financial District.
author: Sunny B.

description: Was expecting better guiness and service. The guiness tasted old, and the service was not very good. That being said it was close and cheap which was a good fit.
author: Jonah K.

description:
This place is great for groups - there's tons of space around the bar and plenty of space throughout the restaurant.  I've heard good things about the dueling piano gig downstairs, but have never gone and I'm not sure what the space is like for it. 

Reasons why they are amazing - they have Murphys on tap. I know of few places in the Bay that carry Murphys. 

In terms of vibe, definitely crowded for middle of the week. It seemed like there were both post-work folks grabbing a drink mixed in with a good number of tourists (I imagine Foley's proximity to Union Square helps).

Finally, their fish chips were heavy but still good? Went well with my Harp. I'll probably make my way back here - not so much because anything stood out - more so for the Murphys, the convenience of the location, and probably to check out their Dueling Piano Bar.
author: Kimya P.

description: Bar with great energy and not to expensive beer. Pretty good cover band. Very nice security guards helped us when we were approached by a stranger.
author: Andreanna H.

description:
Overpriced tourist spot. The Irish pub has become a pretty ubiquitous establishment in every major city, and it inevitably draws in an English speaking (or, alternately, an Anglophile) crowd. Clever restaurateurs have seized on this, and now exploit the Emerald Isle for all it is worth in terms of tourist dollars.

The food is decent, but overpriced. I do like that they have oysters, and better yet-- oyster shooters!

The drinks are drinks, and priced in conjunction with the neighborhood. Beer is your best bet, price wise.

Staff was friendly to us, and fairly on top of things considering the crowd. Two points for that alone.
author: Wes T.

description:
A few of my buddies have been here before. It brought back good memories of the piano bar that I checked out in San Diego a few years ago. These guys were just as hilarious with the corruption of familiar tunes and having the audience sing along and dance either in their seats, on the small makeshift dance floor, heck even next to the pianos. The drink prices were pretty good too. Felt it was only natural to have myself a Guinness since it is an Irish Pub. 

Props to the guys who played my requests, which were pretty much 80s songs. I can definitely see myself back here, especially since cover is free.
author: Rhia R.

description: Bangers and Mash was amazing! And the bacon wrapped shrimp was awesome! Love the atmosphere!
author: Mark I.

description:
J. Foley's. An irish pub set in the middle of a touristy street. 
A group of us, five girls, went in at 12:30 on Saturday night. Tons of guys in business suits. A few other crazy drunks. Turns out there was an Irish school reunion, hence the suits and mass amounts of Guinness. 
There is a back area where we heard a band playing, although many of us thought it was karaoke...Sorry lead singer, you weren't all that great! The drinks were decent, bartenders friendly, lots of pub tables to throw your belongings on. I didn't buy any of our drinks, so I don't know how they compare to other places. Lucky for us the Irish in suits were excited to see a bunch of nice looking girls stroll through.
Tons of shenanigans going on and it was quite the scene. What else do you expect late night in the city?!
I'd come here again for a drink.
author: Lisa S.

description: Food is always great, but the service is not the fastest.
author: Poppy C.

description:
This is for the piano bar, downstairs:

This place is really fun, and the pianists are very entertaining, comical, and really get the crowd going!

Only con's:
1. This place is sort of small, so it's hard to find a seat, or even find standing room, sometimes! We were frequently in the way of the waitress, or just within the flow of walking traffic, because we had no where else to go!
2. A slightly older crowd seems to come here - 30's-40's? Or, at least it seemed like it, since more 70's &80's songs were playing..
3. Your experience definitely depends on the pianist - my friends and I wanted to get some 90's into the mix, but an older pianist claimed he didn't know the tune of /how to play the Backstreet Boys...  It wasn't until our song request was passed onto a younger pianist that we finally got our song! 

I do appreciate the fact that some of the younger pianists were playing more contemporary songs, like Adele.. and even Edward Maya's StereoLove?! What's great is that they had the pianos, but also some electronic bass that they could set up for back-up!

*Tip - Parking in SF always gets groans from people.. but!  We parked at the Ellis-O'Farrell Garage, which was very close (only 1.5 blocks away, not even?), $2.50 an hour in the evenings, and open until 2am. This was super convenient!
author: Julie L.

description: This review is based 100% on the rude hostess -I came in to be seated on a Friday before the rush and she seemed incredibly irritated and she was rude .she is blonde and on the slim side 26-32 in age in case management reads this.
author: Kelly A.

description: Tried to get in to the dualing pianos got there way early and still waited outside, in the rain. The 15 minutes we were told by security was bull. One out one in policy sucked. What a waste of our time. If you are in the city to have a good time this is not the place you want to hit up... Love their lnts and real Irish feel but that doesn't make up for anything when the security are assholes. Obiviously we want to be inside and warm, don't treat your customer like they are a hassle and in the way... Done with this place.
author: Cate G.

description: We didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food, but the ambiance is awesome, and the bartenders are amazing!
author: Mindy N.

description: The music was great, the food is unknown since I arrived just as the kitchen was shutting down at 10p (really?,) and the service was non-existent trying to get a drink. Three stars for the music.
author: JT S.

description:
Been there over 10 times in the past months that place grew on me and it became the place I'd bring my friends out of town.
Yesterday evening I tried to have my girlfriend's music played, a frustrated attempt in the previous times; not sure it was because my girlfriend is a model but I got a rude and disrespectful comment from one of the piano players. I would ignore it if it came from one of the audience, but through loudspeakers to the full crowded bar was an awful experience. I was called 'sugardaddy'! I will never return nor my friends. Shame on them
Luis and Aglaya
author: Luis C.

description: Bacon wrapped prawns were amazing, chicken wings tasty, but the potato skins were not worth the money.  I would recommend this place because of the atmosphere, the old town feel, and the food and drink choices.  My friend tried the cottage pie and said it was ok but didn't leave anything on Hs plate.  I guess that means he liked it.  I would come back here if I ever was in this area again.
author: Craig M.

description: Went here after the SF Giants World Series parade to escape the gloomy, wet weather. We were hungry but generally don't enjoy Irish pub food very much. What a pleasant surprise! We started with mussels that came in a creamy, bacon-y sauce. Very tasty but a little skimpy on the sauce.  Then my husband had the cottage pie and it was warm and tasty after adding a little salt. The best dish of the night was the Thai style yellow chicken curry. Oh man it was good! The flavor was excellent and the chicken was perfectly cooked. Not dry at all- tender and covered in the thick curry sauce. Fantastic!
author: Kristi F.

description: Looking to finish the night? Grab a pint and enjoy the duelling pianos.  There is ample seating and some older folks enjoying roving tunes from the 1970-80's. Quick service and decent pricing. Just a no frills place for a cold one.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
If I was reviewing this place just for the cute bartenders with accents then it is 5 stars in my book!

Now for everything else - good service, large selection of drinks and the food was good. It is a great place to grab lunch if you are downtown. It can be a bit of a touristy spot but we found some great conversations here.

The bartender even gave us great restaurant recommendations for a dinner spot.
author: Emily W.

description: Went here for happy hour with a large group and while I didn't eat many of us did as well as ordering drinks. The staff seemed mad that we were there and didn't want to give us tables. The food people ordered seemed well received but the house energy drink I got was a total bust. One energy drink (no alcohol) was $9!  No one at the table even had a beer that was that expensive. Overall my group was awesome and we had a good time but the service and drinks were a total fail.
author: Kelly B.

description: It feels a lot like Ireland when you settle in with your Guinness and their good food. Great place!
author: Tom D.

description: I came here for the dueling piano show and it was so awesome!! I am so coming back to watch another one! I liked everything about this place: the decor, the service, and the ambiance.
author: Wanda M.

description: Went there for dueling pianos event on Friday night. It was amazing. There was some good talent there. The line was crazy but worth it.
author: Pamela I.

description:
Awwww, man. I am a sucker for Irish pub fare, and after drooling my way through Hugh Jackman's one-man show, I was ready to dig my teeth into something meaty (AMIRIGHT?!). 

The gang and I popped in here just as the clock struck 5, and got a table for 6 right away. The place is HUGE, and has an awesome homey pub feel, complete with large flat-screens that already had the channel set for the Sharks game. WIN. 

This is clearly a place I want to be. And the Smitchwicks on tap: unbearably delicious.

The Buttermilk-battered Onion strings were big enough to split between all of us. I got the Bangers & Mash and the mash was just...it was obscenely good. Words cannot describe the tango of happiness that was taking place across my tongue. 

I wish it wasn't such a schlep from my cave in the Outer Sunset, or I would be here ALL THE TIME.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Recently a certain celebrity....one who I have been in love with since the 21 Jump Street days (and NO not Richard frickin Grieco!) was hanging out here; which makes this THE ULTIMATE FOLEY'S CELEBRITY SIGHTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But did I actually see said celeb??? Was I with my friends at the exact MOMENT he said HELLO to them? No and nope.... 

Why have I chosen to write about this? Because I am STILL crushed to have missed the love of my life by mere seconds! I was walking in the front door, as he was exciting out the back...literally. While my friends were glowing with starstruck awe, I was left dumbfounded and pissed. Like an angry child, I stormed off and went home to pout in peace. I couldn't handle hearing about how HOT he looked in person. Sourpuss? Indeed and rightfully so!!! :)

So there you have it, party people.....simply, Foley's!
author: Gina G.

description: Stopped in for a few beers and to watch the Warriors beat the Clippers - priceless! Looked great from the outside but what's up with the wall placements? It's a maze inside and some customers sat looking at a wall 6" from their nose! The bar itself is divided in half by a wall too! One of the qualities of a good bar is feeling like you're part of the crowd and being in the moment, the walls prevented that. The beer selection was okay, prices as expected but the walls made it less fun. I wanted to try the piano bar downstairs but my friend had enough. Based on the reviews I'll come back and check that out.
author: M L.

description:
Just had drinks here, but the atmosphere was right, and the food smelled good.

Good beer selection, but the bottles were only sort of cold.

Attentive service.  

I will be back to try some of their Irish fare
author: R H.

description:
I've been to this location a handful of times and every time I find the service just about A-O.K.  Nothing too extravagant but I do like the ambiance, it kind of reminds me of taverns in pirate movies, minus the pirates and people sloshed and causing a ruckus.  

I read a couple reviews on this place and I found them a little interesting, a couple of friends and I sat at one of the tables and just ordered drinks and we weren't pressured into buying food. 

If you want to get boozed, I mean, this is only a hop skip and jump away from getting beer on tap in down town.  I like it, no complaints here.
author: Edrian D.

description: The cottage pie was very nice. My wife had the lamb stew, which was tasty and succulent. The drinks were typical Irish pub fare, which is exactly what you're there for. Tables were well spaced, and the place was down-right roomy, albeit a bit of a labyrinth. Overall, we had a nice time. One small caveat - the place is noisy. Again, standard fare for an Irish style pub. Just be aware - it can get loud.
author: David R.

description: Not bad. Food's always been good. It's an odd mix of sports bar and restaurant. I guess that would be good if I was into sports. Servers are attentive. We usually end up here when we're in town because our friends like it. We would not go otherwise.
author: Scott N.

description: Service was fine but the food was below average and way over priced. I ordered the fish and chips and it definitely was not worth $17. I've had a lot better paying only $3. Highly disappointed. Its clean, service was fine but food is definitely not worth what they charge.
author: Anthony E.

description: If I could rate just the dueling pianos I would give it 5 stars. Service was bad. Girl was nice but appeared way too busy. Forgot our appetizer and after our meal we said we wanted the appetizer and she had no recollection of us ordering it. Forgot my order too and had to come back and ask what I ordered then tried to charge me for something we didn't order. TWICE. Food was ok but since you can't take anything out of your meal as I assume it's all premade isn't very nice. Go watch the pianos go eat somewhere else.
author: Dan E.

description: Dueling pianos is best on a friday/saturday night--if you want to have a great time, go here, there's normally an admission of $10 but trust me it's worth it. I would also recommend showing up at 8pm if you want any chance of sitting down! The doors however, open at 9 but again, I wanna stress, it's worth it!
author: Mari B.

description: We were in the mood for a pint on a Saturday around noon so we stopped in here. It's a charming enough place, the bathrooms are clean, and the servers were reasonably pleasant. But ugh!  The pints were $7.50 each.
author: J R.

description: I like this place :) good beers, good food, good company they always have all the good games on tv and theirs always a lot of people everytime we come. The crab cakes and burgers are a must try! Close to shopping in union square and lots of hotels. I like this place :)
author: Marina R.

description:
I'm a big fan of Irish bars, but Foley's is just lackluster. Considering how close it is to Union Square, I expected everything to be a bit more expensive, but they're a bit over the top with their prices.

The overall layout of the restaurant is a nightmare, so if your not lucky enough to get a spot at the bar, you'll have to sit down and eat something (since they don't let you drink at tables without ordering food).

Finally, the service was terrible. The woman serving us acted like I just ran over her dog. Show some of that Irish charm, drink a Murphy's and loosen up.
author: Tyler H.

description:
On the day we were to fly out of SFO we had a few hours to burn and while walking towards Union Square we spotted a clock that informed us that it was time for a pint.  We headed towards the front door and finding it locked, we realized that it wasn't quite time for a pint.  We decided to take a quick ride to Chinatown, and being a rainy day, it wasn't the best day for window shopping... So we headed back to Foley's.

I had a couple pints of Guinness and some french fries and some chicken squewers.  It's a nice Irish bar, a bit to large for my taste of Irish Pubs, but I really wasn't seeking out "the best Irish Pub in SF".  Rather just a place to get out of the rain and drink.  JF's was more that adequate in this role.

Pints were poured correctly, staff had accents and were friendly.  If you are looking for an Irish Pub, you'll find someplace better than this, I'm sure.  If you are in Union Square and need to get out of the rain, you can head here instead of shopping for stuff you can't afford.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Last night was the birthday of two of my good friends, and we celebrated by going with a bunch of friends to a famous dueling piano bar in San Francisco: Johnny Foley's. It took us over an hour to get in as the line was insane, but it was completely worth the wait in my opinion.

I'd never been to a dueling piano bar before let alone heard about one, so I had no idea what to expect. For those of you like me who hadn't heard of such a thing before, I'll try my best to explain it but I definitely suggest experiencing one for yourself! There are two piano's sitting in the center of the room pushed together and facing each other. There are tables surrounding it as if you are at a show rather than a bar. The piano players were extremely engaging with the audience the whole time. People are always going up on the stage to write down song requests along with a tip on top of the piano. A bunch of people were celebrating birthdays that night, and they were constantly being called up on stage being embarrassed by the lively entertainment. It's a great place to go with groups (if you get there early enough) and the crowd varied in age, yet everyone seemed to be having a wonderful time.

It was a great time and if you are traveling to the city anytime soon, I highly recommend it! It is located right across from Union Square in the heart of the city.
author: Megan F.

description:
Oh good ole Foley's.

First night in Union Square my friends and I had a free night, you know what that meannnnnns.;)
My friend had just turned 21 and decided we'd hit up a nice bar near our hotel.

We bumped into Foley's and had no doubt we were going to walk out of there pretty....drunk. It was hectic inside due to a lot of business men being inside but once our Bartenders Paul and Gavin gave us some attention it was ON!

They were so nice and so energetic , we went behind the bar and drank a few drinks with them. Im not the kind of person to get drunk due to me being a very very very lightweight, but i was a goner. They were friendly, joked around and even took pictures with us. Not to mention I had my very first Lemon Drop Shot that was delicious!

Thanks Foleys for a great drunken time!
author: Jessica A.

description:
Jonny Foley's is a great place to be when they've got the full piano deal going on.  The guys get up there and basically try to make as much money as possible by pitting groups of people (and songs) against each other.  This normally ensues into a great time for all.  They are both great piano players and true entertainers.  I have a feeling they make a good chunk of change doing this too.

Drinks and the bar here are great.  Service is pretty standard for a busy SF bar.  If you have people from out of town and want to give them a real SF experience definitely give this place a look.
author: Brian G.

description:
Came here for lunch since it was the closest spot next to my hotel. 

Ordered the Fish and Chips because how could I not!? Beer batter was super, homemade tartar sauce great, chips were chippy. I wasn't a fan of the "mushy peas" though.

And price was a little steep in my opinion.
author: Alice L.

description: One of the best Irish pubs you can go to with in union square area, and locals concur. Don't know much about the food, but plenty of seating at the bar and great beer :)
author: Emily M.

description:
This, sadly, being my first piano bar experience in 27-odd years, I thought it was a pretty good introduction. The musicians are talented, even if some are more charismatic than others. It was loud; it was crowded; it seemed as it should.

Drinks were decently priced for the area (most expensive drink was a Gin & Tonic= $7.25). I would come back.
author: Jason L.

description: This is a cool, non-she-she place in the middle of union square. Its a huge pub with a great drink selection. Their food is also pretty good, I had a lamb-burger which I did enjoy.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I was in one of those moods again.

The kind of mood prompting where most physical restraints are no longer acknowledged and determination seems to be of no avail.  That, of being the craving for red meat.  And the red meat gods made their presence in the form of a warm soft-lit wood accented establishment on an easy discernible corner.

I've been here several times, both for food and beer, with good friends and prior to some heavy bar-hopping back in the day (think when Green St. was the place to be on St. Paddy's day) and rubbing shoulders with locals and tourists was a normal way of communication.

Tonight was different.  My sweetie had tix to see a play at the SF Playhouse and we were hard pressed for time, so my bf made this a point to our hostess.

She smiled and seated us in a section where the waiter was known to be quick.  And she duly justified that and more, since my boyfriend let her know, that since it was 7:15, that we had approximately 45 minutes to eat and be on our way to the play.  She acknowledged with a nod and took off.

Wow.  Not only was service prompt, quick.....but the food was terrific!  I ordered their pub burger, which is not on their menu, but a huge patty around 1/2 pound came out nestled between big leaves of lettuce, slices of red tomatoes, and a thick slice of their fresh sweet red onion.  In addition, the burger was sleeping with a large side of steak fries, hot and slightly salted, just the way I like them.

BF ordered their Bangers and Mash plate, which ordinarily, would have made me suspicious since British food is known to be bland.  Quite the opposite, dear chaps.  The sausage was juicy, fat, and quite savory.  The mash potatoes nice and smooth.....in fact, the plate was clean.

Our waitress also ran the credit card right through and we were early to our destination.

Top stars for a great food experience and kudos to the waitress who had us in, out, and satisfied within 45 minutes of excellent food and service!
author: Miika M.

description: Too loud, too expensive. There are better pubs. At $7.25 for a pint you have to step up the rest of your game, first.
author: Rob R.

description: I probably would have had a better experience here with a couple buddies who's main objective was to get drunk and have some fun. Instead I came in for lunch with the family and thought the food was very mediocre. My chicken panini was majorly skimped on meat and I had to stuff myself with my remaining bland french fries. Food and service wise I'm being nice giving Foley's 3 stars. But with the old school Irish interior and the plethora of TV's, it did get some kudos for sure.
author: Patrick O.

description: Full house on a Thursday evening! Great ambiance, food and beer/whiskey selection. We only had appetizers and drinks but ended up wishing we stayed for dinner and more drinks! Try the bloody Mary oyster shooters.... So good! Bartenders were split. One was cold and not hel pful. The other was great, made suggestions, conversa tion and was very attentive. Multiple patrons noticed this. A man across from us actually asked if they  split tips (they do). The hostess was very friendly. I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Samantha B.

description:
I'm not sure which I despise more:

Watery Manhattans

versus

creepy Irish widows.

But I know I don't want a sip of either.  

There are plenty of other establishments in the area (Edinburgh, Irish Bank) to get your pub on without having tourists and creepy Irish men all up in your business.

Ugh, bad memories.
author: Joanna M.

description: Stumbled into this place by accident, and what a good find. Great food (bangers & mash / mushroom ravioli w/ prawns) and great Irish beers. Highly recommend it
author: Paul D.

description: Went here for dueling pianos. The line was a good hour long. Not exactly sure its worth the wait. We went in and immediately hit the bar. A few drinks later we were dropping $20 for the backstreet boys.
author: Huy T.

description:
The bartenders are freakin' hot. That's enough for me to keep coming back okkkayy... and they are super nice too. Definitely a fun bunch. They hold nice conversations and definitely joke around you. Super accommodating too.

I can do without the piano music, but when your drunk I think it sounds awesome! :) At that point...I didnt even care if there was music of not. Parking sucks for sure.
author: Nathalie N.

description: Best Fish and Chips ever and the Bread and Butter Pudding was AWESOME SAUCE!!  Service was great. Rebekah was a great waitress.  Can't wait to come here again on our next visit.
author: Rosemary L.

description:
Dueling pianos = amazing
Everything about this place is awesome!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: fun with a capital guinness
author: Scott M.

description: Awesome, large Irish pub with TVs replete. Came here to see Game 3 of Giants V. Tigers and were luckily early enough to get a seat (hard and uncomfortable as they may be), some tasty breaded calamari and beer. It got packed and full around the 3rd inning, but the the waitress didn't ask us if we wanted the bill for an hour and a half despite not ordering anything! I was happy about that. For what its worth, there were two sets of bathrooms---good news in a place that can reach counts of over 200 persons. Love not being able to tell whether the portraits on the wall are of famous Irishmen or not.
author: Davey R.

description:
Upstairs:
Johnny Foley's is not a bad place to go to get a pint and a burger if you are in the Union Square area.  The prices are reasonable for the area.  There's a long bar and plenty of flat-screens to watch the game.

Downstairs:
The piano bar is downstairs and a bit smaller of a venue than the bar / restaurant upstairs.  It offers great live-performance entertainment.  A group of my friends and I went on a weekend night and had a blast.
author: James B.

description:
After a day of walking around Fisherman's Wharf, The Ferry Bldg & ALL OVER Union Square, we needed a pick me up & what better place to fit the bill than an Irish Pub - good beers, rowdy crowds - we're there!

Even though right in the heart of Union Square & attracting all kinds of tourists, we had a great time - paid a bit more but it was expected given our location

Wonderful dark woods & stained glass interior.  And with 3 little words, I was in heaven - Newcastle Brown Ale = nectar of the gods!

Munchies included Onion Rings & Garlic Fries for the table & while the garlic fries weren't as yummy as those found at Shoreline / Sleeptrain, they hit the spot

Our waitress was super - seem to come up right at the right time, great sense of humor & took care of all our imbibing needs

Tourist trap?  Maybe.  Overpriced?  Maybe.  But we had a super-fantastic time & would totally come back to re-energize after a full day of shopping, walking all over creation, whatever.......worth it!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Dueling pianos- That right there is usually enough to convince any of my friends, so I don't really feel like need to say more. But I will, because I love Johnny Foley's so much.  I don't quite remember how I stumbled upon this place (or down into it- the best time you will ever have is in the Cellar), but it is something I thank the fates for every day. Every Wednesday through Saturday night, you will find two hilarious (and talented!) piano players battling away for tips from the crowd.  The weapons of choice? Whatever YOU want to hear. Whether it's that new one from Beyonce, a Brooks & Dunn classic, or your mom's favorite Lovin' Spoonful song, they probably know it.  Just be sure to come with plenty of cash in hand, these guys don't take cards, and the place is usually packed with people, all of who want to hear their song played. And that song is usually Journey.

The show starts at 9 or 9.30, but it is recommended that you get there early, as space is rather limited. Food menus are available, but if you are looking for a full meal, you might be better off sticking to the main restaurant/bar upstairs, which offers everything from shellfish to burgers to steaks to panini. The restaurant also features nightly live music, though sadly no one is dueling- which would be fun to see.  Bring your guitar and see what happens!

The Cellar at Johnny Foley's also makes for a great birthday, bachelor or bachelorette party, but make sure the guest of honor isn't bashful- the guys behind the pianos go above and beyond for them and make sure the whole bar knows who they are. It is a fabulous time.  I think I already said it was the best time you will ever have, didn't I?
author: Libby W.

description: A typical Irish bar & restaurant and if you are looking for something on the quieter side look elsewhere. Soooo loud that at times it's hard to hold a conversation. I had the vegetarian stew and it was very good! Also ordered wings for the table and they are solid. Although they were all drum sticks and no wings which I thought was strange. Service was good. Nothing exciting at all.
author: Mike B.

description:
Although this place is a complete tourist trap, it's fun nonetheless.  If you're going at any time during the evening, expect it to be really loud to really really loud.

The food is pretty decent.  I'm a vegetarian and can even enjoy the menu.  My favorite item?  Spicy fries, for sure.
author: Josh B.

description:
Solid. 

I've come to Foley's for many beers, dinners, cocktails, shots, etc. and I've always had a good time. Bartenders and servers are nice and patrons are courteous and polite. Food is tasty and menu is actually really big, so many options for all. The dueling piano bar is a lot of fun and it does get sardine can packed down there but there's fun energy all around!
author: Queenie C.

description:
Tourist trap or not, the food is pretty decent. I had curry fries that were pretty okay; not as good as I've had elsewhere, but not particularly bad. I think they pass for Irish fare as a result -- bland, not particularly noteworthy, edible not memorable.

I had the decidedly authentic old-world granddad's recipe BBQ pork panini (yes.) and enjoyed it. The barbecue sauce used was tangy and sweet with a hint of something that I just couldn't put my finger on. We'll call it Irish charm for now. I'm not sure that toasted bread is the best conveyance vehicle for pulled pork, though.

As others have commented, the pickled onions are really good. I'd ask for more of those if I were you. They're good for ya.

The server was very attentive and happily kept drinks full. Facilities were clean, football was on the TV (not American football) and the prices weren't too outrageous. A good lunch spot in the area for sure.
author: Tim Y.

description: The food was awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone, but my only hope would be that they don't get the same waitress that we received. We saw her 4 times (water, drink-food order, dropped off food, dropped off second drink). However when it came time to pay the bill she popped over every few minutes to check in and see how we were doing. If this was just a food review it would have been a 4-5, but this one waitress ruined our experience.
author: Mark C.

description:
While staying at the Hilton, we ended  up going to this Irish Pub because it was next door.
First off, its like a maze trying to get to a table in the back since that were the only tables open.
This place is a lot bigger then it seems, and it was especially packed on  the day we went, hence the high noise level
There are wood panels that separate areas and it causes you to veer left or right depending on the table next to that panel.
We were placed in a table behind a column and wood panel, all we could see was the wood, the empty tables next to us and the kitchen entrance.

The waiter was quick to get our drink order, and to take out food order. I think their menu is limited, compared to other pubs I've been.
We order the calamari, garlic fries, and the chicken tandoori skewers.
The calamari came with a garlic aioli, but tasted like watered down mayo, and the crispy outside of  the calamari would fall off as soon as I stuck my fork into it.
The garlic fries were a nice think cut, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The only thing about the fries is that it looks as if they just spooned the garlic on the Fries. I don't toss the fries and garlic before service, which will lead to some fries not having any garlic at all, or too much.
The chicken skewers were bland, but I did like the cucumber sauce that came with the dish.

I don't think I will be returning back here, there are  many other pubs to try elsewhere !
author: Alex F.

description:
Not a bad place to go. They serve good beer (Chimay on tap!) in a clean, nicely lit area. The people are friendly, chilled out and on the older side. But nothing really wowed me about this place. I have no qualms about going back, but I think that there definitely are better Irish pubs out there. One thing that I definitely noticed was that the bartender was bored out of his mind. My boyfriend and I were sitting at the bar while he wiped down the counter and the glasses while trying to get a whiff of someone's conversation. First, he lingered by the business group gathered at a corner of the bar. He then proceeded to walk by us multiple times. 

So I liked this place. I really did. Just nothing wowed me. I think I might be back for the Chimay though.
author: Mariko F.

description: Andrich is the best bartender! Do ot be turned back by the hostess, she is lame. Sit at the bar and Andrich will treat you like a birthday kid.
author: Chris O.

description: Our experience here was definitely mediocre.  The setup of this place is very odd.  It has so many partitions it's like a maze.  We felt super separated from everyone else in the restaurant.  The food was mediocre and not worth the price.  The Caesar salad was overdressed and the sandwiches were just OK.  The service was pretty deplorable.  Our waitress was short with us and rude.  She wasn't attentive to our needs at all.  I felt like we were imposing the whole time we were there.  The only thing which saved the experience was the woman who I believe was the manager.  She took care of us for the last half of our time there and was very nice.  I wouldn't recommend this place to people looking for a place to eat near Union Square.
author: Meghan P.

description: Nice building, plenty of room. Great paintings and decor. Bangers and Mash was as expected, nothing special but hot and solid enough. Dessert of chocolate hangover was decent as well.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Last night a handful of friends and I were searching for a joint that wasn't 125db techno music.  We stumbled into Johnny Foley's completely at random.  Had a decent covers band in the corner (no dueling pianos tonight, I guess) and a bunch of folks getting their groove on.  Pleasantly surprised to find the venue kept the volume at an appropriate level - not so low as to sap the music of the groove, yet still able to find a table and have a conversation.  Good on them.

Bar was busy but service was fast and professional.  Those guys know their stuff.  My scotch of choice (Lagavulin...is there a better single malt?  I don't think so) was reasonably priced, we all got our drink on, and two of the most gorgeous girls I've met joined us (okay, that's cheating - they're in my cohort).  

We didn't order any food and thus I can't throw up five stars.  But if I'm back roming Union Square looking for a joint to pour me a Lagavulin, I'll look up Foley's again.
author: Tim W.

description: We like Pub food, but this was NOT good. Irish Soda Bread a joke. Dry, tasteless. Petit Filet (at $27 with NO sides) was overcooked and tasteless. Service just okay. Soon many more places in San Francisco to spend the same dollars for much better food. Won't go back. And we are locals.
author: Jonelle S.

description: Live music upstairs, piano bar downstairs. Major thumbs up. Lot's of space to sit down upstairs, good vibes, good drinks. A little tiny downstairs and they charge $10 on some nights but if you like piano bars, it's worth it.
author: Kat Q.

description:
I have to give this joint the full five stars because the bartender was such a hoot!  He quickly ascertained it was my birthday and that we were looking for Pre-dinner inebriation and helped us by making sure our glasses were not empty and our barstool compatriots sociable and tolerant of our shenanigans!

Oh, Stella in actual Stella glasses!  My pictures look like ads for Stella... Fun place, fun people, clean bar, professional yet personable bartenders.

Went to dinner at Alfred's so I cannot speak for anything but the beer and martini's but everything served around us both looked and smelled very good.

We will be back on our next visit!
author: Allie R.

description: Decent Irish bar with the appropriate  food and drink. Always very busy and sometimes its hard to get a seat at the large bar. Bartenders are attentive and helpful, food is above average Irish pub grub and the beer is cold. Prices reflect the location, meaning higher than other pubs that are off the beaten track in San Francisco.
author: Jim U.

description: Favorite bar in the city by far! $10 cover for the downstairs piano bar is well worth your money, but if you don't feel like paying a cover, upstairs also has live music and is a great time.
author: Tricia C.
