description:
Went here with a group of conference-mates and had a blast!  Was lucky enough to score seats on near the wall (high stools) so we had a great view of the stage all night.  Good thing we arrived early too since the place got super crowded come 11pm.

Drinks priced decent (4 drinks for $25, not bad!).  Entertainment is a non-stop all night with song requests and occasional audience participation reqired.  Small dance floor, or maybe it is huge but there were so many people on the Sat night we were there that it was standing room only!

Great place to visit when in SOMA.  Come early, it fills up fast!
author: Caren L.

description:
***This review is for the pub only, They also have a piano bar downstairs that we didn't visit***

On the way home after watching the  advanced screening of the movie "Catfish"  at the Metreon. Fellow Yelper Peter L. and I decided we grab a beer prior to hitting the road.

So after walking around a few blocks, we ended up at this bar. It seemed nice outside and we decided to walk in. The place appeared a bit crowded and touristy. Crowds of people walking in and out. Plasma TV's on the wall showing sports highlights and a local band blasting live music.

The ventilation appeared to be non existent, it felt hot and humid inside. I just wished the movement of air was a bit better.

The interior design of the place had a classic  Irish feel to it and the staff appeared to be nice

They have a variety of  draft beer selections , but seven bones for a brewski- I'm not sure if I'll be back.
author: Ed V.

description:
I can only speak for the downstairs experience...which is the best!  

I've seriously never been to an Irish bar where the staff are so skilled at doing all types of service. I found this place originally to watch the Euro Cup back in like 2004 maybe. Saddled up to the bar and sat for hours. The drinks kept coming and as their effect was had the bartender and I became better and better friends. Funny how that works out.  Any guy at a bar wants to believe they could be a local there. These guys are great at that. So much so that now that I live in SF i like to come in around 7pm and catch the "conference guy" who stopped in for a round after their 3pm "property tax and you" seminar and never left. They are usually the guy sitting there talking about how they love "football" and "chips" and once had a Guinness in Dublin. But the bartenders never seem to mind.  They'll keep that guy happy as easily as they welcome the post-work crowd in and then the 10pm pre-clubbing/shots-shots-shots rush. The recent move to Jameson usurping Jaeger as the go to shot only amplifies this experience. To be able to be adept at both Irish-sports bar and shot-slinger in the same shift is impressive. I think it's telling that first bartender i had still works here.  Very fun guys that guarantee anyone sitting at their bar will have a great time. 

It's a little pricey even for SF.  

Pro-tip: Murphy's on tap is an increasingly rare find. Do it. I also recommend always staying for at least 5 rounds. You'll see why.
author: Kory S.

description: Overpriced burger from frozen patty, mixed the wrong drink twice.
author: Gavin H.

description: I stayed at a hotel nearby while in SF and wanted to hangout and drink at a 'real' bar nearby. They have some music and dancing on the side but it's not that loud after all which is good. Now, the main reason for the 5 stars is the mixologist in chief Benny, he'll make any cocktail you can think of and he probably already knows it by name. I've asked for cocktails by name at many places before and bartenders would say 'What?' -probably thinking I'm too drunk or something- then I'd have to show them the ingredients which they don't have. At J.Follly, I showed them the recipe on my phone and Benny was like 'oh, you want a Negroni/French75? Sure'. If you'd like some great cocktails come here and ask for Benny , you'll be glad you did... You know what? Maybe the music is a bit annoying but silence wouldn't be cool too lol.
author: Turki A.

description:
One of the best nights of my life happened here. I think.

I don't know how/why I got here.

But I do know that drinks are reasonably priced if you don't pay attention to the menu and just go for a well cocktail.

I also don't know how much it costs to make the piano player stop his horrific piano-driven mashup of Lady GaGa/Black Eyed Peas songs, but I DO know that requesting "Fat Bottom Girls" by Queen will do the trick.

I don't know how I got home from this bar, but I think it was on public transit and I think I was so drunk and zoned-out that the panhandlers along my walk to the Muni stop were actually afraid of how drunk I was.

Thank you, Johnny Foley's. Thank you for obliterating that evening from my life.

BTW, when you arrive and are asked if you would like to sit upstairs or downstairs, you can only have the piano experience downstairs. And never mind the tourists and the tourist games the pianists want to play. Just drink furiously and pick the most non-sequitur songs you can muster to break up the unbearable pop hits. You may not remember what you do, but I promise, it'll be good.
author: Polly Enmity P.

description:
The only reason it's not getting a 4 is because I can't vouch for the food. When I go back...I'm going to have to eat there too so I can update this review. 

The place itself is huge! You walk in and you think it's a small little bar. But it keeps going, and going....and going! The appetizers n food looked pretty tasty. We just stopped in for 2 drinks and they were pretty good! The service and atmosphere was pretty good! My boyfriend's Bloody Mary was pretty tasty and they put all the fixens in which is nice =) My Vodka soda's were tasty too but its pretty hard to mess one of those up. 

Fun place, check it out =) Lots of TV's so its a great place to watch sports!
author: Leza B.

description:
This place makes damn good Bloody Mary's! They have a great selection of booze and beer on tap! I always get the bloody marys, they are a meal on it's own! The mix is perfectly seasoned and topped with a huge celery stalk, olives, pearly onion, pickled asparugus, and lime wedge. YUMMY!

 I work downtown and frequently pop in. I recomend the fish $ chips, the cottage pie (shepards pie) , bangers and mash, garlic fries, oyster shooters, the1/2 chicken dinner is great too. Only thing I have not enjoyed was their curry dish. It was not very flavorful, and didn't like the yougurt sauce it came with. Nasty. But over all this Union Square resturant pub is definatly a favorite of mine.

I usually meet nice folks here too. Friendly crowd of travelers on holiday.
author: Lily S.

description: A great place to have a work HH, especially if you have a large group. They were hands down the most warm, inviting and helpful staff I've had in a long time. We walked over to Johnny Foley's from a bar across the street that really wasn't cutting it for our group due to various reasons. I was a bit moving the team (ever try to move 30 drunk and hungry employees all at once?) from one bad spot and potentially going to another sub par locations but I'm glad I took the chance. They were freaking amazing!! They set us up in our own room with a bar and Ollie worked the room like a champ. I don't how it does it. It was on top of everything! Busing tables, filling food and drink orders, asking us if we need refills with his had full of empty plates. He was a rock star. The team had a blast. The drinks were great, the food was on point (at one point we had a mini riot over the shrimp but Ollie saved the day by bringing in more ). Everyone we came in contact with there was exceptional. And just when you think ti can't get any better we find out that have dueling pianos! I will definitely be hosting another corporate event there in the near future as well as going these with family and friends.
author: Michele H.

description:
I love attempting to spend a quiet evening in and then decide to drag my friends to John Foley's for a dueling piano sing along with me.

I hate to say that they still get Five Stars, even though the singers won't admit to knowing any Katy Perry songs, or at least the ones that I want to dedicate.  Nights, especially weekends are always entertaining as they attempt to call people out of the crowd.  When there is a crowd, beware, as it can turn into an instant steam room.  Otherwise, only a little bit of sweat is the only negative that I can see.
author: Carolina H.

description: LOVE this bar! It is a must for those who enjoy piano bars and dancing. Shout out to my fave bartenders ever- Gavin and Ger!
author: Shannon G.

description: I don't drink but if you are looking for some good piano duelling action, this is your place! Great crowd, and fun entertainers that get the crowd involved! Downstairs has a great "feel" to it. Not your typical creepy San Francisco bar! Just good people wanting to have a good time! This is a must if you are in Union Square looking for a little night time entertainment!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Prices are okay, service... Not so great. My husband had to walk up to the bar and grab a drink and as soon as a server saw him do so, she came right over. THEN it happened a second time. Cool atmosphere, good prices, but overall, nothing worth getting excited over.
author: Maddie G.

description:
Johnny Foleys a Good Order
Foley's by Union Square (http://www.johnnyfoleys.com/) is a spot I like to visit and have some well-poured Guiness pints. They also have a good kitchen with some strong wings. They're not gonna blow you away or be anything particularly special, but they will satisfy and be worth your money. Good wing sauce and well cooked, but the crisp is light. A classy place like this will definitely provide the celery and carrots without charge and some good bleu cheese. Overall Grade: B
author: Christopher R.

description: My friend and I were there drinking and having a good time watching the warriors game, we went out to smoke the server went to security and told them we left without paying our tab which we didnt we were just smoking. My friend is also vegan the only thing on the menu she could eat was fries or a salad which she didnt want she had her own food, yes we know u shouldnt bring food into another place but the waitress said she would ask the manager, she came back and said she could find the manager and to just eat it quick. When my friend went to eat her salad the waitress got hella rude my friend said to go ask her manager if it was ok remember SHES VEGAN the manager NANCY came over was rude as hell to us when I tried to explain to nancy what the server said to us nancy told me to leave and never come back I kept on trying to explain to her what the server told us and she looked at me and said we had to chase u down to pay ur bill well thats funny my friend was paying the bill as nancy was saying this to me. One good thing that came out of this is when nancy the "MANAGER" told me to never come back was I was already thinking to myself I will never come back. If the manager can talk to u like that then that means the rest of the staff and owners don't care. Very dissatisfied would love to hear from the owners and find out why they put up with a manager like her she is very unprofessional
author: Marty H.

description: Piano bars are usually where it's at.  This place serves the purpose, but there's just something missing.  It's missing that rip-roaring clash-your -beer-mugs-together-because-we're-singing-along feeling.  It's tough finding a seat, mostly standing room only.
author: Mel G.

description:
I love an Irish pub. How can you go wrong with beer and foods from the emerald isle? 

Live music, fairly large restaurant, authentic feel and friendly staff.
author: William W.

description:
I was so happy to find a place that served corned beef and cabbage - and it wasn't even St. Patrick's Day!   Good beer selection, live music entertainment in the evening after 9p , and a dueling piano bar just downstairs - it's a great hangout Thurs - Sat.   

The New England Clam Chowder was YUM and hit the spot - this coming from the non-seafood eater.

However, bypass the corned beef.  DRY, DRY, DRY.  :(
author: Kerri L.

description: Kristy was a great server and the food was actually good.  Arugula salad was so refreshing and peppery w/ a nice light dressing.  Prime rib was cooked just right but needed a little more au jus.  Bread pudding was good but served in a tight dish w/ not so warm sauce on the side.  Beers were a bit pricy but expected for the location.  Overall great place for drinks, food, and even live music.
author: L T.

description: Sorry to say this is my first negative review. At the bar in the backroom tonight and ordered coffee with a half shot of Jameson ... cost $10.25 ... 6 for $61.50. For those of you counting thats $ 20.50 for a single shot of Jameson  ... or it's $18.00 per shot of Jameson and $2.50 for a coffee. Oh ya ... the 1st round of coffee was so old it was cold. Who servers cold coffee ??? The bartender just didn't seem to care. We'll be staying in Mountain View and going to Stephen's Green :-)
author: Wesley S.

description: Came in here for lunch.  Had a Smithwicks that tasted like dirt.  Calamari appetizer was OK.  Grilled corned beef sandwich with very little saurkraut or mustard and not much taste.  Couldn't wait to get out.
author: Zach P.

description:
Came here with two girlfriends to get drunk.  Basically because it's close enough to stumble safely back to the apartment.  

We were promptly served our beers while we exchanged crude childish gestures over the table and made fun of old people dancing to mediocre live music.  And I'm sure we were loud and people were staring.  But it was all in good (maybe not) taste.  

Mr. Hostess Man was cutes.  We'll be back for you, grrrrrrr.  

I hate your ranch.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Cottage Pie & Corn Beef are really great. Lots of food for the price. The chicken curry is ok, the chicken was a little stringy. Fun atmosphere but SUPER LOUD! Don't expect to have a conversation without yelling.
author: K. H.

description:
Five of us got together and were walking around Union square.  We were kinda looking for a place where we would sit down and have some beers.  So, we ended up coming here.

It wasn't as crowded as I thought it would be, and we got a table.  Unfortunately, it was really in a dark spot near the wall, and there was a candle, which gave the most light.  I asked the waitress to get another glass of candle and she did.  So, that was great.

We ordered drinks, then looked at the menu.  One friend had to bring up his iPhone 4 to brighten so he could see it better.  We talked about the foods, like recommendations and Ireland is known for its fish and chips, so that's what I told them and two guys ordered that.  I got a salmon.  It was good but strangely, it didn't have any horse radishes - that got me confused.  Horseradishes really help to spice up the taste in the salmon.  One girl had a curry kind of a meal, maybe with chicken.  

So, we ate, had some beers, and just catching up with each other because one couple just got back from Washington, DC, where they're studying at Gallaudet University.

Expect the menu to be pricey, so some stayed with just appetizers.
author: Nathan K.

description: Cool place! I've been there several times and it's consistently good! Great Irish Coffees and beer selection. The Raw oysters were so good I had another order!
author: Rich S.

description:
I like their food, the prices are average, there's no happy hour.

The first time I went was for a late lunch on a Saturday.  We ordered the chicken sandwich, clam chowder and butternut squash soup. Everything was yummy.

The place looks deceptively small from the outside but it has alot of space.

Second time was a Friday around 6pm.  There was a good crowd but no happy hour...BOO! We headed to the Gold Dust Lounge.
author: Nicole J.

description:
In town for a short vacation, this spot was two blocks from our hotel so we stopped in.

Great waitress recommended Smithwick's ale which I'd never had before but will be drinking again. I like a nice Red.

Other Yelper's mentioned that the Cottage Pie was good so I gave it a try and it was GREAT.

Note - this review is for the main bar only. The piano bar only gets two stars.
author: Matt F.

description:
Brought my family to the place for a dinner and some live music.  Food is decent.. I love the cottage  pie and the lamb slider~~ waitress was friendly but a little bit slow.. the place was pretty busy so it was pretty loud if you are going to enjoy the music, make sure you sit close to the performer.. otherwise, you will have a hard time understanding what he/she is saying ... 
overall, a nice experience for a Monday night out .. next time when i was in town, i know where to stop for dinner~
author: i-hsin h.

description: Totally a decent bar! I popped in for a bit to grab a pint and a snack and was impressed with the size of the place. From the outside you'd guess it was like any other neighboring businesses.... maybe seating 20-40 people. But when I went in I spotted places to stand, places to sit at the bar, booths, and various other spots to eat, drink and commiserate with friends. Definitely not bad but not the best Irish pub I've visited in SF. If I'm in the area I' be happy to pop by again and enjoy a nice pint of beer.
author: Katy H.

description:
Love Foley's. Food is pretty good, can be very noisy at night, but there is plenty of room in here. Live bands play here which adds to the charm.

BEER... that's why we mainly come. After having lived in the UK I just need to go to a pub that doesn't feel American these days and Foley's excels at that.
author: Y B.

description:
There are not enough pubs around. And Johnny Foley's is a great example that should be cloned and distributed evenly across the land - minus the horrid waitress.

I've visited three times, twice for food and once just for brew. 
Going for drinks, it's great. Good amount of room and moody pub lighting. And the food is superb if you're one of the rare who appreciates Irish/English food such as bangers and mash, cottage pie, fish and chips and mushy peas (mushy peas are delicious, it turns out!). 

But the service is awful. 

The waitresses I've had are un-attentive and very short with customers. I visited last night and perhaps she was very upset she had to work on July Fourth, but hopefully she made the connection between her complete lack of customer service and the low tip (a few dollars was too much, looking back on it). 
She approached only to get drink and food orders, stopped once to say  "We're doing good here? Yeah," and walked off. Refills never came and she dropped the check while walking by and saying "Thanks" without looking at us. 

If I crave the food again, I'll be going elsewhere in hopes of getting at least a "Hi, how are you doing tonight?"
author: Eeeeee E.

description:
Dual pianos make me swoon. Call me ignorant and/or sheltered but this was the first time I had been to a bar of this nature. I came in expecting a lame tourist trap and left jumping and yipping (yup, that would be me trying to sing and dance). 

The only sucky thing about paying for your songs is that if somebody else doesn't want to hear it, they can out pay your request and thus, put it in the crapper. I requested Vanilla Ice Ice Baby and I'm pretty sure it was rejected in about, oh, the speed of light. Damn.
author: Julia N.

description:
I've been to Irish bars all over the world and the one thing they all have in common is that they are ALL tons of fun. Not Johnny Foley's! This place lacks atmosphere and just feels wrong. It was raining and I thought I'd spend the wet afternoon in this bar. It was not fun. The calamari sucked and when we mentioned to the bar tender that the dipping sauce tasted fishy he noted that it wasn't supposed to taste that way, but didn't do anything about it. Also, prices are too high. Leave this place for the tourists and walk to Kate O'Brians!
PS this review is just for the pub upstairs. I've always wanted to try the piano bar downstairs because I've heard it's great!
author: Vanessa A.

description:
Their cider.... always yum. Their space, oaksy and spacious. Never too busy for happy hour. I came here with a friend this afternoon to enjoy some down time. The bartender was very nice and courteous with his service. 

Still a fan of this place!
author: Eva Y.

description:
Get rid of the lame dude at the front door with a major power trip. Stopped by here after San Francisco Street Food Fest where I was earlier in the evening and bought a flask to benefit La Concina. It was in my purse. I asked lame bouncer with a power trip to hold my purse while I found my ID. He saw the flask (with three drops in it from the festival that I hadn't drank for two hours) and said, "EXCUSE ME MISS, I'M GOING TO NEED YOU TO POUR THAT OUT." Great, I get it, so I poured it out. It's O'Farrell St. in San Francisco - far worse liquids are on the street than two tablespoons of rum and juice. He told me I was "rude" for pouring the flask out and then told me I was going to have to empty my entire purse so he could check it. 
Please. Don't flatter yourself. I'm a normal 30-something who spends copious amounts of money at the bar. I was not trying to sneak alcohol inside the bar in a flask, or whatever else he thought was in my purse. Stop being such a wanker. You lost my business that night - and forever.
author: Jeanna B.

description: I had some delicious fish and chips here.  The fries were delicious.  The mashed peas were something I'd never heard of, but they were great!  The beer was good and cold, and the service was speedy and friendly.  A little expensive, but that's SF for you.
author: Katie G.

description: After a failed Cheesecake Factory attempt, we spilled into Johnny Foleys to grab a bite to eat and to ravage our take out cheesecake. My date got the fish and chips and I checked out the Irish cream ale. Not bad. Foleys is huge and has ample seating so you don't have to wait long for a table. Great bar area with huge TVs. Friendly and attentive service. If you can handle the tourists you can handle Johnny Foleys.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Went on a Thursday night downstairs to the Piano duel, what a blast!  Ok, so my requested song was not quite played to perfection but it was all-around a very, very fun time !  The two gents on the keys were great and pulled off quite a variety of genres with eager enthusiasm.  

I'll go back and stay longer!
author: Bene K.

description:
Maybe I'm partial to this place because we came here on our first night in SF after a long flight. We were bummed to find out that we missed food service by 15 minutes (ends at 10 on week nights).

There was some live entertainment, which kept the place pretty lively. I'm not sure if the singer-musician was a man or woman. "She" was dressed like a woman and had long hair, but had the deepest, most manly voice I've ever heard. Regardless she was pretty good she covered things from Violent Femmes to Garth Brooks.

They have dueling pianos downstairs, but we didn't go there.


Bottom line: I may have been biased because I was there with friends (and was a tourist) but this was a fun place to kick back and have a beer.
author: Mary T.

description:
I am from Denver and we have a piano bar, Sing Sing. The guys at Foley's but Sing Sing to shame. They played such a large variety of songs and had so much fun doing it. Journey to Lady Gaga to Sir Mix-a-lot, and on and on and on. 

No cover, which makes the experience even better. 

Only downside, drinks are pricey. But hey, you cannot win them all.
author: Katie T.

description: Meh. Totally touristy faux Irish Pub in the heart of San Francisco's uber-touristy Union Square district.  Not an establishment you'd search out as a destination bar.  That being said, they have a huge selection of draft beers, and most nights they have live music.  So if you're in the area and need a watering hole, you can do worse.
author: Frank F.

description:
I'v been here several times and have always had a great time. But the absolute best time was the day of the St. Patrick's parade. My friend and I got there at 11am and were having such an amazing time that we completely forgot to actually go watch the parade as planned! Lots of awesome,  funny people and the bartenders are super friendly too. Rarely had to wait for more than a minute or two for another pint after finishing the last sip (definitely a big plus on a busy bar day!). 

Every time we have been back, we've been greeted with a smile and Ger (one of the super awesome Irish bartenders) even remembers the beer smy friend and I like- love it!
author: Colleen M.

description: Granted we got here late but the menu selection was poor. My chicken was moist but flavorless and there were too many scallions in the mashed potatoes. It was like scallions topped with mashed potatoes. Overall a bland meal.
author: Pegah B.

description:
Came here for a drink and a bite to eat in the afternoon.  First thing I got was a pint of guiness.  It's a Irish bar, how could I not?  

For some reason it tasted really really weird.  Almost like tin or copper.  My guess is dirty pipes or the bottom of the keg. 

Since option 1 wasn't available, I decided to get option 2, a bloody mary.  After seeing these giant red glasses fitted with a baseball bat of a celery stick and bedazzled with olives, pearl onions and asparagus it almost seemed like a good lunch item.  After taking the first sip, the first thing I noticed was that it was REALLY HOT.  PERFECT!!  This place knows how to make their drinks. (except guinness apparently).

I got the garlic fries after (which apparently is a big San Francisco thing).  It's essentially fries, with a lot of diced garlic and parsley ontop.  I think if i were to do it i'd puree the garlic for maximum potency and coverage.  BTW, don't even bother trying to save your breath.  Just enjoy it.  Gum won't help.
author: Joe H.

description:
Decent little pub just around the corner from our hotel. I ordered the baked chicken with roasted brussel sprouts. I typically cook them like that at home and I was thrilled to see them on the menu. They were cooked perfectly, but I found the chicken to be a bit dry.

I'd go there again, but it wouldn't be my first choice. It was convenient and packed with a younger crowd on a Thursday night, when we went for dinner. Nice little place to grab a bite or a drink.
author: Desi D.

description: No cover charge for an awesome dueling piano session. The two guys will do pretty much any song you can come up with (I assume people ask for the same tunes over and over too) and there's a third dude that plays some kind of synthesizer in the middle. I came here with coworkers and it was a lot of fun to request songs and to dance awkwardly up by the pianos!
author: Kevin L.

description: I had the fish and chips which is a signature dish... The fish was good and the mashed peas very tasty however the fries were some of the worst I'd ever had... Zero seasoning and over fried to the point of almost burnt, terrible flavor from old oil and this all at an early dinner seating...my daughter had the grilled cheese of the kids menu And didn't like the fries either.... We tried again for dessert... I had the baileys coffee which for 9.00 was a joke as it was a very small cup and very cold... The dessert which was supposed to be a chocolate hangover was half vanilla and the brownie was cold and dried out -
author: Darla W.

description:
I've been to this pub when Yelp was in still in someone's head and I wasn't even living in the Bay Area. In my Guiness-clouded little mind, this place was ginormous. And there was plenty of women, plenty of space between tables to wobble through on your way to the bathroom. I like my bar big. Since the sweeping smoking ban, smelling people's flatulence has been a consistent mood killer; and a big bar attenuates that effect.

No surprise during my solo bar-hopping session Friday night I was drawn to this place again. Armed with two Guiness and a margarita, I found myself squeezing between a pillar and the bar, ordering something I don't typically find elsewhere - A Murphy's Irish Stout. Had I not been a bit tipsy by then I wouldn't even have asked for it, not to mention using that pillar to support my weight.

And there shall be Murphy's. I couldn't care less what the live band was playing, but it sounded awesome at the moment. The most redeeming quality of this place of course, is that it intoxicate you for no reason. Or maybe you just tend to get pulled into this place when you are drunk already. Then again, do you really think about these things with a Muphy in your hand? (OK, get yer mind outta the gutter would ya)
author: Lu W.

description: I had the chicken wings and they were way overcooked and dry. My friend had the potato skins and they were not good either. I will not be coming back here.
author: Shahrooz H.

description: Meh. That's all I have to say. INCREDIBLY touristy, overpriced, watered-down drinks. The piano guys were pretty entertaining at first, but I would have rather heard some more piano and less theatrics. I've gotta say though, these piano guys have a solid job going, they were getting cashed out huge for playing some songs. Also, one of them said something like "me love you long time" to an asian girl. I'm not PC at all usually, but christ, that's not even funny. The songs they played were very general and mass-audience friendly, my buddy put in some random John Lennon songs and they said they didn't know what the songs were... definitely will not be coming back here.
author: Samir K.

description: The food, drinks and service was great. Bangers and Mash was our favorite but we also enjoyed their fish and chips and apple walnut salad. The only reason we have it a 4 star instead of 5 was because the mussels weren't great.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Bouncers are awesome! They didn't let anyone cut in line or get in without first getting in line.

Place is quite small and does get pretty loud with the dueling pianos.  Very good music and lots of laughs.  Watch out for the floor though, some people really can't hold their drinks (literally).  Broken glasses everywhere.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I ate there for a mid-afternoon lunch on Sunday, 8 December, after travelling from central Pennsylvania (12-hour journey).  I wanted something nearby my hotel in Union Square.  

I ordered the garlic fries and a pint of Anchor Steam.  The fries were pretty good, nothing spectacular.  

What I was most struck by was the high price of the food (and drink).  Pints and bottles, even of Budweiser, were $7-8, which is on the high side, even for SF.  Most of the appetizers, of which garlic fries was one, were mainly north of $10.  

In terms of service, the hostess at the door was indifferent, at best; the bartending staff were efficient though it was clear that they favoured people who were likely regular customers -- many patrons were there to watch the 49ers game on the television sets.  

A bit disappointing, but the atmosphere seemed fairly good for watching sports.
author: Danny B.

description: I've been here a few times now and the food is always yummy, a little pricey, but yummy. I've had the steamers, cottage pie and fish and chips. Nothing beats a hearty meal after a night of drinking. I've always been sat promptly and have never waited too long for a server. It's then perfect place to end your evening.
author: Nicole P.

description:
I am not sure about this place. There isn't really anything wrong with it, but there isn't anything really right about it either. 

It was picked  because it was near enough to our office, but not so close that it is a regular haunt.  That said, this place is really a big, not so Irish tourist trap.   It is located by many hotels and you can tell that the majority of the clientele is visiting the city.  

People are there to eat/drink and the service is a bit dicey....that is until we found the second "secret" (because it is a bit hidden) bar in the back and got drinks right away.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Review on Drinks Only:

The crowd for a Monday night is staggering. I couldn't believe how many people were there that night. Given this is a pretty touristy location, the atmosphere was comfortable. The volume in the place was just perfect and the live music was wonderful.
author: Lisa R.

description: I really should have reviewed Foley's years ago! I work at Union Square and have spent many lunch hours enjoying the food and staff at this wonderful establishment. I love pubs, but usually can't stand the food. The food at Foley's is fantastic! I always enjoy my salad with gorgonzola, walnuts and chicken. Also quite good are the fried chicken sandwich, the shepard's pie and the veggie burger. Great drinks and even better service.
author: Amanda M.

description: Thank you Conor Murphy for your recommendation.  Nice ambiance, friendly service and delicious food. I tried: Soda bread and Mussels in Irish Whiskey Cream Sauce with Bacon, Garlic & Parsley. Bangers & Mash, Two Plump Pork Sausages - with Mashed Potatoes, Stewed Onions, Seasonal Vegetables, Gravy. Irish Soda Bread & Butter Pudding- Caramel & Custard Sauce. Complemented with a car bomb and an Irish coffee. I LOVED IT!
author: Mama Titas C.

description: I really felt like I wasted three hours of my life here, and I never feel like that. The bartender was nice. We waited for oh, maybe 30 minutes for a table, again, that was by the bar. It was extremely crowded and uncomfortable. This couple brought their newborn to the bar. He looked as miserable as I was. Service was weird and took too long. I think she forgot to put in our order. We waited another 20 minutes for the check. The table next to us was clearly as annoyed as we were. I had the English Pie. It was okay. At the end though, I just wanted to get out of there...
author: Heidi H.

description:
Nothing bad to say just to confirm it is another Irish Pub in the middle of San Francisco.  

I do prefer a more intimate pub like the Chieftain but it certainly is great to stop in for a pint and some grub.  I will say that their grilled chicken sandwich includes a whole boneless skinless chicken breast and it was cooked perfectly.  No pink, no dryness just a good piece of white meat! 

I do know they put on a great breakfast.  If you are in the neighborhood and can stop in for an Irish traditional breakfast then do so you will be very happy and if you drink enough a few little leprechauns will be seen for sure.
author: Scott P.

description: Nice traditional city pub, delicious buttermilk fried chicken, calamari and the apple Gorgonzola salad...yum! Wish I had gotten our waitresses name, irish accent, very attentive and friendly! The gentleman singing in the back made for a perfect dinner for this SF  tourist!
author: Glen-Kathie B.

description:
I'd say 9 times out 10, if you ring me and im at a bar, im at an irish pub.  What can i say, its like a bad habit i cant kick.  Johnny Foley's, unfortunately, has never made it in my rotation.  Mainly because its a tourist bar and being a native, well, ive got my usual local spots away from the hustle & bustle of downtown.

Foley's is no doubt always busy, especially with the dueling pianos downstairs (which ive yet to see dammit - i highly recommend you do).  But on nights where it isnt so packed, ive parked it here a few times and sat for hours enjoying drink after drink while watching a game or being entertained by the performance of the lovely Nicole.  If you've caught her show, you know how awesome she is.  True story, Nicole taught me a few songs on the guitar.  She's amazing.  

If all that isnt enough to give you that extra push to stop in, chat up the bartenders.  They alone will make you want to come back.  Ok, so i may get treated pretty good because of the ss, but i promise you this review is not biased.  I speak the truth.  All of them are incredibly friendly and great stand up guys - i can attest to this because i know them outside of the bar as well.  Sometimes i wish this bar was in the sunset.  Wait, whats that.....they have a sister bar out there?  She shoots.....she scores!
author: Juv C.

description: I got my first Irish car bomb here! I liked the service and the atmosphere was so fun.
author: Nneka O.

description: Tourist trap...they try to force you to eat at the 'pub' before you go to the piano bar. Awful
author: Stephanie S.

description:
As a Bay Area native, sometimes the tourist traps are so not what I'm in the mood for...but...I like this one!

What I appreciate here is that it's clean, lots of seating and it's not a sleezy kind of watering hole type place.  You can come for a simple drink or stay for dinner.  

I lived in England for a semester and had the absolute privilige to travel to Ireland.  This place happens to remind me of a place we hung out at right after we got to town and for that alone, I love it.  

The food is consistent, and you can find something you'll be happy with and the atmosphere is great.  Pubs never try to compete with 4 star culinary delights...they're pubs...good food...good people and good atmosphere...that's all a good pub needs.  

Bottom line: Try it...you'll like it!
author: Victoria B.

description:
Have been here a few times now, only to the dueling piano bar downstairs though. Came here on Friday night to watch the show and get some drinks. We got there early enough to grab a table which was nice. The first round my BF went up to the bar to order our drinks, but there was a lady coming around every 5 minutes taking drink orders. We then ordered our drinks from her so we didn't have to deal with the crowded bar area. 

Drinks were strong, entertainment was great. Who doesn't love dueling pianos??
author: Rachel S.

description:
This place is over the top!

Try the whiskey muscles - I think I saw god.

Cathi M. was our Bartend, she personifies professionalism and master of the trade.

This is a must stop in Union Square!

My only regret is that the beer list is not more expansive, the focus is on the fare... 

If your looking for some over the top beer list, head on over to the Monks Kettle, you won't be disappointed.
author: Mark W.

description:
I read some of the other reviews before going to Johnnys. I figured since Johnny and me share a name it already earned a star or two!

It's definately a touristy spot... The band that played on the Saturday night tht I was there played 70's rock and the average age was about 45. So if ur around my age - 30ish, then you may run into your mom or dad here. 

As far as Irish pubs go it's middle of the road for me. I live in Seal Beach (home to many an Irish bar), which gives me proper rights for objective critisism.
author: John Z.

description:
Since I always sit at the bar, pretty much everywhere I go, I like going to Foley's when I'm downtown because A-the barmen are nice to look at, and B-there is usually a soccer game on the TV.  (although, they are so high up I always leave with a neck-ache.

Lots of beer on tap, $6 per pint, and really great food.  The soup is fresh, as is the Irish soda bread.  I ALWAYS have the chicken skewers with cucumber salad.  It's fresh, filling and some balance calorie-wise between the pints.  Everyone who has gone with me loves the food, and I have heard great comments about the calamari and the burgers.  

The Bloody Mary's are good, but not the "Best" in town, as they claim.  That's a hard sell, since many places are popping up with Bloody Mary Bars, so you can make your own.

It's a great place to take out of town guests, especially those in for a business meeting, who don't want a fancy, expensive dinner.  The food tastes a bit better than usual "pub grub" but not as posh as the "gastro pub" fare that is popping up all over.  Which, I prefer.  I mean "Gastro Pub?" 

No.
author: Gina H.

description: I travel to San Fran a couple of times a year and usually stay at the Hilton which is a short two block walk to Foleys.  This place is always crowded every time I've gone.  Nice beer selection on tap.  Lots of excellent menu items that you would expect at an Irish Pub.  I usually get the cottage pie which is pretty much the same as shepherds pie.  Can't go wrong for a quick but delicious meal.
author: Mike C.

description:
It was mine and my girlfriend's last full day in San Francisco and we decided to just go walk around and explore a little bit. After a while, we started to get hungry but couldn't make up our minds on what to get. If there's one thing I've learned, it's that there are few things more dangerous to men than a hungry woman! I've got a real affinity for Irish pubs, so upon passing by and seeing the sign saying "Irish House", that was it. Got seated, looked over the menu, and ordered a pint of Smithwick's. I ended up getting the corned beef and "cabbage" sandwich (the reason I put that in " " is because it's what was done on the menu and they use sauerkraut) which was fantastic! My girlfriend got the steak sandwich, which was REALLY good. I'll probably have to get that next time I'm there. Also ended up trying their Irish coffee and for dessert we split the Irish coffee tiramisu. Definitely worth it!

Bottom line:
Great food
good service
good beer

Definitely going back again.
author: Marlon C.

description:
My friend and I went here to watch the World Cup game when, sadly, the US was "defeated" by Ghana. Actually, we were going to go to Lefty O'Douls, but my friend called me from there and she said that was NOT the place to be.

We started walking around looking for a place, getting nervous because we were about 10 min from kick-off, when we saw a small line started outside of this place. We decided to hop in line too, and were reassured when we saw a sign that said they WERE playing the game.

It wasn't a long wait to get a seat at a counter - we wanted to eat *and* watch the game - and we got kinda make-shift seats but were accomodated even still. To my enjoyment, they had Carlsberg on tap, which is kind of hard to find here in the US.
My friend asked the waitress what to get, and ended up ordering the grilled chicken panini. I got pesto with grilled chicken. We both enjoyed our meals well enough, but she didn't like her mojito. To me, it was pretty weak and not worth the $13 she paid for it.

But what really made our experience was the whole atmosphere of watching the game. There were tons of soccer fans and everyone was getting really into the game, even with the US losing.

I'd like come again to explore their menu, but after I save a bit of money. It wouldn't be my first choice, but it's good to know where I can get Carlsberg on tap and watch a game.
author: Apple C.

description:
Great neighborhood pub.  Great beer selection food selection and friendly staff

I live on the east coast but have been coming here for years.   I dont get to SF as often as I used too and hadnt been in the door for about 3 years ... and the bartender still remembered me and what I drink.  

David has been there for 12 years and always quick with a cold pint.

Nicole is special... singing her version of Burning Ring of Fire ...  see her before she leaves us for good.   :-(
author: Wayne L.

description: Visited here with my dad on a Friday evening for dinner.  Owing to my diet restrictions, I ordered the Wild Mushroom Ravioli.  Was pretty sure I'd be regretting ordering Italian food at an Irish pub, but was pleasantly surprised; it was delicious, and I ate every bite.  The place was packed, and was a bit too loud to have a conversation at a comfortable volume, thus the one star deduction.  Otherwise, the experience was a blast: fantastic food all around; professional wait staff who were courteous and prompt in spite of the big crowd; and a really neat atmosphere minus the noise.
author: Matthew M.

description:
For what it's worth, this place is located in a premium touristy spot, close to Union Square and all the shops to boot. I thought, ugh, what if it's a tourist trap and then I went in and had a bite and a sip...
1st star: Easy location and great place to stop by after shopping
2nd star: Great service
3rd star: The food is good ol pub food, warning- the fries come out PIPING hot and damn good. They also have healthy, their arugula fennel salad with Irish cheddar and lemon vinagrette is awesome.
4th star: Good selection of beverages and clean place overall
5th star: TBD
author: Natasha C.

description: Was Yelping for fish and chips in the Union Square area. This place came up. First off, it looks nice. But it smells of stale beer and was absolutely frigid in there. Alright, it's an Irish pub, but it doesn't need to have the same temperature as Dublin in January. Fish and chips was cod (meh!), 4 piece, very bland and soggy fries. Service was fine.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Great little spot right on Union Square.

Awesome decor, clean, busy location but they were all over the Service and took good care of us.

Stacy went Fish and Chips again and called these her 2nd favorite in the city.  Said they were good going down but had a little greasy aftertaste but is to be expected with this dish.  Certainly would order them again.

I ordered the Cottage Pie (also knows as Sheppards Pie) and was over the top thrilled.  One of the best that I have ever had.  Try this dish!!!
author: Don B.

description:
So this has become our group's "go to" bar. Have been there pretty much every sat for the past month. 
- live music upstairs is usually ok ( dont ask them to play Flogging Molly or Dropkick Murphy coz they wont.)
- downstairs if of course where the party is  ! The dueling pianists are always always awesome. The made up lyrics for birthdays, bachelorette parties, engagements are hilarious ( i.e. highly profane). 
- crows is all ages but very friendly. Even if you are not dancing or singing along, the entertainment never disappoints.
- Bartenders are super nice (except the one time I asked them to not pour my Guiness in a Giants glass. The response was " do you want the beer or not ?"....but was followed by some friendly basebell talk). They know how to pour the stouts which is what keeps bringing me  back. Sux that they close at 1:30
- I have never had to wait for more than a minute to get my drink no matter how crowded the bar is. 
- A bit on the pricey side with most drafts @ 6.75 and drinks up of 7 $.
- no cover !!
author: Deepak K.

description:
Finding anything open on Thanksgiving is a challenge.  We know a sure bet is areas near tourists or inside hotels...that said, the ones in Villa Florence and Sir Francis Drake were both closed...very disappointing.

Johnny Foley's looks promising and the dark wood and ambiance just fit the holiday.  We grabbed an isolated table away from the bar and looked around at the holiday decor with lighted gifts and elfs...  I had intend to have one of their drafts but noticed they have the mini Rotari Brut and decided to have a little bubble for the holiday.  The only other place I've seen this is at Maykadeh in North Beach.  While the place is cozy, everything else was just ok at best.  

What we had:
Rotari Brut - $8 - they still use the old styled champagne flute, the tulip styled one.

Boddingtons - 20 oz - for hubby  - $6.50 - love the head on this

1/2 dozen oysters on half shell - $12 - not bad but Sotto Mare still serves the best oysters on half shell

Buffalo wings - $8 - there were dozen pieces and all drumettes - where's my wings?!?  I thought it was way sour so I dipped mine in the blue cheese dressing which was light and tasted more like buttermilk.  The worst part of the wings - they were not fresh.  It was also not piping hot as expected.  The inside was warm and the meat was just tasted old and mushy - yuck!  Definitely the worst ones I've had.  

Time to head out and venture on to somewhere else...
author: Gloria H.

description: Had a wonderful cottage pie, absolutely delicious. Tried their soda bread which was very good.
author: Emily H.

description: Ambiance is great, real Irish pub feel. Corned beef and cabbage is the BOMB!!!  The hostess with blonde curly hair- total bitch, lots if attitude for no reason, but the waitress recovered and has been FANTASTIC!!  This would've been 5 stars but that hostess needs to pretend to like her job or find another place to work.. Other than her, I highly recommend this place!!!!
author: Danny P.

description:
Me and my friend took Bart to the city to shop/walk around and have some lunch. Well we didn't talk about where we were going for once we just walked and walked. 
Once we got hungry she just said she was taking me to Johnny Foleys. I had never eaten there and didn't know what I was gonna order. I started to look at the menu and sooo many things sounded Delicious!! I ended up ordering half order of the apple-gorgonzola salad which was still huge for being half. Then i ordered the lamb sliders off the appetizer menu. It was made with perfectly seasoned lamb,goat cheese, eggplant, mint aioli. All I can say is wow. It also came with a little salad on the plate and I must say this is a must try if you ever come here and you like lamb.
author: Mary Jane P.

description: Irish Pubs have become a staple of my travels. The average Irish pub will have a friendly crowd, good beers on tap, typically live music, and always a magnet for travelers. On a recent business trip, I found myself here after some plans didn't work out. Despite being there alone, I didn't feel like I was a stranger here. I struck up a conversation with some visiting aussies early in the evening, and ended with a conversation with some visiting college students later in the evening. Oh, and they have Magners on tap, which is my personal beverage of choice. There was also a live band later in the evening, which had some great music but wasn't overwhelming. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!
author: Jacob L.

description:
I seriously Love this place. Been here numerous times and the service behind the bar no matter how slow or busy it is, is always on point. This place has my favorite beer (Boddingtons) and my Favorite Whiskey (Jameson 18 Limited Reserve) so they are a definite stop whenever Im in San Francisco. 
Try the Mussels with Irish Whiskey Sauce, you'll thank me later.
author: Chong K.

description: I can't believe I have never reviewed this place.  Another great place to an a pint and catch up with co-workers or pop in after a day of shopping.  As far as pub food goes I think it's my favorite place for food.  Everything I have had has been excellent and the place isn't a grubby bar you feel weird ordering food at.  The place is huge so there is a designated place for eating and drinking.  The service is always great too so that is always a plus.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I've been meaning to review Foley's for a bit. We had a good time here during the day watching the Preakness. We were there for hours drinking and eating. Memorable notes from that day were oyster shooters with delicious small oysters, excellent bloody marys and friendly helpful servers.

Last night we visited again, spontaneously. It happened to be Albert Guiness' birthday. If you stayed until 10:30 PM you could get a glass of Guinness for $1 off. I was pretty snooty when the manager told me about this "deal" at 5:45, and by about 8pm he had the waitress whisk away our napkins - the sign they want to turn your table. But anyway, that's business. 

The food here is very good quality at Union Square prices. But. it's not lousy food. We had the Boxty - smoked salmon on a kind of pizza crust with good creamy sauce, veggie irish stew (a tower of mashed taters with asparagus, mushrooms , other elements and lots of gravy), spinach salad with bacon and such (also towering and overdressed, just the way I like it), beers and irish coffee (the irish coffee was very satisfying). 

It's a stately place with a semi-mixed crowd but on the upscale side. They've been here a long time and I consider it a safe union square staple for nearly any crowd willing to pay union square prices. A friendly place too except for "the business." :-D
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, I did. Christmas shopping in Union Square and SF Shopping center worked up a hunger and thirst in all three of us. My two cohorts for the day were both born in the UK, so naturally, when they walked in and found soccer on the tele and a ton of nitrous beers, they were quite content. 

Server took nearly 12 minutes to even approach about drink orders in a third full section, oh no no no. Food was eh, okay, but also took a lifetime to come out of the kitchen. Everything as a whole was ubber overpriced. 

I like an occasional Harp's Lager every now and again, but I don't want to age a full year in between the two rounds I had there. Blerg!
author: Tony C.

description:
I can't account for the upstairs section, but the basement level piano bar is a very fun spot.  Two piano players "duel" it out with classic hits and throw heaping amounts of sass at all of the guests.  A few downsides - the drinks are fairly expensive, but luckily the bartenders are very quick and capable.  Also, the pianists themselves are not bashful about asking for tips, but they mostly do it in a playful way.  More seating, or at least some stools would be nice.  
I'd come back again if in town, good place to bring a few friends or an after-work get together!
author: Jesse R.

description:
Went here today for the 49ers game it was a terrible experience. The place of the walls that breaks the place up in 4-6 sections are in no exact spot to watch the TVs/Game that's on. 

The server was a negative star if possible. He seemed like he was annoyed by us from the start and didn't want to deal with us. It felt like a fake smile the whole time during the game. He brought out the bill for our table and the next one to us to try to turn around the table at the start of the 3rd quarter. My sister came back from the bathroom wanting to order dessert and asking the waiter for a menu. Annoyed as hell he grabbed the check off the table and my sister grabbed him to apologize about it. He stated that I requested the bill when I didn't, I spoke up and explained that he brought out and no one requested it. At the end we split the bill in cash, told him to keep the change and he came back to the table asking me "Is that right? Is that right?", waiting there staring at me. I opened the bill for the first time and apologized for miscounting the cash by $10 less. So we left him the proper tip and left. Very rude, very cold, no customer service at all. 

Food wise, it was half and half, 3 stars. Steak sandwich was GREAT! Wings were the worst and tasteless wings I ever had. The fish and chips, knowing that its busy, was cold and sitting there for a while before being served to me. 

Overall, not a good experience. I wouldn't visit again to watch any games, eat there or have drink.
author: Andre E.

description:
I don't think they were ready for a convention full of highly intoxicated people on a Wednesday night.  They had dueling pianos to keep us entertained, but the drinks spoke... sang otherwise.

I asked for a jag bomb - dirty.  He looked at me crooked, "I don't have any red bull here." I asked for the next best thing to red bull.  He still looked at me crooked, "what do you mean 'dirty'?"  

I'm no bartender, but I'm pretty sure I didn't get a dirty jag bomb.  It came in a pint glass - half full.  And gross.  And expensive - $20 expensive.

Small place. Pianos are fun.  Drinks are pricey.  Great if you're staying at the Hilton or the Nicco Hotel.
author: Nadine Y.

description: Came here yesterday with a large group of people after my friend got married and all the staff were really nice. I got the fish and chips which were awesome! Also, whatever temperature they keep their kegs at is absolutely perfect because the Sierra Nevadas I drank were ridiculously delicious. A little expensive but worth it forsure. Gotta bring my boyfriend in some time soon!
author: Melissa C.

description: I wrote a critical review of this place in the past, but had to change it since starting to frequent the dueling piano's they have on the weekends.  Some of the best dueling paino outside of Vegas or New York, absolutely a blast.  Still not a big fan of their upstairs and prices, but overall the paino's are a great experience.
author: George M.

description:
I stopped in for a drink and maybe some oysters, however I found myself ordering multiple apps to enjoy and scope out. I went with my homie and he was into ordering shellfish. We ordered the half doz oysters, oyster shooters, Chile dusted calamari, and Irish whiskey creamed mussels. 
The food shocked me because it was balanced and seasoned well. I honestly don't every expect much out of an irish pub....and let me tell you I have eaten at plenty of them. Here is a rundown on the food....
Calamari was perfectly fried and crusted in a very tasty seasoned breading, I could tell the oil in the fryer was fresh and there was no lingering taste of burnt product. The house made tartar is a perfect accompaniment for the heavy fried squid, light tangy and refreshing. 
Oysters---fanny bay are not my favorite, but with the sweet mignonette and mind blowing cocktail they ended up as probably one of the best oyster's I have ever had in my life....Props to the BOH....
Oyster Shooters- they were good, needed booze....I knew what I was ordering....they were just fine
Mussels - The mussels were so fresh and tasty....The sauce could have been thicker but the dish was a blast of flavor in every bite...
I will go back to pick on other dishes.... Seasoning seems to be the hardest thing we do in the industry and this kitchen has it down! 
Thanks Chef!
author: Gary D.

description:
A good place to grab a drink after work and relax after a long day. 

I liked the layout of the area and the dimmed lights. It makes the place more personal when you're with a group of friends. Definitely a lot of places to sit but the place gets pretty packed on a Saturday night.
author: Viel A.

description: Went for appetizers after some shopping in Union Square...this pub was right down from our hotel, the Hilton.  The hostess was very friendly and helped us find the perfect spot to watch the football game.  Our waitress was also super friendly as were most of the people at the bar.  I loved the atmosphere as opposed to the first pub we walked into...Lefty Odules which is cafeteria style.  Johnny's had a great vibe about it!
author: Meegan G.

description: I like it here but I wouldn't go out of my way to come unless I was in the area. My husband and I always seem to stop here mid shopping to get our energies up for more shopping. It's never hard to find a spot and they have a good variety of beers on tap.
author: Beatriz C.

description:
This place ain't too bad. Good for all to enjoy themselves. 

This is definitely a tourist bar. I went hear a few weeks back with some of the fellas. A buddy wanted to go here and then vanished for the rest of the night with some chicks from Chicago. 

Love how this piano pub attracts quite a crowd. Loved how the band played and sang all kinds of different songs from different genres. Everything from Snoop Dogg to Meatloaf to the Carpenters! Hilarious! 

For a touristy spot its not bad and drinks are as expensive when your pretty slaughtered and having fun. Overall i recommend this spot. Check it out when you get the chance. 

My take, 3 out of 5 stars.
author: Bob E.

description:
Bloody Mary... seriously, I've been searching all over SF and here it is just blocks away from me! 
These bloody Mary's are really tasty and they come with everything you could possibly want- its a full meal deal! 
Mine had a full celery stick, pickled asparagus, green olives, lime and an onion. 
The food is pretty good too. My friend ordered the sliders which looked really tasty, and the spicy french fries. The spicy fries were a bit too vinegary for me (tasted like Kimchee) but everyone else in our party seemed to like them.
author: Janell D.

description:
For me Foley's is the mecca of Irish bars you all know the saying Irish today hungover tomorrow well it seems to be my motto when we make our yearly pilgrimage to the Bay area it seems I must purge my soul here to the beer gods which I do very well I might add. It's called practice practice just keep the cold harp coming.
 
Great pub grub, good service we split the some chicken skewers very tender and nice and a filet some really tasty stuff cooked perfect with a nice side of white cheese (mac n cheese) yes soaks up the harp just fine.

The only down thing is a 4% SF health tax. ??? We were told its to help pay health insurance for the employees. 

I will be back soon for my next visit and hell Foley's is where I'll be.
author: Steve B.

description:
This is a review for the dueling piano bar downstairs.

According to the sweet Irish lass on the phone, the pianos duel Wednesdays thru Saturdays starting from 9 pm and battling all the way until last call at 1:30 am.

Lots of great energy and requested songs that everyone knows, for the most part. The entertainers like to the keep the crowd active and even put a spotlight on people (literally) and make them come up to the stage. Beware if you're siting near the front. They won't hesitate to pick on you.

Decent amount of seating and bar stools, but get there early because it tends to crowd up (as a good bar should).
author: Kim L.

description:
I didn't get to go downstairs, there were two options, either listen to "guitar" upstairs or "band" downstairs. So we opted for the guitar, the entertainment was good, servers were nice and friendly.

Since we came from a big dinner we only had drinks and dessert. It looks well kept and they've got mostly visitors from out of town going in.
author: Edward I.

description:
Popped in for a few pints last night and would definitely go back. The bartender was nice and prompt. As soon as I stepped up he came over right away to get me my Guinness. 

Patrons were also super nice - people were moving to let us around, some guys stepped aside and gave us their table, saw several couples making out in corners *jealous*. Overall everyone seemed happy and friendly. Having a welcoming atmosphere will get me to go back for sure. 

peace, love, and good booze were all found here ~ chase
author: Chase S.

description:
Time for a Pint. Pretty good food, as far as pub grub goes. Really nice bartenders, and great atmosphere. Good live music most of the time. 
www.johnnyfoleys.com/
author: J R.

description: Pretty good food, server was overwhelmed.  A fun if touristy atmosphere.
author: Julian H.

description:
Have been here each time i have visited SF as i usually stay at hotels in Union Square

is it touristy?  yes. 
are some things overpriced? yes

but the beers are cold, the liquor selection plentiful, the people are all very nice, the food is quality, the entertainment is solid later at night, and its a good location.

will continue to give this place my business until they do something wrong.
author: Dan L.

description:
Popped in for a pint of cider (or 3) the other day with a friend. 
We actually was there specifically for the cider being on tap, and was magners. yum

So a few days latter, my husband was looking fwd for some steak so I thought to try there restaurant out.  Great success.  :)
My smoked salmon was delicious and cooked just right, moist and butter in the mouth. And any addition of nuts to my meal is always going to win points with me.  Husband got his steak and was cooked rare, you have no idea how RARE it is for steak to come our rare when asked for.   My husbands father is a retired 5star chef, so it is really hard to impress with food generally.  But he was very happy with his meal and already looking forward to trying more of the menu in future.

Service from our waiter was impeccable, and I am really hard on customer service.   So for me to use the word impeccable, I mean it.
We ordered way too much food (still not used to the massive servings here in the US) + some pints each... came to around 120.   I think if we ordered correctly, would have been easily under 100.  

I am not one for live music, so luckily we were all finished to leave just as they started up at 10pm.   This simply exceeded the usual run of the mill irish pub food we generally get back home, so left very satisfied.
author: Monica C.

description:
It was freezing in San Fran (as usual), so my friend and I popped in to Johnny Foley's for some soul-warming goodness. Loved the atmosphere: lots of dark woods and cozy bar seating. 

We lucked out in that there was a musician singing and playing the guitar. The waiter asked us if we wanted a table right in front of him or on the other side of the joint. I thought it was an odd question -- of course we wanted the table in front of the live music!  But I think now I know why he asked that. The musician was rather bitter and obviously wanted to be in a real Irish pub where patrons swig ale while singing along to each song. He made comments whenever possible about the lack of tips in his jar and about how no one appeared to be paying any attention to him. Dude: it's a restaurant. We are eating our dinner and talking to our friends. We didn't come here because of you!

About the dinner... the food was yummy!  I ordered the shepherd's pie and a large glass of ice cold beer. The warm mashed potato dish was perfect for such a cold night and the beer was good, too.
author: Ambs W.

description: This is the Irish House to go to! If your thinking Irish food, think Johnny foley's! Very lively in there! Sometime you have to wait to get in, but once your in you soon forget you even waited. Totally worth it. This is not one of those places where you wait in line, finally get your table, and you are disappointed and feel as if you wasted your time. The service i received from the waitress was above average, i recommend this place for a good time with friends on the weekends.
author: Michael M.

description:
Some caveats before I begin my review:  I'm vegetarian and irrationally suspect of IRISHNESS!!!!! in the U.S..

That said, I ended up in here twice during a recent week staying at a hotel very nearby.  

The first visit was with friends, as we were in pursuit of a beer to pass time waiting for another friend.  We were seated, our waiter was friendly, we ordered some fried calamari and onion strips to much on, and the beer was not watered down.  Solid.  Even better was that the onion strips were well-seasoned and NOT soggy like most onion strips out there in the world.

The second visit I had just walked out on The Worst Indian I'd Ever Had, was desperate for anywhere serving food at 10:45pm, and saw that this place was packed and proudly served until 1am.  Solid.  Except..... I waited for 5 minutes with no host to seat me.  And then did a walk-around looking for a spot to sit or a way to order at the bar.  Nada on both counts.  I left lonely, hungry, and wanting a beer even more than when I came in.

Average it all out and I do think I've experienced better.  But hey, what are the odds you'll walk in those shoes?  Three stars out of fairness.  Not two, but not four, ya know?  And damn, I needed four that second visit....
author: Meghan B.

description: My friend and I wanted to try something new and the wait time in some of the restaurants this past weekend was ridiculous. I suspect it had to do with Santa Con and the holiday season...but still! Anyway, we came in and were seated right away. It was nice to just sit and relax. I ended up having the Foley Cesar salad and spicy fries. The salad was great because it had the anchovies in it (I love anchovies). The spicy fries were flavorful but not spicy (at least not to me). We had a great time--good food and conversation. Affordable and great staff! Will definitely come back! LOVE.
author: Mel P.

description: Stopped in during a day in San Francisco for some good pub food. The pulled pork sandwich with cilantro and swiss and garlic fries did NOT disappoint! A pint of Guinness to go with it was the perfect accompaniment. Service was prompt and friendly, and I was seated near the bar area right away. I would definitely recommend!
author: Lisa L.

description:
fun, chill, laid back bar! 
really needed to use the restroom & my friend and I ended up having a few drinks!
author: Enjoying Each Momen T.

description:
Stopped through here on Friday night thinking it was just an Irish Pub type place... maybe that is the upstairs, but downstairs is a dueling piano bar party. 

Maybe I don't go out enough, but I didn't even know San Francisco had a dueling piano bar! Based on complete knowledge of music and lyrics and ability to belittle the crowd in an entertaining way, these guys don't really compare to the one's I've been to in Texas and Kansas (I know, my out of state outings are happenin!) That said, if I had been drinking more, Johnny Foley's would have been out of this world awesome.

Dueling piano bars are great because you can
1) get a "free" show, pay for a song request but no charge to get in the door and watch
2) request a song and have it played more or less right away (though they sometimes botched the lyrics, they knew every song that was requested while we were there)
3) it's like a karaoke bar except you are signing with everyone not standing alone making a fool of yourself.

There is also a small place to dance if a certain song really speaks to you and you just gotta get up and let it out.

Extra points for having my drink of choice, cider =)
author: Kelley C.

description: Nice place to have a drink and a quick bite to eat. My husband and I sat at the bar and split the Shepard's pie. It was pretty good and we were there during the afternoon so it wasn't too busy or noisy. I'll be back.
author: Danielle C.

description: Amazing service and top notch Irish comfort food. The food is excellent.
author: Scott M.

description: Nice place, nice decor. Food was o.k.. I liked the fish and chips but I'm not sure it was worth the price (not too expensive either though). Worth stumbling in or out of if you are close.
author: Justin N.

description:
Solid entertainment for a Wednesday night. Drinks weren't terribly expensive although we missed happy hour. It was fun to sing along to the songs and the pianists had a lot of personality.

However, unless you give $5 they won't play your song. And it has to be something really popular, non-pop. If you give them $20, you can sing!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
OMG never been to a Dueling piano bar before! My friend took us here to show us a good time and sure did we have a blast! The piano players played the crowd wonderfully! The drinks were however a little on the steep side but the entertainment was fantastic! 

America LOVE!
author: Jac J.

description:
This place is SUPER FUN!  I briefly dropped by recently on halloween.  They had two performers with duel pianos going on (a friend told me both these guys are always here) playing cover songs and taking requests from anyone.  I love live music...especially when it's mixed with a bit of freestyle and flavor.

People were dancing on stage and rockin' out across the entire bar!  I liked the vibe, everyone was very cordial and drinks were fairly quick.  The set-up is a mixture of small tables (seating 2-3 people) and a bunch of people standing next to the main bar.

I've also been here during happy hour - where it's much more tame since the live music is taken out of the equation.  To some reviewers mentioning it may be a little pricey...it is in the heart of union square so you can't expect prices to be like a dive bar.  Wonderful time...brings out the Irish in me!!!
author: Yup S.

description: Great food, great service, great place all around! A must for people who love good Irish food and atmosphere! My family and I always stop by here when we hit San Francisco. You will not be dissapointed!
author: Rachel F.

description: Classic Irish pub...VeryCool...Will hang there again the next time I come to SF
author: Michael S.

description: Service was friendly but the food left something to be desired. The clam chowder was so bland. I think they even skipped salt & pepper?? Texture was good but no flavor. Fish and chips were decent. Not cheap eats either - this plus one beer was $37.
author: Jenn E.

description:
It's pricey, but it's worth the occasional outing.  The place itself is large, has great wooden decor and is very clean, and definitely does "Irish" right.  Great tasting beer and incredibly yummy food!  Try the salmon boxty, or anything with a side of mashed potatoes.  :)

Good for a date out with a paddy or to bring your parental units to for lunch.  I've also seen plenty of business folks discussing their stocks here, but it is a bit boisterous (an Irish bar after all) so be aware.

Of course, like any other Irish bar on St. Patrick's day, this place gets packed, and a bit insane and rude with bouncers and waiters... and most everything gets served in plastic cups... which has its disadvantages.
author: Vicky B.

description:
Don't know bout the food... and can't really mess up a Stoli soda, but DO KNOW that the dueling pianos are awesome!!! Well, I think dueling is a misnomer.. more like duoing pianos? The two back to back pianos work together to make awesome music.. ones that you can sing along with and drink to. The only thing that would have made this experience even better is if they had one of those karaoke things that scrolled the lyrics for you so you didn't look stupid when you yelled out the wrong words :) 
Just come with a bunch of tens, write lots of requests, and the bar is yours to own for the night. The best thing I saw (yes, the little green monster reared its ugly head) was when a girl was brought up to sit on the piano and was serenaded by ten guys, "Happy Birthday" in proper form.
author: Janet H.

description: Highly recommend Foley's for dinner then some fun with dueling piano's!
author: Robyn D.

description:
This place is a typical cookie cutter irish pub.    Nice selection of beer, service is good, food is good (we only tried a couple of appetizers)  As fas as cost, this place is a bit overpriced.

The bad news is, we stopped in Saturday night for a quick bite a few minutes before the kitchen closed.   The hostess said it was not a problem and took us right to a table.  We ordered two bowls of clam chowder, which was quite good, but it was barely warm.  We also ordered curry fries and onion straws... These dishes both were soggy and cold so the watiress (who was great) brought them back to the kitchen.  However, the fryers were already shut down so they took them off the check.   What I realized is that when we ordered our food, the kitchen was already shut down, hence the cold food.   Why seat us and allow us to order if the food is going to be cold and soggy?   I found that annoying and probably would not go back...   .  Plus it is SUPER loud in there.  So loud that I could not talk to my husband at all.
author: Karen M.

description: Planned to go here for the dueling pianos thinking it was free but decided to go to the bar next door once I found out it was 10 dollars. The live music was great  and we danced a lot. However, when my boyfriend and I decided to go out and get some air we were denied entrance both the piano bar and the normal bar we just walked out of because he was "too drunk." He wasn't belligerent, wasn't  falling down, all he did was hand the man  his ID, and plus all our friends were inside the bar. It was really bizarre, considering that my boyfriend is in the military and just returned to his hometown from sea, we weren't doing anything wrong, and we just spent a lot of money there! RUDE
author: Olivia F.

description: I think I like this place a lot.  I have come here a few times to meet up with my "boys" who are visiting from southbay.  It is definitely filled witha  lot of men in suits and not too many girls, but hey for me I always enjoy the visuals.  The service is always pretty good and my drinks are generally strong enough, so no complaints there.  I just recenly got the gorgonzolla, walnuts and apple salad and was glad I got it small because it was plenty big enough once I added chicken to it and I was very very very pleased.  It was exactly what I was craving at the moment.
author: Rebecca D.

description: This place is so much freakin' fun. It's a modern-day saloon. Request your favorite songs to the piano guys and dance on stage or have a blast watching other people do so. Def recommended for a fun night out.
author: John R.

description: Its huge, piano bar downstairs but theirs a wait and cover.
author: Wes D.

description: Watched Game 5 of the ALDS here with my brother.  Great food--I got a potato/fish gratin and wine and my brother got the corned beef and cabbage with a couple of Black and Tans.  Service was great and prices are about par for the theatre district.  I would definitely go back.
author: Jo S.

description:
My friends and I came here for valentines day for the dueling piano bar.  It was, hands down, the best evar.

We stayed for like 4 hours and sung our asses off.  The drinks were not that great, so suggest just going for wine/beer.

Maybe it was just because it was valentines day, but the crowd was a little on the older side, like really old.  It was...odd seeing people my parents age get smashed singing to queen and bon jovi.  

Also come with plenty of cash, the pianists won't play your requested songs unless you tip them and the highest bidder gets their song played first.

We paid 15 bucks for them to play ABBA's "Mamma Mia" and had to pay an extra 20 bucks just to get them to stop playing the current song and play ours because we'd been waiting for 20 minutes for them to play it.  He said "You know here, we play whatever you pay so here it goes."

Apparently he didn't know the lyrics to Mamma mia so he had to read it out of a book while he played and only our small group sang along as the rest of the old dudes and cougars in the bar didn't enjoy ABBA one bit, you'd think for people who grew up in the era of ABBA would have sang along.  Oh well whatever d-bags.
author: Kameron K.

description: Great ambiance, beer selections and descent food.  Very reasonably priced too.  Didn't have a chance to go into their "cellar" where it was a little busier but the restaurant side was the low key atmosphere my wife and I wanted.
author: M.J. J.

description: Food, drinks, atmosphere, staff excellent, specially the smoked salmon...... Ate here twice. Great bar, excellent location.  Would definitely recommend here.
author: Imelda M.

description:
Good Space, good service, cleaner than most irish bars/ pubs. I guess it's because they also serve full menus. 

Prices weren't bad. I don't think there is happy hour (deduct a star..) $5 draft beer. 

We ordered few appetizers, which were all yummy. But then again we were starving, so we devoured the plates FAST. I trust my tastebuds so i will still go with: the food was yummy. and slightly above average other bar fares. 

Ordered: Buttermilk Fried Onion Strings (fried well, maybe could use one extra minute in the fryer to darken the coating more), Buffalo Chicken Wings with Gorgonzola Dip & Celery Sticks (standard Franks hot sauce wings.. ok.
