Nothing special), Niman Ranch Lamb Sliders with Eggplant, Goat Cheese & Mint Aioli (great flavors, 2 in an order, so we ordered 2 plates for our party of 4. The sliders are ya know.. small, Bread could have been less crusty so it would be easier to eat.. but i liked it), Smoked Salmon & Boxty Pancake with Dill Cream & Scallions (my fave of the dishes. The smoked salmon was perfect. Dill dipping sauce was on the side so you can apply accordingly. nice and light). 

Overall.. 3.5 stars.
author: Felicia T.

description:
My review is for the piano bar downstairs.

My friends and I stumbled upon Foley's on a random weeknight and we'll never forget it.  One of the best nights ever.  It's very tourist-heavy so if you're a hardcore local, you might hate it.  Even so, the people really helped make the night fun.  Everyone is extremely friendly, even the pianists.  They really involve everyone in the songs, pull people up on stage, battle each other, make the crowds battle each other, and gives birthday people plenty of attention.  Be sure to carry tons of $1's and $5's so you guarantee your song gets played.  You drop off your song sheet and $$ on the piano then they'll play your song according to how much you tip...or the number of requests they received.  

My only complaint is that they made my drink wrong and put salt around the rim of my glass instead of sugar.  It was a nasty realization but they made me another drink, problem free. 

I've been back a few times and will definitely be coming back for more - one of my favorites now.
author: Margaret T.

description: was here last night for the game. great service, food and drinks. even had dueling pianos downstairs. I love Foley's. Great place.
author: Mandy W.

description:
The one bar I consistently go back to in the city.

My experience with this bar started with one of my good friends who is Irish taking me here in 2001. Very cool place. Very unpretentious and authentic feeling. Not a bunch of hipsters drinking Pabst like you find at so many bars in the city, just normal people drinking a variety of drinks.

The beer selection is really good. The food is really good. The staff is always friendly. The restrooms are clean. It just all comes together to be an enjoyable place to hang out.

Just recently found out about the dueling piano show at the downstairs bar. Absolutely awesome.

I've brought friends from all over the world to this bar, and they've all loved it. What more can you say?
author: Stephen R.

description: Nothing special here, except for the location. Appears to be a tourist trap based on prices relative to pubs a few blocks away. I got the fish n chips, which were average in quality and moderate in portion. Beer was just ok in pour and temp. There are many better options than this place considering the locale.
author: Mark J.

description: Overpriced, and the 'dueling pianos' act they have is absolutely terrible - the guys have no talent.
author: Darren O.

description: Good Irish pub with a great selection of beers and whiskeys.  The floor space is huge, but it's a bit awkward how it's split up by partitions throughout the dining area.  The Guinness was really good and it's one of the few places I've found in the states that had both Murphy's and Killkenny on tap.  Bartenders were quick and helpful.  It was good that they had live music, but not a great cover of 70s/80s music.
author: Patrick B.

description: You come here for one reason. Great beer but get the chowder soup fantastic. Chicken wings ok. Not great. Having had the best Duffs in buffalo. These pale. Great Irish bar atmosphere. Stop in have a pint.
author: Chas P.

description: Expect it to be packed, expect the waitresses to be rude and short tempered and expect the drinks to be overpriced! Other than that it's a great spot! Even if there is a table open for an hour you cannot sit at it unless you are ordering food! Beware, if you are only drinking you will be corralled to the railing and only served when they damn well feel like it! The only real positive to this place is the location! There are a lot of other things to do around this area! Oh wait!!! There are a lot of other things to do in this area! Bye bye!
author: Jay K.

description: Great dinner spot with active bar scene.
author: David B.

description: Good food, good atmosphere. My biggest complaint is a very rude server. A medium height/medium build blonde girl (not sure her name) makes her negativity very apparent.  If possible, when you identify her bad attitude early on, avoid an unpleasant experience and request a different server!
author: Ryan R.

description:
Dueling pianos, fantastic drinks, and hot Irish bartenders named Ger.

I will be back ;)
author: Laura W.

description:
I totally dig this place.  I met up with Amy Z (Oh nooooeees Amy Double Trouble!) here and I broke my drinking hiatus plans spectacularly while she alternated booze and cough drops.

The bartenders were cool and managed to keep up with the huge crowd really well.  I was surprised and happy to see a decent wine list (especially for a pub).  My fish and chips was great, albeit the first time I've eaten fish and chips in possibly 12 or 13 years.

...and there were a lot of real Irish people there!  Simple things make me happy, and Irish people showing up in an Irish pub does it for me.  It's even better when they buy you drinks (even if you can't finish them all).  I'm the sort of person who likes to pester people about the countries they come from (i.e. Is it really as beautiful as it looks in pictures?  What kind of toilets do you have?  What language do you speak at home?  What language do you speak in school?  How does your education system work?  Blah Blah Blah).  I didn't do that to these dudes...which is probably why they kept buying us drinks, but I'd definitely go back to pester some Irish people.  So...Irish people be warned, I'm comin' for ya.  *insert maniacal laughter*
author: PrincessPeac H.

description: The service is good and i love the look and feel of Ireland. I love their fish and chips and of all things their Kale salad. I usually take my food to go because the one thing i dont care for is the music.
author: Debra O.

description:
got sick after drinking 1 pint of guiness dont drink the guiness there
they must not clean the pipes,stick with bottles,very over priced  7.25 for guiness  other beers 6.75 dollars,service is very poor,
theres a lot of bar men but they are watching each other ,and where they put the tips,
they seem to be watching each other putting tips than serving 
very unfriendly staff,dont expect to  meet irish there its an american bar ,people go in to have 1 drink and leave 
its a nice bar,they always have good bands but much too loud,
so if you drink there only drink bottled beer
author: cc c.

description: Great pub, large with lots of space.  It was refreshing to not be packed into a pub like sardines.  Good food, the beer on tap is COLD (which I love), and the ambience is excellent.  I had a rib-eye which was pretty good.  My wife liked her prime rib.
author: Jim G.

description:
Food is meh and beers are on the pricey side. 
Second time I end up in this place...
At least this last time we invented a new sport: butter skiing.
author: Dario B.

description: Bartenders were rude. Thank god for the good music otherwise I wouldn't come back!
author: Ali M.

description: When I can afford to go out drinking in the city, I always have a great time here.  It is usually packed, and for good reason. Good bands rock this traditional brasserie on the weekends.  They do pour a good pint of Guiness
author: Patrick H.

description:
My friend and I didn't arrive in San Francisco until after 9pm (on a Sunday night).  By the time we got there, we were exhausted, and all we wanted to do was find a bar close to our hostel.

It wasn't very crowded-- and since I don't like crowds, this means I was a happy camper.  We found two seats at the bar and got our drinks.  The bartenders were great: very attentive and highly amusing.  After my third drink, I commented that I was a bit too drunk... and the bartender handed me a fourth drink and said, "Well, let's see how you feel after this one!"  Ohhh boy.  Yes, I got a free drink.  My friend also got a free drink or two.  (Possibly not the best idea: I drunkenly hit on the bartender.  Hey, I couldn't help it: he was cute, had an Irish accent, and was a pretty funny guy.)

Drink prices were about average: I've paid more before, but I haven't paid much less.  Really, though, the stars are for the quality of the staff.  There was some sort of live music happening, too-- maybe karaoke?-- but I wasn't paying much attention to it.  It wasn't anything special.

It was a good night.
author: Jenna A.

description:
JF's served its purpose - food and drinks within walking distance from our hotel.  Prices were a tad high and they did not have a burger on the menu - isn't that a staple at most tourist places?

My cottage pie was surprisingly tasty and super hot (temperature).  The place starts to get hopping and LOUD about 10ish (near bedtime for me).
author: Emily W.

description:
Remind yourself that you're in the TL, get over that frightening thought, and relax a little while your guard is at mid-level. This place has live music, drunks galore, and a few interesting characters. Located a stone's throw from union square and the crackheads off of o'farrel st., you'll find yourself people watching for a moment, then enjoying those same people's wild opinions of their moment in history.

Location: 2.5 stars
Atmosphere: 3 stars
Price: 3 stars
Menu Selection: 2.5 stars
Beer Menu: 3 stars
Last impression: 3 stars
author: J Q.

description:
Jaeger Bombs at 3pm.  That's how my friends and I were rollin'.  We ordered them after we ordered beers, food AND closed our tab.  But, we were on vacay and ready to drink.

Our waitress was a little loopy, but, eh...we didn't really mind!  Food was good, beers hit the spot.   Nice place to relax bit after sightseeing took its toll on us.  Seems like a friendly atmosphere.  Tourist trap or not, we enjoyed it!
author: Melanie V.

description: I had the pleasure of making Johnny's acquaintance while on business in San Fransisco. It happened to be on way back to the hotel (hotel Fusion just around   the corner).
author: Stinky C.

description: They always have football(soccer) on the tvs and the bartenders are great.  The atmosphere in this bar is excellent and they even have free live music there some nights, which I just learned sunday.  The drinks are on the expensive side, pint costs $7, but it is a nice place right downtown.  If they only had Caffreys on tap, I would move down there.  I did not eat here on my last visit, but I have eaten there before and it is high end irish bar food.
author: Thomas H.

description: Outstanding corn chowder, prime rib, vegetable stew, great service. Please move to Connecticut.
author: Pete L.

description:
The cellar at JF's is the place to be if you like to sing out loud and make a fool of yourself in public. I had a great time singing and dancing with some good drinks raised in the air. I loved the crowd, people of all ages and walks of life. The only complaint I have is that it is HOT and stuffy down there, oh, and there may be a line to get in but it tends to move quickly.
Definitely Worth a try.
author: Alex P.

description: The food is good and THE SERVICE IS GREAT!!!! Hardest working hash slingers in the area. Every time I go there they are busting their b**Ts. I hope they are appreciated. I cannot remember our servers name and she was great.
author: Ann P.

description: Johnny Foley's has a great steak although I don't do red meat anymore! But the food is great whether it is steak/french fries, watching a game with a ton of sportsfans and fun people in one of SF's most desirable locations for fun, close proximity to shopping and SF cool styles. Crowded brew pub, easy hangout coupled with a very diverse menus and people and that's the bay area!
author: Jonathan F.

description: I've always passed this place but never went inside.  Went here last week and I was surprised to see the place so crowded.  Plenty of tourists and I seemed to be the only asian in the place, but whatever.  The place is located by union square so your pockets will be pretty empty by the end of the night, but it's a fun atmosphere and good food.  As for the dueling pianos....what a cool shindig.  Never heard of dueling pianos before my friend took me here.  It's a nice spot downstairs with an intimate feeling and another bar.  There were 3 piano players rotating throughout the night.  2 of them were flamboyantly gay, but could sing really well.  Request music and make sure to tip or else they'll call you out in front of everyone.  They're very sassy, a little rude, but really funny.  This makes for a great spot to take visiting friends to.
author: Alex G.

description:
My friends and I can spend the whole evening and night drinking in this place.  I wouldn't know but, I will take my friends word that the beer is really good. I don't drink beer but, I can say their mixed drinks are fabulous.  We have been here quite a few times and I always order the same thing for dinner. I get the filet mignon, it's so dang good and I know I would regret my decision if I was to change it up and try something new.  

The only thing that sucks about this place and it's the only reason they are get a 4 star not a five is that they will not put your name in to be seated until your whole party is there.
author: Martina B.

description: This place is good for a beer or 2 with friends when you are trying to figure out where else to go. They have a great beer selection (it IS an Irish bar, after all) but the food is nothing to write home about. Since it's near Union Square & a bunch of hotels, it is usually packed with tourists & business travelers.
author: Erin S.

description:
Johnny Foley's just skyrocketed to the top for me after last night. Sure, it's a bit of a touristy pub, but they do know how to pour a Guinness, which is 8/10 of what being a proper Irish ale house is all about. I've on occasion enjoyed some food here as well -- they do the classics like Shepherd's Pie, Fish and Chips, even a Madras Curry a decent amount of justice. They even have authentic Irish people there!

But last night is what one me over: I was there after nine pm, and that's when Nicole McRory (http://www.nicolemcrory.com/) took the stage (she's there every Thursday). Seeing and hearing is believing is all I have to say; if you don't have a perplexingly good time listening to her, then don't go away mad, just go away. 

To add to the night, some drunk Irish guy almost punched me becuase he thought I was drinking one of his Irish Car Bomb shots. Then he realized he did himself, and apologized. You can't make that stuff up.
author: Nish N.

description: Really amazing Bloody Mary's before storming Macy's boot sale, totally rad fish and chips + black and tans après .
author: Kandish B.

description:
I love foleys, really. My boyfriend and I come here ALL the time. But as of a few nights ago I discovered that Foleys is only great when we stick to what we know.  

I was craving a bruger, and I ordered one. The review stops there. 

Dont get a burger at foleys unless you want to pay a ridiculous amount of money for something completely sub par.
author: Britney K.

description:
Foley's is a great Union Square bar.  I say that because it's clean, friendly and therefore not cheap.  Not overpriced by any means, but not cheap.  

Monetary hangups aside, this is a great Irish pub and the people working here are very friendly.  They helped my buddy with music when he wanted to propose to his girlfriend and that was pretty nice of them.
author: Corey V.

description: Typical faux Irish pub but pricier than most. What has moved me to post is the fact that you cannot get hot or even warm water in their remodeled restroom. I tried every which way and waited quite a while but no hot water. Yuck.
author: Niall M.

description:
This place is always packed and we have walked out a couple times - just too much to deal with - but we got in a couple weeks ago - amazing during the holiday rush!!  The staff here is great- they are unbelievably busy but manage to provide great service!  Good Job all!!

If your just in for drinks - the tables are reserved for dining until 10PM - but you can stand up at a ledge or maybe if your there early enough you could get a seat at the bar. 

The food is average - we had appetizers and beer - the onion rings are great - made from red onions so they are sweeter - the order is enormous!!  The beer is fresh - and the prices are to be expected for the union square neighborhood.
author: Julie B.

description: Great looking place with lots of atmosphere, but with out a doubt the worst bartender I have ever encountered, a complete miserable human being.  When we sat down at the bar we were planning on staying for hours, but after a few pleasant exchanges with the man behind the bar we left after an hour and won't be going back.
author: Ryan C.

description:
A tourist trap indeed, but when you have friends from out of town and they're knee deep in beers, you just go with it.

A college bud came to visit in the city and was staying a few blocks away at the Clift, so I met him at Foley's.

I love Irish pubs, and this place didn't disappoint. They had a great live band, the crowd was lively, and being around ppl who were so excited and in awe of SF made me even more thankful that I'm living in the best city in the world.

Our server was on top of it. She made sure our table was never empty handed and was friendly throughout the night. 

It was great speaking to all the Europeans as well. So proud that the Euro was strong and that Obama was elected. Good times. Good People.

Not sure if I'll be back anytime soon, but if I'm in the Union Square area, I'm guess I'll pop in.
author: Mike K.

description: When this place opened years ago, replacing what I think was a French restaurant, I thought this place would never last. I was wrong. I like this place, but something about it is very claustrophobic. I only go here during off hours, to avoid the crazy crowds.  Great selection of Irish beers...
author: Jim B.

description:
This is a great, authentic-feeling pub that somehow manages to make you forget you're in the Tourist Bermuda-Triangle Hell that is Union Square. Jason K and I once took a visiting band of boozey brits to Foley's and they liked it so much that one of them tried to put the moves on me. Ok, maybe that wasn't because of Foley's. But it did happen there. And he was pretty hot. And I am pretty taken, so it doesn't really matter anyway.

Johnny Foley's is also a good place to take your manorexic best friend who hasn't eaten all day but has burnt a lot of calories pushing food around on his plate and also happens to have been pounding mimosas and beers since noon. By 9 p.m., when you get to Foley's, he'll be dropping pints of Guiness on the floor because he lacks the strength to grip the glass. Two times is ok, but on the third dropped Guiness, you're going to want to put him in a taxi home and keep the brits for yourself.

Go to Foley's. It's big. It's comfortable. There are always men there and a lot of them appear to be foreign out-of-towners. Which means one-night-only in my book. And if you're single and that's how you roll, this is the place for you :) Friendly bartenders and a decidedly un-Union-Squarish crowd round out the experience.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I've been here three times.

First Time - It's  New Year's Eve and I just saw Cake at the Warfield.  I have a hard time getting a drink, because the bartender is only serving his friends.  I contemplate throwing a drink in his face when he finally serves me.  I drink three New Castles and end up getting sick on BART.  I no longer drink New Castle.

Second Time - I have a few drinks and share some stringy onion things with my friend.  A man that I have not talked to nor made eye contact with buys me and my friend a drink.  He looks like Russell Brand and is from South London.  While he is out having a cigarette, I drink the rest of his beer.  I also leave without saying goodbye.

Third Time - I bring my heavily pierced and heavily tattooed ex boyfriend here for some drinks.  He informs me that he's "really not into drinking anymore."  We order dinner and it's good, but I'm over the whole situation.  

This place is always crowded and I guess that's what you get for going to an Irish Bar that's so close to Union Square.  The area is slightly labyrinthic and isn't a very good use of space.  I just never feel very comfortable here.

It's A-OK.
author: Annie G.

description:
For an Irish pub I'm going with this is as good as it gets. We noticed this place because of the Certified Guinness pour sign they had displayed in the window. Being from Toronto I've never noticed this. After a day of walking around town we stopped in around dinner time.

My buddy and I had ourselves a Guinness (of course), definitely was poured right.

Ordered at the table was some Clam Chowder, 2 sets of fish and chips and a cottage pie (or shepard's pie). 

If I were to complain about something I would say I wish the clam chowder was thicker. Taste wise it was great. I'm nitpicking though. 

The fish and chips my buddy and I had were amazing. Tartar sauce was fantastic, not too strong. The F and C was served with mushy peas. Sounds interesting or maybe gross, they were great. My girlfriend's cottage pie was phenomenal as well. 

I hate a pub that has bad food, this place is the opposite of that. Great food, great guinness. Everything else falls into place.
author: Timothy J.

description:
I apologize to any staff and patrons who frequented the convival Foley's Irish House last Thursday.  That was me singing at the top of my lungs during the dueling pianos portion of the evening, and dancing jigs on the dance floor like a maniac.  But this is the magic of Foley's: once here, you will not be able to help yourself once the pianists play those keys for honor and to liven up the crowd.  It is basically Irish karaoke on pianos.  One more apology for my insistence that the pianists play 'Sweet Caroline.'  I have an affliction: I must sing cheesy Neil Diamond songs whenever the opportunity strikes.  And where better to do it than in the middle of an Irish pub?!

So.much.fun.  But I can only speak for the dueling pianos.  And for the strong Martini which was a perfect start to a night of wonderful buffoonery.
author: Kira K.

description:
HEY!!! This is my first mobile review!  I just left this place and am giving evil stares at it across the street where they DO let you sit at  BAR tables and order drinks.  
FU Foley's for making your BAR tables for food service only during tourist season.  Just because the Euro is sofa king strong, you go and white tablecloth the fuck out of round bar tables meant for Irish car bombs? 
I am a Foley, that is my birth name and my excuse for having broken capillaries on my nose (a.k.a alcoholic).  

Today I stand ashamed for being a Foley where at Johnny Foley's "Irish" House.  I was denied a drink because there was NO wait and the last remaining BAR table in the house was reserved for some fucking tourist who would have spent $60 on fries and cokes when I would have spent $100's on liquor and ordered food...eventually.  

Hey Johnny, have a Molotov cocktail on me, right through your sell-out stained glass window & kiss my IRA ass.
author: Michele M.

description:
Be aware that when you walk into here on a weekend, it's like walking into an armpit - NO CIRCULATION!

I guess I had a good enough time here. The entertainment would be defined to most rude, crude and lewd, but nonetheless interesting and amusing. People are pretty much focused on one thing here: Their own enjoyment. So put away your polite "excuse me" or "pardon me's" because nobody is going to give a hoot. Literally. You will be smacked, elbowed, pushed, shoved and have your drink spilled by the amount of  people in this place, but hey, everyone's just trying to have a good time, so it wasn't that big a deal I suppose.

If you're looking for a Ruby Skyy kind of vibe, you won't find it here. People aren't as nice. The bartender's were obviously understaffed, and the air smelled of stale sweat. There being no circulation, beads of sweat started to drip down my face. NOT FUN. Time for the ladies room.

Fresh air, more space, or less people is required at this venue to make it do-able for me and what I believe would be the opinion of the general populous. Did I have a good time here? It wasn't something that ruined the night, so yeah it was okay. Would I come here again? It probably wouldn't be high on my priority list.

3/5, so very neutral. No more, no less.
author: Tisha G.

description:
I think that if I am going to pay over $5 for a beer that it should come with a tablecloth, a view or bar snacks.

You dont get that here, and I was getting that same cheated feeling with the food - good pub food, a bit on the pricey side for what you get. 

This place did save itself with a few details;

1. High celings - I just like high celings
2. Live music for the music addict in me (though we did leave right as the band started playing)
3. Free dessert for the birthday girl at the table, and the opportunity to sing loudly and embarrass her, not once, but twice, without the establishment getting upset
4. Great company, and we all know who you are with can completely alter your opinion of a place

Not a bad place. I would stop back in if in the neighbohood, but wouldn't make a special trip.....unless it was someones special day, of course!
author: Drue C.

description: The place has a poor selection of beers (the same old boring "British/Irish" beers and appetizers that really disappoint. Coupled with sub par service and this is the review you get
author: Rad S.

description:
if it's not the gold dust, it's johnny foleys.  this really is the bar for every man, i have been coming here for longer then i'd like to admit to, bringing just about everyone i know here at some point or another.  in the days before husbands, alicia k., sarah s. and i used to book rooms @ the palomar, shop all day, down half a bottle of vodka in our hotel rooms then stumble here to flirt with the various irish/english/scottish tourists that you will inevitably find sitting at their bar.  (in addition to black dudes,  english guys also appreciate chubby white women so we were often very popular here)

times have changed, and i no longer frequent bars because they have a high chubby chaser ratio or for that matter a high ratio of lonely foreign men, but i still do love foley's.  you really cannot have a bad time here, the pub food is good, the beers on tap are great and they usually have some sort of live music thursday-saturday.  my favorite being "nikki" the folk singing transsexual who covers the song "jackson" and sings BOTH johnny AND june carter-cash's parts.  now that's fucking TALENT.

(see uploaded photo)
author: Jessie J.

description:
Back in the dark age before Beck's rise and that of Portishead, San Francisco drunkards enjoyed a cultishly popular fusion called a Snakebite. By "enjoyed" I mean "blacked out, sometimes beaming". The formula is pilsner and hard cider and is a decidely higher alcohol content than beer alone, though easier on the pallet than snorting testy (and sometimes cloying) ciders all night. It doesn't take a bartender on the Space Shuttle to mix one for you, though many younger Big City mixologists look at you askance when ordering. Let me tell you, when Grunge ruled the city and ponytailed men stomped around in shorty longs with thermals showing, most hotel bartenders would have one in your paw in a hot minute. So will the barmen here at Foley's. Were things better back then? Faack, I dunno. I was very, very drunk. It's more a question of whether you prefer Paul's Boutique to Sour Times. 

[SF/X: Whatever Sixpence None The Bitches passes for pub rock here. Whatever happened to hanging in a Mick bar and being bombarded with The Pogues and Van The Man? There's a giant portrait of Bono in bug-eye shades over the gents khazi. Why then wasn't I subjected to One, Pride AND Angel Of Harlem both inside of a half hour?]

For me to pay $6 bucks for a pint it had better be Carla Ds birthday. Fortunately, EVERY day is Carla Ds birthday at my house. Also fortunately, they have STELLA ARTOIS here. Stella is being muscled out of City taps in favor of the vastly inferior Trumer Pils and its salaciously phallic pint-glass. Stella loves being the beer in a Snakebite too. Clearly the Oirish Haus doesn't price their pints for your typical pasty-faced yard-sleeper with flecks of paint all over his clothes. Neo Oirish.

I feel like they must have polished off a few layers of murky bar patina sometime here in the 80s in an effort to class this joint up. Maybe that funk wound up in my Beef and Guiness soup, which was overly salty. If and when I come back here, I'll likely pull the pins on their Shepherd's Pie, with a Star or so hanging in the balance.

But I have to ask, why no Pogues?!? Fer fook's seck.

And to big Jim Dwyer/The man of wire/Who was often heard to say/I'm a free born man of the USA!!! Repeat...
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I was waiting to meet Carla D and Drue for drinks/a quick bite during my dinner break this evening when I bumped into a couple of very red-faced co-workers at the bar. They joked that I shouldn't be drinking and then returning to work. I assured them that I never drink, ever, and then popped a Vicodin. 
One the bar... The ambiance felt too new, too fake, too clean to feel like a real pub; the menu too pricey, too California. I mean, who the Hell serves fish and chips with a cilantro aioli? On the plus side, I sat right across from a picture of Oscar Wilde which brightened my day somewhat. 
There's really nothing actively horrid about this place, then again, if you're on narcotic pain-killers and still uncomfortable in a bar, something there is definitely wrong.
author: Daniel W.

description:
I've been to this pub on a few occasions and it's really your typical Irish pub.  They've got a fairly good selection of beer, although the price for beer is a little higher than I'd like to pay.

I've eaten here a few times and last time I did I had the Bangers and Mash, which was delicious.  Little on the pricey side though.

It's right downtown so expect a lot of tourists there, but all in all a nice place to grab a beer once and a while.
author: Dylan H.

description:
Oh irish pub, you def proved me wrong. You're not filled with old men drinking beer. You're filled with a young crowd, well, still drinking beer!

Cottage pie. Mmm, stuff got me full so quickly - I was shocked! It's probably 'cause I had these delicious crab cakes to start off the night with. But that cottage pie, filled with mashed potatoes (tip: be in the mood for a load of mashed potatoes. If you're not, you probably won't like it) & at the bottom, there's another layer of something like ground beef. Mix the two together & that creates magic! Temperature wise was super hot in the beginning - burned my tongue slightly, so be careful. 

And the downstairs bar was just oozing with fun, laughter & music. That was the first time I ever witnessed dueling pianos & I look forward to future visits to come. Alejandro was a great host and next time, when I have more time, I'll definitely request a couple songs to be played!
author: Steph W.

description: Shopping in Union Square last weekend we were looking for a breakfast spot. Instead, we went into Foley's and it was a little bit of heaven. It was semi dark and cool, Irish background music, World Cup on the big screen and lovely waitresses. We had fish and chips, buttermilk fried chicken, pulled pork sandwich, shepherd's pie and a delicious ceasar salad. The food was so good no one was willing to share. We finished with a warm apple pie and good coffee. I can't wait to go back!!
author: Susan V.

description: My friend and family went here on New Years Eve, when all the other places wanted a high cover charge or private ticketed only events, we found this place by our hotel and it was perfect. They are family friendly and accommodated us quickly for a party of ten. The food was great and not too expensive. I will visit this place again when in the area!
author: Joel M.

description:
I suppose it's good if you are a tourist and don't have anywhere to go, but personally this place gives me a headache.

Some of the bands that play here are ok, but I didn't like the service or the overall feel of the place... a bit generic for my taste, and I've definitely tasted better "Irish" cuisine.

Pros:  Convenient, sometimes ok music, mixed crowd

Cons:  Bad service, generic touristy crowd, music can sound more like a bad karaoke night at someone's wedding reception

I have friends visiting from back home every year and pretty much always steer them away from this spot.
author: N J.

description:
Cover your eyes if you are a blind follower of all things Irish!

The portrait of Bono that hung above our booth could hardly make up for the inhospitable hostess. A propane torch could not un freeze her frigid pinched bitter face.

The food was so so and came before our drinks arrived. Bloody mary's were good but not worth the attitude. Apparently someone gave my card to a manager because half way through our stay they were nice to us. Blah.Blah blah.

 If you love all things Irish this is a great place but if you are looking for friendly service and good pub food try somewhere else
author: Ellis D.

description:
Good Lord, this is the most OVERPRICED Pub-Grub I've ever encountered! Don't get me wrong, the food is good enough but man, 15 bucks for Fish and Chips is a bit steep for my liking.  I'm sure Foley's is just another one of those Union Square area restaurants that can get away with inflated prices and still rake in the dough from the hordes of tourists who walk out the front door of their hotels and literally stumble into it.   

It's really too bad because it's a nice-looking place, plus being a bit of a bibliophile I've always been a sucker for Irish bars with James Joyce or Oscar Wilde memorabilia in the windows and on the walls.  Oh well.

My advice to anyone in the area with a hankering for some tasty Fish and Chips would be to head down Powell Street past the Cable Car Turnaround and then walk a couple blocks down 5th Street to The Chieftan, you'll get a great authentic Pub experience and the same quality food for around $10 instead of $15.
author: Mike J.

description:
Johnny Foley's was so much fun! We stopped by as we were aimlessly wandering around. 

It was packed with all sorts of people, and definitely had an inviting feel to it. We only stayed for one drink, but it left a lasting impression on me. 

I wish I would have stayed long enough to listen to the live music though. I will put that on my to do list next time. After all, I can't miss out on the chance of dancing around a bar and not feel out of place!

Service: B
Ambiance/Decor: A++++
Drinks: A
Food: ?
author: Jana S.

description:
I've come here several times over the past 8 years and given that this place has a tendancy to be filled with tourists, it's pretty good. I'm not surprised that many tourists find themselves here since Foley's offers a decent Irish pub experience with high quality Irish pub grub. The bangers and mash were great the last time I had them and if I'm near Union Square and in search of a relaxed sit down meal I'm likely to give Foley's a shot.

They seem to offer dueling piano entertainment even though I've never experienced it myself. If you're a sports fan and in search of a decent TV downtown this is probably worth a shot as well. Last Saturday when I was there a large group were enjoying the ALCS baseball playoff.

I'm very likely to be back here when I'm in search of a decent lunch or feel like grabbing a decent pint of Guinness downtown.
author: Bryan B.

description: Ate the shepherd's pie.  Got sick for a week.  $40!  Pie made me ill for 24 hours. Ugh!  Avoid! Avoid!  Avoid!
author: Chris V.

description:
This is a Great place to get a group of friends together. Since its major tourist central, the drinks are a little pricier than many of the local haunts, but very mid-range (i.e. Pints are $6, call cocktails $10). The food is great though, i usually stick with the Burger (1/2 lb Niman Ranch), but the mussels, come in a creme' sauce and are wonderful. Calamari, Prawns, Oysters and Skewers are all good on the app side. I've never had the Main Courses (Bangers and mash, Etc) or Panini's so... cant comment. 

On weekends they have great bands. Check their calendar and see if "Livewire" is playing. Excellent dance band. You can also find them at www.lwband.com
author: Adam X.

description:
Roll in and there is a bar table with my name all over it. I got a speedy "Are you gonna eat cause this is reserved for people eating dinner." At bar table, in a pub, at 9:00, and on a Tuesday? I'm not Catholic or Protestant, but ok. Whatever. I take a quick look around and evaluate the situation. I proceed to roll out back to see if there is any additional seating at the bar and get barked at again. This time by a waitress with food. "Food Food" was all she said. At this point the Irish was truly coming out in my blood. These bitches were hoarding there tables like they were saving for the next potato famine, and I was friggin thirsty. I was out quicker than I got in, and that usually doesn't happen till later on in the night... Never again.

Your shepherds pie is shit...
author: Caleb B.

description:
Absolutely nothing to write home about.  Typical tourist bar lacking any kind of local flavor.  That means that everyone in there is nice and it stays busy, but typical and ordinary in every other way.  For a more local scene, head across the street to the Union Square Sports Bar.

The look: black and white mini tiled flooring, dark wood tables, chairs, and bars, high ceilings and bartenders in white coats.

http://www.cleanscores.com/2527
author: Ann W.

description:
NOTE: This review is only for the piano bar downstairs from Johnny Foley's. And judging from the prices, I can't imagine going into Johnny Foley's without a hook-up. Woo doggy is it pricey! $11 for two lamb sliders about half the size of my palm? Bitch, please!

My friend Robert organized a bunch of people to get together as one of his friends is one of the piano players. Dueling pianos was on the menu, which sounded intriguing and had heard it was a good time. So why the hell not? So I went for the dueling pianos last night thinking "Oh, it's a Sunday. I don't want to be hung over tomorrow and I want to be in bed around 11. I'll be here for an hour or so."

AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA..........AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

God it was SUCH a fabulous time! The piano players were funny and talented, inserting nasty lyrics where they felt appropriate, calling out special occasions (playing "I like big butts" for some girls from Alabama while they shook it on stage) and generally making the evening enjoyable for everyone. 

My friend Brian and I broke in the dance floor to I don't know what but what ever it was, the piano players were happy to comment on how awesome we looked (side note: Brian can make anyone look good. Especially when he has enough space to do aerials. I *heart* aerials). 

In fact they were happy to comment on everything. Including my breasts. I shit you not; direct quote "You can serve drinks on those things!" I had no idea if I should be horrified or flattered. I think I got away with a little of both and a very red face.

In the end I didn't leave until the show was done, around 12:30. I sang at the top of my lungs to the point where my voice is now hoarse, had about 5 drinks and an app and left the bar about $70 poorer. Usually that alone would dock the review starage at least by one but if I could, I would give this evening 1000 stars.

Kevin, you fucking ROCK!!!!
author: Alexis B.

description:
Pianobar downstairs, Saturdaynight:
- Very rude waitress (the blonde girl who doesn't smile)
- She takes half finished drinks away (confronted her, no polite response)
- Charged me on my credit card for drinks I didn't purchase! (I coincidently found out)

Really not a bad place, live music is nice, but keep an eye on this waitress and check you banking the next day.
author: Ruud V.

description:
Holy mash potatoes! I was impressed with the food, staff and entertainment here. My friends and I ordered fish n' chips, and the corn beef plate. The fish n'chip were very good, lot's of fish, not too much breading. My gf's corn beef platter was HUGE, with two kinds of potatoes, mashed (a good helping, might I add) and baby roasted. I've never seen so many potatoes on one plate. She loved it, though!

The service is good, very good for how busy it was. We went on a Thursday, a little busy in there. The best was the entertainment. A singer of unknown gender status was playing that night. It was great. The vocal range and the songs were tops. Plus, this person was very funny with the one liners. We enjoyed it greatly. 

I will be back here for sure, I enjoyed myself and the atmosphere of the place.
author: Candida R.

description:
Incredibly expensive (TWICE as much as other local bars) & amazingly rude
service (bartender). I had actually been advised not to go- shoulda listened.
This was my first & last visit. NEVER AGAIN!
author: Kaci S.

description:
I love this place!  My family has been coming here for ages and it has always been great.  The staff is so nice and the food is better than pub food...

oh yes


THE GUINNESS 

It's the best in the city, hands down.
author: Jess S.

description:
Still a great place! But I don't like it when prices are jacked up $1-2 just because of the St.Patty's Day parade.  Especially when the normal prices are published online...
Raising already pricey pints to gouge customers is not fair.
author: Joey S.

description: This place is fantastic.  I usually don't spend too much time in Union Square due to the crowds and tourist traps, but I had a great time here on a Saturday night.  We went downstairs to the dueling pianos area and although it was crowded and a bit hot in there, it was the most fun I have had in a long time.  The piano players really get the crowd into it and play some awesome songs, all while you sip on some good drinks.  Parking around here sucks and is a major rip off, but then again it is Union Square.  I will definitely come back if in the area or a group of us are looking for a fun to place to hang out in the city.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Hit thz spot up on the day of the parade.... And it was off the hook..... People was havein good time ...... Hella people bought me drinks here !!!!! I guess giants winning the world series brings out the best in people....... 11/3/2010 I will never forget!!!!! Off the hook...... It's hard to explain ...... All I can iz ..... U should of been there....
author: Marcus R.

description:
It was a birthday, it was a party, it called for city dwelling.
We wanted loud, we wanted brassy, we wanted dueling pianos! Enter Johnny's place. 

We were 12 strong when we rolled up in this bitch and had no reservations. None. With a little shuffling and heaving of tables, we were seating within minutes, had a great spot and already had our drink orders placed. 

Top priorities having been taken care of, we promptly got our orders in - got to hurry to get good seats for the show! and sat to laugh & yell and make a mockery of all things in general. 

Our food was prompt, our pallets quenched all within a completely reasonable time frame. Spinach salad and chicken skewers on the side were the order of the day and neither disappointed. The skewers are spicy, savory hot tender chunks served in cucumber-yogurt sauce that was tasty, tasty.

Salad was skimpy on the bacon, but had good flavors going for it to make up for that. 

Alongside it all is that ever flowing basket of Irish Soda Bread, a heavy dense, truly Irish staple that simply must be eaten for a real Irish experience.
Really. Even if you hate that shit. You think we Irish want ALL our food heavy and tasteless? Yeah, suffer through you little Brat. Try living through a famine, Sissy.
author: Katie W.

description:
Great times! Last night a group of about 10-14 of us showed up around 10:30pm. We were able to find ourselves a great big area all for us! The 80's cover band was playing all of the songs we could sing and dance to. I am pretty sure I was rocking out like a wild woman last night. Yes, oh yes, I have pictures to prove it ;) HA! 
Fun, great Irish Bar :)
author: Amy J.

description: Definitely 5 stars. We had our wedding reception and dinner here in the room for private parties and it was perfect. We had our own bar and bathroom. We had our own staff and Kate was fabulous at keeping things moving along and all of our guests comfortable. Seriously, I can't say enough good things. All the food was great, Prime Rib, Salmon, and Veggie Stew. I know the stew doesn't sound very exciting but man, it was SO good. I would highly recommend having a private party at Johnny Foleys.
author: susan k.

description:
Maybe I just wasn't feeling it that night, but there was something about the pianists that struck me as obnoxious.  Maybe it was the fact they were trying to get women to pretend they were playing w/penises (sometimes borderline harassment) or the fact that they came off as smarmy or the fact that they'll accept money to play a song but will try to convince others to pay more to get them to stop playing the song...

I don't know. The stars are more for my friends who did have a good time and for the fact that the pianists were keeping the crowd entertained for the most part.
author: ML N.

description:
Saint Patty's Day isn't complete without a visit to a good ol' Irish pub. Although I'm not Irish, getting into the green spirit is always fun times (especially when green is your favorite color). The minute I stepped into Foley's, I already felt the spirit and excitement of St. Patty's Day. Crowds of green, decorations, and the employees welcoming groups in with free give aways (green beads and little chotchkies sponsored by various beer companies).  A waitress placed a clover headband on my head right as I stepped in (Thanks! I wore this ridiculous thing shamelessly down the street!). 

Although crowded, we didn't wait too long for a table for 7. They have a good menu selection of Irish dishes (specials of lamb stew & corned beef for Patty's Day), burgers, potpies, even oysters. Oh, and a kids menu for the little ones. In honor of the day, I selected the corned beef dish complete with potatoes & veggies ($17 for the plate). It ended up being a really good dish. Flavorful, and satisfying! Topped off with a nice cold creamy cup of Guinness. Cheers to good food and drinks!

The atmosphere was great, fun, and very much lively. Pretty decent sized place, with tv screens playing classic Irish movies. And of course Irish music, but one of the best parts was the live music that came through. The service was great, and the waitress was very nice. 

Overall, I had a blast, and this definitely made my St. Patty's Day. I wish I got to stay longer and enjoy the festivities of the day! Foley's, I WILL be returning soon for some Irish fun!
author: Catherine O.

description: Classy Irish pub with good beer and professional staff. Plenty of space with many booths so it seems more intimate
author: Tommy E.

description:
We were 3 weary travelers coming in for a late dinner to Johnny Foley's with out reservations.  We were seated right away and greeted by a server who had a smile from O'Farrell to Market.  The food was excellent and we had an excellent time. 
I love to take people there for their first time just to see their reaction to the interior.  They look around with their mouths open and say "Wow!", this is awesome.
Good job JF's
author: Tom T.

description:
First, I'll agree with anyone who says the food is overpriced.  It is.  Quality is "meh - B to B+."    It used to be a MUCH friendlier place a few years ago.  Not sure if they changed hands, or had to get bossy and expensive to pay for a remodel but... I do NOT like the staff here anymore.  

There may be a few nice souls who work there - but I found our waitress officious and grumbly, and one manager (female) to be horridly humourless and dour and awful...  See below.

Turned up mid-week with kid in tow - very common so no problem with kids there (well there didn't used to be).  My silly child has a habit of taking a sip of mommy's beer.  She proudly, and rather goofily, announces to the waitress that she'll have a beer.  Hahaha...

Their response?  To send over the manger to lecture me on the inappropriateness, and illegality, of my child's drinking beer.

People - I respect that you have to watch your butts vis a vis the State liquor guys but holy GOD... this was overreaction in the extreme.  When I protested that it was an innocent event, and they shouldn't worry a bit, I was... lectured FURTHER.

If this has been an isolated incident of gruff or off-handed service I would say "bad night, bossy manager... maybe a one off."  But it wasn't.

I've been to Johnny Foley's several times since they reopened and it's been the same scene - NO warmth, really.  At least not with table service.  Perhaps people do better at the bar?  (say, I should bring in my kid and sit her right up there, what do you think?).

Skip Foleys.  A shame because it's a cool looking place.  But if you want warmth and genuine pub hospitality, almost anywhere will do better - and be more fairly priced.

Pig&'Whistle, O'Reilly's, take your pick.  But don't bring your business to this tourist trap.  :(  Damn... what DID happen to the "Old Johnny's?"
author: Juliana C.

description:
Please Note: I have never actually been to Johnny Foley's...I went to the downstairs room last night for MicX Dueling Pianos, and I am led to believe this is not an actual representation of the true Johnny Foley's.  If it is, this is more like a nice bar that your average Irish drinking pub.  

The room was nice and airy, despite being in the basement of the building.  A nice long bar, drinks backlit with blue light.  On average a martini was $8, which is super cheap for how strong it was.  Thank you bartender!!!

MicX Dueling Pianos rock my world.  I am biased...I came to see my friend, Greg, play...and he kicks ass.  Your repertoire has got to be insanely huge to take on a challenge like this.  We got some Journey, Grease, even a little obscure Beatles and Jim Croce (my fav)...and last, but not least, Queen.  Good lord, these boys are amazing!

So I give 5 stars to strong, cheap drinks...a nicely renovated basement...and some damn good music with two hotties who can sing.

Bravo and encore!
author: Jennifer E.

description:
Sort of average. Near Union Square should the crowds drive you to drink. My workplace seems to go there a lot for goodbye celebrations. The food is fine. The drinks are fine. The crowd can be totally San Diego Gas Lamp Guys with Untucked Dress Shirts. But whatever.

One thing I can't get over, however, is the bartenders assume they know more than you do, which annoys the crap out of me. Last time I was there I wasn't in the mood for beer and decided on a lemondrop. In earshot of the bartender I told my coworker I wanted a lemondrop, but "only if they have good vodka." 

Eavesdropping bartender: "We've got every top shelf vodka you can think of. I guarantee you."

Me: "Oh, good. Then you can make me a lemondrop with Hangar One."

Eavesdropping bartender: "uhhhh, well, um, we don't have Hangar One."

Well then guess what, dude-- you don't have top shelf vodka. You have crappy corporate vodka with a high price tag. This is the bay area, get with the program. Geeez.
author: Catherine H.

description:
Ate here for lunch a day or two ago and I liked it!

First of all, it was very busy.  However, our server was very nice and once she got going, was very attentive and very pleasant.

This was my first foray into an Irish place, and I had one of those pies with ground beef and mashed potatoes in it.

It was Dy-No-Mite!  Mighty tasty!  Would have really been good with some hot stuff in it like a lot of black pepper or red pepper.  But I like it anyway!

I will return to this cool place.  I didn't drink any pints, but I did drink a gallon of Diet Coke or Diet Pepsi!!

Good place, good food.
author: Cranky Greg M.

description: Pretty authentic and delicious pub food!  Went at lunch and the environment was pretty chill.  I love the bangers and mash, but I have to say the shepherd's pie my friend got was amazing.  I was so envious!  The service was really good and I never had an empty glass (very nice!).  They had bacon wrapped prawns as an appetizer that day and they had a really good sweet and savoury flavour to them.  I would definitely go back here when visiting San Francisco.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Foley's to the SF Zombie Mob, "Move to the back of the bus."

Walked in with a group of friends after getting done with the San Francisco Zombie Mob. Told our host that we'd like a place to sit and order drinks, possibly food, and we might also call some more of our friends from the mob to join us. He was very friendly and ran into the back to check for space.

After about 5 minutes he approached me with a woman whom he referred to as her manager. She informed me that me and my kind (the rest of my zombie friends) were not allowed to dine at her establishment. Her reasoning was that since we were dressed up (as the living dead), the rest of her customers wouldn't find that acceptable.

I responded back by letting her know that she just lost a lot of money (I could have easily had the place filled with a large booze hungered mob within minutes), what she was implying to me was very very rude and that me nor anyone I knew would be returning there ever again.

Embrace the city you do business in, don't push it away in favor of tourism.
author: Rubin S.

description: perfect guinness pour, good service, clean bathrooms, flatscreens w/ sports on...perfect place to chill while the Mrs. shops.
author: Anthony M.

description: Very good lamb stew! Great service with very fast response times. Eating by myself. Was given bread and beer and within a few minutes had my meal. Very friendly and lively place. Be prepared for it to be jam packed. Loved it!
author: Debra B.

description: Ok if you already ate and dont want to deal with crowds on a poppin day... head DOWNSTAIRS because thats where all the action is at. We celebrated early St. Pattys day be enjoying a dual piano playing show! It was the best thing ever. They played mainly rock tunes ie. Mr. Brightside, etc. All tunes are made w/ paid requests so bring extra cash. A room full of drunken mayhem, green feather boas, and big girls grabbin their boobs while they gyrate awkwardly on stage...
author: Thomas L.

description: Fun piano bar in union square! I came here with a friend last Tuesday and it was happening! The crowd was an eclectic mix including businessmen, tourists, college kids and couples. The only negative is that the drinks are a bit pricey but I guess you pay a premium for the live piano music.
author: Hannah N.

description:
I dont think i've ever had really irish food.... maybe some fish and chips...*wait* is that british? Oh well... any poos! The food isnt bad here. Came here with my cousin and her fiance from NY and he had a bad ass craving for some Banger and mash... i was like "banger and huh? Whatchu say?"

Had absolutely no clue what he said but mann was it good! Its a sausage and mash potato dish with some veggies.Now i know why they call it banger and mash.. the sausage was ohhhh sooo yummy and juicy and just hits your taste buds with a BANG!!!! (ok sorry i know.... total cheetos cheese ball line.... couldnt help myself) But that was THE BEST sausage i ever ate. Normally i dont like sausage cuz its heavy and gives me nasty pork flavored burps all day.. but this was really light and juicy and very mild in taste. OHHH tip- rub the sausage on the mash potato before  taking a bite and its heavenly! You can skip the colorful califlower, just makes the plate look pretty but nah just flick it to the side so its not an interference between your fork and the sausage/potato. First time eating irish food and im so pleased! Thanks Trish and Nick for the yummylicious experience. Oh almost forgot, i ordered a mushroom ravioli for myself from there and it was really good as well. Nothing fancy, not dressed with any heavy sauces. The pasta itself was very light (almost like eating fluffy semolino pillows) and had a nicely diced sweet tomatoes on top....mmmmm good stuff!
author: becky w.

description:
We went to the piano bar for a birthday party last night and, unfortunately, I didn't have the chance to try the food.  I had the brut (the only one offered by the glass) and it was, frankly, underwhelming.  That's not surprising for many bars, but it's still a bummer.  

Dueling pianos was cool.  The guys don't play your song unless you tip them, and it seemed like if you didn't tip them enough they'd just keep knocking you down the list.  

Our server was attentive despite the crowd growing as the night progressed.  

I'll go back again, though, if for nothing else to try the food.
author: Max A.

description: This is my third review of this eatery, as both my previous review have been flagged.  I assume by the establishment.  Anyway, I would not recommend this restaurant.  I have eaten here many times (due to many visitors staying in hotels in the area), and while the food is OK, it is not worth the downtown prices.  They seem to play up the Irish theme, but, having spent a a lot of time in Ireland, I can say from a well informed stand point, that the restaurant lacks authenticity.  I would recommend eating at The Phoenix Bar & Irish Gathering House in the Mission district if you want something yummy and authentically Irish.
author: Hm M.

description: Pretty cool place I suppose. I haven't tried the food though; I've only been to the bar once, which was on a Saturday night. Definitely loud and busy, might take a while to get a drink, but it's very fun and perfect for friends/family nonetheless. Also a great place if you have someone from out of town visiting; It seems like it'd be a perfect place to take them to on an occasion like that.
author: Anthony L.

description:
HATED IT! It was so hot and sweaty- all I could smell were sweaty bodies an bad/beer breath. The bouncer was nice, he was also from so cal. 

Maybe I am just not a "piano bar" kinda girl. They always seem like a bad bar mitzvah to me....but this was worse. This was like a bad bar mitzvah, in the middle of the desert, where everyone was trashed, beezies trying to dance and elbow me all over, heinous, aladdin looking pianists...oh and there was liek 6 girls in the handicap bathroom stall having a photo shoot...what gives? Hopefully I never have to come back. But that said, I doubt it is Foley's fault- I think its just the ppl a piano bar attracts at 12:00 am on a saturday night. Grandma should have been in bed i guess!
author: Jess V.

description:
What a fun place to have dinner!

I've walked past this place hundreds of times, and only recently realized they serve food. So, thought I'd give it a try. A pint of cider started things off nicely, followed by a cup of their potato leek soup and an order of the fish and chips. Good stuff, fresh and tasty. 

Our server was really busy, but was attentive without being smothering. A gentleman played various tunes on a guitar which added to the festive atmosphere. Or maybe it was just that the cider I'd been sipping had finally kicked in. Who knows? 

The decor, I should add, reminded me of a Harry Potter novel, a bit dark, woody, and various portraits hung about the rooms.
author: David G.

description: I like the Irish decor and vibe of the place, including most beers and food, but service can be atrocious.  I've been here on every S.F. visit and more than once I've been unable to get bartender's attention for a pint when it isn't very busy.  I'm not that short.  What the heck?  Prices were reasonable though, and it is convenient to decent hotels and shopping.
author: Albert H.

description:
I went here as a tourist. My best friend from college was visiting for a conference and they put her up in Union Square and this was walking distance. It was only about 8:00 on a Thursday so it wasn't too crowded. We only stayed for one round, but it seemed like a place I would go back to. There was a cute transgendered singer doing Irish songs, which seemed to confuse some people but I thought was cute as a button.

I did have one issue and I'm not really sure who's fault it was. Quite possibly mine. Somehow I didn't get my credit card back from the bartender. This confuses me because I had been paying with cash everywhere I went and there was only one drink on the tab when I bought a round of two. Any other time I would have written it off to me being lame. But I wasn't drunk and it led to a situation the next day where I was stared down at a breakfast place (see my revue for Tad's) because I lost my credit card and only had two dollars in cash to pay for my $3.00 breakfast. Plus I was in San Francisco with no cash and no credit card when I live in Santa Cruz. Thank God it was a Friday and not a weekend and I was able to get money out of the bank. If they had been closed or I didn't have my I.D, I would have been kerf*cked. As it was I wasted an hour running around trying to find a bank.
author: Tracey W.

description: Went back with some friends after a day of shopping downtown and both bartender and manager rejected my friends out of state ID because it had been renewed by sticker.  That's the way they do it in Louisiana. The disgraceful rudeness of the rejection was uncalled for.  3 Girls, me 26, them 24 and 23, just wanted a beer.  The place was packed, and we were in the mood to spend money.  We left, and drank at home instead.  I understand the dangers of serving underage minors, I have worked in the industry for quite some time.  But when in an international city, in an Irish Bar, I would think they would be more educated about the ID renewal practices of our own states.
author: Chelsea J.

description: A little pricey and it was just alright.
author: Kapena C.

description: Strange setup to the place - basically one giant room with a bunch of barrier walls set up to turn it into a big maze.  We had a group dinner in the far back, which has a huge table which worked out well.  Really nice waitress, lots of food and drink options.  Friendly crowd, this was a pretty nice place.
author: Jack F.

description:
Great Irish Decor and menu. They had all the Irish staples,
Shepards Pie, Fish n Chips, Boxtys & Potato/Leak soup.
I always judge on the result of the Potato/ Leak soup and it was yummy so they passed. Very happy & helpful service staff.
Will visit again for sure!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Good food for a pub, upscale style, and a packed bar.

This was not enjoyable for dinner (too roudy), but it seemed like a great hangout to grab a pint or two with some pals. I may try it again next time I'm in town.

They did have a band playing in the back on our way out.
author: Michael C.

description:
Foley's is the place I like to go to if it's a Saturday night and I'm with friends and we're just doing our thang. 

So after leaving the comedy show at The San Francisco Comedy College and Clubhouse, my friends decided that the night was young and my birthday bash was not going to end quite yet. We thought about hitting up a club, but decided that no one was really in the mood to dance. We all just wanted a drink or two and come stimulating conversation. So off to Foley's it was!

For a Saturday night, it wasn't as crowded as it normally was, which was really nice. My friends and I found a bar space and everyone found someone to talk to. The drinks were strong and tasty, and the service was quick. The live band was good, but it was more background music than anything. And the line at the ladies' restroom was always blessedly short. Because it was my birthday, and I was with a group of 8 people, I had quite a few drinks insisted upon me. After a couple hours, I left Foley's very, very happy. It was possibly the best way to end my birthday!
author: Judy F.

description:
Long has its clock dragged me off the street for a pint... Hey! It was time for one. 
I have never been disappointed here. The Guinness is poured well, and the Magners is always cold. Not to mention their brown bread which  is perfect for snacking on, or making a meal of with your pint of the black stuff.
All in all a lovely place to sit and catch up on some 'proper' football.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I have never gone here and not had a great time.

This place has been a stomping ground for me and my girlfriends since moving to CA.  The wait staff is great, good selection of beer and the food is YUUUUMMMY!

The live bands are fun, especially after a few Stellas! 

This is a great place for all occasions!  We took my sister here the night of her bachelorette party and watched her put away a couple dozen of what she called " the best mussels EVER".  It is also a great place to take a friend who is having a terrible day, the good beer and dim lighting helps hide tears.
author: Alicia K.

description: This is one of the worst bars Ive ever been to, this place is crowded; when i got in, i could not move, and it took me like half an hour just to get drinks, I wanted to speak to a Manager about letting my friend in, but had nobody to speak to, the bouncers are rude, there was no place to stand (don't even think about sitting) and it is too loud
author: Ann X.

description:
MMMM... Beer.  Lots of it.  Bass, Guiness, and others.

Good crowd (touristy and locals in one spot).  Good food.  Good beer.  It's all I needed.  Even the Austrailian and British people with me loved this place.

It's a great place to stop and get a beer before a show, while shopping, or right after work.
author: David W.

description:
It was the sign that got me in too! Best Bloody Marys in the city- Okay, no that isn't true. What drew me in was the fact I was touring the downtown area with a man who happens to have a penchant for pubs that can pour a decent pint of Guinness and particular fascination with Irish Icons on the walls. The sign however, did make my first drink, none other than, a Bloody Mary. Was it the best? No, but the sign had me at Hello and it wasn't bad.

At 3:00 on a Sunday, the actual bar was absolutely packed. However, a mixture of barring and eating we grabbed a ledge in an elsewhere location until we could get a place at the bar. I liked the way the tables were mingled with the large bar. 

The only reason for one less star is that our Waitress was not the best. Friendly, but not fast. She didn't offer us a menu, took a long time to take the orders, didn't really check on us. Not horrible things, just enough to knock it to a four star review. 

If I had to pick between this or the Irish Bank- If I was not sitting outside, it would be this in a heartbeat- Unless I had something to confess of course.
author: Danielle V.

description:
Came here last year during the USC/CAL game (USC won btw), it was pouring, and we had to find a place to watch the game. It's not really a sports bar, they don't have any tv's away from the bar. It was mad packed with USC fans though (fight on). We couldn't find seats in the bar area, so we had to stand up in the back while tables cleared.

The food was really whatevs. Basically what I'd expect from an average bar. I really liked the authentic Irish pub look though, a true bar in every aspect.

I was torn between giving it 3-4 stars, but I won't dock them for having mediocre food. It's a damn bar right?
author: Frank N.

description:
Love this place however if you want to sit at the bar it's a crap shoot because it's always full. In a pinch grab a table and order up the salmon pizza like appetizer with cream cheese. I turned the corner on smoked salmon because of this appetizer. The tandoori chicken is also very tasty.

Come with a group and enjoy the crowd
author: Dianne M.

description:
I want to give Foley's 3.5 Stars, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  

At 8:15 on a Friday, my friend and I were able to sit down at a table without waiting -- there's a lot to be said for that.  We weren't really hungry, so I can't say anything about the large plates on the menu, but the calamari and the clam chowder were decent.

The calamari was interesting.  It was seasoned in something spicy that made it taste almost like taco meat.  The funky mexi-pubfood blend was a bit disconcerting.  By far, not the worst pub calamari I've had -- it served nicely as finger food to go with beer.

Oh, and what beer it was.  The first sight on entering the place is an oblong view of a row of taps, clearly labeled with backlit handles -- Guinness, Harp, Smithwicks, Magners, Chimay, and a host of others.  The beer selection here is solid and dependable.

Our table service was prompt, attentive, and friendly, especially for a crowded, busy bar.  I've only got two complaints about this place, and given what it is, they're pretty minor:

First, for the level of crowd noise in the room, it's pointless to play indistinguishable music quietly.  Either play music that the crowd will get into, or play music that will blend seamlessly into the background.  As it was, the noise of crowd muffled most of the mid-range from the music, so all you were left with was some bass-line and whatever high tones made it out of the speakers...  The same song sounded like U2, Guns'n'Roses, and Matchbox 20 at different times -- it just frustrated me to try to figure out what the hell was playing.

Second, the decor and space combine to produce a really strange feeling.  There was a large (like twice lifesize) portrait painting of Bono on the wall next to us, flanked on each side by stuffed, antlered deer heads.  Bono and the deer were both looking off into the distance in the same direction, and it kinda seemed like his head was stuffed and mounted as well.  The ceilings are really high, but there are standard height partition walls placed somewhat haphazardly, which makes you feel small and claustrophobic at the same time.
author: Jay M.

description: Just a quick 5 star review, Johnny Foleys has the most attentive staff I have ever encountered. No matter how busy they will have a menu in front of you in minutes. I almost always sit at the bar even when dining, try it you,ll like it.
author: Paula M.

description: I was over it five minutes after I came in the first time, but then had to come back a few more times because everyone else seems to like it. It's too stuffy, the drinks are gross, and the dueling pianos concept really isn't that entertaining. I'm all for great music, but I squirm every time someone says to go here. If you live in SF, check it out once. If you're visiting the city, there are WAY more interesting places to check out. (And if this one any must-see lists, I have a bone to pick with those writers.)
author: Emilia S.

description:
This place was a pleasant surprise.  When I travel I try to give myself a range of eating and drinking options in the area of town in which I expect to be.  Johnny Foley's was not on my list, but we dropped in because we were hungry, and there it was.  I like the space - high ceilings and lots of tile.  The food was uniformly good, and the service was extremely friendly.  Plenty of good beer as well.

And, keep and eye out for the Rock Star as Religious Icon painting on the wall . . .
author: GL K.

description:
I love this place. The drinks are fantastic, the food is extremely tasty, the layout well designed, the ambience warm and friendly and the service excellent. The only reason I don't end up there more often is the noise. Evenings, especially weekend evenings, have historically had live music that I've rarely enjoyed and that has always impeded talking with the people I came there with. As a result, after shows I'll usually head elsewhere with friends, but when I do get into Foley's I always eat and drink well.

I went there with my girlfriend last night. We had an hour before a show we were catching, and let our server know that we were in a rush. We had our drinks, salad, meal and were out the door in 45 minutes. That might not seem like much, but I've tried to grab "a quick bite" at places like this before and found myself asking for a "to go" bag as soon as the food finally arrived. Not the case here. The staff really takes care of you, which more than makes up for the slightly pricey nature of the place (for a pub).
author: Dan W.

description:
I went there to eat last week. Accidentally left my favorite jacket. I call back the next day and I am so excited because they found it and put it away for me. They say that they will hold it until I can come get it.....
I had left town for a few days, I come back to get it... They gave it away. My favorite jacket, not cheap at all, just given away. It's probably hanging in one of their employees closets right now. Assholes!
author: Matthew D.

description: Good food, above average beer selection, outstanding whiskey selection.
author: chad h.

description: Had a great time here with my coworkers on a week night out.  They had live music on a Tuesday night and it was great.  The interior is actually bigger than I thought.  Bartenders were nice and knowledgeable.
author: Victor C.

description:
I really enjoyed this place.  Being newer to the city and wandering around Union Square on a Wednesday night, we couldn't find anywhere to go that wasn't a snazzy restaurant/piano bar.  Thats when we came across Johnny Foley's.  

We didn't eat, so I can't comment about the food, but it was the perfect place to meet up for a drink with a friend and chat. Thats not to say its dull, but you can talk without shouting.  It was clean, the service was prompt, and I didn't think $6 was too much to pay for my champagne.   One of my male friends was aggressively flirted with by a woman, approx. 20 years his senior, who resembled Phoebe on Friends.  It made for an all around good time.
author: Adrienne G.

description: The bar here is great, though pricey. I paid six bucks a beer and eight bucks for a whisky sour, which admittedly wasn't a great one at that. The beers though were great, and the ambiance was too, which is why I gave it 4 stars
author: Zach H.

description: This dueling piano bar has a good atmosphere, fun patrons, and good customer service. We have been down to the bar (near Union Square) a few times and have always had a good time. The dueling piano singers engage the crowd and it is easy to meet new people at the bar. Go early if you want a table, otherwise it is standing room only.
author: Jessica D.

description: We stopped in for drinks last night while they were serving.  Thought about dessert, so were seated at a table.  When we decided against it, a fuss was made that we didn't really deserve a table since we weren't ordering food.  May I just point out the fact that only a quarter of the tables were filled.  The decor was great, the drinks were fine, but the staff was incredibly snooty and uptight.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place is FABULOUS! The food is so good! Please Try the Salmon boxty appetizer soooo delicious!!
author: Niki R.

description:
Had another great time at Foley's last night - met with a friend that drove down from Seattle for a convention and I dragged him out and around the corner to Foley's for a few drinks and to chat.

We didn't order food but the times I've been here before, with rather large tables of friends, everyone at the table raved about their food, to include myself. They have one of the best in-house vegetarian burgers I've ever had. I do wish they had traditional boxty without the salmon (maybe next time I'll ask if the chef can prepare it for me).

So, big thumbs up for the food. Beer selection is about as good as it gets without going somewhere like Yard House - I'm a Guinness fan so last night was no different, a couple pints and I'm happy as a lark. It was really, really loud where we sat, unfortunately, due to the band (which wasn't bad at all, I just wasn't paying much mind to them as I was chatting with my friend instead), so now I'm hoarse this morning! But that's a Friday night for you. Lunchtime is a bit more sedated and relaxing.

The place was packed last night and we stayed until last call and then some, finally the doormen rounded us all up and out we spilled into the night....There were lots of pretty girls there and I'm happy to report that my smiles were returned :^D so that's a nice feeling - no reason not to be friendly at a place like Foley's.

I had no trouble at all getting a bartender, and I made several trips to the bar.

I've never had a bad experience here so I must unconditionally give it five stars, I think they deserve them!
author: Todd C.

description:
This place is a good place if you have a big group of people because of the size.

Service was good-- our server always wore a smile and was friendly.

I had the beef and barley Guinness soup and it was good but the entree was a let down. It's huge but the fish was very salty and tasted like it was frozen forever. Mashed potatoes was good though.

Will stick to the drinks here and not food next time...

Update on Dec 2007: came here for the second chance and had the fish and chips (bar food) and it was much better than previous experience!

Update on Feb 12, 2008: Came back for a drink on a weekend and found it's a 40 and over crowd, including the musicians. They were playing like 80s and early 90s music so it's good if you are into that kind of music...
author: T L.

description: Stella on tap! Oversized potato skins and some of the best fish and chips I've ever had. Oh and the smashed peas were flavorful. (think seasoned mashed potatos, except they are peas) Service was great.
author: Ruben A.

description:
Yeah, you're likely to have an expat on one side and a tourist or twenty on the other, but if you've spent the afternoon trapped in the shopping hell that is Union Square, there's nothing nicer than a well poured Murphy's Stout while sidled up to the bar at Johnny Foley's.

Unforutnately, it's closed for earthquake retrofitting - and if they don't hustle, my neighborhood will soon be home to a branch of O'Neill's (of San Mateo) - so it will be harder to justify tromping through the crowd of dazed tourists at the cable car turnaround just to get there. However, if I am ever in need of a time-out while exercising the bank card downtown, you can be sure I'll end up there before making my way through the tourists to get home.
author: Avery G.

description:
The Full Moon was working her mysterious majick last night and it took us hours to figure out what was going on.  Getting to Foley's at midnight, to find the "Prince Cover Band" in full swing, with no one dancing was strange.  Instead, the band was squirrelled away in a Fung Swayless corner and no perceptible dance floor.  Instead, the band came to our little quiet partay, and started singing to us and groping at us.  No lie!
