At one point, I saw the lead guirtarist humping my gf's leg and playing his guitar they were that lonely for dancers!  We obliged and got our groove thing on as best as possible on the DANCELESS FLOOR!  

Hey Foley's!!!  I know your hard core drunkard locals would rather focus on the tv and Guinness, but if you are going to have a rockin' band, provide some decent space to dance! 

What else?  Oh yeah!  Saw a woman throw a glass at a  man and shatter it all over the place risking bodily harm to everyone in it's path.  A man weighing at least 300 pounds fall like a redwood in the middle of the room without warning.  A small Asian man dancing and swirling relentlessly all over the room in a drunken stupor to the point I thought he would mount one of the poles and do us a stripper dance.

MORAL OF THE STORY:  Don't go to a drunken Irish bar on a full moon!
author: A W.

description:
I should have read Robert P's review. But then again I would have not known since I think we might have been at this location the same day.  I was there on 06/02/07 for lunch I had the calamari and a couple black and tans.  They sat me right next to the kitchen so I saw most of the platters that came out and they looked like good portions and very tasty.   

Then my calamari came out, at first glance you can see a pool of oil at the bottom of the basket. Then the taste just as is, no condaments.... bland and mushy. A very different texture from most calamari I have had.  It had a mushy over cooked texture, I guess its the best way to describe it.  People might think that over cooked calamari or octopus turns rubbery and hard.  On the contrary if you over, over cook calamari as sort of a braising you actually make it mushy and had no bite to it.  Another disappointing part was the Aioli, it looked like store bought mayo with no flavor at all.  Hello Aioli (garlic mayo sauce) wheres the GARLIC! 

The only good thing about this place is the service is fast and friendly.
author: David P.

description:
I have to agree that the prices are a bit high.  My friends and I decided to meet here b/c it was convenient, but that only goes to show that you never let non locals pick the bars.  

There were plenty of choices which you can order from, but don't get the fries.  It may look good on the menu, but it's not.  The drinks are a bit pricey too.
author: AhLin C.

description:
So we were tourists in SF from SD staying in Union Square and this was one of our safe houses. We went back when we were tired of looking for a new place and just needed food or drink. We did so because our first experience was good. And so were the next 2. We went 3 times over the course of 4 days.

The food is great if a bit pricey. Good beer selection. Great service. Great central location in Union Square. Varied menu focusing on Irish/American/California. Good beer selection. They say their bloody marys are "arguably the best." I would argue the opposite.

Fish and chips are great served with an herby aioli and mashed peas and fries. Oysters on the half shell are good but they're small! Caesar's good. Burgers are pretty good.
author: Aa-Ron L.

description:
I heart dueling pianos!

This was my first piano bar and it definitely rocked my socks.  I was surprised to see so many people in their 20s and early 30s chillin here.  Everyone just wanted to have a good time, dance, and sing terribly, which made it a fun environment to be in!  No one gave a F**K about looking like a fool!  Just enjoy yourself baby!

The downside:  It was ridiculously crowded at first.  Then a ton of people left around 11pm.  I like my place to be full and "poppin."  yeah i'm lame.
author: Liezl C.

description: I'm always searching for a good homemade veggie burger and this place has a great one!!  Slight curry flavor burger on brioche buns.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I love this place. Its always busy in there and its a big place. 

They have a great happy hour that sometimes includes some fellows playing accoustic Irish music. Good St. Paddy's day parties. The staff is really nice too.

The beer is always flowing if that's what you're into. Good selections for sure. I myself like the Midori Margarita unblended. Its really sweet, but I'm always good for 1. The food is good. I love the Salmon Boxties and all the different types of potatoes they have.  A great place to go after dance practice. Or any other time.
author: Marz W.

description:
I can't decide whether or not I like this place.  Everytime I come here,  I try to think of other places I can go to in the area.  It's just convenient and on route to the BART/Muni station.  What's a girl wanting a nice cold beer to do?  Take whacha got.  

The noise bounce off the walls, so it's extremely loud and noisy. You'll find yourself shouting to the person sitting next to you.  Then again booze makes you shout anyway.   I've only had the apps and its mediocre.  I'll have to give the "pub" food a try some other time.  

This is just a great place to grab a beer, chat with a co-worker and go.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
My girlfriends and I were here for Mad Pianos and decided to eat here. I'm not sure how I feel about this place.  It is a nice sports bar and such, but to have dinner here felt a bit strange.  They had fancy dishes along with the usual fried bar food.  I had the beer battered fish and chips because it seemed to be  hit with all the yelpers.

I found the fish and chips to be just okay. It was a tad overly oily for my taste, but then again...it's fried, so I can't really complain.  Overall, it was good and the fish was really fresh, but I started to pick off the fried parts and just ate the fish. I know, I know...BOOOO on me.  Their mushy peas were, well...mushy. It kind of reminded me of baby food. It wasn't BAD, but it wasn't GREAT. It's just fish and chips.

On the other hand, the almond crusted salmon that my friend ordered was really good. 

Service was mediocre. The waitress didn't really bother with us much.

I'd come back here to drink, but not so much to eat. Then again it's a bar, so I can't blame them.

I did have fun here with my friends and Mad Pianos was fun, but I will write a separate review for that. :)
author: Dolores L.

description: Did nothing but use the restroom here because they had stopped serving food by the time I strolled in, which was unfortunate, because I was really hungry and fish and chips sounded kinda good!  Anyway, bathroom was a mess and there was no toilet paper, only seat covers, which seems to be the way it goes in San Fran.  They had a band playing, which wasn't bad at all and lots of people milling about drinking.  Too bad the kitchen closes at 10 pm!
author: Prettylilredhead H.

description: Located on Union Square, San Francisco, California.  Foley's offers a great place for friends to get together for scrumptious food, variety of alcoholic beverages, live jazz, and excellent atmosphere.  This is a popular night spot for visitors due to its location in a tourist and shopping district.
author: Val B.

description: If you are looking for a fun evening with a group of people I highly recommend Johnny Foley's! This place has a great vibe that just forces you to have a good time. The piano players are extremely talented and before you know it, you will find yourself singing along! It is a great place for birthday parties or group events.
author: Kristin M.

description: We have had many Guinness at this place, always a fun time, music is awesome although u have to be a little patient wether they play ur song or not. But we always find our way back.
author: Daniela B.

description: Super fun pub! Older crowd classic environment, fun group of people. Love the downstairs piano bar, fun comedy style performance. Drinks are a bit on the expensive side, but the bartenders are friendly and and on it.
author: Laura W.

description:
Good:  
Great service- I encountered a really nice bartender when I went.  The kind that makes you enjoy being at the bar and keeps your glass filled.
Cool atmosphere.  

Bad:
A bit pricey as others have said.
author: Karl B.

description: A friend of mine brought me here last night. Awesome crowd!!:D We had fun singing with the performers..
author: Ella B.

description: Wow this was the spiciest bloody mary ever! It was unbearable but since it was almost $10 I forced that thing down!  It was one of the most attractive bloody mary's I've seen with the neat arrangement of veggies.  Very busy in here, older crowd. Nice character and can't wait to go back!
author: Stacey G.

description:
Good service, good beers, good food.

Crowd was loaded with douche-baggery. 

Erin go bragh!
author: Patrick G.

description:
Definitely a cool bar to kick back after a long day from work...  Decent price point & plenty of choices from cocktails to beers!

Phenomenal services...
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
yes, deserves 5* for being in a touristy location yet you don't feel as though you are treated as a tourist. Came for lunch a couple of weeks back as partner was working in the city. As soon as you step inside you feel transported into a traditional oldie world country Irish/British pub with class. Has a long bar with a couple of TVs. Historical artwork on the walls. It was quite busy for a midweek lunch time. 

Menu was full of traditional Irish & dare I say it - 'British' dishes and items even the picky American teen (I dragged along) can enjoy. Which he did with a cheese steak sandwich ($12) filled with good quality steak and a plate of 'chips'. He couldn't finish it and was excited to take a 'goody' bag of leftovers to hand to a homeless person on the way back to Bart! I wasn't too hungry and settled with a spinach, grape tomato, onion salad - it was huge for only $9 - loved the grape tomatoes which I'd never tried before and of course more leftovers! Partner was looking forward to Steak & Kidney pie which they didn't have and settled with Steak/mushroom pie which arrived in it's own clay pie dish, piping hot with delicious flaky pastry, tender steak and thick gravy. A side salad was included ($14). 

Service was excellent with super friendly bar staff. Spacious but with a cozy feel. Very clean, cloth napkins. Prices are no different to any other restaurant with style - did not feel it was expensive at all. Naturally if you want a cheaper menu you'd go somewhere without the quality of service, huge portions or tastefully decorated. Really no complaints at all. Would like to go one evening as I gather they have a a piano bar and performers on certain nights. Will be back. I believe I saw a family with a kids menu!
author: D B.

description:
Dueling pianos, booze, singing at the top of your lungs with friends and strangers.  Yeah, definitely a fun time.

Only thing that keeps me from giving this five stars is that our waitress was hella weird.  She complained to us about not tipping her even though we gave her a big tip in cash, not included in the credit card bill.  I noticed her dropping money earlier, so.... you can put two and two together.
author: Arthur L.

description:
For what I suspect is an IPco (Irish Pub Company) offering, I can't really find much fault. I went there to meet up with out-of-towners last night and was hit by a wall of human sweat upon entry, other than the jam-packed nature of the place though there was noting to complain about.  There was a folksinger loudly covering Air Supply in the back.

Still the thing I remember most about Foley's is the other time I went in and ate some bar food, some kind of Guinness stew.  I shared it with another, but there was still more than enough food to make me feel bloated full.   The food must have been decent, if a bit processed, 'cause I ate enough.  The point is that the portions were huge!

This didn't stop the couple at the next table - tourists from the Mid-West I assumed from their accents and dress - from ordering three appetizers, splitting a bowl of stew (just as we had) and each eating a full Cheesecake factory size entree.  I was awed by the sheer caloric intake!  This couple had just devoured more k-cals than an oil drum full of jet fuel.  They looked satisfied upon completing this gluttonous feast, and then, after a pause, the woman said calmly, with a small speculative tilt of her head, "You know, I could use a little something more."

I know, you're thinking, these were hungry fat people, but that was the odd thing, they weren't.  They were big sure, she at least 5'11", he 6'4", and large boned (knuckles the size of bison bones), even a little chubby, but nothing abnormal, nothing to indicate that 6-8lbs of food would leave them peckish.
author: Gustie L.

description:
So, we were just basically looking for anything yesterday where we could get a quick bite and a beer and stopped into Foley's, which I hadn't been to in years. First off, it's hard to really dock this place too many points because it is what it is, a by-the-numbers Irish pub that you could find in any of the fifty American states, all serving the same provincial menu of Americanized Shepard's pie, undercooked pannini's and oyster's with lemon juice, and of course, a place where you feel slightly queasy subsequent. 

Beer selection is normal and the bartenders were basic and humdrum as was everything, including an overabundance of god-fearing Midwestern tourists, probably intimidated by any real culture, so they slothed back to things that remind them of Kansas City or whatever. Needless to say, a quick bite, a quick beer, we were gone and on our to the way Nite Cap to get shitty, and I assure you next time, I'll just pop into a TL Thai house!! With so many wonderful, charming authentic restaurants and Irish pubs, this feels like something out of O'Hare Airport!! 

Oh, and the couple next to us literally moved down a barstool and and glared uneasily at us, I'm assuming because of the tattoos, greasy hair and educations, but we couldn't stop staring at his plaid shorts and tucked in yellow golf shirt and her terrifying fumpa!!
author: Steve l.

description:
I need to get back to this place. On a Saturday afternoon when my wife tackled the shopping at Union Square, I snuck down O'Farrell Street and came across Johnny Foley's. Sure as hell beat DSW Shoes. The crowd was pretty good, I was certainly not the only guy ducking the retail that day.

The place does well dressed as an Irish Pub and is certainly more authentic to what you'd find in Dublin than other places around San Francisco. It did well to pass on the Irish trinkets glued to the wall and instead has dark wood, etched mirrors, paintings, and matted posters and photos. The flooring, walls, trim, and casework all look like they have been there a while and not part of an Irish Pub kit you've probably seen elsewhere. In short, you feel like you're in the right spot and the surrounding neighborhood fits it relatively well. The bar, signage, and taps are particularly well done.

The beers on tap are the standard ones, nothing interesting but definitely a good assortment, and the food was surprisingly good for a pub. When my wife joined me, she had a pretty darn good salad and we split some lamb sliders that were pretty legit. So now it's not just a pub, but a restaurant.

The service was good, nothing stood out or otherwise, and there were some TV's on showing the winter X-Games which people were actually watching with some enthusiasm. The music was some general rock, no live bands at the time though it sounds like the dueling pianos at night are something to be seen. It's a good layout, the Irish House is deep and has many neat nooks to separate your group from the noise if that's what you want. 

I love places like this, Johnny Foley's does it well and is as good a place as any for a quick Guinness, a bite to eat, to watch the game, or live music at night with some friends. Almost as good as it gets and perhaps I change my rating if I get there on a Saturday night.
author: Dave C.

description: Very loud bar indeed.  I don't like shouting if I'm having drinks with friends.  The band played for a really long time.  Otherwise, this place is decent.  The drinks are decently priced.  Not bad, not that good either.  The staff seemed pretty nice here.  If you're looking for a bar that has plenty of seating though this is it.  It's a nice change compared to all the busy Mission bars (that are mostly standing room only).  Within walking distance from Union Square though so that's a bonus.
author: Amy J.

description:
I went to that pub for the second time. This time it was to celebrate the St Patrick's Day. And I have to say that we had a great time there.
We were able to get a table only ten minutes after we order our drinks. The place was customized for the event as you can imagine. Lots of balloons of different shapes. Some of them said "Happy St Patty's" :D That was funny.
The place was not crowded at the beginning but at the end it became very noisy. I guess this is often the main issue with packed pub like this one.
I have to mention that I like the fact that you can find ciders here!. Specially one that came from Ireland: Magners (even if I don't think it is the best one if you already spend some time in that country!)
author: Cedric L.

description:
Wow.

I came here last week because I was early to meet a friend from out of town who was staying at the Niko.  This was the closest bar that I saw so I walked in and tried to find an empty stool. Finally found one when I realized that I was in theme bar hell.  I always forget that SF is a tourist town until I come to a place like this.  Tons of people walking just  a few safe steps from their hotel to get a drink.... think about this as an Irish themed TGI Friday's.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Ah, Johnny Foley's.  The only bar I've ever felt truly comfortable at as a solo drinker.  The bartenders are polite but not too nosy.  I can leave my pint on the counter and pop out for a smoke without anyone swiping my seat.  It's close enough to Powell St. to stumble to the Bart station, yet just off the beaten path enough so it's not flooded with tourists.  And thankfully I've never been bothered by any drunken ole coots.  This was one of my first watering-holes, where I'd stop for a drink after work once or twice a week.  I recall having my very first hangover after a night at Johnny Foley's, the same night I tried Goldschlager shots for the first time.  Yeah-bob.  Good times.
Ah, Johnny Foley's.  Enabling my drinking habit since 1999.
author: Brenna M.

description:
Jonny Foley's Irish House has always been a great , authentic Irish experience. I have been to many Pubs in Ireland, and this is no different. They usually have great Bands to listen and Dance.
  They have recently added the "Dueling Piano Bar", which is fantastic. We ended up at the place on Friday night, wandered down around 9:30, by 10:00 not a seat left , and line forming. This reminds me of some of the great Piano Bars in Chicago. The drink service was very good.They get the crowd going, and encourage dancing. By the time we left around Midnight, line way down the street.
author: Julia M.

description:
I really like this place! 
1) Their oysters are HUGE and yummy
2) TVs
3) Great atmosphere
4) the Petit Filet is pretty damn good lad! (especially with the gorgonzola sauce) I go in every few weeks for one. 

The service isn't always great.. but that goes for a lot of restaurants in this city.
author: Sarah W.

description: Great food.  Had the prime rib and gorgonzola and apple salad.  Great and friendly service.
author: M H.

description:
If you are in San Francisco on business; if you don't want to venture more than two blocks from your hotel; if you want to loosen your tie and dance with all the other geezers that have had the misfortune of being fooled by the pretty decorations, this is the place for you.  
It might as well be a hotel bar in Nebraska.  
Guinness comes in a keg.  They don't contaminate the experience of drinking Guinness by stepping in-between the tap and the glass.  
Way to go.
author: Patrick A.

description: Just enjoyed the fine Jameson shots here. Quick service, awesome one man band action, and the night's topper: gettin' hit on by dudes. Perfect boost to the self esteem when I know i've been letting myself go.
author: Corey H.

description:
On a gloomy, foggy Sunday afternoon, we stumbled into Johnny Foleys for a "pick ye upper". The restaurant was packed, but we managed to grab two seats at the bar. I swear it already felt like we were in Ireland...with the mystical paintings (picture Mona Lisa with a Guinness mustache). And oddly enough, everyone in the bar looked Irish. A bunch of middle aged white people already drunk on Sunday afternoon. Awesome! 
Maybe I am used to paying high prices downtown, but 5.75 for a pint of the most delicious Guinness I have had since Australia, is A-O-K with me. 
Definitely took the gloomy out of foggy San Francisco.
author: Rada I.

description:
It's like a maze getting through to the seating at the bar.  But we found the bartenders to be pretty friendly.  WOW drinks are pretty pricey.  (but i guess that's just SF in general too).  Their bloody mary is like a SALAD!  We made some friends almost instantly, being strangers in a new place and all, and partied all night.  The musician there wasnt great and people were yelling and howling and talking over him and when i walked out to grab a smoke i noticed my ears were ringing.  

But i thought the bartenders were nifty.
author: jacqui w.

description: This place is really fun and entertaining. I actually walked in here randomly because I was alone and ended up just sitting at the bar. The bartenders were very nice and hardworkers. They had tvs all around the bar and also have live music playing. Alot of people were dancing at the other side of the bar and the side I was on people were just standing and chatting. I just had the chicken wings but I thought they were very good. Their portion size was too much for me but I gave my left overs to a homeless man outside. They also have a wide range of beers and wines.
author: Kyla C.

description:
Excellent food (cottage pie, lamb shank, fish & chips, brown bread (yum!).  Excellent service - Ger, Gavin, Kathy, et al.
Excellent atmosphere - ceol, ol agus craic (music, drinks, and fun).  My husband and I visited SF for a few days and discovered Foley's after our initial disasterous visit to Tiernan's Irish Pub by the Wharf (a definite NO NO). We were treated like family despite the craziness of the Giants games. (older crowd 30+ -- good!)
author: Angie K.

description: Let me tell you that I don't usually go to Irish Pubs because I simply don't. I go to Foley's on my home from work and its right there. I must say sipping my beers w/ a lively music and company makes you feel a little bit better because lets face I'm always exhausted after work. I sip on whatever I see and too tired to pick. As your sipping your beer, the music from the live band puts me to ease. I like it when they have the pianist who plays any song you wish. I like it. Go to Foley's in Union Square in SF.
author: Matt B.

description: Food is pricey, but absolutely delicious! We had cottage pie, steaks with gorgonzola sauce and red wine and peppercorn sauce, mushroom ravioli, mixed berry shortcake, and a fine port wine. Everything seemed to be made with fresh, high-quality ingredients.
author: Charles J.

description:
I stopped in here while staying at the Hilton right down the street.  Yes, it is a little bit of a tourist trap, and it is a large bar where they had live music at least one of the nights I was there so it was also loud.

BUT

They seriously had the second best Guinness I have ever had.

They have a great selection of beers and even though it was crowded I didn't have a hard time getting the attention of a bar tender.

The staff was nice and overall not much to complain about!
author: Braden D.

description: I'm not a local, but I visit Johnny Foley's every time I'm in SF.  It's a great place to hang out with friends; the food and service are both awesome (try just ordering a bunch of appetizers and sharing - they're all amazing!) and the live music on weekends is awesome!  It's a great place to sit for a few hours and enjoy drinks a music - try it out, you won't be sorry!
author: Nycki P.

description:
Decent beer selection, fun dueling pianos, and the most delicious vegetarian Irish stew I have ever tasted (one of two or three vegetarian options on the menu).

The place was loud and crowded and the only seat available was a bar high top with uncomfortable, backless stools.  Apparently they also overserve; I witnessed a past-gone drunkard being thrown out.
author: Helena K.

description:
Nice staff and good food.   On a recent visit San Fran, we stopped into Johnny's because, well... we were cold.  I usually avoid restaurants in tourist-heavy areas, but after striking out at a nearby sushi restaurant, and Italian restaurant, our thoughts were heat-food-heat-food, and Johnny's green sign beckoned.  It was a great find.  

Our waitress was very pleasant and attentive, which is what we really needed after a busy day.  The smell of garlic fries got us in the mood for comfort food, of which Johnny's has plenty.  We gulped down some oyster shooters, which were the perfect blend of buttery and spicy, as we waited for our entree.  We shared an order of fish n' chips (garlic, of course) which were yummy, including the mushy peas.  They have a nice selection of beers and whiskeys, which would keep me there all night, but we had to go.  As we were leaving, I spoke to the manager (who was supervising a musician setting up his stage for the evening's entertainment) who was happy to pass along our compliments to our waitress.  Then it was back into the chilly night to find a nearby BART station, which can be an adventure with a nice whiskey and beer buzz.  Woo hoo!
author: Michael C.

description: Don't come here if you are looking for friendly service. Maybe it is just the holiday bah hum bug blues, but I I am spending money, at least one smile is nice!!
author: Shelly D.

description: Best fish'n chips I've ever had(the mashed peas were even tasty)! Large portions too. Definitely worth 17 bucks!!! we'll be back fer sure
author: Brian C.

description: Great atmosphere. Shepard's Pie AWESOME!!! Nice place for a Guinness.
author: TERRIE G.

description: A few years ago I while I was up in SF I was meeting up with some folks with whom I did a study abroad in Italy. They were barting it into the City to meet me & one of the girls suggested Foley's on O'Farrell. (Segafredo on Powell would have been much more appropriate, but I didn't know of its existence then) Foley's was cool. I liked the vibe in there and it actually did remind me of a pub we went to while in Rome one weekend so I guess it was ok ha ha!!! We had a couple beers and reminisced about our trip. It was a large place with lots of patrons yet we didn't have any trouble having hearing each other or blocking out the the crowd. I would hit up Foley's again happily ANYTIME!
author: Lori K.

description: Went to this place only because it was around the corner from our hotel.  Not that great - mostly a mid-40's/older mom crowd.  Not too fun for two 26's year olds.  Decent beer selection but not that cool.....
author: Caitlin B.

description: Visited my fair share of Irish pubs. While this is good for beer and hanging out with friends, go elsewhere for food. I have tried the Cottage Pie (like Shepard's Pie, but with ground beef) and the fish & chips. Both were extremely bland. I'd go back for the beer, but not for the food.
author: John P.

description: Wandered in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. I had the lamb sliders, they were quite good; I'd order them again. I enjoyed the atmosphere and service. Granted it didn't knock my socks off but there was nothing off putting either hence the three stars.  If I was in the area and wanted to drink some beer and have a bite I'd go back.
author: Heathet B.

description: I came here for the second time last night around 11 pm, and again it didn't disappoint.  The live band was great and it was thoroughly amusing to watch an older crowd get sloppy on the dance floor.  It was my friend's 22nd birthday so we ordered some shots and swanky martinis, although the vibe is much more laid-back and fitting for a few beers rather than a blowjob shot...
author: Tosca M.

description:
I'd like to preface this review with the fact that I was horribly intoxicated at the time. 

I remember the crowd being older but laid back and friendly. There was a live band that I am pretty sure I was rockin' out to at some point and time. It wasn't too crowded on a Saturday night but the bar sometimes did take awhile to get a drink. Our group had a good time there, but I do remember the smell of fresh vomit...somewhere in there...and no, it wasn't mine!
author: Matt K.

description: Wow.Its like beening back in Dublin.Especially with the waitstaff''s Irish accents.Sixteen different imported draft beers and ales on tap.The bartenders here have strong arms! Food is good pub food. Try the cornbeef & cabbage;also excellent lamb which is hard to find in San Francisco..Although its near Union Square plenty of locals eat here. Hope to be back one day.
author: Gregory J.

description:
Why would a person who lives in SF give 5 stars to a "touristy" place in Union Square? 

-Lamb sliders were excellent (and they agreed to leave off the eggplant* topping 
-Mac and Cheese was phenomenal (I'm always on the hunt for good mac-n-cheese) 
-Wings were great: good sized and perfectly sauced AND SERVED WITH BLEU CHEESE (that is an incredibly important detail and I grew up in Buffalo, so if I say the wings are great you can trust me on this ;)  My heathen friend did request a side of ranch dressing, oh well, I still think he's cute.
-super friendly hosts that seated people promptly on a very busy Christmas Eve and even found us a couple of secluded bar chairs to sit on and took our drink order while we waited. 
-super friendly waitstaff that didn't rush us along... on a very busy Christmas Eve. 
-drinks were well made.... we didn't have anything special but it looked like a well stocked, well run Irish Pub 
-the entertainer that night, Terry Savastano I think, played 2 great Christmas songs "Fairytale of NY" by the Pogues and the spoof "Walkin 'Round in Women's Underwear" by Bob Rivers 
-then he played 'Your Song" by Sir Elton John just before we left.... I don't know how he knew that I loved that song or that we were on our third date but it was eerily perfect. (we ended up making out like teenagers at the Powell St BART station before we parted. (My date and I, not Terry) 



*eggplant = totally useless and tasteless and since I found out it has ZERO nutritional value I cannot understand why people eat it? Maybe because it contains more nicotine than any other edible plant? (look it up on Wikipedia) The only thing I like about it is its British and French name "aubergine."
author: ALEXIS S.

description:
Summary: Great Bar tenders. Great atmosphere. Overworked wait staff. Mediocre food. 

Food: As a steadfast rule, I go for the fish and chips every time I try a new pub.  Unfortunately, at Johnny Foley's the fish is full of bones.  One of my pieces was good. No bones. Decent flavor. The other piece, however, was like eating a fried fish ribcage.  Had our waitress stopped by more often, or even more than once, I would have asked her for a new piece, and some lemons to go with... don't lemons always come with fish and chips?  Apparently not at Mr. Foley's.  The beer selection was OK.  Enough to choose from, but nothing too exotic. 

Staff:  The hostess was super friendly but over worked.   Most restaurants employ several hostesses during  a dinner rush, apparently not Johnny.  The bar keeps were kind, and offered us tastings of the beers we were deciding between. Great service.  The waitress was also friendly, but either had too many tables, or simply forgot about us, as our table was literally in the lobby area.  It was kinda like sitting at the kids' table on Thanksgiving; we were still a part of the party, but could see what was going on in the other room, and it looked like they were having a lot more fun.  

Atmosphere. Lively, and pub-esque: loud, bustling and full of kind and jovial people.  Great vibe.  

Bottom Line:  I would hang out at Johnny's again for the great atmosphere, and the awesome bar tenders. However, I would not eat anything but the bar menu.  The dinning options are just not that great.
author: Joshua M.

description:
A solid Irish bar. Thursday nights are great... "Rock and Roll with Nicole" will keep you entertained. She is an incredible human jukebox -- and a singer's range is much expanded when she can sing like a man and woman. 

Enjoyed a long lunch here as well. Immensely tasty Steak & Mushroom Pie. 

Minus one star for the touristyness.
author: Erin M.

description: Magners cider on tap and boxty are not easy finds in the city, and Foley's is a great pub that has them both. Also, Dave and Andrish never fail to give me a glass of ice for my cider without me having to ask for it. Top fellas, they are!
author: Aurora A.

description: Was skeptical but was great! Clean, clean bathroom (very imp). Thought food would b mediocre but was impressed. Bloody Mary oyster shooters, onion strings, clam chowder & Caesar salad all were great! Highly recommend!
author: Ericka J.

description:
Went in on Saturday afternoon to have a bite to eat, drink a few pints and watch the Green Bay game. Lovely place Johnny Foley's is.

I had the wings (meh) to start and moved on to the fish and chips. Served gastro-pub style on fancy glass (square) plates with mushy peas and a non-tartar, tartar sauce, I was initially non-plussed. Then I tasted. Yum! Fish and chip nirvana. I scarfed them right down barely even leaving time to order another Bass.

The environs are good with plenty of flat screens to watch the game on and a comfy, woody decor. My only complaint is that it was DAMN COLD in there. Turn on the heat people, sheesh.
author: Brad B.

description:
Music, Beer, Great food, Awesome Bar Staff!

This is what 5 star places are made of!

The decor is a sight to see. It gives you something to stare at and marvel at how you didn't come here any sooner.

The burgers, bangers and mash, finger foods, all delicious.

We meet up here every year before our co. xmas party and every year I grow more and more fond of it.  I've been to this place on many other occasions as well. The weekends are alive with great music and an awesome crowd.

If you are coming to SF to visit, stop in for a drink.. DO IT.. DO IT NOW!
author: Ray W.

description:
If you take out the high prices and the overcrowding, this is a fantastic place.  Where else do you get an interesting mix of  conventioners and locals?  Shameless flirt with the cute bartenders- "Hello Colin"- and  converse with those classy Midwesterners who are in the big city for the first time. Watch them drool all over you city gals.

Pull up a chair, or sit at the bar Tuesday and Thursday nights for the sassy performance of Nicole the " Human Juke Box" who performs a wide range of songs. She is fun, she sings well, and you will have an enjoyable time. 

Sure the food is overpriced, and the owner can be a bit snippy, but with all its character- paintings of Irish greats all over the walls and hardwood floors- this is a great bar.
author: simone l.

description:
This is a true watering hole for tourist and local alike, and god help you if there's a big game on the tele.

So my experience here is bringing large groups, around 20-25 folks, all hungry, and obnoxiously large. Hard to go wrong with bar-type food, and it's near parking (which I am obssessed with). You will not have a hard time finding a spot with a garage across the streetish and down the way as well.

This is my Foley's story: I was here with friends after work, and there was a tranny workin' the mic singing away. Pretty entertaining, especially when she started hitting on myself and my friend. Literally singing to just us as if we were the only people there. It was weird, but I couldn't stop looking at her! That's entertainment! I can't say that you will get the same kinda lovin' but if you're there at the right time, you rule.

Go for the show, stay for the fish and chips.
author: Charlene L.

description:
I end up here a lot of the time, after shopping usually or for a good Irish meal and an overpriced beer.  Whatever, I understand rent is high in Union Square so I'm willing to pay the extra few dollars.

The bartenders are friendly and the atmosphere actually reminds me of being back in Ireland.  I think they might even import their help . . .

There is usually a band playing live music and too drunk people pretending to dance, a great place to be reminded not to take life so seriously.

This place is also really large so it's usually not hard to find a table and the service is surprisingly good, plus they don't make fun of you when you're buying $18 dollar Irish Car Bombs.

I like this pub, it's kinda like a fallback, something you can always be sure to enjoy
author: Lauren G.

description:
I have found a place to drop the boyfriend off to if I am downtown shopping.  It is a block away from H and M and I love it also to hang out at.  Yes a huge tourist trap but when you are in that part of downtown, isn't everything a huge tourist trap?  

Our waitress had only been there two weeks but she was nice, and quick and whatever she didn't know she got the answer for us.  

We had the spicy fries, curry fries and garlic fries.  The best of the three was the spicy fries as it had been mixed into the spicy stuff whereas the curry fries had the sauce poured on it, so parts of it didn't get any sauce.  And the garlic fries, well they were good but the garlic kept on falling off.  Oh well.  Then we also had the calamari which was good, the fish and chips which were decent and the clam chowder which had actual bits of clam and was very clam flavored (as opposed to the generic clam chowder you get which is all creamy and no clam parts.).  All okay.  

For my boyfriend the highlight was the fact that he drank 5 beers in an hour.  For me it was the soda bread pudding with caramel.  AMAZING and delicious!  SOOOOOO good, the best.  In fact the best bread pudding I have ever had ever ever!!  I ordered it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top and that, when topped off with the creamy sauce stuff they give you on the side to pour on, well it was sensational.  

A little pricey for bar food, but if I was the owner of the place and it was in the location that it was in, with a ton of tourists, and bored husbands and boyfriends, I would also try to get away with charging a little bit more.  

Nice decor, huge beer barrels in the back.  Typical pub.  And I go to alot of them...........I had fun.
author: Denise B.

description:
This is a nice place with room to hang out and drink. The bar tenders were friendly and helpful.

What I did not like about it was, the drinks were a bit more expensive. Also this place is completely run over by tourist.

I would recommend checking it out.
author: Amlan S.

description:
Comfortable booths for sitting, nice open hall with dark wood, very busy waitress who seemed uninterested in being patient or helpful, obnoxious entertainment (but luckily we weren't close to it so it didn't bother us much), definately overpriced food.

It's a tourist bar so what can you really expect?  Anything this close to Union Square is going to be overpriced, if this bar was located anywhere else it would be dead by now.

I won't go back, not too impressed.  Definately better places to go for Irish pub food.  It was an experience and now I can say "Hey, I've been there."
author: Mary R.

description:
One word
Murphys.
I'll never be the same.
Even in the madness of St. Pattys the bartenders were on top of everything, the prices were reasonable, the crowd was INSANE but awesome
btw did u know its normal for guys from Spain to live with their parents till their 27? crazy!
Course that means that have TWO houses....one in Madrid and one in Ibiza...I was instantly jealous of a 27 year old man living with his parents. Never thought that would happen.
I'm definitly coming back here even not on an Irish holiday!
I'm knackered.
author: Stacy L.

description:
UPDATE:  OMG... so disappointed with their Irish pub food.  Eww!  Chris got the fish and chips and they were so bad.  Soggy and just plain yuck.  I've had better at RED ROBINS!  I ordered the corned beef and cabbage.  YUCK!  My mom makes better corned beef and cabbage and we aren't even Irish!  

You claim to be an Irish pub, but your typical pub food is so awful.  
Won't come back for the pub food, but the appetizers the first time around were good.  Hmm... calamari and spicy fries... I don't know much, but I don't think that is typical Irish pub food.  

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Jazmine.. you beat me to it!

HAHA!  Well, came across this place via yelp and I was glad I did.  It was the evening before my 2-week winter break from school and I had one hell of a week with my students.  Jazmine said that it was time to celebrate and that it was time to do a Happy Hour.

It was bustling in the pub and lots of people with beer and fish and chips.  It was a nice mature crowd (late 20's and up).  I felt comfortable here.  

The food was good.  The calamari was great and the fries were interesting (should've been more crisp).  The ribs... indifferent.  Next time I will get the fish and chips.  =)

I would come here again.
author: Theresa M.

description:
First time here yesterday, however, my friends/coworkers have been coming here for years since our annual holiday party is at the Nikko, so Foley's is usually their pre- or post-party bar.

Cool place to hang out with a group of friends, drink beer or cocktails, and even watch sports on their TVs. Our first server, I wasn't feeling too much, he had a forced smile on his face...maybe it was almost the end of his shift and couldn't wait to get off. Hence, our second server, I guess. He was much more sincere and accommodating.

I'm not much of a beer drinker anymore because it makes me too full, so I only get to drink 1 or 2 at the most, so I stick with mixed drinks. I had Cape Cods the whole time we were there, could use MORE vodka. Fried Calamari was less than okay but we got down with the Fish & Chips (it may have been because we were famished and drunk at this point!).

Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, will definitely grab a drink or 2 at Foley's again and some Fish & Chips, too!
author: Barbra C.

description:
I live in the eastbay and I don't go to the city as much as I would like, but I always seem to come back to this place. Friends Birthday, celebrating the Giants World Series win, St. Patricks day, or just a Wednesday this place is a good time.
I love the decor of the upstairs bar. A big bar serving all types of delicious beer on tap. The dark wood panels with stainedglass windows that snake  through the bar. Random paintings of people that are a little creepy but add to the whole experience of this place. 
Geting a beverage has never been to difficult for me, and the staff has always been friendly. The food is not gourmet but still delicious. Nothing goes better with beer than fried foods in my opinion.
This bar has a downstairs bar that has a stage for performances. I have been to the dueling piano night and it was a blast. I was lucky enough to get there early and get a table. There are not that many of them and if you have a large group it could be difficult to get some tables. But there is ample space to stand either at the bar or around it. I actually went downstairs on St. Patty's day because upstairs was WAY to packed. Downstairs I was served fast and there still was a good size crowd there. 
Like I said before, there is something about this place that draws you in. I really do enjoy coming here and whenever I am in the city I always suggest Johnny Foley's!
author: David G.

description: Our friends bring us here every time we visit SF.  Kid friendly---I was really impressed that they brought out my friend's 7 year old son's lunch first so he could get started----this is a restaurant that understands parents!  Good food as always; my husband had the turkey burger, I had the Spinach Salad with Chicken (divine!) and my friend had the cottage pie, which she gave a thumbs up to.  Lots of fun, great atmosphere.
author: Susanne R.

description: By far the best Irish Bar in San Francisco. Absolutely LOVE this place. Not only are the bar staff friendly and attentive, but the food is great too. This is a regular spot for me and my husband on a Saturday night!
author: Aisling M.

description: My first visit was solely because I wanted a Guinness before going back to the Hilton next door, where I stayed.  The service was fast, friendly and efficient and I decided to come back 2 days later for dinner with my group.  I ordered the filet and have to say it was one of best steaks i have ever eaten.  WOW!  Everyone in my group ordered something different, and everyone was very pleased.  This place is not only a cool pub to hang out and have some beers, but it also has some awesome food.
author: Mike S.

description:
We went here after dinner at Hana Zen which is right around the corner.  We stopped in for a quick drink and was surprised to find the dueling piano bar downstairs!  I was excited because I have always enjoyed piano bars in Vegas and Denver!  

As expected, it was great fun!  The pianists were hilarious and really got the crowd into all the songs and funny banter!  Drinks weren't outrageously priced and the actual bar was very clean!  I will definitely take friends back here! :)
author: Candice M.

description: Great corned beef and cabbage, well presented and lean. The vegetable irish stew is awesome, perfectly cooked veggies. Two complaints: bring back the Guiness beer soup. Also, beer is ridiculously expensive. $6.50 for a pint of Guiness? Seems excessive, though I don't drink and could be wrong.
author: Johnny O.

description:
Huge pours, cute bartenders, hot doorman, and a great band on weekends-and by great I mean they sing songs that everyone knows they ask for requests from the crowd, and don't care when the patrons of the bar are singing(screaming) along with them.  

re: Tourists
It's a bar on Union Square, of course there are going to be a ton of tourists. All the ones I've met have come there for the same thing: Great atmosphere and good music.
author: Leesa P.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE  my husband and I actually designed our kichen and dining room after the look of this pub.  

Gets a bit loud - so don't expect to carry on a conversation.
author: Jenn B.

description:
We spent out two late nights out having a vew beers there.  It was the weekend so the place was packed but the service was pretty attentive.  The place had a band both nights were were there and I liked what they were playing.  

It does get loud in there so I suggestion if you want to have a conversation sit in the front of the house.  The booths are hard wood so it isn't always so cozy.   Does get real hot in there but otherwise it's a nice chill bar.
author: Sara D.

description: The barman was unable to read my age on the European driving license. In any other place that was not a problem at all.
author: Darwin B.

description: The waitress I have now upstairs is perhaps the best waitress I've ever had.  She is amazing.  The place is packed and she is still amazing.
author: N K.

description: Very mediocre pub food. Come to Boston and I'll show you some real pub food.
author: Nate C.

description: We have gone here a few times.  If we can get in and get a table it ends up being a good time.  There is no cover Wed-Sat, which is confusing, but works out in your favor.  My main complaint is that a lot of the times it is so packed that you can't get in.  It gets very hot in here and it is a mixed bag on how loud it is.  Sometimes it is so loud that you can't take it and other times it is just fine.  We take our out of town guests here because it is in the heart of Union Square.  We don't go here often because it is in the heart of Union Square.  This is a good place for tourists.... it would be rare to find a real San  Franciscan in this bar.
author: Jonathan U.

description:
I had a good time at Foley's on Friday night.  The place was hopping and the bar tender was Johnny on the Spot with the drinks.  They had live music which was playing the famous hits of the past and had the baseball game on the flat screens.  I like these old time bars.

The only thing that was a bummer was that it got really hot in there.  There was no ventilation or something which is weird since its a really big place that goes on forever.  My buddy and I had to leave to cool down.  Not sure what they could do better except put in some fans or something.
author: Fritz W.

description: This is a fun pub on a Friday night. Cool decor, Live music (beatles cover band--sweet lol), Guinness on draft, plenty of bar space and stools if you want to park it and chat with friends. This is one of those places I'd go when it's just me and the guys. Oh wait, that's exactly how I found this place!  Yup, it's not exactly your girls night out spot, but it's definitely worth a Guiness or two to unwind. Especially if you happen to be in the Union Square area after an exhausting day of retail therapy!
author: Kristen S.

description: Awesome food! their veggie burgers are home made can't get any better than that. The food is high quality and the service is great. I went there around 3pm on a Saturday and it was empty. Good beers on tap, there are a lot of selections.
author: Alex B.

description: Came specifically to check out the famed dueling piano thing - and was more than satisfied. The trio of rotating pianists were expert crowd pleasers and entertainers, adding hilarity to the sweaty underground bar chock-full with tourists. This place is free, which is great. Very fun!
author: Paolo D.

description: Not really my favorite place we went while visiting San Fran. Ok, I look young, but I wandered up to the bar, ordered an adult beverage, he asked for my ID, and he walked away and never came back! They were busy with a large group that came in but I didn't feel like a very important customer, all because I look a little young for my age! It smelled funny in here and the crowd inside was "eh". Not really worth a return visit for me...
author: Lauren M.

description:
This Irish Pub has got a GREAT Bloody Mary!  Haven't tried the food yet and the drinks seem pricey, (11 bucks for an irish car bomb???) but it's still fun.  Too bad they are closed for earthquake retrofiting for the time being.

UPDATE:

Back to being open and back to being a great hangout!
author: Medwin M.

description:
You know, for bar food it is definitely on the upper end but its all relative isnt it?? I had the chicken, it was passable. My friend had the cod..super smokey and salty but not that bad. I think i had a burger here a few years ago and remember that as being pretty good. I think i will get that the next time!
Oh the guinness is pretty good here!
author: Not M.

description:
So my friend Theresa and I were looking for a place to have some drinks and do a little shopping during the holiday season. We decided to go downtown and shop so we needed a bar. She found John Foley's using yelp and from the reviews we said sure why not!

This place is very good. Its a nice little pub...actually its not very little at all...its pretty big. I would imagine that pubs actually look like this in Ireland ( but what do i know?!). Anyway the food was very good. We had ribs, curry fries and calamari with some beers. The ribs fell right off the bone and the calamari was deep fried very well. The fries were good too but i think with the curry flavor it was a little much...but they do have other toppings for it. We didn't have any big meals but they had some traditional Irish pub food. It looked good..the people next to us had some. The thing that added to the experience was that our waitress was from Ireland. SCORE!!

I'd go back again..maybe for St. Patty's.
author: Jazmine S.

description:
I've been coming here for a while, and usually I am with my friend who absolutely LOVES Aussies, Irish, British, Scottish men.  Quite a few of the above frequent here, but alas, they are a bit older than my 21- 25 age group.  But my friend is into older guys... so...

Many a night I played the wing-woman to my dear accent loving friend.  And let me tell you this is a decent fun place.  If you have a big enough group of friends (if you are part of the younger crowd), you won't have to worry about getting attacked by waves of older men here on business or who are flight attendents... hehehe.  But again, if you are into older men...

The cover bands vary from suckiness to greatness (The Cocktail Monkeys are the best band I've ever heard here!), and the bar is definitely better than the food.

Some food is good (mostly the appetizers, and I always love their Cottage Pie), but mostly come for drinking, atmosphere, and fun times!  Some of the bartenders are Irish... if that helps your "Irish pub" experience... and they are pretty nice.

Only if you are a foreigner, have a CA ID with you... they don't accept passports for IDs...  :(
author: Kitty O.

description:
They have lots of TVs and put the Champion's League and Euro 2008 matches on during the day, and will turn the sound on for you, but not loud enough to hear the announcers.  The food is okay, but a pricey as it seems to mostly cater to tourists.  For example, fish and chips is inexplicably $15.  Chips, whether garlic, curry, or regular, are not good, and are too thick, like steak cut french fries, so swap them out with mashed potatoes.  

When they have a cover band here at night, it gets super loud and caters to baby boomers.  Definitely the place to watch daytime soccer matches around Union Square though and the place is often packed with Europeans then.
author: Adam Z.

description: Decent Pub, Friendly staff, Good beer. Weird layout though and OK decor, would have given five if it was better.
author: Chris H.

description: This is a pretty chill place.  We came here for our friend's bday.  Drinks were decent, my bf and I had the corned beef, it was ok, mine is better =).  I like the piano bar downstairs.. this is a fun place.
author: Oriana C.

description:
My friend and I were in pursuit of a particular sports bar in the union square area and guess what we didn't find it so we stepped into Foley's, I love Guinness and I knew they would have that on tap...

The place was packed and I mean packed, my first thought was oh no, we will never get food with this crowd, the petite and smiley hostess said keep your eye on the menu as she raised it over her head and started to dart through the crowd, I followed as close as I could, about midway through the restaurant she stopped with a big smile and waited for my buddy to catch up, back to the menu chase, and alas there was a table open in this bustling Irish house!

Our service was quick! The Guinness was delightful!  

I ordered The fish and chips as did my buddy, I had not had fish and chips in quite some time and this fish and chips did not disappoint!  great flavor and depth in the french fries, the fish was hot crisp and perfect I must say, I love that batter!  The mushy green peas were different especially as I pulled a hair about 10 inches long out of my mouth, literally as I was pulling it out of my mouth the manager walked up grabbed it from my hand and said that shouldn't be in there, well no, no I think your right, everyone was so nice and I know these things happen, I didn't demand anything and I was almost done anyway, but I left the last few bites for the garbage, a hair in the mouth does end the drive to eat!  Moments later the waitress walks up all apologetic and says, we are so sorry, please everything is on us, even the drinks want another?  We had already decided to get another Guinness and I added a shot of Bushmills to gargle with and kill any potential germs, It was a wonderful night, with a new friend, and we have had some laughs since saying no angel hair with my peas please!

If you happen into Johnny Foley's Irish House You will feel like you touched the blarney and shook the Shillelagh, Have a Guinness and some Fish and Chips you will not be disappointed!
author: Jeff A.

description: Dueling piano bar? Yes, please. The downstairs area is way better than upstairs.
author: Jeanne C.

description: EXCELLENT EXCELLENT Service. I wish I would have gotten my waiters name because he was on it! We had a baby with us and when she was fussy he offered to get her ice cream or a piece of bread. I've been there a few times now and every time it's the best food! I would recommend the calamari, it comes with a spicy mayo an it's the best I've ever had.
author: Ashley L.

description: We live in Arizona and don't have a rocking Irish pub like J. Foley's. What a blast, the place was packed, the Celtics were beating the Lakers, life is good and this place is great. Excellent lamb sliders and decent wine selection. Very good service considering how swamped the place was.
author: Bob G.

description:
I like this place alot for lunch. The Boxty is one of the best I have ever had even though it's a very different kind. Smoked salmon, creme cheese chives on a cripsy potato pancake. Fish and chips excellent and the fries with curry is a must try.
The Bloody Marys are a little too spicey for my taste, even when you ask for them to be extra mild they are not. But the beer selection and cocktails are great.
If your ever ther in the even check out the dueling piano bar downstairs, it's quite a crack up, took some friends from out of town and ended up closing the bar and being quite alot poorer, two beers and a lass of wine $20?? A bit steep I think.
author: Ang x.

description:
A comment on the people reviewing the food...Who the hell goes to Irish bar for food. In fact, why would anyone think to themselves "I'm hungry, you know what sounds really good, an Irish bar and grill." 

Now if you want to go to a cool bar where you can drink and have a good time, this place fits the bill.
author: Justin C.

description:
I have been here 3 times with three totall different experiences:
1st: Bachelorette party at Harry Dentson's was too dry. Myself and another girl snuck out and walked a few blocks to Foley's. I have no idea how many imperial pints of Harp and shots of Jameson we put away, but as the rest of the group shows up, I get cut-off at the bar. One of the older girls at the party lures me back to the hotel across the street by telling me she has a bottle of Jameson in her room. I follow only to find out she tricked me. There was no Jameson, she just wanted to keep me out of trouble. I thanked her the next morning when she relayed this story to me, as I had no recollection of any of it. Thank you, T. 

2nd: Came here for lunch with my man. Curry and chips were the best I have ever had. Sandwich was disgusting. I forgot to ask for no mustard, and that is all I could taste. Murphy's Stout on tap! I was pleased by that.

3rd: After bar hopping all over the city, we came back to where we started and passed Foley's. Remembering my first visit to the place, I decided that we best not go in, but then something amazing happened. We saw this group going downstairs, so we followed them in. There is a piano bar underground! We had the best time of the night! I don't really remember why we left the place when we did, but I fear I might have made my man jealous when I was talking to some guy, telling him I am a muralist (one who paints murals-which I most definately am not) and he was showing a great deal of enthusiasm and interest. 

Piano bar was the coolest part about Foley's, By far.
author: A K.

description: I really like this place.  I went for the first time yesterday and I'm sure to be going back whenever I'm in the area.  Everyone in the place including the patrons seemed to be pretty chill.  This is a great place for a few brews and has the bonus of being so close to the Powell BART station.  I'll have to go back to check out the food......
author: Neil A.

description: I can only speak on behalf of the entertainment, and it was awesome! 2 guys on pianos playing most any song you request (all from their head - no sheet music). It was pure entertainment! Loved it!!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Freshest Guinness tap I have ever tasted. Great service and good food also.
author: Jackie P.

description: Decent place to grab beers and hang out.  The bartenders are hilarious.
author: J T.

description: It's a face-off between piano and piano?? No, it's not like rap wars. Nor is it like battle of the bands. One could only say that Foley's in an interesting experience. Submit a song you want to be played and watch two men on adjacent pianos duel it out to see who can out play the other guy. Think The Mint karaoke bar where everyone drunkenly sings along to favorite sing-a-longs that everyone knows. The bar has a full bar. The crowd is significantly younger. But the concept of the bar is cooler than cool. For a one-of-a-kind pub experience, come to Johnny Foley's where you can sing song and rock your socks off.
author: Alex H.

description: Stopped in for beer, appetizers (fried seafood with chipotle aioli) and a cottage pie. Food was just okay, and service was a little slow and even more unfriendly.
author: Erika E.

description: Good place for a draught beer.  Nice Irish bar feel.  Friendly staff.  They gave us a table for just drinks during a not so busy time.  French fries were very good.
author: Rebekah W.

description:
yeah.. it's cool that you're hidden in an alley, but your waiter took forever to ask us what we wanted to drink sitting outside under the heaters.  and i don't mean, oh he was busy inside (because it was pretty empty) or he didn't notice us sitting outside (he WAS outside), but he kept walking right by us. again. and again. no me gusta.

anyway.. food was okay, we were starving by the time we actually got to order and it showed up.  i wouldn't go back, which i would have liked to, since i really liked sitting outside under the heat lamps in that alley.
author: BF K.

description: Looking for a nearby eatery, casual, place was busy, but not crazy for a Friday night.  Prices are a little high for what you get, atmosphere is loud but the building is beautiful.  Ordered a few guiness, lamb sliders were good, but for $12 two was a little cheap.  While waiting for our food, we realized that the table that sat down after us was already half way through their meal, I looked at the waitress who now realized something wasn't right, she came over and told us that she forgot to put in our main courses.  No problem, we are all human, mistakes are made, so she bought us our drinks for the night.  I would definately go again.
author: Michael I.

description: Great, liveley atmosphere. I took my friend from England here on the night of the election Bush vs. Gore and it was a scene...very fun and often with live music...
author: Laura K.

description:
Beer is good and the food? Love the Spicy Fries. 
Love the bar area ( service there is much better ) and further into the night you'll start singing along to ' Brown Eyed Girl ' or 'Touch Myself'. Oh you will! You must! 


.
author: D Q.

description:
A giant selection of expertly poured beers, smartly dressed bartenders, soccer on a myriad of flat screens. 

I should love this place, but the huge, loud crowd completely ruins the atmosphere of this place. It's just too damn packed in with dick-heads and douchebags to compensate for how cool and woodsy the rest of the place is.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Foley's is classic San Francisco. Where else can you find a decent chicken Cesar salad at an Irish Pub? They serve some pretty good mojitos too, go figure.
This place is special in many ways. Since it is right in the heart of the Union Square area there are always many travelers and out of town guests. They also have some of the most unique live music acts in town, including Nicole McRory, who is truly one of a kind.
The clientele is always rotating from adorable Irish tourists to huge groups of convention attendees, but somehow the food, drinks, service and entertainment blend harmoniously into a family style setting.
author: Schuyler W.

description: My friend and I dropped in for some Guinness. The place gets pretty packed on a Friday. Good service and a fun atmosphere. Fair warning it does get packed with tourists, but they have a relatively mixed crowd. Would definitely come back for Happy Hour.
author: crystal e.

description: best place to go watch the EPL and have a pint while at it, the food wasnt the best, but the service was.. overall a typical irish bar, CHEERS!
author: Raymond R.

description: I don't know what it is, but I love love love the irish coffee here. I've gone here with a bunch of different friends and I always have a good time here. I love the smashed peas that goes with the fish n chips. The Cottege Pie is fresh. The food in general is really good and the staff is friendly. On busy nights everyone is running around so service could be a little slow, but it's worth the wait.
author: Thu L.

description: Love this place! My roommates and I went for a night out, and ended up having the best time with The U.S. Marine Corps and The British Navy. We danced to Nicole's music and drank our asses off. The servers were nice and even joined in on the fun with us sometimes. And although I didn't get to see the dueling pianos (because they stop letting ppl downstairs), I'd say it was time well spent. I've never had the food (Mel's Diner afterwards) so can't comment on that. Needless to say after a night at Johnny Foley's I felt very charitable and maybe even a little ready to serve overseas. Sike! I'll leave that to our Navy & Marines! Hoorah!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Fun atmosphere and good food = a good time

Try the Cottage Pie absolutely scrumptious!

They also have a small room in the back with a HUGE table for larger parities.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Had lunch here a couple months ago and forgot to write a review about it; the waitress was very nice and the food was damn good. I had the irish sliders with lamb and my mom had the spinach salad...both were great, and this place packs at night so be aware of the large crowd...
author: Andrew M.

description:
We were here to celebrate a friend's birthday. The live music is pretty cool, and the piano players get people involved. I didn't particularly like the fact that if they don't like your song they will read the title and move on (if you don't play my music gimme my money back). And although the night was fun the waitress that was working that night (redhead) was so rude she brought the review down to three stars. 

Here is why: 
As mentioned before she was pretty rude, not so friendly and truth be told dressed in poor taste. 
When she would bring drinks to the table she would not necessarily take the finished glasses away and at more than one point we had a ton of empty glasses. But this is what really got me: two of the guys in our group ordered a couple of beers it took her about 20 minutes to bring them (understandable it's a busy night). She put one glass on the table, and slammed the other one down spilling all over my friend. No apologies no offer of napkins she moved on. The guys laughed it off. Two minutes later she comes back grabs the drink out of one of the guy's hand takes the other off the table and takes them over to another table... leaving both the guys with a WTF look on their faces. Once again no apologies, no questions. 10 minutes later she brings them their drinks, not even mentioning what happened. 

All in all we had a good time, and I can definitely see us all coming back but I will stick with getting my drinks at the bar thank you very much.
author: Yulia K.

description: I've previously only come to this restaurant to have a drink at its bar. I'm really glad I came in here this last time to try their food. I really enjoyed their food. I ordered their Corned Beef & Cabbage and it was one of the best I've had. Being a restaurant and bar, it was a relatively quiet restaurant so this place would be a good place for a date and a good conversation. In addition to their good food and good ambience, they had great service. I also love that they have a jazz club in the basement. I've listened to some great music down there on more than one occasion.
author: Rylan C.

description: This place is always so much fun to go to! Not only are there entertaining pianists who have friendly/dirty banter... there are irish bartenders that are easy on the eyes. This is the type of bar you would go to drunk to sing and enjoy the company you're with- not a dancing/club type and too expensive to be a dive bar.. but fun nonetheless. Definitely worth trying at least once while you're in sf
author: Annette K.

description: 4 stars for sitting at the bar enjoying a pint with the other locals and bar tenders. 3 stars for sitting down and eating. Food is not very good, I wouldn't recommend eating here. We also had a waitress with a horrible attitude, boo! It's a little pricey even for a pint but considering the location, that's to be expected. I will pop back in for a pint and good conversation.
author: Kristen L.

description: Came here yesterday post the St. Patties day parade. Definitely the perfect post parade spot to celebrate. Great atmosphere and great beer.
author: Polina S.

description: really enjoyed my time here. bartenders are super cool, drinks are reasonably priced.  this spot has a great atmosphre and great music
author: Damien R.

description: What a treat!  When we were seated, the host asked us "did you see the gentleman I was speaking to at the door when you walked in?"  We let him know we did and he pointed to a huge portrait hanging on the wall and said "that's HIM!  That is Mr. Foley.  He is visiting from Ireland this week."  Thought that was a pretty good start to our visit!  I opted for the fish and chips....without the nasty mushy peas!  I got 3 nice pieces of flaky white fish (guessing cod) and a nice serving of fries....er...chips.  Covered them in malt vinegar, washed it all down with a nice cider and I was quite content.  One of my three friends chose the steak and mushroom pie.  Smelled and looked delicious and he said it was awesome.  Another picked the steak sandwich....a bit pink for me but he thoroughly enjoyed it.  And I think the other choice was a veggie sandwich of some sort.  Didn't pay much attention as I like my meat!  ;o)   Our server was awesome.  Only complaint was the price of the irish car bombs.  Almost $50 for 4 of them OUCH!  I know they aren't cheap but I've had them in many different places (NY, Las Vegas, LA, etc) and that seemed especially steep!  It got really crowded pretty early so apparently I'm not the only who who is content with the food, drink and service around there!
author: Hootie P.

description: A most stop when in the Union Square area for a pint and a bite to eat.  The chicken curry was out of this world I felt like I was in London!
author: John C.

description: This place had a great atmosphere and good beers but that is all it had going for it.  I went here for lunch with a group of friends and it looked like it would be a good choice, however the food was nothing great.  I ordered the steak and mushroom pie and it tasted like someone opened a can of beef stew and then placed a leathery textured puff pastry on top.  It was served with a pile of foully dressed greens on the side.  The bottom line is if you want Irish pub food you can do better than this.
author: Neal D.

description: Great bar but pricey drinks...they have dueling pianos!
author: K P.

description: One of the best Bloody Mary's ever.  Went there today after several years, remembering how terrific the fish and chips were.  Oh, what a disappointment.  No longer do they have the best hand cut, fresh chips in town, they are very ordinary, probably frozen.  What a shame.
author: Yella W.

description:
Food was meh. Clam chowder soup was too salty, irish soda bread was ok, fish and chips were ok, the garlic fries were fries with some garlic on top...not really garlic fries. Someone ordered a caesar salad and said it was doused in dressing.

The service was absolutely terrible. First, we were a group of 9, but the waitress (short, blonde) comes and only take down drink orders for 3 people. Hello....I wanted a drink! Ok fine, I ordered it with my food. She comes back with the food and drinks, "Can you take this?" in a really mean tone. Other friends also note her lack of service and attitude.

When the bill comes... we split it up, I needed change. I only bought $15 of food and drink... I put down a twenty. I needed change ffs. She took 20 minutes to pick up the tab. Comes back to clear the table. She is considerably more bitchy. We ask for the change. She is like, 'Why do you need change?" Obviously by then, we realized that she thought we had already included the tip, so I explained to her, we need the change. We were going to tip her afterwards, you know...leave it on the table. Her answer is to slam the tab back down on the table and say, "Wow". Okay, that right there, is the reason why the rest of the fucking table didn't leave you a tip. She comes back and asks, Was there something wrong with the service? But still her tone of voice is bitchy, if you have to ask that, don't you think there was something wrong with your service? I felt conflicted, so I tipped 15% of what my tab was, which is like $2.50. I don't believe in leaving nothing as a tip but honestly I was tempted to. Everyone else was pissed off and offended and just basically left her with nothing. zip. She really treated us badly. I will never go there again. 


The piano bar downstairs is pretty good tho, I may one day return for that ONLY. Too bad it's only the dueling piano players that are fun, the service there is decent (unlike the service mentioned above).
author: Carol C.

description: If you only have one night in San Francisco, the Piano Bar has to be high on the to-do list.  The vibe changes from night to night depending on the groups that go, but the performances are always awesome.  The guys always pick on the Birthday Celebrations / Bachelor / Bachelorette / Drunken Idiots and its a really interactive environment.  I give it four stars only because I caught the bartender on two occasions adding drinks onto my tab I did not order.  In these cases I wasn't drunk enough to not notice, and I had a good enough time to keep coming back, but still, you gotta deduct a star for that!
author: Matt C.

description: Delicious Guiness beef and barley soup and delicious steak and mushroom pie.  Black Velvet poured correctly.  We love Johnny Foley's Irish House.
author: Cookie C.

description: came here for the first time for a private party last night. the ambiance was great - fun, loud, casual and friendly. the food seemed to be pretty good - we had the "buffet" type set up at the party. simple food like mac-n-cheese was delish. Hubby had 4 sliders and enjoyed it. I was the DD so only had a few sips of champaign. Hubby got the party doing Mexican shots around the bar. All was great when my 20yo daughter was stopped at the door @10:15pm -- they started to card patrons @10p. well, she only have 4 more months to go. i'll take her back to enjoy the food and drinks and music freely later this year, when she's legal. :) definitely wants to go back and check out their regular menu. stay tuned...
author: Ada L.

description: Dueling pianos just adds another great piece of entertainment you can find in this amazing city of ours. From old school rap to country to rock and roll these guys can do it all. I have a blast every single time I have been here. You bring people here once and they come back for more. The crowd ranges from the twenties to the fifties. It's awesome. Everyone comes together to sing, dance and have a grand ole time.
author: Jen B.

description: My boyfriend and I tend to stop in here on our way back home after shopping at Union Square. We take a break, get a beer and recover. It's got a beautiful old fashioned bar, with plenty of servers. Even though it is usually crowded, you never have to wait long for a drink.
author: jen w.

description: Now, I've tried both floors. I don't know how, but the fries downstairs were better. Though a bit pricey, at least they have Smithwick's. I kinda like the old Irish decor.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Good selection of beers.  I had the Chimay which is delicious!  This place gets pretty packed at night.  We had an early lunch here on the weekend.  Hubby had the fish and chips.  Came with 3 HUGE pieces of fish, big fries and a thing of peas.  The fish was light and crispy.  Very well done.  I had the corn beef and "cabbage" panini.  I was craving some corn beef and cabbage..but they didn't have it an an entree.  The panini came with a side of mixed greens and pickled veggies.  The sandwich is basically a ruben.  It was a bit dry for me.  The pickled veggies were good though.  Would probably come back for more Chimay!
author: Eegnam A.

description: Foley's definitely has the feel of an authentic Irish Pub, but the prices are way too high! I get it that it's in Union Square but come on! $6.50 for a pint of Magners? $14 for a cottage pie? Crazy! My parents and I came in for lunch, each got a drink and a meal and the total was over $60 before tip! The food is tasty, so if you're stuck in Union Square and real hard up for some bangers and mash it's a good place to go but there's better and cheaper Irish places in the city to get a proper pint of Guiness.
author: Melanie V.

description:
boring beer selection, over-priced WEAK cocktails. stick to shots and beer, for more bang for your buck. (yay, shots!)

Upstairs, the only good part going on are the bartenders. Although Foley's doesn't employ females behind the bar, (Idiots) they make up with decent service from the men behind the bar. Good personalities.

Don't sit in the server area unless you absolutely-can't-go-elsewhere -and-have-to. The girls are often, sadly, extremely rude- BUT all the staff seems to buzz on a tight wire of nervousness and tension, so my money is totally betting that's the result of their boss and management. Because, it just DOESN'T feel comfortable, ya know? Like a pub should? There its just more a walls and concrete feeling there, than a homey/comfy vibe. Sucks, could be so much better and warmer.

The food is great, again over-priced, but still good. 

ANYWAYS
downstairs is rad, gets super hot with the sweaty masses of people and pianos. Good show though, go see it! Very accommodating to requests! Again, shots and beer only- weak cocktails. (yay shots!)
author: S B.

description:
dueling piano dudes are crazy fun!  
went on a saturday night little bit of a line but really fast moving...no cover! =)
HOT as a demon's balls on the inside though =)
