the piano players take your requests and they are excellent at playing ...one dude was completely rummaging through his books with one hand and playing some fast pace music on the keys and singing all at once...fella had some skill! ahha they sang and played new stuff, old stuff, and stuff i've never heard of, but it sounded real good...=) hehehe
irish pub ...irish boys...irish accents mMMm sexxxy hahahaha
author: Michelle W.

description: Fun atmosphere, very pubby. Food is good. Had the fish and chips. The fish itself was a little on the thin side but otherwise good batter and good taste. My wife had the vegitarian soup which looked and tasted very good. Lots of mushrooms and a big dollop of mashed potatoes right in the middle! The service was pretty good too and the waitress was helpful. Try the spicy fries, which seemed to be covered in a combo of siracha and Louisiana hot sauce.
author: Brad K.

description: I've come here several times a week since I started working in San Francisco. The beers and cider on tap provide a great selection. Doesn't seem like a place to me to go beyond a shot of Jameson's and beer for drinks. The food is great for a bar/restaurant at it's price range. The live music is usually cheery and adds to quality of the experience. Another plus is the piano bar down the stairs that is clearly part of the establishment.
author: Scott K.

description: 2 stars for the bloody mary.. We got Irish Car bombs and spent $11 each on them!!! I dont know how thats even legal. Never again. We could have bought a bottle of Jameson for the $22 we paid on 2 shots!!
author: Sarah N.

description: A great place to grab a pint a watch soccer.  Maybe a little irish whiskey if you fancy it.  THis a graet atmosphere and good service too.  It is nice to have a bartender acknowledge your presence in a busy bar, it makes you feel wanted.  Foley's anytime.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Unlike most other US cities, where the line dividing straight from gay is clearly drawn and the trappings of celebration rest within the confines of the ghetto, I'm free to spread the love during SF Pride throughout the city with my straight friends. Tons of straight folks see Pride as their party too, even and especially straight men. I think that's fabulous, politically speaking. Oh who am I kidding, I just think it's fantastic because I want to fuck all of them. I mean, we're all about conversion, RIGHT?!?! We're like a nefarious cult: one minute you're laughing at the hetero-safe humor of Will & Grace, the next minute BAM! you're a fuck toy on a lazy susan and all your inputs are filled with jizzing cock! You laugh, but THAT'S HOW THEY GOT TO ME.

So you shouldn't be surprised when I tell you that I spent part of Pride Sunday watching the final match between Spain and Germany in the Euro Football Championship at Johnny Foley's with a bunch of hetero Asians presently learning English as a second language. And yes, by "football" I mean "soccer" you overzealous USA Patriot Act jingoist shitheads -- PLEASE DON'T DEPORT ME! I know, I know. My hetero proclivities die hard, and the fact that I'm Liberace's hair stylist doesn't hide all those women I've stuffed and babies I've fathered, but you've got to give me some credit: football isn't THAT straight. It's actually pretty metro and ambiguous. In fact, according to the Scale of Sport Sexuality ranging from straightest to gayest, football/soccer falls in the middle:

                             STRAIGHT
                                   l
           Muff Diving = l
                                   l = Hockey
             Genocide = l
                                   l
NASCAR Racing = l
                                   l
                                   l = Competitive Impregnation
                                   l
           Basketball = l
           Beer Pong = l
                                   l = Sucking Dick For Drug Money
                                   l = Baseball 
  Football/Soccer = l
             Volleyball = l
                                   l = America's Top Model
     Swordfighting = l
                                   l
  Working at MAC = l
                                   l = Snowballing
                                   l = Britney Spears Walkoffathon
                                   l = Anal Olympics
             Wrestling = l
                                   l = Platform Diving
                                   l
                                GAY

Anyway, Johnny Foley's is much larger than it appears from the outside. Airy. Mysterious and welcoming. It posesses a bit of what the French call "je ne sais quoi," which in English means PASS THE FUCKING GUINNESS, YOU TOSSER. The decor reminded me of my Grandmother's house, you know, the crazy Irish one who stashes Smithwick's behind the volumes of Joyce and Flann O'Brien. Lots of dark wood paneling and partitions break up the cavernous space, creating "rooms" and secret nooks perfect for hiding from the family priest when he tries to molest me. I also liked the numerous paintings of Irish luminaries on the wall, especially the literati 'cause you know Irish lit makes me hard. Like the huge painting of Samuel Beckett fronting the restroom entrance -- I don't know about you Estragon, but seeing Sam's leathery mug is an excellent laxative. And we were seated by the fireplace in the back, next to a painting of Oscar Wilde. One of my Japo friends pointed to the painting and said his teacher looked like Wilde. 

"Your teacher looks like Oscar Wilde?!?"
"Yes. Who is Oscar Wired?"
"Some cocksucker. Good writer, though."

The prices are a wee bit higher here than comparable pubs, but that comes with the Union Square tourist trap territory. I can't comment on the food since I didn't have any, but I will say the wait staff was friendly and professional. They checked in with regularity, and made sure our glasses were consistently filled with the poison of our choice. And while it was crowded, I never felt like I'd be trampled to death in the event of a fire. In fact, I have to say the crowd (split 60/40 between fans of Spain and fans of Germany) here was pretty mellow. I mean, I was cheering for Spain (VIVA ESPANA!) but to be honest part of me wanted them to LOSE BADLY if only because those Spaniards are so fucking EMO. They would have bawled and tossed back 3,518 sangrias and I would have been able to comfort the super hot Spanish dude wearing the RUN DMC t-shirt with pity gay sexo. Whereas the Germans -- FUCK, talk about expressionless and stoic! Did they just lose the football match or invade France? Hard to tell. Wait, what the hell am I talking about again?!?

Oh, right. Thanks to Johnny Foley's, I left with my hetero cred intact, free to don my wrestling singlet and rim my way through Pride. I'll be happy to return.
author: d s.

description: Went there for St. Patty's day.  Prices were fair at best.  Nothing particurlarly stood out but it was clean and there's a good crowd.
author: Keith P.

description:
Went to Foley's on a Saturday night ready to get some good Irish pub food and some tasty beers. There was a short wait which we made go even faster by getting cocktails at the bar. I asked the Irish accented bartender for a good amber beer and he gave me a sample taste of the one he suggested. YUM! It was just how I liked it! Now if only I could remember what it was called! errrrr! 
Once we sat our 12 year old waitress came by to take appetizer orders and any drink refills. We got calamari for the table. Probably one of the best calamari's I've had! I'm not an expert on it because usually it is difficult to find a friend to share it with. But, this one was lightly breaded with very tender (not chewy) meat inside. YUM! I could have eaten the whole plate myself! but I kindly shared :P
I decided after a big plate of fried calamari it would be in my best interest to stick with a salad. Amazing salmon salad. The dressing was sweet and tangy and they actually didn't drench the thing! The fish seemed juicy and fresh (not dry). over all very tasty. The rest of the table got chicken and steak which everyone seemed to enjoy. The best was the spicy fries my BF got....I stole only a couple! 
My mission to get Irish food didn't quite turn out the way I expected, but next time I'm so getting the cottage pie!
author: Casi C.

description: Best service in the city! I don't know if all of their waitstaff is as good as Deirdre, but we had such an amazing experience with her! I'm social director for our company and every week I direct our company to new venues in the city for our happy hour, so we've seen a lot of places in the city! I arrived about an hour before everyone else and when I mentioned that I was going to eventually go out for a smoke, as soon as she saw me put my jacket on from across the room, she was right there to put a napkin over my pint to claim the table. As new people arrive, generally, you just send new arrivals to the bar to get served and 10 minutes later they return with a beer. We just told them, "No, we have great service, she'll be around soon." and she was at our table within a minute or two to get the new orders and to refill existing ones! She knew what everyone was drinking so just saying "one more" actually meant something to her, you didn't have to remind her of anything. No one had an empty glass for more than a minute and rather than spending the night trying to get the attention of the bartender to get another drink, we were all able to just hang out and have our needs handled! Of all the places I've been in SF, Deirdre was the best server we've ever had! We left a generous tip -- when you find good service, you have to reward it! She made everything so easy for us. Quick drinks and refills, quick service of new arrivals, quick removal of appetizer empty plates, quick bills, everything! I can't speak for the service of all of the waitstaff, but Deirdre definitely left a very positive impression on us! I made a special effort after our bill was paid to make sure I had the spelling of her name right because I knew I had to write a review and mention her. If you go here, make sure to get in Deirdre's section! She's amazing!
author: Paul E.

description: Cool bar. Lots of bartenders so it does not take a millennium to get a drink. The crowd is really fun and I enjoyed their live music.
author: Darius A.

description: I'm sure the food is great and the Guiness is real authentic and everything, but I'm obliged to write a bad review on behalf of my friend, my actual IRISH friend visiting from actual IRELAND, who was turned away from this alleged Irish pub ON ST. PADDY'S DAY because they claimed to not accept Irish passports. What is that about? Lame on many different levels. No stars.
author: Annie G.

description: While spending the summer living in San Francisco, Johnny Foley's became a Friday night favorite of my friends and I. This bar is unlike most of the bars I have visited. Upstairs there is a Irish dinner that serves delicious and authentic Irish food, while downstairs boasts a dueling pianos irish pub. Two piano players sit in front of two pianos, performing song requests from the audience. The bigger the tip, the more likely your song is to be played. The musicians are fabulous. They know just about every song in the book and belt them out as the whole bar sings along. Another plus of this bar is the price. I was served two tequila shots and two Coronas for under $25. Cheap drinks and excellent service make Johnny Foley's a great pick for any evening. My friends and I enjoyed sitting together, having a few drinks and singing along. Whether going out for a night on the town or searching for a regular hang out, Johnny Foley's is a perfect place to unwind and have some fun.
author: Jaimie A.

description: Still absolutely love this place and out of all the pub/grills I have been to this one has the best fish & chips. I'll have to make a list about that soon. Still 5 stars from me!
author: Sarah D.

description: hard to rate - the food was great but mine didn't have hair in it like B's did.  mushroom rav. with chicken - good choice.  friendly staff.  hard to tell what it's really like there since it was 4pm when we dined.
author: Hammer Time H.

description:
Normally I would never set foot in such a cliched place.  However, when one is hungover to the extent that I was you could have deep fried a paperclip and I would have declared it fine cuisine.
Now me being hungover is nothing new and certainly not different from any other night of the week.  However, there is a sliding scale of hungover magnitude and I was sitting pretty with a score of 7.  This requires treatment with alcohol, grease and sunshine.  Bloody Mary's were great but fucking EXPENSIVE! Last I checked we didn't have an embargo on tomato juice.  My fish and chips were good but the vinegar they had at the table wasn't acidic enough and, although it was tasty, I was almost resentful of the presence of a malt vinegar mayonnaise dipping sauce.  I like my fish and chips dirty style with lots of grease, wrapped in paper and with a lot of salt and vinegar.  Foley's fish and chips are too refined for my tastes, although still tasty.
All in all I'd just say "Meh".  I'm not down for touristy bars and locales nor did I find anything particularly inspiring enough to get me to come here regularly and to pony up that much cash.
author: Jill D.

description: Came with a couple of friends, atmosphere is very lively and buzzing. Food tastes pretty good, ordered Madra's chicken curry with chutney and cucumber raita. Didn't really care for the cucumber raita, so left that alone. My friend ordered fish & chips in lager batter which was really delicious. Service was good, friendly.
author: Lily K.

description: A nice beer and plate of fish and chips couldn't have sounded better. So, knee-deep in shopping bags and wet hair from the rain, I was seated at a nice table in the back. I got my fix in and the food was pretty good. The wait for drinks and such was a little long for my taste, but nonetheless I got to rest my feet, warm up and fill up.
author: Natalie N.

description: this is the real deal irish pub! Been here many times and had a great time every single time. Love going in there to watch some soccer games and grab a few beers! does get pretty busy in there and sometimes a little uncomfortable. if your downtown its a fun place to check out!
author: nick h.

description: They used to have great music in the basement.  Not sure if they are still doing this  but it was worth the trip downtown of an evening to enjoy it.
author: Rose Q.

description: The atmosphere is what you'd expect from an Irish Pub.  The food was better then I was expected (although I did not care for the seafood chowder appetizer).  I had the salmon with cabbage and potatoes (total cost $38).
author: Scott M.

description: This place is just plain fun.  Cool Irish bartenders, energetic piano players, and always a good crowd.  I love how there are always multiple generations and people from all over the world.  This place is great to go when you and some friends just want to dance, sing, and have a good time!
author: Karen B.

description: I love this place.  Very casual dining, attentive waitstaff and of course an excellent pour of Guinness.  Bar grub to die for -typical fried, meaty, starchy but quality.  Try the Bangers and Mash mmm mmm good. Comfortable atmosphere. Not pricey. Some nights Nikki the talented Tranny sings the 80's.  She is very sweet.  She sang Blondie for me.  I asked for Heart but that wasn't part of her repertoire.
author: Anna W.

description:
i hate going to touristy places, but foleys is an okay spot. my friends from SJ love going there, so i will tag along every now and then.
the thing i love is that outside if your smoking or something the staff or receptionist will get rid of the homeless if they start walking up to you! that in itself is worth 4 starts!
author: Ryan B.

description: Definitely not a bad choice if you do not know where to go and what to eat.  I prefer drink there, than eating. A lot of selection of beer. I just love the beers there,..
author: Ken C.

description: This is a great place for a bloody fantastic Bloody Mary any ole time! The bartenders are all ultra-friendly, hysterical, actually, and the munchies are great too. You can have Irish Cider on ice, draft pulls, and again, those Bloody Mary's are like a garden of Eden in a tall tomato slice o' heaven. Great mix of business folk, tourists, and 20, 30, and 40-somethings any time of the day.
author: Braden B.

description: This place is great, it's nice and dark, just how I like it.  Sit in the back room if you really want to escape the Union Square crowds.  The cottage pie was delisious.
author: Maria D.

description: typical irish bar in every way aside from the dueling pianos (hate those damn things in any place they're at), so foleys loses a star because i had to find a new place to drink.  walk into a host station and a couple tables.  the bar is huge and along the right side.  there are multiple maze-like dividers throughout the main seating area behind the bar stools with high/low tables.  foleys is constantly packed and must take reservations because frustratingly there are "reserved" tents over all the open tables.  food is average, but there's a great alcohol selection.  gets very loud even before the stupid pianos start (dividers seems to keep the noise in a smaller place rather than breaking it up.  convenient given the choices in the area, but not a destination.  great staff and mostly friendly patrons.
author: D h.

description: I was put in the back bar and got very little attention. The bartender spent a tiny fraction of her time actually in the bar area.
author: Chuck H.

description: I've been to Foley's twice before - once with my Dad and my sister to have dinner and once this past Friday night to have a couple drinks before heading to B&B with my bf and some friends. I remember the food being really good - my burger and fries were delicious and there are a lot of good beers on tap. Maybe I didn't notice it the first time since my Dad was picking up the tab, but my beer was $6.50!! I dunno about the rest of you, but to me, that's expensive for your average, ordinary beer. I checked out the drink menu for a sec and saw that the rest were around that price too. Jeez. Overall decent atmosphere and there's live music too! I didn't check out the cellar, but I noticed a lot of ppl heading down there. Ooo - another plus are the clean bathrooms! Good location and easy parking in the Ellis/Ofarrell garage across the street.
author: Corrina S.

description:
My ideal Irish pub...an old, speakeasy building with awesome wall paper, dark stained wood and really huge paintings of famous Irish folk (Bono is among the ones in the front part of the restaurant).  It can get pretty noisy, but not overly so and the music selection, whether traditional irish music or otherwise, doesn't ruin the atmosphere.  

So I went there with my boyfriend to celebrate our three year anniversary, and instead of seating us in the very crowded and noisier main room, we were seated in what I believe is a banquet room which had it's own mini bar, portraits, everything the same as the larger room.  The hostess had an attitude, but she did seat us in the little off-shoot room, so whatever, not going to ruin our night.  Our waitress was really great, although sometimes we were sitting around waiting for a while, but the place was completely packed and she was running around doing her job, so it wasn't a huge problem for us.  The food was...simply incredible.  I had the chef's special Lamb on top of mashed potatoes with asparagus and I'm used to lamb being somewhat on the dry side, but this was so tender and moist I couldn't believe that it was lamb.  We were so stuffed that we couldn't partake in any of their coffee or delicious dessert selection, but I'm definitely going to go back to have some of that on another day.  

The only downpoint is that it does get a little pricey, but remember, I'm in college so eating like that is a special occassion and not a weekly deal.  Excellent all around, the beers they have on tap are fantastic (my favorite is Smithwick's), and my boyfriend says their Bloody Marys are near the best he's had.
author: Veronica S.

description: After two years of trying to get into this place being under-aged, me and my best girl pal finally turned 21 and where able to get in and experience a Irish pub! it was grand!!! the food was enjoyable and the live music was great with all kinds of ppl. You should kind of dress up...like jeans and a nice blouse with some heels should be fine and as for fellas some jeans and a nice button-up will do. The prices are reasonable and the drinks are exceptional. This is a grand place when you want to go out on a date and experience live music ladies, and fellas a great place if you want to impress ya women. that is not going to break your pocket book : D
author: Shante E.

description: Cute bartenders/doormen and good drinks (not too strong, just right), EXCELLENT Guinness! Was there for St. Patty's Day. It was a madhouse downstairs where the dueling pianos are but good times! A bit touristy. Upstairs were men in jackets and had a european feel.
author: linda y.

description: I agree with other reviewers talking about a tourist trap. I had some beer, took a look at the food others had ordered around me, and skip it. Nothing very interesting here.
author: Javi V.

description: Had a smashing good time at this pub tonight. It was super crowded, but I was advised of a wee bar in the back. My bartender was bloody lovely and loads of fun. It's the oddest thing, like every server I met was and Island import and 95 percent of the people eating there were too. I had so much fun!!! The fish and chips is divine and the bartender convinced me to try mushy peas which are pretty good. Turns out not all the peas are smashed just a few and they mix in whole ones. Healthy and interesting.The TV was set to Oxygen in the back and I had the chance to watch Baby Boom and a portion of Brokedown Palace. . Perfect.
author: Jocelyn F.

description:
Upping my rating to four stars - why? Dueling Piano Bar. It's downstairs and was a BLAST. I'm a solid fan of Foley's pub area when I'm in the area, but would actually make the trip to this part of town for the piano bar. It's the fun of kareoke (drunkenly singing along to songs) - but with really good singers that can play an instrument :-)

------------------
Every other bar tries to call themselves a "pub"....few really are. Foley's on the other hand, actually reminds me of  the pubs i went to back in Ireland. 

It's a big place (giant by SF standards) with a decently large bar area, tables, and a back room. Haven't eaten there, but it looks like good Irish fare. 

Good beer selection and a full bar with live music at times. 
Went to the back bar and quickly realized why that bartender in the back... was in the back (she actually slowly increased her warnings of "i'm the only one back here, just a heads up" to "it'll be a while" to "i'm not going to serve you" evidently she prefers the crappy-attitude-small-tip method of bartending). but once we left her, had a good experience. 

i doubt i'd travel to the union square area just to go here...but next time i'm in the area, it'll be my pick. no cover, decent prices, lots of seats and a fun low-key crowd. my kind of bar.
author: Diane W.

description: I always have a good time here.  Drinks are pricey, must me the downtown real estate.  Most of the staff are very friendly & professional (David, you rock!) ....though, I was 'carded' the other day & the bartendar said "I'm being nice today."  Ouch, back handed compliment.  Oh well.  I'll try to remain a fan. Hand me my $6.25 pint of Sierra.  Good day.
author: J M.

description: Not pub-ish enough.  Not Irish enough.  I had a Caesar salad and my friend had a curry dish.  What's Irish about it?  The waitress, though nice, was kind of trippy, and playing Sinead O'Connnor overhead does not an Irish Bar make.
author: Joanna L.

description: I have gone here on a few occasions and every time I say never again. The food is Ok, but it always takes forever and it is pretty pricey. Bartenders never seam to be in a good mood, ditto for servers. The place tends to be packed, I feel with tourist. On the up side its clean and open late. I have been to a few Irish Bars and this one just dose not make the cut.
author: Lisa A.

description: Good pint of guiness, good cottage pie and a pretty good crowd. Certainly a tourist trap but it was a pretty friendly vibe overall. I was in there thursday night and the transvestite/transgendered singer was very entertaining.
author: Karl L.

description: If you're in the mood for dueling pianos, as odd as that may be, this is as good as it gets. Raucous, out of control, and very funny, would be the way I would describe a night at Johnny Foley's. Lot's of drunk tourists, which could be good or bad depending on your perspective.
author: Neil C.

description: good beers, good fun, nice staff, live music - sometimes good sometimes not so good. its a good spot to meet friends in union square.
author: Jordan P.

description: This place reminds me so much of the pubs I used to hang out at in London and for that I love it!
author: Reza E.

description: The vomit/sewage smell is gone!! Yippee!! We use to come here all the time when we first moved to the city but stopped due to the horrid smell as you walk in. Must be under new management because the smell is gone!! Now I can enjoy the fattening fried foods and Guinness and ambiance.
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
this is a neat irish pub that is centrally located in union square.  it makes a great spot to refuel, and catches you when you're just about to drop from all that shopping.  it's also a cool place to meet locals, and the transients and journeyers that come to explore san francisco.

i love the classic woodwork, and the enormous bar that wraps around the right side of place.  the food is delish, they make mean martinis, and the staff are on point with excellent customer service.

i still have yet to see the dueling piano battle.

do pop around when in the area!
author: Sheri N.

description: Ahh, Johnny Foley's, what a marvelous place. Every St. Patty's Day, the bars and clubs in the city are awash with green beer and Guinness, but for the other 364 days out of the year finding a touch of the emerald isle means coming to Johnny Foley's. This place brings out the feeling of a classic Dublin pub, a long, elegant bar pouring a variety of stout Irish beers and a lot of tables tucked into little corners and a bandstand that plays all night long. A handful of flat screens keep you up to date on the game during the day, and serve as a place to stare while your wingman is crashing and burning.
author: Eric P.

description: Big, but fun irish pub. Has the yummy selection of pub food any respectable irish pub should have, and the dishes I have tried have all been savory and satisfying. The have cider on tap, which is always a bonus to me as I can feel like i'm one of the crowd drinking beer and actually enjoy my drink. Overall a fun place for a hearty meal.
author: Aimee B.

description: This place is always busy, but the staff always go out of their way to make sure you are taken care of. Plus the food is unreal... sheppers pie, chicken curry, and if your like me and know they have the most unbelievable chicken pot pie in the world thats not even on the menu anymore... you ask for it, they'll give it to you... Great staff, fantastic food, fun music and a good crowd.  Always happy to go back to foleys when I am in the area.
author: Laura C.

description: I love this bar. Wen there for St. Patty's day this year and had a blast. Too many people and some got pretty drunk by the end of the night but that's to be expected at most Irish bars. They had a great band playing a variety of music. Good fun with cute friendly bartenders.
author: Randa T.

description: I love this place. I never thought I would have so much fun at a very touristy place. The pianists were so good. Drinks were delicious. Didn't eat though.
author: Sheila D.

description: If you have to choose a spot to grab a quick drink/bite in the Union Square area, I recommend this place. It's a great pub that pours a solid pint of Guinness and serves good Irish/pub food. While it has its fair share of tourists (due to the location), it's a great escape from the normal traps in the area.
author: Sig N.

description: This is a cool place to hang out with friends. Lots of elbow room even with the band playing. The service is a little slow and I caught one of the bar tenders trying to scam me out of my change. No big deal, but I must have looked as though I was from out of town. Rude!  It is a big place but it is sectioned off with partitions and it still has that old town pub thing going on. I would definitely come back for the food. The corned beef looked pretty good.
author: Steven M.

description: I love this Irish bar/pub. They have real pub grub, but it's excellent. And REAL Irish beer on tap and anything else you can find in the UK. Great place for lunch, happy hour (I don't know if they have specials), and dinner with friends. Not too touristy either for being near Union Square.
author: Tammy S.

description: It's in my genes to like a place like Johnny Foley's. Irish pub with live music and relatively good food? I'm there. I've gotten together with friends many times at Foley's over the years and it's convenient downtown location has made it an easy gathering spot. However, I've been less impressed with Foley's on recent visits. It's been so loud that it's impossible to even carry on a conversation. Noise levels like that in a club, fine, but it's off-putting in a bar. The food is pricey, but a big step up from standard pub fare. So stop in early for a bite to eat to start the evening before the music blares or keep it to a pint before moving on your way.
author: Megan K.

description: We live within walking distance of Union Square and randomly set out in that direction fairly often. There is pretty much nothing good to eat in that area, save for the hot dog stands, so when we don't know what else to do with ourselves we end up in Foley's. I have to say I love the atmosphere here, as it's always packed with a mix of locals and tourists, so it's good people watching. It's a good cozy place settle down with some beers and some sports on the weekend. I gave it three stars because the food isn't great. It isn't bad, it just isn't good either.
author: Chaka K.

description: I've been back a couple of times and the food has definitely improved as has the service.  This is pub food so it's not fancy but everything I've had was good.  The fish and chips are done well and substantial as is the Chicken and Vegetable Pie, basically a Irish version of a Chicken Pot Pie.  Prices are reasonable and staff are friendly and efficient.  It's close to my office which is a nice plus!!!
author: Ron T.

description: "Foley's?"  "Where is that?" Is exactly what I said when my friends told me we would be meeting there for a pre-warfield drink/bite.  When you walk into Foley's you are accosted by the smell of vinegar and fried food.  Neither  of which I actually tried.  My friends were half way through dinner when I arrived so I just had a pint.  The vibe is great in that clamoring, sports bar, Irish pub sort of way.  The place is huge and the servers were friendly.  I'd definitely go back for a pint and to try the fish and chips.
author: Anne D.

description: If you want quite decent pub fare and are in the Un Sq vacinity, this is a good stop.  Tried the curry fries and calamari, both were fantastic versions.  The beers here are not cheap, up to $8 for a pint!
author: e w.

description: I was driving through the Tenderloin/Union Sq. tonight looking for a place to grab a beer and I was pleasantly surprised by this place. There were plenty of spaces at the bar, lots of tasty beers on tap, and March Maddness on the TVs. The noise level allowed for conversation without yelling. Having just come from dinner elsewhere, I didn't get anything to eat, but the food smelled and looked quite tasty. The pints weren't cheap, but still priced very reasonably for its location and proximity to Union Sq.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
There are a few cool people that work there.... like maybe 2................otherwise some of the most unhappy staff and it shows in their service.I have frequented johnny foley's  for the music and food for the past three years . However I find many of them very unfriendly and in fact on tuesday the first bartender was cool then a second one abruptly comes at us throwing  coasters down with a BIG attitude and tells  us  to leave if we didn't order at least a coke.. BTW  the place was empty  at this time ..and the band had no one to play too , we were just there a few minutes. I wanted to eat but they were not serving anymore it was about 10:30........We truly were not sure if we were staying ... but ...............I told him that i come there a lot  and ..just days before i spend $150 and brought in a group of friends to hear musicians  we knew playing. ( very  very rude waitress that night  as well..)     in defense to our questioning this bartenders command   ..... said he just told two other girls to leave as well, because they weren't drinking ... what kind of treatment is that??? give me a minute to build of a thirst dude !!!!! If it is so important to get two dollars charge a cover at the door! instead of letting us leave with a bad tast in our mouths... I don't feel welcome  and it   Seems they are ALL about the buck! one buck to be exact ...
NOT  GOIN BACK FOR ABUSE!! I guess they don't want locals to patronize  there restaurant by the way we are continually treating  us  .Pretty sure this attitude is coming from the top of the chain..(owner) who was there. Penny wise but pound foolish.. over a coke.!!!!.
author: susan m.

description:
we came here, went downstairs to the dueling pianos and i want to come back!

once you pass the double doors, it's a hot, sweaty mess in there, and it's just perfect! 6 bucks for a black an tan, not bad. awesome service at the bar, never bad. this is what makes you want to stick by the bar, instead of taking your drinks to the table with your friends. the guys playing the pianos were pretty impressive, and i enjoyed the irish accents nearby. yeah! who woulda thunk that we'd get some irish brethren in an irish pub?!?! we didn't get to talk to them much, but we had fun and cheering our drinks with those around us and singing along to the songs that were played. classic journey, some hotel california, even a bit of gin and juice. yes, they found keys on the piano to mimic the beats of snoop d-o double g, and the little white dude knew every lyric to the song!!!
author: Pamela s.

description:
super cool joint.

didn't have much time to spend here, but wish i did.  food was good, service was quick and atmosphere was right up my alley.  lots of young, good looking people here.  kinda bummed i had to split.
author: Jen S.

description: Amazing experience. Made it to this charming irish pub on New Years Eve after a failed attempt at a bad Moroccan restaurant a few blocks away. It was a short wait [and it was New Years Eve!] and all of the employees were welcoming and friendly. Great food, great service, fun atmosphere, overall awesome restaurant. We will be back!
author: Luna V.

description: Busy Saturday night.  I had the smoked cod. My friends had cottage pie and corn beef.  There was no potato famine here since most of the meal consisted of potatoes.  They ran out of beer glasses  so the took ours before we were really done with the beer.  Then the 4% health insurance tax topped off the evening.  Won't go back and will not recommend to friends.
author: Vokome G.

description: I took a date here, and had an amazing time. Its a great place to get a few drinks, laugh at tourists, dance, and sing. The dueling pianos, was really fun, and both of the guys did a great job. All the staff is friendly and energetic. The piano man forced me and my date on stage to dance and sing with them. It was a very memorable time, and I will definitely do it again! Audience participation and the energy of the crowd is the key to having a fun time here.
author: Chris P.

description: Hubby and I came here for dinner, actually, so no real review on the bar, but the food was AMAZING! The server recommended the slow roasted prime rib beef. I had that with mashed potatoes and seriously, hubby and I agreed this was the BEST meal we've had since we've been in California (almost a year now). I don't even remember what he got because I was too focused on how amazing mine tasted! We were sad we didn't discover til our last night because, I swear, we would have come back for every meal! Oh, and DH had some kind of alcoholic cider drink and said it was one of the best tasting alcoholic beverages he's ever had!
author: Methodical M.

description: didnt try the food got there late but the ambient was cool and the bartenders were nice would come back if im in the area again. the band that was playing was good to.
author: Ricardo A.

description: Loved this place.  On a Wednesday night, sports on the flatscreen TVs (soccer and baseball, if you must know), great fish and chips, and great beer on tap.  Guinness was smooth and Chimay on tap is always a treat.  Friendly servers, just and overall nice pub vibe.
author: Tom K.

description: Visiting SF with our 8 year old. Staying at the Hotel Nikko and needed a family friendly/road weary parent friendly place to enjoy dinner. Foley's Irish House managed to make all 3 of us happy. We even got our song request "Cecilia" played by the evening musician. We recommend sitting deep in the restaurant with a child~ close the the restroom yet right by the bar. The children's menu was so far beyond the standard *chicken strips* that we thanked our server~ salmon and mashed potatoes! A celebration for parents who want our child to have an actual palate beyond a hamburger.  The prime rib was noteworthy as was the almond crusted salmon.
author: Nori M.

description: On a cold day I went to this place which I've passed by many times thinking that it's a tourist trap which it is! Fortunately the pub food here is good, I had the Bangers and Mash with guinness and it was wonderful. I plan to go again and try some other stuff.
author: N A.

description: Great Food, and Great Beer. The decor was nice as well. Side note the bartender was able to make drawings in the beer foam.
author: Jer J.

description: Stopped by after a day of visiting SF. It was near my garage and I didnt feel like heading home without some food and a pint. It's a pretty standard Irish pub, great atmosphere and friendly staff. The crowd is a little bit older than what I'd prefer (28-32) but I found some girls around my age to chat up anyway.
author: Marcus G.

description:
THIS REVIEW OF ONLY FOR THE DUELING PIANOS DOWNSTAIRS - NOT THE REST OF THE BAR. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I have been on the hunt for some good dueling pianos in SF and I am overjoyed that I finally found it. How come nobody has told me about the secret downstairs of JF's before? I am mad at you all for keeping this from me until now!
I have admittedly been to the upstairs of JF's a few years back and I don't remember if being all that special...kind of, ehh. Obviously "ehh" since I haven't been back in 3 years. I heard through the grapevine that JF's had dueling pianos downstairs for FREE, EVERY NIGHT, so I had to check it out. 
We had such a great time. The entertainment was wonderful and we were singing along and laughing non-stop. To get a song played you have to tip the piano players as you write your song request down..and people fork over a pretty penny to get their song played, so be prepared to spend some $ or just chill and listen to the songs that the bigger spenders request...you'll know and like most of them, probably, unless you're weird. 
The drinks are average sf prices, and the food was like upscale bar food. They just served appetizers by the time we got there around 9ish on a Sunday night. Our waitress was attentive. No complaints on the food or service. 
I can't wait to go back!
author: Julie F.

description: I think I'd give this place 3.5 stars.  The place is big and the bartenders were good and quick.  However, my friend ordered 2 orange martinis and the glasses were little more than half full.  I watched the bartender make them and he just didn't put enough of the ingredients in to make a full glass.  Considering it is an Irish pub, my friend was just happy they were able to make an orange martini that tasted good.
author: Seong P.

description: This was the last bar we hit, so I was at my limit for beverages.  The atmosphere was typical Irish Pub, but the live band made the scene so much fun! The crowd was laidback, and dominated by the Baby Boom generation and tourists.  I didnt even mind cuz the music was great & it was spacious enuf for everybody.
author: McCracken C.

description: Stumbled into this place after seeing a movie and decided to give it a shot. Many beers on tap, attentive barkeeps, super diverse crowd with its share of tourists due to its location, funky live music. Not the worst place to down a beer or two, really.
author: Roland A.

description:
I LOVE this place during the week, I hate this place on Fridays and Saturdays. Fridays and Saturdays are way too crowded and although I have heard good live music there on occasion....usually it is painfully loud that you can't even hear the people across from you at a table or next to you. Hey, I didn't pay cover....so you're obviously not making money from the band. Make my experience enjoyable so I have more than one drink.

Fri/Sat: We left after 1 drink because we didn't like it.

Weekdays: Loved it. Good beer/liqour selection and good Irish food as a restaurant. Could come here often to enjoy a pint, shoot the shit, and relax.
author: Mike T.

description: My favorite Irish Pub of Irish Pub's.  First off, let's talk about an Irish Pub REQUIREMENT:  Murphy's on tap.  If the pub doesn't have Murphy's then it's probably not worth your time.  Secondly, the food is great, the atmosphere is always poppin'. This place is packed 24/7, so be prepared for a wait if you're looking for a meal.  But i just dined on a platter of Mussels ($8), Seafood chowder ($5/bowl) and a shitload of great beer ($5.75/per tap beer) and staggered pack to the BART with a smile.  Conveniently located next to the better shopping districts off Powell Street, this pub will make a great end to a long day.
author: Ross H.

description: Just to point out that the dueling pianos / crowd participation / singing / dancing / laughing event is in the basement, which is a separate entrance from the perfectly reasonable irish pub facsimile upstairs, known for good beer and decent food and an enjoyable atmosphere. The piano guys are outrageously fun! Try it out.
author: James H.

description: 2 years later and the place smells more than it did before, the hostess was a rude bitch and the beers are $6. Definitely a last resort stop around Union Square...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Decent pub with a cool, partitioned layout. I liked my gorgonzola and apple salad, but it upset my stomach later and that's no fun when you're trying to have a night out. Definitely overpriced and super touristy. I guess I shouldn't expect anything but tourists when I'm in Union Square, it's March Madness and there are games held in the vicinity. Just beware of Gonzaga alums the day after their team loses-- slurring and groping for any escape. Scary.
author: Michie L.

description: This is a great place for happy hour after work, bachelorette Irish party and company dinner. I love their fish and chips. It is soooo good. I had a company christmas dinner here once. The food was very yummy. I ordered steak and it came out ok. Steak is not their specialty. The only time I will avoid this spot is St. Patrick's Day. On that day, the pub gets jam-packed with people and the floor is sticky with spilled beer.
author: Helen L.

description: Rumored as the second place Irishman go after they come to the US, Foley's can be a fun place.  Great if you go here on a weekday, when you don't have to endure no seating, and a crowd of slobbering drunks.  The food here is pretty good, especially for pub fare.  The bloody mary oysters are damn good, and this coming from a person who HATES bloody marys'.  Cottage pie, fish and chips, both good.  Great beer and whiskey selection.
author: Kapeli M.

description: Great bar - $ gone up a bit since the re-fit back over Christmas '05 but still worth the trip after a hard day hanging out in union square.  food decent as is the beer.  also, it's not one of these 'Irish' theme bars where leprechauns are depicted in figurines on the bar etc etc - it's decent.  you can dress it up (take date, family etc) or down (get v drunk with friends).  up to you. Cheers!
author: A H.

description:
good atmosphere, great crowd

on the other hand, it's the union square area so parking is nonexistent, the beers are $5.50 at a minimum, and it's a sauna inside because they don't apply any a/c

take tourists here, otherwise stay away
author: Charles C.

description: Packed, packed, packed.  And what's up with the bizarre partitions in the middle of an otherwise roomy space?  Definitely a place for tourists, but the beer is good and the food was decent.  A GIANT plate of calamari for 9 dollars, the gorgonzola and apple salad was huge ($9) and there were candied walnuts with a hint of nutmeg.  hmm.  VERY loud.  A solid 3 stars.
author: Tempe M.

description: They have tasty last night munchies and good beer. I went with a group of friends we had a good time but we didn't stay here all night.  They have live music which is a plus. Another plus is that they have a few beers that you don't often see on tap.
author: Sharon M.

description: this place is crawling with tourists... but who cares, the beer selection is unheard of.. what i dont get is, why do tourists always get bud or miller? HELLO.. 20 plus on TAP..
author: Dee L.

description: Stopped her for a couple pints of Guinness as I waited for the Apple iPhone lines to thin out.  The place was packed, but I slid into an opening at the bar.  The bartenders were very attentive despite how busy it was.
author: Mike S.

description: This place is good only for cocktails, and only if you find yourself in union square in need of a drink.  The menu sucks, it's overpriced and the food is crappy.  They have a very clean bathroom.
author: Emily T.

description:
This is a really interesting place, located downtown in SF.

At face value, it's just another Irish Pub in an urban area, filled with tourists, business travelers, and other undesirables.
However, this place is a bit different.  The staff is truly excellent, the food is very tasty, the drinks are great, and there is a very special attraction that you absolutely MUST go see.  
Everyone must go there to watch a local musician named Nicole McRory.  I'm fairly sure she plays there on Wednesday and Thursday nights (maybe more).  She plays covers rock n roll covers and is a fantastic musician.  She knows thousands of songs and you can request just about anything you can imagine.  You can go right up and talk to her and she is constantly interacting with the crowd.  She is truly a Bay Area original and if I owned a major record label, I would sign her in a second.  She has forgotten more about music than most of us will ever know.  Go check her out immediately.
author: Daniel C.

description: Something about the high ceilings and tiled floor makes it feel like Foley's lived a previous life as a five-and-dimer.  And while Irish pubs usually involve quaint nooks and nondominant music, in the interest of good conversation, Foley's bends the rules a little bit.  But it's nicely wooded and clean, beer selection is good, and the bar personalities are polite.  Passable for at least a pint or two.
author: MScott S.

description: Great beer, hearty food, decent service and low-key for the area. Plus, you can usually get a table! Yum, Guiness!!
author: Rose J.

description:
note to self: don't go to irish pubs unless you are already faded or desire to become wasted quickly.  screaming to talk over loud ass music is not fun when you are sober.  
points for cool bartenders and creative layout.
author: rachel l.

description:
I always walk into this place thinking I want a Bud Light and end up ordering a Guinness. 

The inside is dark in that sexy-wooden-bar kind of way.

But the clientele are obvi tourists, or old, and for someone like myself who likes to get her party on in an Irish "pub," these things are deal-breakers.

The food is typical pub grub except pricey. I did the math: .86 cents per ring of calamari. 

Figure out for yourself if that's really worth it.
author: Jenna F.

description: John Foley's is one of my favorites. I'm not all that wild about trekking to Union Square and braving the tourists in my own city, but Ill do it for JF's, and for a few reasons: the bread pudding; the corned beef, the bloody marys, and Nicole! Tuesdays and Thursdays are the best nights to go--Nicole never disappoints. She's got a great voice to drink beer and bloody marys to, and she's sweet. Ask for Come Back to Sorrento and White Wedding, and don't tell the people you take what to expect!
author: Elle C.

description: I love IRISH people and would have preferred to watch the soccer match here today, had I known it was brighter and better than the Union Square Sports Bar. The food is definitely priced for tourists. Beware.
author: Miles G.

description: I've been here countless times, if only for the ambiance. This visit was for a quick lunch of fish and chips along with a Guinness. Disappointed that the lunch plate only included two small pieces of fish. The pub decor is fun and the room is always  very lively.
author: Terry G.

description: Pretty cool place to grab a beer. We stopped in on a Friday afternoon and had good service, a few beers and enjoyed the Ryder Cup. Check it out if you are in the area and looking for a low key place to grab a beer. I cannot speak for the crowd after 5:00 we had moved on by that time.
author: Brian B.

description: i love foleys.  we go there for lunch, dinner,  and drinks.  they are one of the few union square spots that has remained minimally touristy.  their food is AMAZING!  i have a few things i always order...  the vegetable and goat cheese panini, the lamb sliders, the vegetarian shepherds pie, and the garlic fries.  beware of the curry fries though, even the employees say theyre gross.  may be the only thing though.  they have a huge tap beer selection, and properly make their cocktails.  they also have live bands on a regular basis.  their bar crowd is a nice mix of ages, from 20 somethings all the way up to people in their 50's and 60's, and everyone has a blast.  there is an attatched downstairs bar with dueling pianos, but, to be honest, ive never made it because i have too much fun upstairs.
author: Katie H.

description: Foley's is not in the Tenderloin! A block up from Union Square, this is a safe place to walk to. I kinda like this joint, and the staff is always good and quick to serve.
author: Henry F.

description: Somehow we always find ourselves here.  A nice Irish pub in a very touristy location.  I like to go here to watch Premiership Football on Saturdays.  Also a good place to go after your done shopping in Union Sq., prices are nice so you can spend more at the shops.  The bar gets a bit crowded, so it's best to grab a table (preferably near the fireplace) and enjoy a nice pint of the black stuff.
author: George K.

description: Fast, friendly service. Great Irish Car Bombs. Very cool atmosphere. Somewhat expensive for a pint of Guinness. Great place to go to and hide from the crowded streets and crazy shoppers.
author: Jenny C.

description:
So I went to San Francisco yesterday to visit a friend who was in town for a conference. Mind you I should have been attending the same conference but since I am on vacation I was just strolling around having some fun, (enjoying the free food at the Hilton) when 20 minutes after finding my friend I ran smack into my BOSS, well that was an awkward moment. Therefore, trying to avoid the rest of my coworkers we decided to ditch the reception and walk down and find something to eat. We ended at dear Johnny Foley's Irish House. The decor was great, our waitress was nice and their food was very yummy. I must say that their drinks were great. Ordered an Irish coffee somewhere along the way, I've had better but this one was pretty good. We only had to wait about 10 minutes to have our food brought out and when it did it was hot!! 
But I must say what put this place over the top was that I did not encounter any of my coworkers as I proceeded to stuff myself with food and drink the night away!
author: Ana O.

description:
I haven't been here since Lauren moved to Chicago but I needed to write this review to give this place it's props... It's cute not in that trendy way but it's got this nice dark wood look (I don't think anyone will get that description but me but that's all I got)...  I do have to add that Lauren hasn't been gone long so I have been there rather recently... 
I love coming here after work to unwind, vent, joke and occasionally whine... they make a damn good bloody mary and trust me I've had my share... high ranking cosmos and lemon drops... and a good selection of beer... their menu looks pretty ordinary but everything I have tried has been extraordinary to my taste bugs... and I have never had better fish and chips... and I have eaten there before I imbibed... It does tend to get over crowded just after work hours and it's hard to get a spot at the bar if you have more than 2 people with you but you can always get a table...
author: Gracie A.

description: Wonderful Union Square night spot for entertaining and hilarious dueling pianos. It's not a gimmick it's pure fun. I heard Rocky Top Tennessee when I went and I freaked out (this is my roommates' favorite karaoke song ever.) Drinks are pricey but you'd expect that from a place with no cover charge before 10pm.
author: Jessica M.

description: Tourists, after-work. They renovated the place, they did a great job. There's a full bar, and the grub aint bad at all...that's all I have to say about that.
author: M S.

description: This place is very fun if you like pianos and cover songs.  The drinks are expensive; I paid $12 for an overly-sugared and weak mint julep.  I went on a Friday night and the crowd was very lively.  I recommend this as a late stop on a night out with friends.  The songs are entertaining for the most part, though since it is by request you might not like everything.
author: Chris E.

description: Old Irish house feel, but if you're getting a drink stick with Guinness. Bartenders are slow and don't offer any creative drink options. The Irish food is okay, but not the best fish and chips I've had. Bangers and Mash is my go to meal choice. 30's something crowd with soccer on the TV's. Little bar space to hang, better to get a table with a group of friends.
author: Erik W.

description: stopped in here after a day of shopping in union square... i enjoyed this spot because it was simple, not to crowded, and it was on the way back to the parking garage... the food was good and they have a great selection of drinks... when im in the area i will most likely be stopping in again!!!
author: Nic M.

description:
The decor is great. The martinis are cold. The service is friendly but glacial.
The food is horrendous. We ate there once and hoped it was a bad day. We went back and alas it wasn't.  If time and quality are not issues by all means go there.
author: Kent P.

description:
I used to LOVE Johnny Foley's when I lived in SF. It was never cheap, but before they turned into a restaurant/bar their drink prices were good for the area. Even after the change I found that it was still fairly affordable since my group made friends with the bartenders and there's always a happy tourist around who is more than willing to buy all your drinks. 
    I think my favorite thing about Foley's is that it's mainly a tourist bar so you rarely have to worry about seeing someone who you, ahem, might not want to see again. And all the tourists are so happy to be on vacation that their joy turns into an air-born contagion and suddenly you're happy too! 
    The best nights to go are Tuesday and Thursday where this lovely newly-made woman named Nikki plays her guitar and takes requests from an almost impossibly long play-list that she has completely memorized! It's awe inspiring. And she's so friendly and sweet and loves that moment in the night after all the dining families are gone and it's only drunkies left when she reveals to the bar that, yes, in case they were wondering, she WAS a man.
    I strongly recommend this bar for any girl who has had a hard day and just wants to go, sit down, and have an endless string of men buy her drinks. Very nice.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Hands down the worst service I have ever had in San Francisco.  One of the J-off's working the bar should take a chill pill.  I don't represent the friggin British Empire.  I said I was originally from London and he made some jokes that just about saw him get his a-s kicked.  If I hadn't been with my lady friends it would have got ugly.  
Oh and when you order a beer you usually expect the person to actually fill the glass.  This p-ick filled it 3/4 full and served it to me all the while cracking on me football club.  Oh for the record not everyone from the UK likes Manchester United.  I'm a gentleman, I don't ask if he saw a lephrechaun in his Lucky Charms.  
I will say it would be nice if they would hire real Irish blokes instead of San Francisco pretend Irish.  I could spot that fake accent from a mile away.  
Oh and nice toilet lads.  Why don't you try to wipe the dookie off the seat from time to time.  I really enjoy stepping in someone's bloody stool when I try to drain me sausage.
Nice place otherwise.  If they would fire their bartenders I think they might have a chance.  Clean the stool, eject the bartender, and I be back.
Cheers.
author: TJ R.

description: ordered the "steak" and mushroom pie...the meat in the pie was the worst cut of beef i have ever tasted...full of gristle, the "steak" was like a really cheap stew beef...i kept eating, thinking that the next piece of meat would actually be meat...final score, 1 piece of meat, 8 pieces of gristle...the pie crust and sauce was good, but the low quality of the meat ruined the dish...i will not go back to eat.
author: Phillip N.

description: This is  just a nice typical Irish pub and I love it! Nothing too fancy, they serve simple good food. I recommend the sheperd's pie and the salmon with the very tasty onion and cherry tomatoes sauce. You always get some delicious brown bread with the meal. The service is also decent, we never wait for too long.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Note: This is a review of the downstairs piano bar only.  I always enjoy myself at their upstairs establishment.

I had been to the piano bar a few months back with my wife and some friends and we had a blast.  The piano players were young, fun, and really got the crowd involved.  My wife decided she wanted to go back for her 30th birthday party.  We arrived on Saturday night with a group of around 20 people and quickly claimed a section of tables.  The staff couldn't have been more accommodating - Cassie (waitress) and Jerry (bartender) were great.

The experience went downhill once the performance begun.  The piano players seemed like nice guys but their piano skills, vocal skills and song knowledge was sub par at best.  Their use of a drum machine playing the same beat at the same tempo really disrupted any song.  They didn't even know the words to Sweet Caroline.  The last straw was when they kicked off the Chicken Dance.  Appalling.  We gutted it out for 45 minutes but had to pull the cord at that point and relocate the party to another location.

The staff encouraged us to give our feedback to the GM upstairs as business had been slipping since they changed piano players.  I'm down to go back if they bring back the previous pianists; otherwise, my patronage of Foley's will be limited to the upstairs bar/restaurant.
author: Mike R.

description: I have been drinking many times at Foley's but I was there for dinner last night and was very pleasantly surprised. Everything we ordered (party of 6 -lots of food) was great. Stars were the crab cake app and for main courses the corned beef,  chicken curry and cottage pie. Will definitely go back. for the food. Waitstaff was attentive and lively. We really enjoyed ourselves.
author: Tara M.

description: My all time favorite place around Christmas time. If you haven't been there around the holidays, go! you'll looooove it!
author: CUPCAKE S.

description: ok, there's this sign out front that says "probably the best bloody mary's in the city... seriously"... it was the 'seriously' that drew me in for a sample... I'm something of a bloody mary fanatic, but generally don't like them from restaurants or bars... the perfect bloody requires special attention to detail, a flare for the arts, and a fabulous garnish... well... the boys at foley's know their craft, their bloody marys are thick (but not too thick), spicy (but not too spicy) and check out the mother effing garnish... a huge stock of celery, a wedge of lime, an olive, pearl onion and PICKLED ASPARAGUS!!!!   I'll drink my breakfast mr foley, thanks for the best bloody mary's in the city... no... the world... seriously.
author: Caleb D.

description:
Shakes a finger to anyone who gave this place only 3 stars and slaps you in the face if you gave it two.  Okay did you feel that?  Great now wake up and smell the alcohol.  

Johnny Foley's, along with Metro Bar on Market in the Castro are my two watering holes in the city.  This review is why I choose Foley's.  If you would like to know about Metro Bar, please read my seperate review on that.  

Johnny Foley's feel comfortable from the moment you walk in the door and into the nice low lighting.  The lighting reminds of of Cheesecake Factory or if you have ever been to Los Angeles, The Grand Lux Cafe.  For those of you who hate low lighting, for one a pub probably is not for you, and two there is a Burger King down the street with all of the bright fluorescent lighting you can handle.  The staff are really super friendly, especially after you become a regular and they get to know you.  The size of this pub is pretty impressive.  You keep walking through and you begin to wonder if there is ever an end.  Dinner is served until 10pm and if you are only getting drinks you will need to try and find a seat at the bar (good luck with that.)  After 10pm all seating opens up just in time for the live entertainment.  My favorite performer at Foley's is Nicki McCrory.  She performs every Tuesday and Thursday evenings.  She is an AMAZING performer who has won my respect.  The food is a little pricy however I think it is will worth the price for the quality.  If you think the prices are unreasonable, again, there is a Burger King down the street.  This is San Francisco, NOT Bakersfield.  I definitely think the drinks are made quite well here.  I usually get their apple martinis which are absolutely sinful, howful Sunday I had a dirty martini with two olives and I was thouroughly satisfied.

So if you are looking for a great place to hang out, check out Foley's at O'Farrell and Cyril Magnin.
author: Jeremy S.

description: overpriced, barely edible meal-perhaps a bad night for the kitchen. not going back.
author: tureg u.

description: The upstairs "Irish" (not really) bar would get 2 stars; the downstairs piano bar would get 5.  Focussing on the latter: Wednesday-Saturday they have "dueling pianos" starting 9ish.  Very entertaining gimmick big in places like Vegas but all-but-unheard-of in the Bay Area.  The drinks are too expensive but there's no cover.  The entertainment is very worth it though
author: Christian W.

description: closest to an actual pub ive ever experienced.  rooms are all sectioned off.  and they have carlsberg on tap.  feels a bit touristy but definitely worth checking out.
author: Ryan H.

description: If I'm going out to eat and have a few drinks in the city This place and the Liberties are the place to go.    Last time I was here was my birthday and the food was really, really good, everything was cooked to perfection.  Great place to eat even though the last two times I've been there I was seated at the little table right inside the door, otherwise it would have been five stars.  keep up the good work
author: Aidan M.

description: i came here for a wedding rehersal dinner party. they rented out the whole down stairs basement area from 4-8:30. walking in up stairs the place was very busy which was a good sign. the up stairs and down stairs was very nice and clean. the bar tenders and wait staff that was helping us was very friendly and fast. we all had a great time here and it was a cool place to have a big gathering.
author: jessica h.

description: this place was pretty crowded early on a fri night.  stop by for a pint after shopping to get a feel of ireland in the middle of union square.  they also play soccer, i mean, football, on the flat screen tvs, which makes me very :).
author: Helen T.

description: Our San Francisco office is close to union square and when im in town working with quite a few Irish guys, they always want to make a beeline for their pint of Guinness after work (I guess that should say something as they are very particular as to how it's ordered, poured, served, chilled, priced, and any other characteristic you can think of).  Now I myself am not a Guinness drinker so I steer towards Harp or the old class of Stoli Tonic.  The atmosphere in here is Jolly, but when there are singers or bands, its just way too loud, if you are not sitting "intimatley close" to someone you can barely hear conversation and I dont plan on sitting that close to my coworkers!!  They recently changed their menu's they have scaled up from bar food to upscale bar food :) but I dont think much has changed besides the prices and the dishes they are served in.  The food is your average pub fair.  Anyways, I will probably end up going back there over and over again until I can ween the irish guys off Guiness!
author: W M.

description: for a big pub joint, this place gets filled up pretty fast. its always packed and noisy. there is a wide variety of beer choices and your usual hard liquor stuff. the noise is the only negative thing about this place but who goes to a pub to hear each other breathe right? good place to unwind on a weeknight afterwork.
author: Bren L.

description: big and crowded, but nice woody decor, and pleasant atmosphere, even if a bit crowded. service was fine and the pub foods were good.
author: Ted M.

description: how can you beat a place that has painted pictures of bono and the mona lisa drinking a guinness???  this could be the best spot on union square to cure the aches and pains of a full day shopping.  impecable service, and good food.
author: Tony S.

description: i had a blast here last night. the bartenders are funny the drinks are good and the crowd is lively.
author: Devin B.

description: I'm a big fan of this pub. First of all, they have the best fish n chips I've had in the city. Second, they have attentive and friendly waitstaff. It's a comfortable space with loads of seating. Due to the proximity to Union Square, you can often find dozens of foreign tourists or other friendly folks dropping by for a pint or four. The music gets a bit loud at times, but that's nothing new in SF.
author: Elise U.

description: I've been here twice.  Neither experience was pleasant.  Really horrible bland food - cottage pie, salmon, house salad, bangers & mash and fish & chips.  Service was minimal & cold each time.  The 2nd time I was here was purely for pleasantries d/t being in a group.... I absolutely refused to order any food and savored my water.  Waste of time.
author: eek z.
